Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Love B
Reviews.Content: Stayed from March 5-12th. Unusual weather for Maui. Alot of rain, but got to do everything we wanted to do. Renewed vows for 25th wedding anniversary on the beach. Our stay at the hotel was wonderful. Stayed here 3 years ago and loved it. Requested room 905. A great view from our lanai. Great sunset view. Had breakfast on the lanai every morning. Great staff. We wiil always stay at Kaanapali Shores when we come to Maui. Perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Like being home...”
Reviews.Author: BigPunnPhotoz
Reviews.Content: Great condo style room, with kitchen... Convenient location close to attractions, free breakfast the first morning to try to sell you travel packets, multiple pools one is an adult only the other is family... Right on the beach but it is very rocky (would find another beach you'll be better off) They charge $9.00 to park there wish I think is crazy since you are staying there and it's not valet. If you have kids there is plenty to do at this resort for them. There is a PS2 in the room and rental of video games/movies in the kiosk in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Kaanapali Shores Maui put simply is just plain funnnnnnn.”
Reviews.Author: livingmauitime g
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for location, surroundings ,price and a wonderful staff. Hopefully when we come again which will be soon, we get the same unit #153.The unit was located perectly in the resort. Our stay here helped us a lot with making our minds up about moving to maui in the future. This looks like the area in which we would like to live at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Amy H
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! Beautiful room with a kitchen! We recommend doing a ocean view, as we had a view of the parking lot. They had free new dvd rentals, great hot tubs, a very helpful concierge desk, and a beautiful facility! Great location to all the great things to explore on the island. Makes Hawaii all you would dream it to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: Sandy R
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Hawaii with 3 sisters and 1 sis-in-law. Our room (3BR Suite) was beautiful and had more than enough room for 5. We spent our evenings sitting on the lanai enjoying the sound and look of the ocean. We were all pleased with the decor and cleanliness of the Aston. Housekeeping staff were in and out in record time and replaced anything we used. I would highly recommend this property to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaM0rgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in February and there were 5 of us in a two bedroom suite. The room was really nice. Nice modern kitchen, nice balcony, nice master bedroom and 2 bathrooms. The beach? It's ok if you aren't picky. The last day we checked out Kaanapali Beach and it is nice and wide, not hilly but probably really busy. The problem was that we couldn't find a 2 bedroom on that beach so this worked. We never honestly went to the beach, it is really narrow and there was high surf when we were there so there's no way we were stepping in the ocean. It wasn't the least bit inviting because it rained and was chilly for the first 3 days of our stay. We ended up at the mall because there wasn't much to do. Lahaina the town is cute to shop in though and it's waterfront so take a trip to see that. We did the road to Hana as well, the weather was great that day. The 2 complaints I had with this property? The pool was cold, I'm pretty sure it's not heated and if they rely on the weather, the weather was pretty much not what you would expect for Hawaii. The Big Island was way warmer, humid and beautiful. The other were the Myna birds. From the time dawn hits for an hour these birds commune in the trees outside and squak unbelievably. We had to all sleep with extra pillows on top of our heads to sleep through it. Not my idea of a holiday, I'm sorry but too early to wake up. They do this again at dusk, who cares, it's noisy as heck but at least it's not waking you up. We stayed for 3 weeks in Hawaii, Maui for a week, The Big Island for a week at Kona Sugar Shack, see my review, amazing and Waikiki at the other Aston property, which was great. We never encountered these birds anywhere but here and it would be enough to sway me to stay elsewhere because of it if you want to sleep in past dawn. All in all, the property is great and the grocery store across the street sells everything, even boogey boards. The Italian restaurant was great too. There is a town towards the north shore that also has a grocery store and coffee shop and a great Mexican restaurant as well. Worth the short drive. Also, they charge you $10 amenity fee for wi fi and coffee. The wifi is rotten and you can only use it from the living room and the balcony. Wasn't worth it. They charge $9 for parking too. These are hidden fees that the Aston in Waikiki doesn't charge and still provides this plus the parking is valet. Just be aware it will be more than what you planned if you have a car and you don't have a choice about the other daily fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cindy G
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Ashton Kaanapali Shores in Lahaina but my parents second. They returned due to the extraordinary staff that made them feel like family and went that extra mile in everything they did. We got the wonderful opportunity to experience their exemplory service too. They made our vacation so easy and took care of everything. Their knowledge and suggestions were unbelievable. They were just awesome and made you feel very special. Thanks again to the wonderful staff, their wonderful sense of humor, for being upbeat all the time and for sharing their lives, their island and heritage with us. I'd stay there again in a heart beat. It is very understandable why people return there year after year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most worderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: denfos461144652
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you go Maui, Hawai, Great hotel, wonderful beach, great personnel, The rooms are very well clean and spacious with a washer and a dryer in them. Great kitchen also. Very safe place also and just across the street there are food stores and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay If You Like The Location”
Reviews.Author: espressotritom
Reviews.Content: This condo/hotel had everything we were looking for. We had a studio apartment which was nice for two of us for the week. It was in great shape and the kitchen was very functional although we didn't cook. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and efficient. Although the hotel is called Kaanapali Shores it is definitely not on Kaanapali Beach. It's closer to Honokwai. We were hoping to snorkel at Black Rock directly from our hotel but we had to drive to it. If that's important to you I suggest you look at a map and familiarize yourself with the area. We used Snorkel Bob's, Java Jazz and L&L BBQ in the strip mall across the street which worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently high standards, no bad surprises”
Reviews.Author: markincc
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Kaanapali Shores for many years, and the quality of the property and the staff have been consistently excellent. Rooms are clean, well-maintained, and comfortable; most rooms have an excellent view in one direction or another, and in the spring if you have an ocean-view room you can sit on the lanai and watch whales blowing, breaching, and slapping tails and fins. Grounds are impeccably groomed and beautifully choreographed. If you love the ocean and the beach, you can't find anyplace more agreeable, anywhere we've been. You can't find Maui accommodations closer to the ocean: you can walk barefoot from your room to the north end of the incredible Kaanapali beach in a minute or two, then have an unimpeded beach walk (or go a few steps inland to the boardwalk) for almost two miles. Staff is cordial and helpful. Pool and spa are crystal-clean and the right temperatures. The feel of the place is family, with lots of kids around. Downsides: the restaurant is ok and convenient, but much of the food is uninspired and you'll get better value elsewhere. And our main complaint is the constant roar of the restaurant chimney, very noticeable from the lanai of some of the inner rooms. But overall, this hotel is, to our taste (and we have stayed in many upscale hotels), preferable to the pricier and stuffier hotels to the south, both in atmosphere and in overall Kaanapali beach experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice; good value.”
Reviews.Author: tlarie
Reviews.Content: We rented through Kaanapali Beach rentals; unit 737. The furnishing were very nice and the layout perfect for two couples. We had a view of the ocean and could watch whales from the room. The property was well maintained with two nice pools and hot tubs. There is a strip mall right across the street which made shopping and take out very easy but didn't mar the luxury of the condo grounds. It is an easy drive from Lahaina, Whaler's Village and several excellent beaches. Our only complaint it the nickle dime business center ($.25 a minute to use and print tickets and $.50 to print a boarding pass is just a pain and petty.) We would go back to Kaanapali shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great in some areas, not so good in others”
Reviews.Author: Linda G
Reviews.Content: The common areas are very well maintained. Landscaping and pool areas are very nice. This condo facility has all the amenities of a hotel. Tours will pick you up here and front desk staff is great. You get the home-like convenience of a condo with the amenities of a hotel. The food at the restaurant was very good. The negatives were: the location: Not in the heart of shopping, night life or any of the other vacationy stuff you'll find near whaler's village. Some people might find that attractive, but to me it was a little boring. The beach was mediocre also...VERY narrow and hilly: hard to relax on the sand. Housekeeping inside the units left a lot to be desired! One day they didn't show up at all, which was no big loss because I think the only thing the housekeepers do is make the bed. They certainly didn't clean the bathroom! The worst thing, though, was that the bed was SOOO uncomfortable, that I was in pain for days after staying there. The last 2 nights I slept on the couch. My poor husband was stuck with the bed and was miserable. Sleeping apart put quite a damper on the romance aspect of our stay. Still, if it was possible, I would have given 3 1/2 stars. There were several really nice aspects, but for me, I would stay on Kaanapali Blvd., closer to more activities...and in a better bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!”
Reviews.Author: Pam Z
Reviews.Content: We were less than impressed with our stay here. Our "ocean view" room, had a view of the roofs of the hotel next door- and the garbage recepticle out back- oh and a bit of the ocean. Added fees included the $10.00 resort "fee", plus $9.00 per day parking fee, this is above and beyond all the other rates and fees. Had to call the desk every day for the first three days to request enough towels for each member of the family, even though you had to list each family member by name, upon check-in.You are rationed to one coffee filter per day, unless you request more. In addition, we had to request additional dishwasher soap. Seems like they could just give you enough to cover your stay, so that a daily chat with housekeeping isn't neccessary. There can't be that much street value in coffee filters and dish soap.The Pull out sleeper sofa was not user friendly, kids ended up sleeping on the couch. One person at the desk made for long check in and check out lines. For the price, we would choose another property. So disappointed, because the reviews made it sound wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the birds!”
Reviews.Author: Animas_11
Reviews.Content: They are loud, but I thought it was great coming from the dead of winter. They are much louder in our first room (479?) than the second (209?) as they are in the trees in the garden. Out toward the ocean you don't hear them as much. Myself and two sons stayed for ten days beginning 2-2. We arrived just after sunset, parking and check-in (and check-out) was easy and quick. I was not impressed with our first room, though it had a beautiful garden-view (which is what we booked) but with high windows in the bedroom which faced the parking lot at the front of the hotel. I spoke to the front desk early the next morning about what I was unhappy with and asked if there was possibly another room we could move to. They did not have anything available for two days but were graciously willing to move us then. I asked to see the room the day we were to move and they provided a room key to check it out which was not necessary as they were cleaning and the door was open. It was ready two hours sooner than they had promised but we were in Lahaina when they called to let us know and had even offered to move our things while we were gone but because I had left the "Do Not Disturb" sign out they had not entered. The second room was larger (though with a smaller kitchen), still garden view, but able to see some of the ocean. Much quieter and I was very happy. King size bed was VERY firm. Staff was very helpful, friendly and cheerful. Do attend the island orientation downstairs every morning if you are a newbie, very helpful and lots of info I didn't get anywhere else. I even called back to Expedia Concierge on my cell phone from around the island with questions they were able to help me with and they booked our surf lessons and whale watching. Lots of families, pool was nice. Lounge chairs start filling up by 8:30. Shop the sale items at Times Market and Safeway in Lahaina to save a shopping trip in Kahului, same savings. Nice to have free dvd rentals for the boys in the evenings and on one day of bad weather. Go whale watching on a raft with Pacific Whale Foundation or another conservation group and support the work they are doing. If I could change anything I would paid more for ocean front and above the second floor. You really can watch whales breach from your lanai, bring some binoculars. They are beautiful. Also bring water shoes. The beach in front is not as gentle or smooth as on Kaanapali, it is rocky, though there is some swimming and snorkeling on calmer days. Also, you can walk all the way down to Black Rock and all the way to Lahaina if you want, but there is not a boardwalk you have to cut into the resort areas and it would be difficult coming back in the dark if you did. One complaint I did make to the front desk and the hostess at the pool is the smoking on the boardwalk along the beach. The woman at the pool said people can only smoke ON the beach and the woman at the desk said the boardwalk didn't belong to Kaanapali Shores, so they have no control over what happens on it. Either way, four to five smokers at a time is very annoying cigarette smoke, even in the open air. The grounds are beautifully kept and a conch shell is blown every evening at sunset and the torches lit. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: mailirequested
Reviews.Content: How nice to stay in a condo. Amenities include: Full kitchen with frig, dishwasher, microwave, granite counter tops. Washer & Dryer. Air conditioning. Hair dryer. Wi-Fi, free DVD library. Balcony with view. Room was comfortable. Resort had 2 pools + beach with chaise lounges. Great view of Molokai and Lanai. Grounds were nice, but not over the top like some fancy resorts. Bottom line: Comfortable, nice place to come home to after a day of site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelDunbar
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 wonderful nights at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. We were with another couple and had a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit with full kitchen and nice living room. Our room had a great oceanview and was overlooking the pool. Sometimes it was a little hard to find a lounger around the pool but they also have a nice grassy area with loungers if you just want to soak up the sun. My husband and I especially enjoyed the long (several miles) of walkway along the ocean and we took a nice walk every morning. We were glad to have the nice kitchen area and used it mainly for breakfasts. It was nice to be able to keep beverages cold too. We saw MANY whales from our balcony and also went on a Pacific Whale Foundation tour which I would highly recommend. We enjoyed being in the raft instead of the big boats because we felt you could see better and taking pictures was really easy. Another suggestion would be to take a tour on The Road to Hana instead of trying to drive. We had many people tell us this since the driver doesn't get to see much since they are concentrating on the hairpin turns and one lane bridges. The early morning sunrise at Haleakala was worth getting up and leaving at 3:30 a.m!!! Overall the rooms and grounds of the resort were very nice. Our unit could use some new furniture as the couch wasn't very comfortable. I would definitely stay at this resort again!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: JLool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family for 9 days. Had a wonderful time. Each 2 couples had their own condo, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom. This setup worked out perfectly for us. Everyone had their own space. Loved having the kitchen so that we didn't have to go out to eat all the time. We used the bus system, only a dollar per way, or 2 bucks for a day pass. Takes you to Whalers Village. From there you can go on to Lahiana (switching buses). We saw whales everyday while sitting on the beach. Times Supermarket right across the street, super convenient. We waled there a couple times to get food for our stay. We tried to be careful not to overbuy, since we couldn't take extra food home with us. Also wanted to go out some. Great place to go and stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Susan T
Reviews.Content: Had a great holiday. Very comfortable. Picturesque. Staff were extremely helpful. Something for everyone. Close to convenient places. And, of course, a fantastic location. Kitchenette was very well equipped. We would choose this again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: IowaCubsfan25
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times but this time we took our whole family! The kids had a great time. They could play at the beach or swim in one of the 2 pools. They upgraded us to an aloha room which is right on the beach. The kids thought this was really neat as they could watch the whale from the lanai. They have 2 hot tubs which is just what the adults needed. The staff is always great. The housekeeping staff always have a smile for us.

Reviews.Title: “A whale of a trip”
Reviews.Author: Gary67_12
Reviews.Content: If you like the adventure of the open sea, and waching the crashing spray of diving Humpbacks this is the trip for you.It's called whale soup because of the abundant number of whales just off the coast of Maui. Our base camp was the Aston Kaanapali shores resort. A well run resort mainly because of a dedicated staff. I f you like good food the Beach club restaurant at the resort is a relaxing end of the day delight. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, the food is quite good and very reasonable. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, upgraded free to oceanview suite”
Reviews.Author: Brandon36
Reviews.Content: Theree are a lot of hotels to choose from, in Maui. Here's why we loved it: 1. Deal through Expedia saved about 3000 for our family of five on air and hotel. 2. We reserved an ocean view 2 room, and at check in, I asked if there were any upgrades (willing to pay if needed). Because of the Expedia deal, we got a free upgrade to the largest ocean front suite. 3. The beach is good, get reef shoes. But the hotels on either side have almost no beach. 4. The rooms are spacious, a little outdated. But you could tell they are all going through waves of renovation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place and location”
Reviews.Author: oregonfamilytravel50
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at Aston Kaanapali Shores. Traveling with our son, his wife and 9 month old baby was a bit daunting. Fortunately, our travel agent was able to get us a third floor loft and this made the arrangements perfect. From the full kitchen to plenty of space for both couples even while the baby was napping. Sitting on the balcony enjoying the breeze and view was fantastic. Location is very good, out of the way enough of traffic and close enough to Lahaina and shopping so that it makes little difference. We would definitely return. My only quibble is with their $10/night "amenity fee". For crying out loud, just add it to the rent and say amenities are included.... Certainly the poor connectivity and bandwidth of the Wifi was not worth the $10, and we didn't care to use the Xbox. Breaking this fee out makes it feel too much like a nickel and dime operation.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Putcz
Reviews.Content: We had reserved an ocean front room and when we arrived we were upgraded to an ocean front suite, not sure why but who cares, the view was spectacular. The entire staff was friendly and all services were also great.The resturant was also good. You can also walk to Dukes down the beach and across the street are a few restaurants that are also ok,for pizza,Mexican and other lower fare meals. Will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: pauline c
Reviews.Content: great hotel just a couple of picky things like not enough beach chairs, maids were not good at replacing condiments for coffee, the placement of the bbq's, and it was a little bit noisy at our room I told you I was being picky. those things just would of maid the place perfect. THE BEACH WAS AWESOME

Reviews.Title: “This condo served us well”
Reviews.Author: GoLoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2- 2 bedroom condos with our married children, no grands along. We arrived late Saturday night & our rooms which we had booked were waiting for us. We had ocean view rooms on the 6th floor & were able to enjoy the beautiful garden as well as the oceanview with the whales. I would recommend this place as it is within waliking distance to the Times grocery store, the MWF farmers market, & an ABC store. It served our needs well. Seperate bathrooms ( a must ), full kitchen, daily clean linens, pool towels-new ones several times a day, expdia travel agents that we were able to book our kayak tour with in the lobby, our bed was made most everyday & clean sheets every 3rd day. The only thing I didn`t care for was that they didn`t sweep our tiled floor the whole time we were there & it felt like the beach by the end of the week. Over all this condo served it`s purpose---vacationing with family & the ability to make our own meals. I would stay here for sure again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beach, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sheltonang
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's near a grocery store, smaller restaurants, and it has it's own narrow stretch of beach. There are 2 pools and hot tubs. A fairly decent poolside restaurant. The rooms have a washer and dryer as well as a private balcony. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: quiltdiva
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 14 day trip to Maui - we stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores and absolutely loved it! There were 6 of us and the couple sleeping on the pull-out sofa were suffering so complained at the front desk and they sent up two beds, not cots, beds. The couple used these for a couple nights and asked if we could possibly upgrade since the two beds in the livingroom were making it difficult to navigate the room. We were upgraded to a oceanview pent house suite at no additional cost to us! The condo had a king bed in the master bedroom and a queen in the loft (spiral staircase) and twin beds in another bedroom. Fantastic! We will highly recommend this place to anyone who asks - the grounds are beautiful, the staff is very friendly, loved the two cats we saw strolling through! This is a family oriented, quiet, clean hotel/condo - we had a great memorable experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 609 which had a perfect view of the early February setting sun. This was actually a one bedroom condo. Also could see whales from balcony. I have no complaints about our visit. The room was nice and it was cleaned everyday. All employees we encountered were pleasant and said hello. As mentioned in other reviews there is a $10.00 daily resort fee and another $9.00 daily parking charge. I knew about this before hand so it was not a problem or suprise. Other resorts we considered staying at had $25.00 daily resort fees plus parking charges. We were on our honeymoon which was stated on the reservation and on our second day a bottle of champagne and box of chocolates were sent to our unit. Very nice!! We did not use the onsite restaurant so I can't comment on the food there. We left the resort everyday to explore other beaches. Other reviews also mention about stopping at Walmart or Costco by the airport for groceries before heading to the resort. Bad idea in my opinion. We landed at the airport at night and not knowing the area, spent an hour looking for Walmart. We finally found Walmart, which you should know is not a super Walmart, so there were very limited groceries available. There is a Times Marketplace right across from the resort which has everything you need at resonable prices. There is also an ABC store one block away that has the best sandwiches around. To the left of the ABC store is a small shop to rent snorkels and boogie boards, etc. The cost was only $5.00/day for snorkel and $4.00/day for boogie boards or $8.50/wk each. They don't try to sell you pricey trips either. We went to the Hyatt Regency Luau which to me was way over priced ($115.00 preferred seating)with average food. Drinks and wine were included but cheap quality. The red wine I was drinking came from a bottle that I can buy back home for $3.99 and the labels on the liquor bottles look like they came from 3rd world countries. But I realize this is really about the performance and that part was good. Besides, you have to go to a Luau once in your life. This was our first trip to Hawaii and the biggest point I want to make is our stay of 6 days was not long enough. We came from Wisconsin (10 hours flying time) and with the time invested getting to Hawaii we should have stayed at least 10 days.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly...loved every second!!”
Reviews.Author: Brent_L346
Reviews.Content: We were on the 6th floor with an ocean view. We had a two bedroom/two bath unit and it was perfect for the four of us. Very clean rooms, they were cleaned every day with new bed sheets every three days. The rest of the place was also just as great and very clean. The staff was friendly and always greeted us with a smile and "aloha." It was close to grocery stores and fresh food market. We rented boogie boards and snorkel gear just down the road that cost less than what it would have at the resort. We brought some food from home to keep the cost down of what we spent at the grocery store...food and most everything is more expensive here...over $4 for a gallon of milk. The beach was nice, maybe a little smaller than what I am used to for a resort. The water was warm and beautiful. Once in the water you could wade out to about thigh deep before running into rocks and reef. But then, if you wanted to swim out further you could walk further down the beach to the south and there is more beautiful beach with the reef out a lot farther. We saw tons of whales!! I was a little worried that we wouldn't see any but instead saw the complete opposite. Overall I absolutely loved it. Why spend tons of money on a place that you are only in to sleep and eat. I would definately come back here and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome Resort!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Planet-Hirth
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding resort on Maui. Absolutely beautiful grounds, extremely large and spotless clean rooms, and exceptional customer service! We travel frequently and this is one of the best resorts we have stayed in. The Beach Restaurant had great food with decent prices. Although we paid for a one bedroom suite, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite down by the pool and beach. Everyone we met that worked at the resort were very friendly and always greeted us with a big Aloha and smile. The only thing we would have done differently was to stay longer!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this place”
Reviews.Author: Traveing-fool
Reviews.Content: There were 4 girlfriends on this trip, so we rented 2 of the condo units so that we could each have our own room. Very nice. Huge bedrooms each with their own bath. Nice frontroom and kitchen area. Balcony. Ours was very nice because it overlooked the gardens and beach. Our friends room did not have as nice of a view though. Just depends where your room is. Ours was also located right around the corner from the entrance to the attached parking garage - which was quite handy. And we never heard noise from the garage. The beach was nice, sandy and clean. We snorkeled off the beach, but it was better snorkeling at other island locations. Pool was nice, clean and never felt crowded. There was a small grocery store and a few restaurants within walking distance right across the street. We often bought supplies before heading out for a day of exploring. The restaurant on site was OK. Not bad, not exceptional. I would recommend this for just about anyone. Very roomy accomodations. A family could easily ft in the 2 bedroom unit. (2 queen beds). Location was good. Very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Great views loud elevator”
Reviews.Author: Smcabc
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this resort & we were not disappointed. We were on the 9th floor & the views of the ocean were great. We could watch the whales from our room. The room was clean & the furniture was comfortable.The grounds were very nice. The resort is very casual which is great for those of us that don't want to dress up on vacation. The resort only has 1 restaurant which gets crowded during dinner time. If you wait until around 7pm there isn't any wait. The food was excellent. We had the Spicy Tiger Shrimp, twice. Now the things that we didn't like: our room was being on the top floor next to the elevator it was very loud at night. Everytime someone used it we could hear the gears humming even at 2am. Also with the bedroom on the "hallway side" we could hear every suitcase that was rolled over the tiles. The king bed was 2 twins pushed together which meant there was a lump in the middle. The last night there we decided to cook a pizza that we bought from the grocery store only to discover that they did not have any baking sheets/pizza pans. Had to use the broiler. Overall we had a great stay & can't wait to come back. The staff was very pleasant & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: We checked in and our first room was horrible...literally! The room was dingy, smelled and dirty! We spoke to staff (who were not as friendly as hoped) and the 2nd room was not much better...so then a 3rd room which was average. The third had no carpet and just tile which made the room feel more comfortable. The two rooms before had carpet and were gross. This is of no fault of anyone but the owners as it is a owner owned condo. Soooo, be prepared when you check in because you won't know what you're going to get! We paid about 260 a night so the third room was worth that because the owner took care of the condo. The first two rooms were a rip off for that much money. Good luck and I hope you get a good room! The grounds were nice, the pool was nice and parking was fairly easy. The beach access was close and nice as well (not too rocky). If we would've checked into the third room first, our experience would've been better. We eventually left early and went to another condo (the Honua Kai). The first two rooms left such a bad taste in our mouths we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Susan A
Reviews.Content: These condos were a perfect spot for a family of 11 to vacation. Everything that we wished to do was either right on site (scuba, massages, surf lessons) or very near. The pools & hot tubs were lovely and well kept, and the beach was very accessible. My only (slight) complaint was that there weren't very many pots & pans or serving utensils, but then we just combined the two condos we had rented...which, by then way, although not connecting were very close & convenient. The staff & service was excellent, and I would come here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: Dave W
Reviews.Content: The Good..The beach, the grounds, the location and the weather. Also the Expedia Trip advisor. The OK... Room 439... a bit shop worn... poorly equipped kitchen.. a wine opener but no wine glasses, a skillet but no spatula... 4 cups - count 'em! The Bad... Weak Internet connection... which is apparently OK with Hotel Management who are aware of the problems but not willing to invest in a remedy. The Beach Restaurant...I had trouble distinguishing the fish from the chicken. Duke's down the beach was great. The Check Out... incorrectly calculated my final check out account.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: cork484
Reviews.Content: My husband, 1 year old, & I stayed for 8 days at Kaanapali Shores. It was the perfect place for a low key, relaxed holiday with family. The actual resort exceeded our expectations - the room was super tidy, comfortable, & updated with an awesome ocean view (7th floor). The grounds were beautiful with two lovely pools and a nice beach (shade in the morning!) with plenty of swimmable areas & lots of people boogie & paddle boarding. The vibe was excellent - very relaxed & family friendly. Very nice staff. The only reason I give it 4 stars is that the restaurant food did not match the quality of the resort - we ended up going down the beach to Duke's for most of our meals or eating in our place (which is easy to do since there is a lovely, well stocked kitchen).

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and still GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: bjf12345
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Kaanapali Shores!!! Another great stay. Stayed in room 946 and the view was great. Watched the whales again from the balcony. Very affordable and having a suite with a view is really nice. They added a few charges since my last visit. Ten dollar fee per day for wifi and safe for the room. I think having to have a card to get a towel for the beach or pool was inconvenient . I still think this is a great place to stay and will return again!!!!! Location is really close to everything. Can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in room 705”
Reviews.Author: saaji
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui several times,and am a travel agent from MN, we have stayed at a few Aston properties, but this hotel was by far the very best to date. We stayed in room 705, there were 6 in our party, we had 3 rooms total. The check in was seamless, the front desk staff was professional and very nice. We were allowed in to our rooms and a steward brought our luggage up. We stayed 11 nights. I was sad to go home. There was well appointed, well everything. We didnt think we'd use the washer dryer, but did, and loved it! Our room was spectacular. I cannot say enough. I will for sure be staying there again. Nice to have a little gift shop that had milk and such, as well as t-shirts and shorts! Bought a few souvenirs there myself. NIce freebie show on Wed nights, get there early for a chair. Awesome beach access, if you can find a chair. Loved the 2 pools, and ironically, spent more time at the kiddie pool b/c it had less kids! Nice to have a fridge, and ice machine, for filling our coolers for picnic lunches on the wayside rest stops. Snorkeled right outside out hotel, although was a bit rough there. Great view of both Lanai and Molakai (sp?) Saw whales from my balcony, and from the restaurant! We ate most breakfasts at the hotel restaurant,but loved to get away once and a while for a trip to the Gazebo! There is a Times Grocery store just across the street, as well as a great ABC store about a block away. We went there a few times to have sandwiches made. Great time saver! A few must do's while on Maui in my opinion. Go see Lou at the Expedia desk by the Banyan tree, (not the one in Kanaapali shores) he is a good friend we met on our first trip to Maui years ago when we bought all of our tours through him, and go see him everytime we are on Maui, as well as send all of our friends and clients to see him. He works M-T & W 9-7, he is GREAT! Go see the Warren and Annabelle Magic show, I go every time, and its different each and every time. Book it early, he sells out almost every single night. Eat at the Aloha mixed grill, and at 5 Palms. Spectacular! Also, superb Italian food, go to Basil tomatoes (not far from hotel) if you get there between 5-6pm, and pay cash, all the food is 50% off. I went to the Old Lahaina Luau, which was great, but really liked the Royal Lahaina luau better simply for the fire portions of the acts. Go to Crazy shirts, if you go to the one at the wharf (by the huge banyan tree, and Lou) Lou can give you some coupons, and you get 20% off! He has a coupon book that has coupons for all the stores at the wharf. Also, there was a FANTASTIC Indian restaurant in the back of the Wharf, bottom floor, called Monsoon India. Great owner, great chef, I highly recommend it. Go to Ono Gelato on Front St, pineapple sorbet, that's all I need to say! Great breakfast (cash only) go to Sunrise cafe, they are just off front street, also by the banyan tree. Great yogurt with granola and fresh fruit. Finally, if you want to book any tours, like whale watching, dinner cruise, snorkeling. I used Lou of course, and Pacific Whale foundation. Our family has a membership, so we get 20% off all of our excursions that we book through them. If you must go to Costco or Walmart, be prepared. Its busy. Also, Maui gave up all plastic bags a while back, so either bring your own, or you can buy one at most places. I came back on Jan 16th, and have already tried to book again for 2014! No prices avail for that far out yet, or believe me, I'd have my deposit down on it already! Cannot wait to go back. I love Maui, and I have been to all the Hawaiian Islands, this by far, has stole my heart. If anyone has any questions about anything Maui related, I'd be happy to help. Feel free to e-mail me! Aloha Maui, Mahalo for your wonderful hospitality once again. See you soon :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic room, great facilities.”
Reviews.Author: rdparis
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical at first because we read some reviews that the beach was not a beach you could swim at. That's completely false. The beach to the right is unswimmable but the beach was great in front of the hotel,our two small kids (7 and 4) swam there and the snorkeling right in front on the beach was fantastic. To the left it's very calm and everyone swims and snorkels there. You can even scuba in front of the hotel and see turtle, octopus and many other sea creatures. You can also see whales jumpiong like crazy everyday in front of the hotel. The pools and gradens were great also and everything was close together. I love the sounds of birds chirping in the morning and the evening but WOW they are very loud. If you are not used to that you can not sleep with your windows open. Our rooms exceeded our expectations, we had two bedrooms plus a huge loft so there was more than enough room for all of us. We were on the 4th floor and had an ocean view, it was great.Washer and dryer were a life saver and the kitchen was fully equiped. Dish soap, laundry soap you name it, it was there. One downfall is that the maids did not clean our rooms for the first few days for some reason, they came after 5:00 pm and then it was too late. But the rest of the week it was Ok. Internet works great, the grounds are beautiful and there's a boardwalk three hotels (starts at the Westin) down that leads you right to Whaler's village which is awesome. Ran the boardwalk every morning and it's very safe. There's a supermartket right our front of the hotel and a great place for coffee in the morning called Java Jazz, a must if you need a coffee fix in the morning. Very satisfied with the hotel, will definitley be back.

Reviews.Title: “exelllent”
Reviews.Author: Molly C
Reviews.Content: As soon as we entered the lobby our expectations were exceeded. The whole property is beautiful. A few tips for those who are considering staying here. We found a range of prices for the units and ended up going through VRBO. All of the units that Kaanapali shores rents directly are upgraded with granite, etc. but you can find deals a little cheaper if you are willing to forgo the upgrades and book through VRBO. We still found our unit to be fabulous, clean, nicely decorated and just what we wanted. There are a couple of little shops on site that are handy and have snacks and some basic food essentials as well as some souvenirs, sunscreen, etc. Not too back of prices either. The snorkeling just out in front is pretty good, especially if you go a bit to the left . There is a nice walking path toward black rock and it is fun to take the stroll and look at the other hotels. And after seeing many of them we will again choose Kaanapali shores next time we go, just can't beat the value. You get a lot for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space and the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: BlueUlysses
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the space of the one bedroom ocean view apartment we stayed in. It had a spacious living room and kitchen with a large oven. There was heaps of cupboard space for clothes and a good sized lanai to relax on. We loved the colourful light switches and Hawaiian style furniture and prints, The resort was attractively set out with a good sized pool, spa and lovely garden area. We were well looked after by the concierge when we booked day trips and the bell boys were friendly and helpful. One thing we did find surprising was the cost of transport to the hotel from the airport. There were no cars to hire at the airport and the people in front of us were being charged $1600 for 7 days hire. It was a $100 trip to and from the airport by taxi. The shuttle was more economical at $70 for two adults one way. Australians may find this an issue as they could be reluctant to drive on the opposite side of the road and then you are stuck with expensive transport. One advantage of not having a car was we did not have to $30 per day to park. Once at the hotel you could pay $1 for a trip in the bus to the Whaler's Village shopping area and then another $1 to travel to Lahaina. We did this each night to both shop and to eat at the restaurants. If you are lucky you may be able to negotiate with the taxi driver to get a better price to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: MauiTime_11
Reviews.Content: Throw in very reasonable rates and it doesn't get any better. The staff is very friendly, you're taken care of the minute you drive up until the minute you leave. We had a one bedroom Ocean View Condo with all the amentities you need, well decorated and spotless. The housekeeping staff was great (my girlfriend cleans as she goes so we had the Do Not Distrub sign out most of the time). Housekeeping called us several times to see if we were ok and if we needed anything. This is our 2nd time here and the Bartenders and Servers welcomed us back the minute we walked in (not sure if that's a good thing!). The Expedia booth is excellent also, PJ remembered us the minute we walked in and took care of all our adventures (he has not steered us wrong once).

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: GandT222
Reviews.Content: The entire Kaanapali Shores experience was fantastic! Every employee we dealt with practices the ALOHA attitude. The rooms were great, the beach is beautiful (with exceptional whale watching opportunities). The grounds and hotel are beautifully maintained and within walking distance to local shopping, including a farmers' market. This was our first visit to Maui but we will go back and we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel,Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ramona L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel for 1 week in December. This is truly a perfect location on the ocean with beautiful grounds and a great restaurant. It was wonderful waking up every morning to the sights of the ocean while sitting on the lanai with our first cup of coffee. Mahalo for the hospitality of the hotel staff and the extra amenities that made our first week in Hawaii so very special. We would definitely stay at the Aston Kaanapali Shores next time we come to Maui. Bruce and Ramona Moorhead,Mn.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Maui experience (low-key honeymoon!).”
Reviews.Author: Antlerdancer
Reviews.Content: The hubs and I stayed here for 8 nights, from 1/15 - 1/23/2012. I chose this property for its value, because I was able to ge it as part of a package including car and also for the condo amenities (full kitchen, washer/dryer), etc. I've traveled to Maui at least 5 other times and typically stay in Kihei out of habit. I like knowing the neighborhood and usually my goal is to spend less on my lodging and more on all the fun that Maui has to offer. That said, this time I chose to stay in Ka'anapali because the hubs has never seen Hawaii and because I was unfamiliar with the area, it was ilke staying somewhere new for both of us. We stayed in Room 528, overlooking partially a parking lot, partially a grassy area and with a limited view of the ocean. The balcony was a nice size and included a chaise lounge and a small table with two chairs. We didn't spend any time lounging on the balcony, truth be told, but would have. It was pleasant and I really didn't need a fancy schmancy beachfront view. The side of the resort we were in was quiet. The living room was furnished "tropical" style, like most Maui condos, but was not tacky in any way. The couch was L-shaped and comfortable for lounging. The wireless internet was nice, and included in the $20/day resort fee (at first I was ticked about having to pay the fee, but most hotels do charge for parking and internet and such, so it made sense. I liked the free DVD rental program too, and the hubs checked out several movies during our time). The full size kitchen was nice - we didn't do any cooking per se but we did store lots of drinks in the frigo and appreciated the automatic ice maker. To me, the best part of a condo is being able to get dirty and wash clothes when needed. The bathroom was a decent size. The shower's water pressure was not to my liking - I like a lof of pressure, but it did the job. The shower didn't run out of hot water. However, it was EXTREMELY annoying that the tub drained very slowly so we ended up standing in several inches of water while showering. Just annoying and felt dirty. The bed in our room was king size and very comfortable. There were plenty of pillows. The lighting in the condo overall was not satisfying. There were two small bedside lamps in the bedroom that cast hardly any light. The bulbs were compact flourescents and annoying! Overall, I believe all the bulbs in the condo were this sort. I'm all for energy efficiency but I can't stand not being able to see! The bathroom had good lighting, though. The resort grounds were nice. The beach was pretty reefy so it wasn't a great swimming beach but perhaps the snorkeling was good? We didn't spend much time at the condo's beach. Staff here was great - I particularly liked Sheena at the front desk and Andrea at the Expedia activities desk in the lobby. The sundries store in the hotel was convenient for postcard stamps and a quick bottle of water. Mostly, though, we bought sodas, trinkets, convenience foods and beer at one of the ubiquitous ABC stores nearby. We would absolutely stay here again. If you're like us and more interested in seeing the island of Maui and experiencing all it has to offer, and less interested in staying on property, this is a terrific option for a comfortable, affordble place to stay. If we end up having a kid as a result of this honeymoon, we'll be back as a family, too. By the way, we casually mentioned at check in that we were on a honeymoon and they sent up a bottle of champagne. Nice! Fabulous vacation in Ka'anapali! A few other notes: Fleming's beach up the road a piece was a wonderful place to chill out, boogie board and relax. The Gazebo restaurant at the Napili Shores was terrific!! The food was wonderful! They do not take rez so you'll probably have to wait. We ate here twice and our average wait was about 30 minutes, but again, we weren't on a schedule so it was no problem to us. Amazing banana mac pancakes and wonderful fried rice! Lots of flavor- the 1/2 order of rice is huge!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and vacation of our dreams!!!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly666
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and enjoyed ourselves emensly. There were 6 of us in total so we got 2 suites. The grounds were always very clean and the staff was very helpful. Our trip was also a wedding ceremony. Madi (wedding coordinator) and Andrew (minister) were amazing. Madi helped us out with literally everything. We couldn't have asked for anything more. We will defanitly be returning to this resort within the next year.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Bryan G
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful the whole time we were there. I don't like having to pay resort and parking fees, so that is the only thing I would like to see them change but my guess is that all hotels do the same thing in that area. The free dvd rentals were a pretty cool perk, and the restaurant by the pool area was very good and the best priced food on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable place for kids”
Reviews.Author: ghibesan
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 traveled to Maui in July. We choose this resort because it offered a full kitchen and one bedroom suite for much less than staying at a brand name hotel without separate bedrooms. The room was clean and we got great use out of the kitchen. There is a supermarket across the street, or a Safeway down the road, where we loaded up on breakfast and lunch items to help save money. We have traveled to Maui before and didn't expect to spend tons of time on the resort (which we didn't) but the days we decided to relax on the beach were very pleasant. If you bring your snorkeling gear in the AM you may find great conditions, but it becomes windy and the water less clear in the afternoon. Another big plus for families is the availability of a kids club on some days/night in the summer so parents can have a bit of time for themselves. We would definitely stay again. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the pictures do not give justice for how nice the grounds are.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackbilly44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in January and was surprised by the lovely surrounds. The grounds are kept in very good condition as are the pools. The restaurant has reasonable meals that are reasonably priced but the menu is a little average but fairly priced. Service was very good and waiter very helpful. We did venture down the road to Lahaina find some really good restaurants Ours was a two bedroom with kitchen which was clean and had a garden view. The room was a little tired and could do with a revamp but it was comfortable and a good size fridge Across the street was a supermarket where you could stock up and save a few dollars on meals and rent videos if need be. Beach has a few rocks to avoid which was a little bit of a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: My bf and I spent 3 days here. The hotel is very nice. there are 2 pools and hot tubs. One for children one for adults. They have free activities on hotel grounds ei. snorkeling and scuba lessons. On Wednesday they had a musical show by the adult pool. The restaurantat the hotel was delicious. Only problem was adult pool was WAAAY over crowded. spent most of my time at the childrens pool which was more quiet, more shade so you're not baking in the sun, and not many children. I prefer no children on my vacations. Overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: FraserFamilyCalgary
Reviews.Content: Rooms were cozy, kitchen supplies were great, the only thing missing was a non stick frypan. Service was excellent. Take the time to attend the expedia meeting, lots of great tours available. Try to get an ocean view, we were able to see the whales from our balcony. Great location! There is a strip mall across from the hotel with a Times grocery store. Contrary to other reviews, a Costco visit is not necessary unless you are traveling with a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view of Molokai”
Reviews.Author: SteamKeeper
Reviews.Content: This resort is a little older than many in the area, but is very well cared for. The rooms are large and have everything you need for a relaxing holiday. We had a one bedroom condo. We found the bed a little firmer than what we were used to, but not uncomfortable. It was nice having a washer and dryer right in the room and this allowed us to pack a little lighter for our two week stay. Our room was on the eigth floor facing the Island of Molokai. We would often eat our breakfast on the balcony and watch the whales play in front of the resort. I don't think there was one morning when we didn't see the whales. This resort is nicely landscaped and the staff are constantly busy maintaining it. The resort has two large pools and two good sized hot tubs with towels available near by so you don't have to bring them down from your room. The restaurant and bar overlook the main pool and offer good food and drink at fairly reasonable prices (for Hawaii). There are a few souvenir shops and a small store right on sight where you can buy any essentials you may need. There is also an Expedia Expert booth in the lobby where you can book any excursions or tours during your stay. The beach in front of the resort is narrow, but beach chairs are available and it is a nice place to relax for a few hours, just make sure to slather on the sun screen. Keep small children to the pools as the surf here is strong. This resort is in a great location, about ten minutes north of the town of Lahaina. Across the street (within walking distance) is a little strip mall with a few souvenir shops, Pizza Paradiso (excellent pizza), and a large super market. If you don't feel like driving you can catch the bus right next door to the Resort. For a dollar you can ride to Whalers Village and shop till you drop. For a dollar more you can go to Lahaina. We quite often took the bus as parking is at a premium in Lahaina, but watch your time as the last bus back to the resort leaves at 8pm. All in all we were very pleased with this resort. The staff were friendly and helpful, the resort was well cared for and the room was clean and well kept. We would definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property!”
Reviews.Author: travellingwife
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Shores and LOVED it. My in laws had a one bedroom and the kids, hubby and I had a 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom. The second room had 2 twin beds in it. When we first arrived in Maui we headed straight for Costco. We bought tons of food. Then we realized that we needed to bring all of this food to our rooms and we weren't sure how we were going to get it upstairs. BUT....we got to the property and we were greeted by the friendly valet guys and right away they grabbed a shopping cart and luggage rack. They brought everything upstairs for us. The front counter staff were welcoming and helpful. Then we headed up to our rooms. Once there we couldn't believe our eyes. ALL of this space for us. With an absolute stunning view. In fact, we saw whales breaching right in front of the condos. There is a TIMES supermarket across the street that sells everything. So if you need smaller quantities then what you can get at costco, chances are you will find it at TIMES. I could go on about how wonderful Aston Kaanapali Shores really is, but you really have to visit to truly experience everything this property has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely time”
Reviews.Author: Summer P
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maui during the 2nd week of December, and the property itself was nice. We travelled for my mother-in-laws birthday, and we were upgraded by her AAA rep to a 2 bedroom end unit, with a very nice view of the ocean. The vacation was only dampened by the windiness at the resort and the unusual amount of rain. Overall the property was in nice condition. The restaurant left a little to be desired, and was a little overpriced for what they had, but the food was decent. Snorkeling right in front of the hotel was fabulous, and we even got to see a sea turtle!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Thank You Aston Kaanapali Shores!”
Reviews.Author: Doug Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores one week before Christmas. Absolultely a fantastic experience. Rooms are great. Lots of room to move around. Fully equiped kitchen. Easy to get around the resort. Pool area is great. Beach area is very nice. Good value for families. We will be back! DA in Regina, SK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base for Maui vacation”
Reviews.Author: delphi11
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at this condo from Dec 27-Jan 6. We found it to be an ideal home base - kitchen, dishwasher, washer and dryer - all made it very convenient for us. We shopped at both the Lahaina Safeway and the Times Grocery across the street. BBQ's were quite out of the way, but we did use them a few times. Would not recommend the on-site restaurant for more than the first breakfast or so - service was quite awful - would be funny if we were not so tired and hungry by that point. Only real issue was that we were in garden view one bedroom, and our bedroom window faced the walkway, so we heard people's conversations as they walked by our room when we were sleeping. More of a room design flaw than anything else. Check in and out were speedy quick and efficient, and staff were always very friendly. The grounds were gorgeous - so many different varieties of plants and flora - felt like we were in paradise. It was a great base for our excursions - trip to Hana, dinner at Mama's Fish House in Paia (not to be missed!), surf lessons, snorkel tour, etc. etc. We did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the riptide”
Reviews.Author: recentvisitor60878
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week with family and friends. We generally enjoyed our visit but there were some irritating deficiencies compared to other hotels we have stayed at on Maui. The restaurant is not very good, and the hotel staff ranged from friendly to passive-aggressive. The pools are not heated, which is OK during the day but less inviting in the evening. The pools and spas are closed from 10pm to 8am. There are lots of small charges (e.g., parking, activities fee, extra laundry detergent). The most troublesome aspect is a dangerous rip current at the south end of the beach. There is a warning sign at the neighboring property, but unfortunately we didn't see it. My wife and I went out for some casual snorkeling and got pulled out well offshore. We began to tire and would probably have drowned except for the kindness of some surfers who noticed our distress and guided us to safety on their boards. We later learned that another tourist had drowned at the same location last year. When we notified the hotel of our experience and suggested that the hotel should post a more visible warning, they replied that "the ocean out front (of) our resort is no different than anywhere else on the island" and "hundreds of thousands have enjoyed the ocean fronting the resort over the past 30 years with no incident." Apparently appearances trump guest safety. I am posting this review so that others don't repeat our mistake. For snorkeling, the waters at Old Airport just a few minutes down the beach are much calmer.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing family vacation”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: During the Christmas break we rented a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo garden view to accommodate our family of parents, and three young adults (20, 18 and 16 years of age). We enjoyed our stay at this resort. By the beach, clean, lots of space and well-equipped kitchen and bathrooms, grocery stores close by. Staff were pleasant and answered all our questions. We found snorkeling was best in South Maui rather than at the nearby Black Rock or at Honolua Bay (clearer water). My daughter found the sofa bed uncomfortable and had to sleep horizontally on the bed in the middle to be able to sleep. BBQ area was far away from condos and awkwardly located (not a place to linger or congregate at). Wonderful tropical fruit bought at highway stand south of Lahaina. I miss our daily papayas for breakfast. Farmers market 2-3 times a week less than 5 minutes drive from condo had delicious produce and edible gifts to bring home (i.e. Maui pineapple syrup). Swap meet close to the airport Saturday mornings where my son bought a beautifully toned ukelele without sales pressure. Highly recommend eating at Leilani Grill near Whalers village and Kimo's in Lahaina (look for coupons for free Hula pie with purchase of 2 entrees). My family loved Ono's gelato so much in Lahaina that we had to stop there before we went to the airport on the morning of our departure. Our vacation was just what we needed in the beauty that's Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but no sleep”
Reviews.Author: olioaceto
Reviews.Content: Like others say it's a very nice place, great pool, good restaurant, beautiful lobby, convenience store onsite, which is a great thing when you suddenly run out of something. Ours was room 446, a 1 BR garden view unit rented thru Aston. I dont know how they standardize the quality of rooms when they are owned by individuals but don't book this unit unless you like sleeping on a sheet of plywood. Bed hard as rock. Teenage son slept on sofa bed which was awful but you know boys, they can sleep on anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: dangerman_yyz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in lieu of the Ritz Carlton where a wedding was being held and did not regret it. A really good find since the place was much more family-centric than the Ritz. First, there is a full supermarket right across the street. So you always have the option of making your own/healthier meals instead of the salt laden options that are in most restaurants today. The suite we had (beachfront) had a fully furnished kitchen which made this possible. They really thought about the parent with young kids experience here. I never had trouble with parking and found their on site beach store convenient and well priced. They of course have a kid's pool and access to beaches, in addition to having a beachside restaurant. A big plus was the ability to use the BBQ grills and the tennis courts were nice (but surprisingly empty) If there is anything I can fault this place on is that the check-in and out speed is a tad slow. We will definitely be returning here if we're in Maui once again.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: LouisWu
Reviews.Content: Nice beach, nice pools. Rooms more than adequate. Would noramlly give an above average rating, but just can't. I found all of the ancillary charges made the place feel like a Super 8. Per-minute charge for internet access in the business center and additional per-page charge if you want to print anything, parking charge, fitness center charge, etc., etc. Would much prefer them raising the room rates by $5/night rather than looking like they always have their hand out.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Bubbsie84
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, was very pleased when we checked in and were updgraded to an apartment (we booked a hotel room). We had no view, but didn't mind. Very convenient location, close to Lahaina town and farmer's market, also right across the street from Times' supermarket

Reviews.Title: “upgrades galore!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhea O
Reviews.Content: We signed up for a trip saver room with AAA pleasant holidays, and were psyched when we showed up and had been upgraded to a condo (complete with ocean view balcony, full kitchen, separate bedroom and bathroom, dishwasher, flat screen, internet...you name it!!!) They did, however, at first give us the wrong room and we walked into someone elses room...awkward! But overall I got a lot more then expected, and that makes for a happy vacationer :)

Reviews.Title: “Not reimbursed adequately!”
Reviews.Author: slurpee10
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is the first poor review I have written on tripadvisor but feel the need to since I feel we weren't treated the way a guest should be treated. To make a long story short, we had not checked out of the room yet, however when we returned to get the items out of our refrigerator just prior to the 12 noon check out time, the maids had come in our room and started dumping our food in the garbage or down the sink, including the leis I had delivered to my daughters the day before. The front desk was pretty good about reimbursing us for the lost food, but proceeded to have leis delivered to our new resort the day before we left. When they arrived, I looked in the bag and they seemed fine, but I made the mistake of not pulling them out and looking closely at them. I guess I didn't dream they would deliver brown, slimey leis to us. The next day we arrived home with the leis they delivered as well as some leis we made in a class several days prior to that. The leis we made were in like new condition, even now, a week later. The leis that were delivered to us were just as I stated, brown and slimey. When we contacted Kim, the manager of the Aston Kaanapali Shores, she stated there is nothing else they can do about it. So I paid $58 dollars for leis that my daughters had for one night, then their maids threw in the garbage, and they think brown slimey leis work as a reimbursement. This is not how a guest should be treated. I get very tired of people that want something for nothing and I usually do not speak up about things because I usuaully feel it is better to just let things go, but this really made me feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartments on a beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: Carmel O
Reviews.Content: Had stayed with Aston in Waikiki, but these apartments were a lot nicer and top location. They upgraded us to an ocean view one on the 6th floor with a beautiful outlook over the sea and gardens too. Lovely master bedroom with a huge bed and our own washing machine and dryer. Gardens, grounds and pools well maintained and beach area lovely and clean. Just be careful of beach out the front, can be rocky. If you walk along to the left a bit it's more sandy and safer to swim with a small reef just off shore. Went to the free hula show one evening by the main pool, lovely with the sun setting behind over the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Aston Ka'anapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: Judy298
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit to Maui included staying at Aston Ka'anapali Shores. This was our third time at this resort, and I would highly recommend it . The service levels of the people working there are very friendly, warm, hospitable and extremely helpful. We were given a suite on the fourth floor overlooking the garden and a beautiful view of the ocean and beach. If I had any complaints it would be that we were not able to stay longer than the 18 days we were there. My husband and I love Maui, and the hearts of the people who live there. Mahalo. Judith and Phil McDonald. Maple Ridge, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent two nights at this condominium hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean, views from the balcony were great, and the kitchen was remarkably well-appointed -- even had a cheese grater and a corskscrew, plus great pots and pans. The grounds were lovely and the pools clean with pleasant temperature of water. The beach access was excellent -- we saw whales spouting in the distance! Facilities well-lit at night so we felt safe. Staff was pleasant (although the young woman at the front desk who checked us in was not warm or friendly -- efficient though!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough of a place.”
Reviews.Author: HankCalifornia
Reviews.Content: It is a nice place but not quite "heavenly" and "exquisite" as noted on some reviews. May be I am a little spoiled by other places. Nevertheless, the Aston Kaanapali is a nice enough of a place and I would recommend it. The weather did not cooperate. Can't fault the hotel on that. The hotel was doing some rather noisy (the drilling, specifically) construction work for a new parking area. I can't fault the hotel on that either although, for customer relations, it should make some type of gesture to make up for the inconvenience. The room we (my wife and I and our college son on winter break) had was nice and spacious enough. It is on the 7th floor with a partial ocean view, a kitchen with microwave and frig and dish washer and more utensils you would need unless you plan on doing some crazy cooking (why?). They clean the room and provided fresh towels and a new supply of tasty coffee every day. The services are good. Quick response to request for extra towels. They also printed our airline boarding passes for our departure flights. However, the extra fee ($19 ? a day) for parking and internet seemed a little high and unnecessary but don't they all do this sort of things nowadays? The pools and the beach area are a little small though. Not quite enough lounge chairs either. Our son took a 2 hour-surfing lesson on the hotel beach although he had to stop after 1 and half hour due to the rain and the cold. "Turtle", the surfing instructor, is a good guy. You should pay for the lesson at the towel shed and save about $20. We didn't. The most important item, for us anyway, is food: The hotel restaurant is too too expensive. There is a small shopping area with a grocery store and a couple of small restaurants directly across the hotel. You can pick up breakfast stuff and pre-cooked foods and sandwiches from the grocery store. (Don't bother with the sandwiches, mine was not editable). There is another small shopping area less than half mile left of the hotel with a breakfast place ("Soup" something) and a Chinese restaurant. The Chinese restaurant looks barely approachable but the food is much better than we first thought. Wished we had discovered it the first night. There is another larger shopping area about two miles right of the hotel with a food court. The stuff doesn't look appetizing. We drove north of the hotel along Rt-30 for about an hour until the road was a little too narrow and windy. Great views even though it rained on and off. We did not venture to Hana due to the weather and the long 4 hour (?) drive although we probably should've. I was told the view of the seven pools on the way is just incredible. As to car rental, yes you would definitely need a car. The next time I will try someone else rather than Avis because this is at least the second time they charged me extra fee ($46 more than the cost of my original booking of the travel package for 4 days) for tax and what not that the person at the counter couldn't really explain and I didn't want to waste time after a long flight. All in all we had a nice time. Would I go back to the same hotel again? May be not but at this point I am not sure if it is due to the hotel or just that Maui is not quite the place I imagined.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great to stay at! We stayed here for six nights. It was like a mini apartment supplied with - washer and dryer which we used four times, oven, fridge and dishwasher were great! We went across the street to the grocery store and made some meals back at the hotel to save some money. Staff was very friendly and very accomadating! Front desk was very helpful! We were supposed to be checked out at 12 on our last day and our flight was at 11pm. They let us stay a few hours extra free of charge so we could enjoy the pool a little longer! You could see the ocean from our room as well. Food was great the restaurant at the hotel, however, it was a little slow. But that certainly would not change my mind to going back to this hotel! Two pools which was nice! We will stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Maui gem”
Reviews.Author: AccountingBoyWonder
Reviews.Content: This was the third leg of our three island adventure - Oahu - Big Island - Maui We arrived on a Tuesday and the hotel staff were very welcoming, rooms are nice, beach was great, only down side was food at the resort was only okay. Overall great value

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing - Heavenly - Peaceful and Royal treatment - Superb service”
Reviews.Author: karthikg_11
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Shores (Aston) was exquisite, very well maintained, extraordinary service from each and every employee we came across. Check in was so simple and fast, that I doubted if it was really over :) The lady at the desk was proactively doing everything and explained every bit very well. Service at the Beach club restaurant was awesome. Bell boys were very helpful. The location was so alluring. It is not an exaggeration to say that I have already recommended this place to my daughter and her friend and to our other friends. You will only be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Kriesa
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our trip to Maui and our stay at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was upgraded for free to a 1BR with a full kitchen and a washer dryer, which was very convenient. Even though it was a "garden view" room, we could see the ocean from one side of our balcony, and the courtyard was lovely. We didn't use the restaurant or the pools, as we're pretty active sightseers, and were usually out of the hotel by dawn and away for the day, but they looked nice enough. We rented snorkel equipment through their kiosk, which was convenient, but it seems like there are better deals around. We got married while we were on the island, and the hotel left us a bottle of champagne on our wedding night. Overall, we were very happy with our room. The housekeeping was excellent, and everyone we dealt with was just so nice and helpful. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jopaldi
Reviews.Content: Great location, can't beat the views and the prices. If you land early enough and have some energy I highly recommend getting a trip in to Costco and Walmart (they are both right by the Airport) right after you land and save the 90 min round-trip. In response to the prior reviewer, Hawaiian State law regarding Health and Sanitation requires that any open food items such as oil, condiments etc must be thrown out by Hotel staff upon guest checkout. On prior visits to Hawaii I have seen some Hotels that have bins for unopened canned and boxed goods for collection for the needy. Also, there is a Post Office nearby in Lahaina, its a good deal to grab a few of the Priority Mail boxes and ship souvenirs, coffee, etc home rather than loading up your luggage. Buy a roll of tape and reinforce the Priority Boxes prior to shipping.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: disarm
Reviews.Content: Check in went very smoothly, and we were given a great room with a kitchen. The kitchen has everything you need in terms of dishwasher and plates. There is no salt or oil for cooking so all of that you will have to pick up yourself. There is a market accross the street as others have mentioned called "The Time" it is in a smallish strip mall that also has a hawaiian eatery (it is a chain we have one of these where I live in CA) and a pizza place (which was pretty good and the staff are super nice). I didn't spring for a ocean view as I was going on the cheap but I got a fantastic view of the ocean and the pool (521). So maybe you will get lucky if you decide you wanna go on the cheap. I do have to say waking up and having a mimosa on the balcony while looking at the ocean would have been a shame to miss. The birds....ahhhhh the birds. They ARE pretty loud. The loudest being when the sun sets or rises. My room was pretty close to where they were having their little bird party but I didn't have trouble going to sleep. A lot of guests I spoke to did say that the noise annoyed them, but it didn't really bother me so I guess its about your personal tastes. If you think you will not be able to take it I would make sure they put you away from the birds. I also know some people things the birds where cute. But they are little rats with wings trust me. Make sure to use your screen or you will find them trying to eat all your food. ;) The pools were ok. Nothing to write home about, or to you about. I will say that there were really laid back friendly people, and the families all seemed very nice. There is a daily drink that is on special at the restaurant by the ocean front pool. And they have a drink happy hour. If you walk down the beach to Dukes, they also have a happy hour with some food on special. It was fine for a snack. I liked the rental system they had for DVDs. It was pretty awesome to check out flicks for as part of the fee. The gym is also pretty good. If you stay at the hotel you get to use it for half off. So the daily fee is $5.21 with tax. They have a weekly rate you can get for about $20. So its not that bad of a deal at all. The hottubs were nice and welcome because it was very windy during my stay here (I am writing this review from my room) They also are letting me check out an hour after check out which I thought was nice. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “This place is the BEST of the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Connie D
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding stay at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores. Nothing could have made this trip better! Many Mahalos to the great staff throughout this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet place on North-West shore of Maui”
Reviews.Author: SMajor_11
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores the units the first week of December-we booked only a month earlier thru COSTCO and chose the location for it's VALUE & it seemd kid friendly (ours are 7, 11, 13) and it WAS.
