We booked a 1BR and on arrival, we were offered a 2BR for a SWEET nominal upgrade charge and so glad we did. The hotel is well located along the Ka'anapali Beach Boardwalk... the beach was a little rough at this spot, but a short walk or drive south led to calmer surf and great snorkling. The unit was ocean facing, had a nice kitchen, not as much kitchen equipment as I would have liked, but was do-able for the week stay and saved a ton of time and moeny to be able to prepare meals there and not eat in restaurants every breakfast/lunch/dinner. Overall, the staff was super friendly, they unloaded our car and even had a grocery cart to take our weeks worth of groceries up to the room. They even put our cold items in the fridge! The entrance was pretty, welcoming and opened up to a beautiful garden and they of course had a large jacuzzi, kids pool and adult pool. The pools were a little cool given that the weather was only 80 degrees or so but we're from California so...spoiled I guess. The hotel is walking distance to a grocery store, ABC Store (souveniers), gas station, other hotels and Dukes Beach Club is nearby. The boardwalk was great for a nice mornign jog or walk. This place is NICE, but NO FRILLS, great value and we were very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aston Ka'anapli Shores for two weeks for our honeymoon. We relied heavily only on reviews when choosing where to stay. All we wanted was a CLEAN and safe place to be for two weeks. When we arrived we were more than pleased. Every room was extremely clean and spacious. The kitchen was updated with all new stainless steel appliances (which we used daily). We were provided with dishes, baking pans, cooking pans, etc. We had a full size refrigerator and dish washer. This is a GREAT feature for families who want to stay in and cook or for honeymooners, like ourselves, who want to have quiet dinners alone. The living room was extremely spacious with a pull out sofa bed (good for a large family). We had a balcony that had enough room for a chaise lounge and a table and chairs. There was a hallway with a washer/dryer (amazing feature for anyone!). The hallway included a full closet and the bedroom had an additional closet and some drawers. My husband and I had plenty of room to get ready every day. The bathroom was a great size with a good amount of storage space for all of your toiletries so you didn't have to clutter the sink. We basically moved in and felt right at home. The housekeeping service was extremely friendly! They cleaned our entire condo daily. We were very pleased with our room. On site there was a barista (coffee) and a convenient store. We probably used the store every day. It had everything from frozen pizzas to medicine. There is a seating area with t.v.'s and a mini library (take a book, leave a book or just read it and return it!). Also, the on site restaurant was a great place to eat. We ate in for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Sometimes we ordered take-out. It overlooked the pool and the ocean. The staff was very friendly. The bar can be accessed from inside or poolside. We used it daily from the pool. There also was an Expedia travel guide right at the pool that can help with any activities you would want to plan. If you go through this place a lot of the activities will be discounted. We booked two weeks worth of activities and they were some of our best memories. There are two great pools along with lounge chairs and beach access. Across the street are some restaurants for a quick bite (Subway, Mexican, etc.) or places to have a sit down dinner. Next to that is the Times Grocery Store. It was really convenient to be able to walk to the grocery store. Also, the bus stops right outside of the hotel whereas other places you have to walk a little ways to the bus stop. Overall, everyone was so friendly and very welcoming. The place had everything we needed and more. It was very clean and a great price for the service. It was much better than we ever anticipated. We would recommend it to any family or friends. It's a great place for families, honeymooners, anniversary celebrators, or friends to enjoy Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back time and time again...”
Reviews.Author: Sonja R
Reviews.Content: Wow! From the moment we checked in through the time we checked out four days later, all we could say time and time again was 'Wow"! The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room (907) was awesome and the views....spectacular! Five minutes in our room and we both agreed that we would definitely return again and again. We traveled with friends who stayed in 603 and their response was the same. Definitely check out the restaurant. We had breakfast and dinner there and both were wonderful. We've often been disappointed because we see one thing on the website but something totally different (and not in a good way) upon check in. This was defintiely not the case here. I wish we could have stayed longer but we will definitely be repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “Our wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the above resort and could not fault the whole experience. We had such a wonderful stay and would recommend to anyone to stay here.l

Reviews.Title: “WOW--Wished I planned a longer stay!”
Reviews.Author: matret
Reviews.Content: We rented rooms 402 & 405. When we first walked into room 402, the beauty of the room and the ocean view beyond took our breath away. The amenities--granite countertops, full kitchen, washer & dryer, HUGE master suite with adjoining bath, comfortable living room and especially the beautiful patio were beyond our expectations! That room was for my son & family with 3 small children. We spent most of our time there because of the large, lovely wrap around patio. We ate at the restaurant on site & the service was great & the food very good. The area is great as far as availability of shopping, liquor store, local take out & restaurants. The beach & pool were also great, We could only stay 3 days & wished we had booked a longer vacation. It was paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: DaddyTP
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a 2 bedroom ocean-view unit for 1 week in November 2011. These rooms are spacious with 2 bathrooms and full kitchen, and our had 2 patios over looking the ocean. This was our 2nd stay with this resort, and is very well suited to families with kids - ours were 9 and 12 years old. The service is excellent, there are 2 outdoor pools - one that's perfect for the 8-12 year old, and another that's deeper for more mature swimmers. There are also 2 hot tubs. The club house dining is excellent as well, being open all day from early morning to late night, less just half an hour prior to lunch for clean-up. And there is a bar connected, and both restaurant and bar overlook the pool and ocean. The facilities is wonderfully clean, and has several amenities readily available for guests - gym, spa, massage, salon, gift shops, store with basic supplies, just to name a few that we took advantage of. Highly recommended 4-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice play to stay”
Reviews.Author: Canadianreviewer72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a week and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Mynah birds reminded me of the crows back home as they all seem to meet at dusk in the courtyard, create a terrific racket and then go quiet once it's dark. Beware you will have to pay a $10 per day amenity fee and a $9 per day parking fee on top of your bill. I felt we were already paying enough for the room and that the hotel shouldn't be charging for this. That was our only gripe though.

Reviews.Title: “First time to maui”
Reviews.Author: alsqueenie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near great sightseeing, restaurants and grocery store to stock your kitchen. The rooms are very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. T Go to the welcome breakfast presentation in the Lobby your first morning to learn about all the activities on the island. The ladies at the concierge desk gave us great advice on companies to use and didn't steer us wrong. The grounds are beautiful and beach is right there for you to enjoy. Rent a cabana by the pool for the hula dance you won't regret it. Only complaint are that the beds are not comfortabl but that didn't stop us from enjoying our trip one bit. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Jen T”
Reviews.Author: jen t
Reviews.Content: My Husband and my self took my parents to Maui for a 8 day stay. This is a wonderful resort and came with everything that you would need. We took advantage of the full kitchen which made things much easier. The pools were awesome both my parents had there favorite. My husband enjoyed the hot tub also. The beach is easy to get to but you might want to buy water shoes because it is a little rocky to get out into. It was also to get a nice run done out to the road in front of the resort, there were also many runners out there. The stores across the way were also convient. It was easy to get the Lahaina which was also perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property great location love it”
Reviews.Author: scott j
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at this fantastic resort, what a great location on Maui. This place is set up perfectly, it has two pools, one on the beach and one set back, so you have options to hang out on the beach or drink pina coladas by the pools. My wife and I love to take long walks on the beach and this resort is perfectly situated on the most wonderful part of Kanapali. It is so close to Lahaina and all the hot resteraunts on Maui, not to mention all the great golf courses right next door!! The staff here is awsome from the minute you check in at the front desk to the girls at the bar. I will always recomend this property to my friends and family for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: BReady2go
Reviews.Content: Our family leaves the cold Midwest in February whenever possible and on our 3rd trip to Hawaii we stayed at this property and it was everything we wanted in a relaxing trip to a warm and beautiful spot. The hotel staff was wonderful, our condo exceeded expectations, we walked the beaches daily, enjoyed watching whales from our lanai, and overall came back feeling like we had the best of everything without breaking the bank. Our 2 bedroom, 2 bath ocean front room was the best spot for whale watching (which we did for hours) and with the kitchen right there having dinner 'at home' became a thrill. We are going back in February because we were all so pleased with the stay at Kaanapali Shores. We even convinced another family member to come when we showed him our whale pictures and movies. We are counting the days!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Vacation We Will Cherish Forever.”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis M
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our 45th wedding anniversary and a special birthday at Aston Kaanapoli Shores in Maui was a dream come true. We were upgraded to an oceanview Pent House Suite Condo when our's was not available at check-in due to an owner's meeting. We enjoyed eating lunch and dinner at the lovely Beach Club restaurant, always sitting at an oceanview table. The fish tank with colorful Hawaiian fish, and the other tropical decor added to the fine dining experience. Part of our wonderful memories is the leis making class in the lobby where we made beautiful fresh leis which stayed fresh all week in the refrigerator.They were worn to the photo shoot on condo grounds, where we got a complimentary 8 x 10 color picture. We also wore the leis to the "Ulalena" show on Hawaiian culture, playing at the Maui Theater for over 8 years. J&P

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: N A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week and it was wonderful. Room was clean and had everything you needed including full kitchen and washer and dryer. Free DVD movies and free WiFi. Property is on the beach and we had a great view of pools/garden with great ocean view. Couldn't have been any better. Will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with kitchenettes”
Reviews.Author: Stasia74
Reviews.Content: This property is beautiful and wonderfully located. Awesome staff. Some cochroaches and ants, but its Hawaii...bugs happen. Close to Lahaina and other beautiful beaches. Having the kitchenette and washer and dryer was awesome. Just stop by Costco, pick up food and drinks and you're set for the week. Good times

Reviews.Title: “Very well maintained beach front condo hotel.”
Reviews.Author: behaynie
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice. Staff is nice, friendly and efficient. Beautiful garden area with two well maintained pools and hot tubs, one set of which is beach side. Poolside bar and restaurant with friendly staff. Comfortable beach with loungers was not crowded. Each night at sunset the garden trees fill up with swarms of birds. They are loud, but somehow this seems natural and unique at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay at the Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: bran-chan
Reviews.Content: I really am partial to this location. So low key and central as we really like to visit so much of the island. Easy trek up to Kapalua Bay, and not far from Lahaina. The views are phenomenal and if you are there during the whale season, you WILL see whales from your lanai. Such a great and relaxed vibe, all sorts of amenities nearby and on property. It is great value for the $. Would recommend highly, we rent through VRBO. Many units are privately owened, so some are upgraded really nicely, and some have orginal furnishings. The upgrades have been nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Clean, modern with great facilities and staff. Well situated right on the beach with a shopping centre opposite that has everything you need. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great value”
Reviews.Author: Iluvthetropics
Reviews.Content: I was pleasently surprised on how wonderful this resort was. The beautiful new lobby and the gals at the from desk always having a smile. True aloha spirit. My room on the 3rd floor was just perfect. The bed was so comfortable and my spacious living room and kitchen was huge. The balcony had a super great view even though it was a graden view room I still had a great view of the pool and beach. The grounds were just lovely and peaceful. Great beach access and good location for walking the boardwalk. All the rooms are personally owned and then put into inventory and they are all kep up very nicely. So the property is managed well. Cant wait to recommend

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and good value!”
Reviews.Author: ibkatg
Reviews.Content: I have already been here for 3 days and will be staying for 6 more! I have a one bedroom suite with a pull out bed in the living room. Room is spacious and furniture is nice (nothing to write home about, but nice). I booked a garden view room but I still have a very nice view of the ocean (see room details below). My room is also right in front of the hotel waterfall so you hear wanter constantly which has been great. Friendly and helpful staff. Even the bell man had wonderful travel tips for us which was great. Full kitchen is so useful if you don't want to spend time eating out so you can spend all your time soaking up the wonderful sun! A complete reasonably priced grocery store is across the street (its called the Times). But if eating out is your thing there are also several eateries of varying kinds just up the road. Beach is nice, many beach chairs with and without covers available for your use. Pools are great, spa is great. So far my only complaints are that the internet connection in my room is very weak and when I called for help they said they would call back but still haven't (but i'm writing this now so its clearly working at this moment :-). Also, although we have received fresh towels each day the cleaning so far has been at a minimum (cooked dinner last night and came back to dirty stove and kitchen counters this morning so ended up cleaning my own mess which was a little disappointing since I am on vacation :-) And finally, the pull out couch bed is NOT very comfortable but the main bed in the bedroom is more than comfortable. Still very happy here enjoying my Maui vacation.

Reviews.Title: “William”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Maui to celebrate her 50th birthday and stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. We had a beautiful room with a kitchen and living room, 2 flat screen tvs and a very comfortable king size bed. The staff was wonderful and very friendly and courteous at all times. The view out to the ocean was spectacular, the food was great as were the drinks, love those lava flows! We highly recommend this hotel and will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: 9__Escape_Artist__9
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, her family and I decided to take a trip to Hawaii on the spur of the moment. We ended up finding a good deal on flights and a 7 day stay at Kaanapali Shores. It was fantastic! Everything about the hotel was in top condition, the maid services were perfect, and nothing at all went wrong (if you don't count stepping on coral and slashing my feet open). I would highly recommend this hotel not only because it's a great stay, but because everything you need is nearby. Golf, shopping, a grocery store, it's all there. Enjoy your stay there!s

Reviews.Title: “Great View, beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: JanetBenedict
Reviews.Content: The view from the balcony was wonderful, we left the patio door open as much as possible to hear the surf.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda710
Reviews.Content: We were in room 846 (eigth floor), one bedroom unit. Great view from balcony of interior courtyard and gardens, garden pool and then beyond, the ocean. Could hear the ocean from our balcony. The property landscaping is beautiful. I spent at least a half an hour just taking pictures of the grounds and flowers. Property has two pools and two spas, both very nice. Our room was very nice. Kitchen looked newly remodeled with granite countertops. Kitchen was a little short on pans & cooking utensils, but I found out later that housekeeping will bring additional items if needed. We usually ate breakfast in our room, sometimes lunch and mostly out for dinner. Nice dining area and "L" shaped couch. TV with game system/DVD player. The bathroom was very nice as well, same granite countertops. Bedroom wasn't very big but had plenty of storage for two people, in room safe and the bed was very comfy. The staff was friendly and helpful. Called maintenance twice about very minor items, and the responded very quickly. On Wednesday nights, you can enjoy a free "hula" show down by the big pool. Speaking of the pools, the are very clean and well maintained. The beach area at the condo was great! They have lounge chairs and a handful of covered cabanas if you need to get out of the sun. The sand is like walking in baby powder and the water is not that cold. Perfect size waves, not too big. There are also tennis courts and a shuffle board area on the property. My husband and I were here for our 5th anniversary and we were not disappointed one bit. We will definitely return to this condo and Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew K
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of coming to Maui on business and a coworked had made the reservations. I was blown away by the beauty of the resort and the ammenties offered at such a resonable price.This trip was paid for by my company but I will definitely come back with my family and spend my own moneyto stay here again. Better than any expectation I had of the experience and the resort. The staff was exceptional and the aloha spirit was evident!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tropical Resort”
Reviews.Author: brian51709
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days here in early October and had a great time. The property is beautiful and very spacious. It's located on North Ka'anapaili Beach which has a beach length over a mile long...perfect for longs walks along the beach. Black Rock and Airport Beach are along this stretch which are also excellent snorkeling locations. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs and the Beach Club restaurant was excellent for breakfast, lunch or dinner. A short 10 minute drive south and your at the town of Lahaina and a bid selection of restaurants and shops. This was our 5th time staying at this resort and we've enjoyed ourselves everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful condo property north of Ka'anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: Jonvilliers
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations for this property, since friends of ours selected it and they prefer condos. They stayed at this property two years ago and liked it, so we decided to stay there as well to be near them. For comparison, the last time we stayed in Maui a couple years ago, we stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. So it's not the Ritz, but it is a very nice condo unit and very reasonably priced. We paid $230/night for a 2BR garden view that actually had a really nice ocean view (unit 354). Our friends were in 356 and they had an even better ocean view. If you can get in that building (I think it is all 2BR condos) on the left of the property, all of the garden views have a pool and ocean view, no need to pay more for the ocean view. The rooms were extremely clean and well kept, very updated in terms of furniture and all of the needed kitchen appliances and gadgets to make it a comfortable stay. We had a large lanai (balcony) where we moved the dining room table to eat each evening, large enough for six people. They had maid service that came in each day to change the towels and empty the garbage, changed the linens every third day. We were there for 9 days. Most condos we have stayed at in the past didn't offer any maid service at all, so this was a nice plus. The pool was quite nice and they had a decent hula show each Wednesday at 5p. There is also a restaurant on property which we did not try, but our friends did, and said it was decent food at decent prices. It is located right next to the pool, making it convenient for those lounging around the pool or not wanting to cook in their condo or go out for the evening. On the downside, the hotel is not actually on Ka'anapali Beach, at least not the Ka'anapali Beach that most people think of, which is south of Black Rock. This resort is about a mile north of Black Rock. So you don't have the wide beaches and sandy bottom, the beach is smaller, more slanted and quite rocky. Be careful going in, even with water shoes. Almost everyone I knew who went in ended up with cuts on their legs and/or feet. It would have been nicer to have the barbeque grills in a more accessible location. They are located between the tennis courts and the parking garage at the front of the property, near the main road. While there are picnic tables in this area, it's not a great place to gather for dinner. And they are so far from the units that food would be cold by the time you walk back. Several reviewers commented on the bird noise. We loved the sound of the birds, they were not too noisy to be disruptive. The one noise that did bother us was the drone of the kitchen fan in the restaurant, which was at about the same sound frequency as the ocean waves roaring into the shore, so we missed hearing the sound of the waves.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: turtlepics
Reviews.Content: The Resort was very nice, the room was more of an apartment ( huge) . Food on the property was well priced & service was fast & friendly. Liz at the front desk went above & beyond. She really was the spirit of Aloha ! Parking was good. We were able to enjoy so much from this location . The only down side was the housekeeping. We found sheets on our night stand instead of on the bed. We did not get a bathmat one day, but I specifically went out of my way to try & recycle. When the bottles I had separated ( glass , plastics etc) I saw the maid throw in the garbage I was disturbed ! They did only light housekeeping at best during our 1 week stay. The pool & hot tub were ok , but really do require an update to stay competitive .The lady in the cabanna was helpful & well informed. The grounds were great ! Beautifully kept gardens made you feel like you were in paradise. There was construction on the parking garage, however that did not effect us at all. The workers were all so nice and friendly. A great store to fill your fridge across the street and shopping everywhere. The concierge staff we did not take advantage of their services , although we had heard really good feedback from other guests.We will return, we will tell our friends & this is a family friendly nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha and Mahalo”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Cap_Gal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the AKS in Oct 2011 and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is well located just 10 minutes north of Lahaina. Our ocean view room was spacious and the service was excellent - very attentive staff. The rooms are dated in terms of furniture but were most comfortable. We ate twice in the Beach Club Restaurant which was very good. The onsite gym, although not large, has excellent equipment (many machines seemed new) and was very clean. The only drawback is the rocky beach fronting the hotel which is not ideal for swimming. A five minute drive north to Napili Beach or south to other Kaanapali beaches brings you to beautiful white sandy shores for all water activities. Thank you for a restful and relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KERRY M
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights at the resort from Honolulu 3 days before going and had no idea about accommodation in Maui. On arrival we were thrilled with the location and style of the resort. Having the shopping centre close by was great for easy meals, also the resort restaurant had good reasonably priced meals. The beach walk from the resort south to Whaler's Village was easy with beautiful views. We loved the quiet pool amongst the rolling green lawns and found it so peaceful and relaxing. The staff were friendly and helpful. we didn't hire a car but the public bus available close to the entrance of the resort was great getting to Lahaina and Whalers Village. We thoroughly recommend this resort and will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: AAMFS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in October 2011 and thought it was really great. The room was clean and the kitchen was top class. Check in and check out was easy and the staff were generally very helpful. The beach at the back of the hotel was fantastic, great view and not too many people (and beach furniture provided). Hotel was also right opposite a good sized supermarket and other food shops and a short drive to Lahaina. Bed was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dennis W
Reviews.Content: We were very happy staying here. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms, while they could use new carpet and furniture, are very quiet. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: adisabatino53
Reviews.Content: This is really a condo rental with a good locale. Great for a family if you want a kitchen to save some money by eating in. The beach is nice there, but take a 1/2 mile or more walk south of it and you get to the greater Kaanapali beach. You'll see more hotels on your beach walk and nice shopping! There are a few very good restaurants there. One of our favorites is the Hula Grill, located on the beach. A fun place to dine at sunset, good food, and then walk around and shop or see some free live performances located at that spot!! Go into Lahaina for more shopping, great restaurants, art, and people watching. I've stayed in Wailea before but we always return to Kaanapali beach. A really fun thing to do is take a sunset cruise from Lahaina - the town and the mountains make for a beautiful backdrop to the sail!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kged623
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure we had a great experience at Aston Kaanapali Shores. We had a 1 bedroom with kitchen, living space. Upgraded (due to promotion for over 50+ yrs.old) to an ocean view room. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Room was clean and spacious. Pools nice. Not a huge beach front, but acceptable - sandy bottom. The only negative is the restaurant. We ordered a meal to pick up and take to the room. (No room service) Quality was really bad. Soggy bun from what appeared to be the result of heating a "grilled" chicken breast on the bun. Yuk. Chicken strips were "created" as were the pulp created "fries". There is a market across the street -- easy to pick up quick-to-prepare meals. I would stay here again! Miss our ocean view already!

Reviews.Title: “Great mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: Marcia S
Reviews.Content: Three of us took a mini vacation from our home on Oahu. Yes, we loved the Kamaaina rates. The kitchen was more than adequate and we had a lovely garden view. The staff was friendly from the time they hauled our suitcases up till the day we checked out. The activities staff was very pleasant and helpful in booking our snorkeling and assisting with suggestions for dining. And by attending the activities briefing the first day, we won a free day in a cabana! With two pools and two hot pools there was always a place to swim and relax. Lei making and other activities are available. We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Maui - Great hotel, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy B
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived at Ka'anapali Shores, we arrived in our room and realized we didn't have any views. We went back to the front desk and asked if we could be moved to a similar room with an ocean view. Ivan was happy to assist us, and moved us. We loved our new room! And we received a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate our one year anniversary. We found the staff to be very friendly, and willing to assist whenever needed. The hotel is located acoss from a small strip mall (walking distance) where you can grab a quick meal, or pick up groceries and stock up your room. The hotel is about 5 minutes from Whaler's Village, and 10 minutes from Front Street in Lahaina. The pools and beach were perfect. We never felt the need to go check out other beaches as we were perfectly content being on the beach at the hotel. Our area of the hotel had just had its scheduled pest control so there was a funny smell in the halls for about a day or two but wasn't overwhelming. Overall, we found our room to be clean. And we slept wonderfully every night. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sound of the ocean peaceful. This was our first trip to Maui, and we are already talking about coming back and staying at the Aston Ka'anapli shores. I hope it's soon as it's getting cold in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get away!!”
Reviews.Author: Fabian G
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time staying at the Shores. I recommend it to anyone who is going to Maui to stay at Ka'anapali Shores. Everything from the staff, services, and facilities really impressed me. I was sad to leave Maui and the Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Linwa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Maui. This time we decided to stay at the Aston Kaanapali Shores Resort. We absolutely loved our time at the resort. Quiet, clean and very friendly staff. Already we are planning our next trip back which just might be next year.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly staff, Awesome accomodations, beautiful court yard”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel and wished we had booked the entire two weeks. the staff were so nice and helpfull. The grounds and pool areas were very clean and very beautiful. The beach was not as large as around Black rock area, and it gets deep quite close to shore. There is a grocery store right accross the street and the prices were reasonable. The small pizza shop beside the grocery store was the best on Maui. We will be visiting the Aston Kaanapali again when on Maui, it is central on the island and a short drive to all the best Maui has to see.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: etiquettediva
Reviews.Content: Aston Kaanapali Shores is a fantastic hotel for families, couples and retires. We stayed their as part of a 15-person group! The rooms are BIG and so comfortable. We had a room facing the ocean from the family room balcony and the pool from our bedroom balcony. Loved that. And the sunsets. Oh my! Each day we come in from our sight seeing or beach combing and enjoyed happy hour at the pool. We met so many friendly people from all over. Many who come back to this hotel every year. Across a not-so-busy highway is a little boutique rich with souveniers and cute dresses and tees. And at a much lower cost than anywhere else. There's also a very good mexican restaurant in case you need a spicy fix, like I did! Book your tickets. It's FABulous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetFromOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst on Maui and were upgraded to a two-bedroom suite, with ocean and garden views. The rooms were big and well maintained, the hotel itself is beautifully furnished and it fronts right onto the beach. It's a lovely spot to stay for the Western side of the island, but it's name "Kaanapali" is a little deceiving as it is not actually part of the hotel community in Kaanapali, it's a couple of miles up the road. But it's still nice and has great access to public transport or hire cars once you're there. The only real problem was that we had to fly to the main airport on Maui, which is about a 45min to 1hr drive away... so it's a bit $$$ to get there if you don't hire a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ecg005
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the Feb 19-27 2011 we in Rm 402 it was a great place. We receved a upgrade(thanks so much) Everyone was so nice. We had a toaster and the wash machine break down. Within 2 hours both was repaired. The grounds were beautiful,and well kept up. We are going back there Feb 2012. We highly recommend this place. Having stayed in 2 other places in the Kaanapali area this was by far the best

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in Maui”
Reviews.Author: thesjones
Reviews.Content: In September 2012 I was blessed with an opportunity to travel to Maui on business. I had a discounted companion ticket, so I was also able to bring my wife. I had promised to hold down costs for the client, so I wanted to keep the hotel/copndo fees around $200/night. Since the places we had previously stayed were higher than this, I decided to take a chance on Kaanapali Shores. It rated good in Trip Advisor and we had been by there a few times on our walks on the beach from the Mahana and Kaanapali Beach Club. They had a senior program that allowed us to fit the budget and get a free upgrade (if available). We got the upgrade to an ocean view. The staff at Kaanapali Shores, from Brenda who made the resrvation, to the desk folks, to the restaurant folks were all exceptional and went out of their way to make this stay enjoyable. The facility is well-kept and has all the amenities we look for. Our 6th-floor room was great as well. The food was very good and prices OK for Maui. We enjoyed our stay so much that we have re-booked with them for our vacation trip in February. We have been to Maui several times and this is the best value and service we have encountered. If February is as good, this will become our regualr place to stay on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “With the convenience and amenities offered, I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Dahwnvet
Reviews.Content: When traveling with family, the Aston Ka'anapali Shores offers the ideal convenience of laundry facilities and a kitchen while being beachfront to one of the best beaches in the world. The location is perfect and the front staff was accommodating and friendly. One of the best decisions on this trip was to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than standard condos”
Reviews.Author: johnofor
Reviews.Content: My family of four just spent one week in Maui. To enjoy both west and south Maui, and save money, we spent four nights just south of Kihei in a decent condo on Kamaole beach, and then moved to the Aston Kaanapali Shores. Wow, what an improvement! Only about $60/night more (total with taxes, parking, and amenity fee was $220/night), but everything was much better: the room (big kitchen, comfortable beds, rap-around sofa-bed, 2 TVs, big bathroom, quiet washer/'dryer), the lobby and stores, the several pools, hot tubs, and big lawn, pool bar/restaurant, free boogie boards, and right on a beautiful beach. Service was excellent. This seems like a three to four star resort to me. At about half of the price of Kaanapali Hyatt (we stayed there three years ago), the Aston Kaanapali Shores provides many of the same experiences. I liked hanging out at the pool with the ocean in the background. And for a fancy luau or fine restaurants (we liked Dukes, Hula Grill, and Kimos) - well they are just next door or 3-5 miles down the road. PS: The birds were noisy, but only for about an hour around sunrise and sunset - so we didn't mind. If you close the glass door, which we didn't want to do, the noise was barely noticeable above the air conditioning. The beautiful sandy beach was great for sunbathing, and many people were swimming, but I thought snorkeling was too difficult because just under the water surface were a lot of rocks, and you needed experience to avoid them. We found much better snorkle beaches just a few miles north and south.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: caro_pachon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in a 2 bedroom condo for 2 nights at the beginning of this month. I had been to Maui before with my husband and stayed at a different property but this time I was going with my family as well, so we decided to book a 2 bedroom condo at Aston Kaanapali Shores. We all loved the condo!!! It was so spacious that my mom said she felt like a queen. The living/dining room area was huge. The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare whatever meals we wanted. The master bedroom was almost half the size of the condo. The most amazing feature of the condo was the wraparound lanai. The view was breathtaking and it was the perfect spot to view the sunset. We would definitely stay here again!!! Tip: Fly into the West Maui Airport (JHM). It's a 5 min ride to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: mad175
Reviews.Content: This place is very nice. Its a cross between a condo and a hotel. While it was mostly 1 & 2 BR condos, it had hotel amenities like a restaurant, some stores and a concierge. The grounds were very pretty. The restaurant was OK - we found the birds to be very annoying. The rooms were clean and functional, but I was surprised that the decor (at least in our room) had no personal touches. The furniture and supplies were in good condition, but very bland. FYI - If you want to stock-up on food, there's a great supermarket almost across the street called TImes that's open 5 AM-2AM!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: jenbahr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location and would recommend it to others. Great room, Great service, Great view and Awesome location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Moniv2011
Reviews.Content: Had been there for a week. Was a very good resort. Good service had booked studio and got an upgrade for 1 bedroom. A good place for couples with kids as it has good facilites inside the room like full size refrigerator, basic stocked up kitchen washer dryer and dishwasher. The main disadvantage is their swimming pool area is not great just has one regular sized for kids and one regular size for adults. For honeymooning couples or couples looking for privacy its not great. Would suggest westin or marriott, those places have awesome pool and beach front. The beach view is good here too but its too rocky for doing surfing or any water activity. Got huge cuts inspite of wearing water shoes. A decent place for those who want facilities like home and for kids, but not for couples who want a private and romantic time together.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: LZ001_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just gorgeous. Rooms are recently renovated and beautifully fitted out. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment and found it very spacious. The kitchen is particularly good and you would be very well equipped for an extended stay. The grounds are immaculately kept and there are two lovely pools. The beach is right out the front but be careful of rocks in the sea. The location is convenient with a grocery store and restaurants nearby. A short ride to Lahaina town. We had a wonderful time and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Patty C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10 day stay at Kaanapali Shores. Was outstanding! Was booked for a "standard hotel room", upon arrival they had already (at no additional charge) upgraded us to a "studio". We went ahead upgraded to a "1 bedroom" so we could have the washer/dryer for our 10 day stay. Just a few extra dollars a day. Staff was great, housekeeping did wonderful, beach was beautiful, pools/hot tubs nice. Its not the Ritz, but they don't charge those rates either. Very nice for what they charged. If I had to complain about something it would be the restaurant. It wasn't bad....it just wasn't good. Had breakfast and lunch there. Nothing to rave about, but with so many choices, you won't go hungry. Duke's down the broadwalk had an outstanding breakfast burrito with beachside dining. Merriman's....get your wallet out, but the view was to die for and the food was great! Cool Cats in Lahina, as well as Kimo's for prime rib. The Warren and Annabelle show is a must see. Don't forget the road to Hana and zip lining of course. Across the street from hotel is a grocery store and a pizza place if you're too tired when you arrived. Was very sad the day we had to leave. I'll be back Maui (Lord willing ;-) )

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: aahanson
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to see what a beautiful hotel this is. We were upgraded from a hotel room to a studio with a full kitchen. All the units have been remodeled so it was great. The rooms were quiet and had everything we needed. The grounds were nice, but we only used the hot tub once and watched the sunset at the beach once.

Reviews.Title: “I had the best time!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler56003
Reviews.Content: Given, I was 15 and only cared about chasing girls on vacation, it was an awesome hotel, pool, and location. It had a very laid back atmosphere where you could enjoy the hotel or go do things around the island and still have time left in the day to relax, which is what vacation is all about!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Room for the price”
Reviews.Author: MissyTulsa
Reviews.Content: I had booked the package through Travelocity and their version of Hawaii Saver room was different than what the hotel offered. I was on the phone for hours the night before trying to get the room we were actually quoted which was the studio with kitchen. To my surprise when we arrived they had automatically upgraded our room. We were so pleased. Also we needed an ice chest to take on our road to Hana and the staff were very helpful in lending us one and told us we could use the whole time we were there. The only thing I didn't like about this resort was how small the grounds were and only one pool. The beach part was ok but we chose other beaches to go to because there were nicer ones. This is a great resort for the money and the front desk staff were very kind. Oh and when we used their wireless network the Trojan virus kept popping up when we were online. This was scary since it didn't happen at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo, Great View, Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: jadedpony
Reviews.Content: We booked this room as a hotel on Expedia but you can tell that it is definitely a condo. We stayed in room 543 and it was fabulous. The booking stated that this was a "One Bedroom Garden View" but I'm not sure if there is a bad view in this place. I'm sure it helped that we were on the fifth floor but, our "Garden View" room had an excellent view of Molokai and the turquoise ocean. The condo has a bedroom in the front of the hotel which faces the West Maui Mountains (which you can see by walking out your front door), a narrow bathroom (with enough room to move around for two), and a main living area split into a full kitchen, dining area and living room area. The back of the condo has a simple lanai with a lounge chair and a table with two additional chairs. Amenities These included a washer, dryer, dish washer, refrigerator, microwave and oven. There was even dish soap and a couple of packets of soap for the dishwasher. Glasses, pots and pans were stocked in the cupboards. Bed The bedroom was probably the most disappointing portion of the condo. The bed was stiff (not firm) and was a little damp and smelled musty as described by my wife. Meals Honestly we did not spend very much time in the room other than for breakfast and for getting ready to go out to dinner. It was convenient however having the fridge, stove and microwave making it easy to warm up leftovers and keep our pineapples fresh. If you are looking for a great meal on the island, try one of Chef James' establishments. I'O had the best meal that we ate on the island and its sister restaurant Pacific'O was even more crowded and highly recommended by friends of ours. Maui Exploring the island was our main goal and even though we set aside a beach day every other day, we felt like we never got to relax. A word to the wise, try to balance exploration and relaxation. A big reason our beach days didn't feel as relaxing as they could have was that we tried to hit most of the major beaches. Our favorites ended up being Kapalua (laid back, barely any waves, good for snorkeling) in the north and Makena in the south ("Big Beach", big waves, wide, no resorty feel). Kaanapali where the Aston is is pretty nice with a spectacular view of the two near islands, Lanai and Molokai. The sunset on the day that we arrived left us speechless standing at the edge of the property. The view is really beyond description. We had been to Kauai last year and never seen anything like this. The offshore islands give a dramatic backdrop to the already gloriously sparkling ocean. Other Take note that parking is $9 a day. The "Island Orientation" on the first morning was mostly a rehash of everything we had already read and planned from Fodors Maui. The food (pastries, fruit and juice) was really fresh and tasty but we probably would have rather gotten up earlier and gone to Haleakala for a sunrise because the time difference has you waking up at 3am which would be a good time to leave in order to get to the summit. The garden or courtyard in the center of the resort was well kept and very beautiful for a man made garden. All in all, I would recommend the Aston to those on a budget. I'd only be concerned that you may not be as lucky to get a condo that was as well kept as ours but if they are all kept up to the same standard, I would not hesitate to book a room at the Aston.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, close to beach”
Reviews.Author: Machar S
Reviews.Content: What we liked: - Beach access - Swiming pools - Towels provided - Beautiful garden - Kitchen in condo - Clean room What we did not like: - amenity fee of $10/day extra - internet is slow for anything useful, some DVD's do not work properly (besides with beach nearby DVD's are not needed anyway) - parking fee of $9/day extra

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay here and would highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Tracy J
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Everyone was willing to help answer any questions. The room was beautiful. Kitchen, living area, nice bathroom, and bedroom. A home away from home. Mandatory $10 ammenity fee included internet, free DVD rentals, free photo session with professional photographer and free 8x10 pic included. There was a $9 charge per night for parking. We liked the location (walk out to ocean). Grocery store across the street. Was clean and the service was excellent. We hated leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff and vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Gina J
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel and staff! Loved our one bedroom condo. Plenty of room for all of us and the ocean view from our balcony was amazing! The restaurant food was excellent! Loved being right on the beach and having two pools was good! Kids Club was really a great opportunity for our son. One thing that truly stuck me about this hotel was the customer service from the staff. When checking in I shared with the front desk staff that I was celebrating my Birthday during my stay. The next day I received a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts! Also upon checking in we received a postcared that said to join a Expedia Local Expert presentation the next day. My husband and I thought it was a timeshare gig so we decided not to go. Later we saw a poster in the elevator that advertised the Expedia Local Expert presentation and it stated it was not a timeshare presentation. I decided to go with our son to see what it was all about besides it was a free breakfast if anything. Andrea Wallace gave a presentation on all of the adventures you could do in Maui. From helicopter rides, submarine rides, walking to the beach, which beach was awesome, just everything to do in Maui. She had the experience in each tour she was talking about and a passion about Maui that was contagious! There was no pressure to book anything so that was nice. But what a lot of information packed into less then one hour! We booked through Pili Sundin, a Expedia Local Expert, the Atlantis Submarine ride and the Molokini Snorkel tour. WOW he was great to book through. Thorough with questions to ensure that we had chosen the right tour and what would be good for our 8-year-old son. No pressure, no gimmicks just excellent customer service and knowledge! Throughout our stay we would run into Andrea and Pili and they would ask us how we were doing and what we had done that day. They remembered all of our names and what genuine smiles and questions they had. We honestly felt like family with the staff upon leaving to go home. Thatâ€™s how Andrea, Pili and the staff at Kaanapali Shores made us feel. I would go back in a heartbeat! While in Maui for six days we did the Molokini Snorkel Tour, Atlantis Submarine Adventure and the Old Lahaina Luau. Each adventure we did was excellent! We learned that if you book through your hotel you get better deals! So glad we learned that early in our trip!

Reviews.Title: “This is the BEST there is available!!”
Reviews.Author: Ardie S
Reviews.Content: The staff, grounds, amenities, and location are all fantastic. This is a real piece of Hawaii. We had the most beautiful 2 Br that we've ever stayed in. The grounds are manicured to the nth degree and the views spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay can't wait to come back again”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiGuy5-0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring break with our two kids and found the location great right on the beach.You get all the amenities of a 4 star hotel but with all the convenience of a condominium.Grocery store right across the street in a strip mall which was great to stock up with snacks and drinks for the kids.Great walk on sandy beach , 2 pools[1 kiddy pool] restaurant on site with bar overlooking main pool and ocean.Beautiful manicured grounds to walk around and enjoy.Easy drive down the road to Whalers village in Kaanapali where all the resorts and shopping are , but Kaanapali Shores was quiet without the crowds which was very nice.We had a 1 bedroom condo with ocean view and lanai which was wonderful,condo was fully equipped with full kitchen and washer/dryer,queen size sleeper sofa in livingroom.Lots activities for kids to do such as Hula lessons and Lei making with real flowers kids loved this.Staff were friendly and efficient and helpful which made our stay more enjoyable.Overall we had a fantastic time here and can't wait to return to Maui real soon and would definately stay at Kaanapali Shores again, would recommend to friends and family to stay here which I have already. Forgot to mention that I saw whales every day we were on Maui which made our visit even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “With the upgrade to 1 bedroom, this place was off the charts”
Reviews.Author: korling12
Reviews.Content: Booked everything through Orbitz, no issues. Checked in early at 1:30, was told that we were getting an upgrade from our studio to a 1 bedroom suite. This place is basically a 1 bedroom apartment, full kitchen, washer and dryer. There is a DVD kiosk downstairs - free, playstations in the room, so kids will like that. The room is really great, very spacious, clean, great lanai overlooking the garden area. Only used pool and beach once, no problems. We were here on labor day weekend, and the place is definitely not booked up, so that might be how we got the upgrade. All in all, very impressed with the property. Getting the upgrade and having all that stuff in the room was really the icing on the cake for the trip. Parking is not a problem, kind of annoying to have to get a ticket each time, but oh well. Like lots of people posted on here, the grocery store is right across the street, and there are plenty of places to eat. We never ate at the property, we never do when we stay at resorts. Having the full kitchen, with the grocery store right across the street, makes it very easy to stretch the travel dollar, which is awesome. Price, location, stores/restaurants in the neighborhood, the place has the whole package. Final note - I love to snorkel, this property doesnt really have great snorkeling, but 5 minutes up the road, Napili bay, great snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cartoon
Reviews.Content: We actuall stayed here in a private condo (VRBO) 7th floor and it was everything we expected. The one bedroom apartment was very clean, well fitted out with everything we could need. The resort had 2 pools, and a lovely lawn area to sit in the shade. It had direct access to a beach. There was bar and snack service around the pool. One of the pools would suit younger children. The staff were extremely helpful, and we booked 2 activities from their concierge who is connected to Expedia. Other people may find slighty cheaper prices down the street for the same trips but we just wanted to get things done. There is happy hour every day round the pool and I got quite fond of Mai Tais. We ate in the restaurant once, food was average, but service good. They have a little library of used books to borrow to pass the time. There is a good shopping centre across the road for all your needs to eat and drink. Apparently the pizza shop there has the best pizzas a NZ hawaiian resident told me but we did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores for 8 nights in unit #943 which we rented thru Kaanapali Beach Rentals.We were very happy with our choice of both property and unit. The unit was on the top floor and had a lovely view of the property, ocean and neighboring island of Molokai. It consisted of 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, full size kitchen, lounge, dining area and even had a washer dryer. It was well equipped with everything you could think of including beach towels, beach chairs, boogie board, flippers, esky etc. The renovated unit was in very good condition and well maintained. The property has 2 pools, a small garden pool and a larger pool near the ocean and on-site restaurant. The grounds of the resort are well maintained and laid out. Parking was $9 a day paid directly to the resort and there was ample parking spaces available. Across the street is a Time supermarket which sells everything and at the Cannery Mall in Lahaina there was also a Safeway. Each morning we had breakfast on the lanai and it was a lovely way to start the day. The sunsets each evening either on the beach or sitting on the lanai were simply beautiful. My husband and I loved our stay at Aston Kaanapali Shores and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag O' Maui Chips”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl T
Reviews.Content: If you notice, reviews for this property are mixed. Makes sense if you realize that units are independently owned condos. Some are 'owner used' and rented out ~ very nice. Some are used mainly for rental pool fodder and unit condition will reflect that. Some are in the middle and are fine too. To guarantee against disappointment? Don't pick run-of-the-house lodging that can't support its condition through specific unit pictures. Avoiding "Package" trips will give you some control over your accommodations. This is an OLD property, but its been up-dated in many respects If you want amenities +, head to Honua Kai or the Westin Ka'anapali Villa Ocean Resorts, but know the sticker price will match. For the money the property is a good bet for families looking in moderate price range. commons areas are not fancy, but clean. There's a decent on-site restaurant, 2 pools - tennis courts, outdoor BBQ areas. Having a kitchen saves on dining out which is not cheap. Times Market is a full service grocery nearby, with full deli, bakery, great produce and meats - even a Hawaiian tchotchke isle if you don't get your fill from local ABC Stores. The property is near some of the best snorkeling spots in the area. You'll need a rental car to get around, but that's true for Maui in general. Ka'anapali/ Whalers Village and Lahaina are a short drive and lots to see and do at both places. Good pick for a value conscious Maui vacation. How it made # 8 on Trip Advisor is beyond me, however.

Reviews.Title: “Want to come back every year!”
Reviews.Author: Roy T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a first floor 2 bedroom condo with an ocean view. My mother was in a wheel chair so being on the first floor really helped. Our 7-year old daughter loved it! She couldn't believe she can just walk a few steps to the beach or to the pool right out of the lanai. Room was well-equipped and comfortable. The DVD rental came in pretty handy as well. The staff was very friendly and accommodating as well. The beach front restaurant was very convenient too. The two grandma's with us was able to watch our daughter swim while they enjoyed a light lunch poolside. There is a great supermarket right across the street too so if you want to pick up some snacks, drinks, etc to stock the refrig, it was very convenient. We hope to do this again next summer. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Did not like this place at all”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for three nights. We originally booked seven nights at the Hanua Kai through vrbo but our trip was delayed with our one year getting sick. So we had to split our holiday with four nights at the Hanua Kai and three nights at the Kaanapali Shores. First and foremost the Hanua Kai is exquisite. We had a one bedroom suite and we ended up paying $200/night (before taxes). The room was modern, the grounds were well kept and the employees were helpful. I called the Kaanapali shores the day before my check in to request if I could arrive early since I was already on the island. The lady who answered the phone said it shouldn't be a problem. She made a note in my file and said to call the next day to confirm. The next day they weren't as nice. I explained that I had a one year old and that I would greatly appreciate if they could help. She told me to come to the hotel right away to complete all the paperwork and then maybe something will open up. When I got there she said to call back at 12:00pm and that a room should be available by then. At that moment I realized that I booked a studio with a kitchen instead of a one bedroom with a kitchen. I asked for an upgrade and she said that wouldn't be an issue but to call back at 12:00pm. When I called back I talked to a very rude lady that told me there wasn't a one bedroom available and that I wouldn't get an early check-in. Everytime I tried to get a word in she would just talk over me. I didn't care about the one bedroom but I wanted to get into the room so my son could nap. She could care less and eventually just hung up on me. There were other instances that I found annoying and unprofessional. The next day I received a phone call asking if I wanted the one bedroom but upcharge changed from $24/night to $75/night. When I asked for a late checkout they wanted to charge $120 to stay until 6pm. I don't mind paying extra to stay late but $120 for a studio doesn't seem right. I know everyone has a budget but if you can afford it go next door to the Hanua Kai. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are unreal.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in west maui”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: upon arrival EVERY employee was smiling, kind, and ready to answer any question and help in any way. the check in was simple and prompt, the rooms sparkling and modern with full kitchen & gorgeous views from the lanai.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend this resort will return!”
Reviews.Author: mamashenay_11
Reviews.Content: We wanted a lodging facility that was kid friendly and decided to try Aston Kaanapali Shores bases on recommendations from folks here at tripadvisor that it was kid friendly. Well, we want to chime in and say that is absolutely true - my 9 year old twin girls loved this place and do did us adults :-). We stayed in room 813 and 2 bd/2 bath suite with full kitchen (stove, frig, micro, dishwasher). And to boot it off, a washer and dryer in the room as well - we were in heaven! There are two pools - one is in the garden area of the resort and geared for the kids from 2ft to 4ft only and the other i fairly standard 3ft to 7 ft and sits right in front of the beach. Other hotel amenities, in room wifi, beatuty salon, fitness cener, tennis courts, shuffle board court, a couple of gift shops, travel agency, conceirge, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Good value. Clean. Great beach and pools....resort fee should include gym. Gym is tiny. Recommend”
Reviews.Author: fistful_of_dollars
Reviews.Content: Nice place...family oriented....resort fee should include gym. Housekeeping us stingy but nice unit....no issues. Great pools......Bbq area is near rotten garbage area.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: cindyrellah
Reviews.Content: This hotel/condo was part of the vacation package that we booked through Pleasant Holidays. We were happy with our 6-night stay. The hotel was in a great location, spacious, clean, and comfortable (ideal for families with kids). The property consists of privately owned condos but is managed and rented out hotel-style. The condo had a full kitchen, older large color TV (not flat screen or thin), Sony Playstation 2?, and in-room safe. I wished that bathroom was more elegant (it was just simple, but clean). My only questionable concern was whether or not housekeeping actually changed soiled towels when intentionally placed on the floors. There was a $19 per night amenity fee that includes self parking, unlimited dvd / playstation game rentals (Red-Box like stations in the lobby), and some other things that we didn't take advantage of. Restaurant was actually pretty good. Pools are clean, but nothing extravagant or fancy. Coined laundry facility on site. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We could live there!”
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: A terrifiic resort, especially for families. There's a wading pool for smaller children, a glass inclosed pool next to the bar restaurant and beach frontage with good snorkeling and tide pools. Waves were small when we visited. The property and rooms were incredibly clean. The resort is pretty much self contained: small gym (I'm a gym rat), spa, beach wear retailer and general store. You can also rent all the things you might want to play with for snorkeling, tennis, etc. We were in a one bedroom condo with a drop dead gorgeous view of the ocean. It was perfect for our family of three. It was nice to be able to eat in if we wanted and having a washer/dryer was really sweet. Food in the restaurant was good and service friendly. There's also a good espresso stand in the foyer. I hope to find our family there again next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: keshme
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, good size kitchen, staff was pleasant and helpful. Special shout tout to Diane at the bar. Only downside is that the pool areas were small compared to the others I saw in the area. Otherwise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to vacation.........”
Reviews.Author: hbpLongmont_CO
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time at the Kaanapali Shores and I hope to come back again. We stayed in Condo 905 and it was outstanding -- probably the best one yet. The condo you're assigned makes a huge difference in terms of how recently renovated it's been -- this one was great -- newly redone kitchen. It's a good idea to request a newly renovated condo when you make the reservation. The Kaanapali Shores is an older property, but has held up well over time -- really like living in the middle of a park with the ocean and beach at your back door. The amenities are great -- washer/dryer in each unit, housekeeping staff is very responsive to requests, onsite help with planning trips, stores in the complex and a supermarket within walking distance, Maui bus service available in front of hotel, pools, etc.... the list goes on...... We had a great time and would recommend this place to singles, couples and families!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asheen J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Kaanapali shores from 7/27 to 8/1. Below are our comments: The room was great. All new granite and tile and appliances. Everything was in working order. The bedrooms were nice and beds comfortable. The pullout couch was perfect for our two 17 year olds. They provide a PS2 along with access to a RedBox like kiosk to rent games and movies for "FREE". However our PS2 was not working very well and we felt a little disappointed in that we weren't able to watch movies during the evening hours. The TV is also the old CRT kind, but was perfect for our needs. We had a garden view room on the 5th floor in section 43, and we had a clear view of the ocean as well. There were two pools, the one by the garden is only 3 feet and the one by the ocean is up to 6 feet. The jacuzzis were nice and warm and always working. Definitely try the lava flow at the bar. We couldn't get enough of them. The beach is rocky right in front as everybody has noted and there were quiet a few waves that made swimming interesting. Beach chairs are right there and available for all to use. We tried snorkeling and saw some small fish, but the current was very strong and there wasn't a true reef to see. We didn't take a snorkel cruise, but did get some advice from locals to try McKenna Landing for snorkeling. Key Suggestions for Lahaina 1) Hit the costco after you land. We stocked up on Bacon, English muffins, Eggs, Alcohol, and Milk. It was much cheaper. Go to Times Supermarket across from hotel and get butter, cream cheese, salt, pepper, and paper towels. 2)Hit the Expedia seminar the first morning. There's free continental breakfast and they have some good recommendations on activities. 3)Do the Maui WaveRiders surf school through the Expedia desk. It was only 50 per person. 4)Don't do the Maui Zipline at the plantation. It's a waste of time and money. We did the Skyline Eco Adventures - Kaanapali. It was a blast and had a good lunch as well. Don't wear anything nice, the red dirt is everywhere and doesn't come out. 5)Places to eat Ona Kau Kau - right outside the hotel to the left. Great chinese food and big portions. Pizza Paradiso - Across the street. Great pizza, everybody's right. Jawz Fish Taco (Kihei) - about 20 minutes south of the hotel. Great food and atmosphere. They owner was way nice and gave us free sodas. 6)Hang around the tiki torches at dusk. When the guy comes to light them and blow the horn, he'll let the kids light the torches and it's a great picture. 7)Hit up the Longs Drugs at the Canner Mall. They had great deals on Maui and Kona coffee for souvenirs. 8)Saturday near the Kahului harbor by the college is a swap meet. Great chance to get souvenirs. 9)Sunday in Kihei across from Jawz fish tacos is a little souvenir cluster. Got a great deal on coconut bras and grass skirts. All in all everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki L
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom garden room on the 4th floor and it was beautiful. We could see the ocean although it wasn't really close but it was more of a view than I expected. I had read reviews to ask for free upgrade which I did but they were booked. We had another couple that was booked for regular hotel room and they were upgraded to one bedroom suite so they were excited about that. Overall, we had a great experience. The staff was very friendly. There was a desk to book tours and such and PJ was very helpful in getting us information. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Crackerjack1954
Reviews.Content: This Aston was a beautiful well kept hotel. It was really a resort w/ pool, jacuzzi, beach, restaurant, tennis courts. The entrance to the pool area has a lovely waterfall, flowers everywhere. The service was very good. The apartment was spacious and very clean. We were four people in a one bedroom, 1 bath w/ queen foldout couch. The kids said the couch wasn't great but the beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and lovely. Kitchen had everything you could want but we didn't cook much. This was a very nice Aston but be warned all Astons are not equal. See my comment on the Aston Kona by the Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: missH2525
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times; most recently with my entire family. It is a beautiful place and very family-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh! What am I missing? 4.5/5???”
Reviews.Author: Meh001
Reviews.Content: If you like rooms that constantly reek of automobile fumes because the parking garage opens onto your floor's halllway; If you you like standing in line for 30 minutes in order to check in; If you enjoy the smell of trash stinking up the hallways, sleeping on mattresses constructed of plywood, and hotel managers who scold you for having the audacity to question the shabby room you've been assigned; If you enjoy paying $200/night for less than average accommodations, a beach that pelts your shins and ankles with rocks, and an isolated location that offers really no where to walk; then, perhaps, the Aston Kaanapali Shores is for you! (But I think you can do better.)

Reviews.Title: “All good!”
Reviews.Author: MimiLadybug2009
Reviews.Content: Although somewhat older than many other places in the area, this hotel was nicely updated and most important, beautifully clean. The condo has everything you could need. There is a store with staples right in the hotel, a grocery store right across the street, and just a few miles to a Safeway for everything you can't find right there on the premises. Each room has a great view and the balconies are constructed so you have complete privacy, so unless you are on the first few floors, you can safely sit on the lanai in your jammies or bikini without anyone next door glaring at you. The elevators are rocket fast and take mere seconds when called. The staff is friendly and nice. The pool has towels for you to use and you are free to bring them to the beach that is only steps away. Parking spaces are abundant, and the fee for the night is $9. The swimming and snorkeling right on the property is very nice, but a little rocky. We found by going just a short stroll to the right or the left of the hotel had fewer coral deposits. I only had breakfast at the convenient restaurant on the premises and it was OK. I heard the food was average, in general, but I cannot personally attest to it. There are many choices within walking distance, so you won't ever get hungry. I'd stay here again, and I am very, very picky! And as I mentioned, cleanliness is the most important thing to me and in that regard the place was 5 ***** Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Maui is a perfect vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: Quantumraj
Reviews.Content: I recently took my parents to Maui to celebrate my Dad's birthday and we stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores (AKS). We had a very enjoyable and memorable trip. The accomodations are very comfortable with great views (try to book an ocean view room), and the property is well located-just off the beautiful beaches of Kaanapali overlooking the Pacific ocean. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Local Expedia experts are terrific in planning and booking local activities to make your stay fun. Overall, a great experience. AKS is well priced and highly recommended for all visitors whether they are on vacation with family, as couples or even for business. We'll be back some time and will be checking into AKS.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Kerander
Reviews.Content: My husband, two sons (5 and 8), and I stayed here for 10 nights in unit # 844 (1 Bed, 1 Bath, pull out couch, ocean view). It worked out great; I loved having a full kitchen and washer/dryer. The unit was updated with slab granite and it was clean. The only thing missing from the unit is storage containers, so bring some small ziplocks and gallon sized baggies. There are also 3 grills you can use (near the tennis courts). And, yes, there are some really annoying birds in the back center courtyard area. In general, they were noisy from just before sunset to sunrise. There have also been a lot of gripes about housekeeping, but we didn't have any problems (they do come at inconsistent times during the day, though). It was our first visit and I was worried about getting a bad unit (I booked our air/hotel through Travelocity, not VRBO) so I printed off a picture of the hotel (# floors, rooms numbers, configuration) from the 'Maui Revealed' book website. At check-in I asked what unit she had us in, I looked on my picture, decided I didn't like the unit location, showed her my picture and asked for something better. She was very nice about it and made the change right away. Also, the Maui Revealed book has an IPhone app that only cost $6, and it was really helpful to have as well as we explored the island. We stopped at Costco (next to the airport) on our way to the hotel. The bellhops carried everything up for us and later that night we went to the 'Times' grocery store across the street to pick up smaller quantity items. The hotel was full, but it never felt full on the grounds or at the 2 pools. The ocean next to AKS is okay; you can swim a little or play in the waves, but Kaanapali and Waliea beaches are a lot better. We rented boogie boards from Boss Frog's down the street (to the left as you leave the hotel). It cost $15/week instead of $25/week at the resort. My husband and I liked to take turns running; if you go to the left out of the hotel, you can run on a nice sidewalk through a residential area. AKS is a great location...only 10 minutes to Lahaina and there are several coffee shops within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “I don't think you can find a better value anywhere on Maui!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMK70
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by chance thru American Airlines Vacations in a package deal (we are from the Chicagoland area). I wasn't expecting very much for this price, but this hotel agreed to let a family of five stay in a one bedroom room suite. I went with the very basic one bedroom, garden view. Was I surprised to learn that our room faced and had a view of the ocean! The grounds were very, very clean and well kept; the unit we stayed in recently remodeled. The mattresses in both the fold out couch and the bedroom were of a high quality. The kitchen has granite counters, white appliances and looked like cherry cabinets. Basic kitchen stock such as pots, utensils and plates were included. (For those who travel with children know that eating breakfast in your suite saves the big bucks.) Had two pools, two jacuzzis and a bar area. Private beach that was just extremely convenient and very relaxing. Bought groceries at Times supermarket across the street--both quick and reasonably priced. Restaurants not to far from hotel. Had lunch at hotel once and it was good. By the Times grocery store there are two restaurants. One is more a coffee shop but very very good breakfast and the other had great pizza. Try both. I don't think you will be dissapointed! Appeared to be one of those condo hotel deals. And I think this is a deal! Note: parking is not included in price. We went with the $19 per night deal (additional to the hotel room price) and this included movies and games from a kiosk on site and a daily package of coffee for the coffee machine. We were very pleased and highly recommend this hotel to anyone with kids that is looking for value. Staff was very friendly and quick to respond to the one or two minor issues I had with the reservation. I also understand that there are many owners so not all units are as nice as ours. But I understand this hotel went thru a renovation recently and it shows!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, not great service.”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJodi
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed so instead of landing at 8 pm we landed at 2:30 the following morning, meaning (for us East Coasters) that we'd been up all night. By the time we got our luggage and rented the car and drove all the way to Ka'anapali, we were utterly exhausted. The guy at the desk was not friendly or welcoming. The room itself was very nice with a lovely balcony from which I could see the hotel property and a bit of ocean. When we got back to our room after spending the first day driving the Road to Hana, our room had not been made up. Annoying. We called and they sent someone up fairly quickly. The restaurant at the hotel was fine, nothing special. Overall we had a nice stay but I wouldn't rave about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Shores, would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: happy4travel
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a great time at the Kaanapali Shores. The property is beautiful with many well-tended gardens and walking paths. With two large pools it never felt crowded even with lots of guests swimming. A real highlight of our stay was the staff.
