Everyone from the front desk receptionists to the maids, gardeners and waiters was friendly and helpful. Our 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo was very roomy, comfortable and well-appointed. With views of the Pacific from every window we had beautiful sunsets each evening. A nice touch was the starter kit left in the kitchen which included a few packets of Kona coffee and filters as well several tea bags. So nice to have coffee readily available the next morning! Another nice touch is the refreshing water decanter in the lobby. Filled with icy cold water and garnished with fresh fruit it was a treat to enjoy after a long day in the sun! Although we prepared several meals in our kitchen we did enjoy a few dinners and lunches at the Beach Club Restaurant. Great salads, wraps, Maui onion rings and wonderful piÃ±a coladas. Again, excellent service by the staff! There is a full market right across the street-similar to a Safeway which makes it very convenient to pick up what you need to stock your kitchen. Also within a short walking distance are a few reasonably priced restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 706”
Reviews.Author: stelucu
Reviews.Content: Stunning view from the living room an balcony, the condo was very comfortable, very reasonable price. Restaurant downstairs is just ok ... And ... TVs are very old ... Remote controls you have to say please to work. It's time for new tvs !!! You can get better TVs for free from craigslist :))). Overall ... Very happy with the place. Would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome time, it was great.”
Reviews.Author: Simella
Reviews.Content: Aston Kaanapali Shores was fantastic, the gardens are beautifully maintained - the hotel is so clean - the website does not do it justice - you have to go for yourself to really experience this magical place. As soon as we arrived the gardens on the outside were gorgeous, the foyer was immaculate and the staff at the front desk especially Vangie was exceptional. She was so professional, she explained everything so well, I even bumped into her in the hallway a couple of days later after we check-in and she asked me if everything was alright and how was my holiday going - that was so sweet - she is so suited to that job - keep up the great customer service Vangie. Inside the hotel once again the gardens was just beautiful - I absolutely loved them - the gardens make the resort. The pools and hot tubs were great - nice and clean. We met so many other families in the hot tubs. Aston Kaanapali Shores is a very family friendly resort. I have three children 18, 17 and 14 - they met so many other children - they had an awesome time. The restaurant was also very good, we mainly had breakfast there, the food was good and the staff was great as well. The security guard Michael was also awesome. He was very friendly as well. The apartment was also really nice, we had a great view. I cooked a few times there in the kitchen, it had what I needed. The king bed in the main bedroom was awesome - it was so comfortable. While we were there we rented a car for three days. We went to Hana, that was an experience, really pretty but too many winding roads - it went on for ages - wouldn't recommend if you suffer motion sickness. we viisted the rock pools they were really lovely. We went snorkelling at Honolua Bay that was the highlight of the trip - we hired smorkel, mask and fins accross the road at Snorkel Bobs for 9usd for the day - what a bargain - we parked the car on the street and walked down to the beach through the rainforest - this beach is privately owned by a Hawaiin family so they asked for a small donation - that was nothing as compare to Hanauma Bay at waikiki where they were asking 7.50 usd per person to get onto the beach and 1 usd to park your car - what a joke. Honolua bay had so many more fish and the place was just magical. We also visted Lahaina shops - the shopping strip was so cute - the banyan tree was so big and beautiful - we had lunch at he kool cat cafe - the burgers was awesome - a family at the resort told us to go - food was really good. Overall my experince as the resort and Maui was fantastic - would highly recomment the resort and the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, economical, clean.”
Reviews.Author: NoCalJen
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a long, economical trip. My children and I stayed here for 2 weeks. Hotel is nice, clean, good location, great beach and the service was exceptional. If I was only rating on customer service, they'd have an A+. This is not the Westin but I would stay here again. 2 bed/2 bath, family room & kitchen was plenty of room for myself & 3 teenage girls. Price made it so we could stay 2 weeks instead of 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: mcs99001
Reviews.Content: Very family friendly hotel with condo style amenities. Washer/dryer in our unit as well as a full kitchen. The location is perfect with the beautiful Pacific Ocean in the front yard and a walk to the grocery store for provisions. We enjoyed being able to borrow tennis rackets to play on the grounds. Two pools and hot tubs open late. The restaurant on the graounds is decent. Very relaxing stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ZA2008
Reviews.Content: All the amenities and fun without the attitude. The grounds are nice and tropical with an open architecture. They've got two pools a convenient cafe/resraurant and it sits right on the beach. I had a room that was more like a studio with new tile flooring and stainless steal appliances. Right across the street is a strip mall and a grocery store if you get sick of the restaurant prices. Great for family or friend vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Friendly Staff.. Too bad about the nickle & diming”
Reviews.Author: dewey25
Reviews.Content: Overall I was pleased with this resort. This was our 1st Condo vacation rental.. The rooms were big enough for a family of four. Had a nice partial view of the ocean.. The grounds were nice and clean.. Beach was great.. .What I really liked about this place, the pools were never too crowded, nor was the beach.. We visited family at The Westin and few minutes away and it was way too busy... Certainly not relaxing there... BBQ area by the tennis courts where we cooked our won meals.. Staff was great. Very friendly. Maids did a good job. I do have an issue with all the little charges... I completely realized that happens but this was ridiculous.. $9 for daily parking... ok... $11 to use the gym.. Come on.. No wonder no one was ever in there... this was the kicker.. $2.50 for daily use of the gym... REALLY.. Do you really need that extra 24 dollars a week... Pretty Weak. But overall, a good expereince in a great part of Maui..

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: loveacleanroom
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Aston Kaanapali Shores. We enjoyed the location-close to stores and resturants. Had a nice garden view, but could see the ocean. Beach chairs were available and we loved the breakfast at the resturant. We will stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: QueenofdiamondsTulsa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this condo many times but this was the first in the Aloha Suite. We had the most beautiful views--a corner room overlooking the ocean on one side and the gardens and pool on the other. The room was beautifully furnished with everything we needed. We had breakfast and lunch on the lanai and there was a rainbow to wake us up nearly every morning. It was a beautiful trip to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DianeC5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores resort. Although it is about a 45 minute scenic drive from the airport, the location was perfect for a relaxing Maui vacation. The grounds were immaculate and the people at the front desk and friendly and helpful. Our suite was decorated in a tropical motif and included a bedroom, bathroom, living room with a sofa bed, and a kitchen/dinette. Although our 8th floor lanai was a little windy at times, it offered a beautiful view of the resort gardens. The housekeeping staff was great and made sure we had fresh towels, that our bed was made, and that our bathroom room was clean every day. We attended a briefing at the resort, with complimentary pastries, fruit and juice/coffee, the morning after our arrival to learn about potential tours on the island. The people at the excursions desk were very helpful in helping us arrange a snorkeling trip to Molokini Crater on the Pride of Maui and a bus trip to Hana with Valley Isle Excursions. (I would highly recommend both tours.) There is a plaza across the street from the resort that has a few small restaurnats and boutiques and reasonably priced food market. We used the "first come first serve" gas grills on the resort property to barbeque our own dinner one evening. We also ate three meals at the resort restaurant and found it to be reasonably priced and a gorgeous place to watch the ocean sunset. One evening they even had a guitarist who played as we ate. On Wednesday evenings the resort offers a free show with polynesian singers and dancers next ot one of the pools. Although we didn't go in the pools or the ocean at the resort, eveyone seemed to enjoy both. I would definitely stay at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: dweber1
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort. I was wanting a relaxing vacation at a beautiful resort, and this was definately it! The resort was not only beautiful, but was very clean and the entire staff was very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this resort to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Portland_Jeannie
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly friendly and the grounds are beautiful, we had a great time!! The beach is right there and was able to swim and snorkle without having to step off the grounds of the hotel. The pool areas are clean and convenient. Restaurant very reasonable and good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, large rooms and great lanai and grassy area! Rocky beach”
Reviews.Author: mauilovermomoftwo
Reviews.Content: If you like to swim in the ocean you may want to go someplace else to do so. We got many cuts. But I have to say the whole resort is great otherwise. Great sized rooms. Nice pools and hottubs and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with apartment style living”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithMe09
Reviews.Content: Spent over a week here and thoroughly enjoyed it. If you plan to do any activities, it is best to hire a car as most activities require you to drive yourself to the Kahului town centre (about 45 mins drive). Parking at the resort costs $9 per day. There is a fairly large supermarket across the road (Times supermarket) to stock up on food if you plan to do some cooking or save on breakfast and lunch costs). The pizza restaurant in the shopping strip is also quite good for an easy dinner meal if you don't want to dine at a restaurant. Had free internet access which was great. There is also a computer room for you to use (but you need to pay for this service). You can however bring your own laptop and use their printer in the computer room for free as it operates on wi-fi. Gym usage is not free. You can take the local bus ($1 per person) to go to Whalers Village or go further on a different bus from Whalers Village to Lahaina (Front Street) which has quaint shops and mainly geared for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, great location on beach”
Reviews.Author: LfromVegas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Not totally fabulous, but nice. The pools leave something to be desired - they could be more luxurious/larger but they aren't bad. The beach is fantastic. I wish they had a cocktail server or at least someone serving soda/water on the beach. They have signs that you can't bring down cocktails to the beach - why not? I can see not bringing glassware to the beach but everything they serve is in plastic. The drinks they make at the poolside bar are really really good though and the staff is pleasant. We were in one of the hotel suites with a kitchen. It was clean and was fully equipped. The bed didn't seem like a queen bed - seemed slightly smaller, but it was really comfortable. They have a no-smoking policy in the rooms, and that includes the balcony (which, as a non-smoker, I loved). A guest in the balcony below us was smoking and our room would smell like cigarette smoke when we were trying to get the nice island air in. I called the front desk and the smoking immediately ceased - most likely due to the fact that if they didn't they'd get fined big time (if they catch you smoking it's about a $400 fee added to your bill!). So I was pleased with how responsive the front desk staff was. The restaurant is not exactly gourmet. We ate breakfast there and the waiter was nice but the food was boring - I've had 10x better breakfast at Denny's or IHOP. Don't know how the lunch and dinner services were, because after that breakfast we decided to go elsewhere. My biggest gripe about the hotel is the housekeeping. When our room wasn't done by 2:30pm I called and the lady who answered wasn't very polite and told me that their services don't end until 4:30pm. I've never heard of housekeeping not finishing rooms until 4:30pm! That seemed somewhat ridiculous to me. However, I asked for towels and they were immediately brought up, so that's a plus. The town of Lahaina is only about a 7 minute drive down the street, which has plenty of shopping and dining, and Whalers Village is just up the street, about walking distance. Overall it was nice, not a 5-star resort but the grounds were beautiful, the staff was pleasant overall, the room was clean/well kept, and the beach is wonderful. Their new $19/day amenities package that is manditory includes free parking, room safe, movie rentals, and I believe access to the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Nice all around resort!”
Reviews.Author: lakeside83
Reviews.Content: This resort is nice and offers a lot. It is on the beach, which is fairly swimable, it has 2 pools, 2 spas, a resturant, bar, food store (similar to 7-11), a gift shop, salon, massage, gym (which costs more), and is right across the street from a grocery store and other quick eats. The rooms are nice and fairly updated, however i upgraded to a ocean view room, which wasnt what i expected. I paid more to have half my view obstructed by a this resorts noisy parking lot and the entire neighboring condo complex. I was easily 300-400 feet from the ocean, and i couldnt see the beach at all. Not woth the extra money for ocean view unless you get a closer unit. Overpriced parking and they nickle and dime you for everything here. Resturant was good and good prices. Overall, good experience, but disapointed with the money spent to go to a ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Both Worlds- Value with a View”
Reviews.Author: RunningRob
Reviews.Content: Our family went to Maui to celebrate my wife's and my 20th Wedding Anniversary, my daughter and her friend's high school graduation, and my other daughter's 15th birthday. A total of 6 of us spend a week at Kaanapali Shores and shared a 2 bedroom suite. We arrived after a long plane flight from the mainland and a 26 mile car trip from the airport at about 10PM local time. The young woman at the desk greeted us warmly, wished us happy anniversary and handed us a complementary bottle of white wine (which was pretty good by the way.) She also upgraded our room to a full ocean view "Aston Suite" from the partial ocean view we had booked. What a great way to start off our vacation. When vacationing with 4 teens and 2 adults (4 girls, 2 boys) space was a major concern. We need not have worried. The room was huge! The master bath alone was bigger than many hotel rooms I've stayed in. There was plenty of sink space for the girls and the second bedroom had a standard totally independent bath and shower. The older girls literally had their own bedroom and bath. There was a spacious kitchen and a wrap around couch in the living room with a pull out sofa. Even with the sofa pulled out there was plenty of room. A fair sized dinning area was somewhat separated from the living room area and made meals in the room easy. The master bedroom was cozy with its own TV and private access to the balcony. Speaking of the balcony area... it was simply amazing! The view is unsurpassed facing westward over the white sand beach and clear waters of the pacific. The sunsets are breath- takingly beautiful! There is a reef literally yards offshore that is totally visible from your chair on the higher floors (we were on floor 7.) The balcony wraps around the end of the building and at that point faces inland toward the green cloud clad mountains in case you get bored of the blue water vistas of the ocean. I am not over- exaggerating when I say that the balcony at this resort is was one of the most beautiful places I have ever been. I could spend hours out there and never tire of the view. There is impressive snorkeling right off the beach out the back of the resort. Lots of fish and gentle surf. The hotel itself breaks the winds that rush from mountains in the afternoons and makes lying on the beach comfortable at all hours. Staying anywhere in Kaanapali is smart since it is on the "Dry side" of the island and you are more likely to have sun for your trip. It is less lush than the wet side but that is a small price for the perfect weather. Wind is an issue sometimes but the protected beaches around the hotels are rarely effected much. The hotel is a little isolated being on the North side of Black Rock although you can walk to the main strip in 10- 15 minutes along the winding "Beach Walk" (that sometimes randomly goes through the middle of some condos or on the parking lot of a hotel and not just along the beach as the name implies.) This was not a bad thing for my family but may be an issue for those who have to be "in the middle of everything." Also the grounds, while lavish enough, are not as over-the-top as some of the most modern of resorts. There are no "Lazy Rivers" or Water Slides. The restraunt is adequate but not a 5 star kind of place either. Kids 12 and under, however, do get their lunches for free (too bad for me.) To sum up, Aston Kaanapali Shores is not the newest or most centrally located resort. It is an incredible place with amazing beaches, a reef perfect for exploring, friendly staff, easy parking and fantastic weather.The Full Beach front "Aston" 2 bedroom suites are totally worth the extra money, especially if you have a large family or group who value space. The extra space and those amazing balconies with the unbeatable views are the best value you will ever get for your vacation dollars. Splurge a little. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jam8x2
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for a scouting trip for my wedding. We arrived a little early, we were pleasantly greated and offered to wait at the bar until our room was ready, we were given free drink vouchers. Our room was ready in 20 minutes, we were upgraded to the penthouse floor. Our room had a kitchen, huge living room, big bathroom and an ocean view. We were able to save lots of money by having a kitchen. Huge help! Great proximity to local stores. Pool was nice, simple but good. The had a dance show one of the nights. And each night a Hawaiian conch shell blower would light the tiki torches around the pool at sunset. Internet access to print boarding passes was easily available and not too expensive. Nice walking beach along the property!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TomSueBenicia
Reviews.Content: We wanted a trip to celebrate our 40th anniversary and we wanted to include our children and grandchildren. The Aston Kaanapali Shores condo units are ideal for families. The rooms were clean, comfortable and "felt like home". The beds were made, the rooms vacuumed and fresh towels were brought each day. The people we encountered were friendly and efficient. The grounds were impeccable, and all the amenities we needed were available. The poolside restaraunt served great food at reasonable prices, and kids were FREE !!! The garden setting was beautiful and calming. The pools and hot tubs were clean and relaxing to be in and around. The whole setting is right on the beach and self contained. There was no need to leave the grounds, but when we were so inclined it was a very short ride to downtown Lahaina with lots of shopping and restaraunts. The Kaanapali golf course lived up to it's reputation beauty and service. We had a wonderful time with our children and our grandchildren (2 and 4 years) and can't wait to come back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-priced family-style facility”
Reviews.Author: RogerBrooks
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and found this property to be somewhat dated, but comfortable. The pluses include: - A great area of Maui just minutes from Lahaina and Kaanapali attractions and shopping. - The staff is attentive and good, housekeeping does a great job. - The Expedia folks do a good job at the morning orientation (optional, of course, but worth the hour or so). - The food at the restaurant is also good, informal, and reasonably priced. - The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. - The furnishings were decent and well taken care of. The negatives: - Wireless Internet access was half the speed of 10-year old dial-up (I tested it four times during our week-long stay. The slowest I've experienced in years. Pitiful to say the least. If getting online is a priority, find another place or tether your 3G or 4G phone to your computer. It will be far faster than what the hotel provides.) - The property is pretty dated. We had a "rear" one-bedroom unit. The bedroom - in the back of the unit - was dark and dingy. Because it's next to the "back" walkway, you can hear everyone who walks by - no matter what time of day or night. - The television is a 25" (or so) CRT TV (tube TV) of 1980s vintage. - The king bed was good, although somewhat hard. The bedding was fine. - The pool towels were ratty "old" bath towels being reused as pool towels, and so most guests grab two in order to get what one pool towel would normally do. - Our unit had a washer, dryer, full kitchen and everything worked just fine. - There are two pools - both are far too small for the number of rooms at this property. If lying around the pool or in the pool is in your plans, and if the property is busy, good luck getting a space in or even near the pool! Swimming won't be an option. Most other properties have two to three times the pool space as does the Aston. If you're planning on being out and about each day, then this shouldn't be a concern. - The beach is nice but there are no lounge chairs, chase lounges, umbrellas, or any furnishings of any kind on the beach. We saw guest lugging around chairs and lounges from the pool deck out to the beach, which looked like quite the hassle. Most other properties have all kinds of seating/lounging on the beach. Summary: If you're looking for a median-priced, clean, comfortable, family-oriented hotel, the Aston would be a great choice. If you're thinking Westin, Marriott, Hyatt - something more upscale (and more expensive) - you'll find the Aston a little disappointing primarily because the property is getting somewhat dated and it shows. You do need a car if you want to golf, shop places like Whaler's Village, or have more restaurant choices - even in the area. A grocery store, however, is right across the street - handy if you have a kitchen and want to prepare some (or all) of your meals. On a scale of one to five, five being as good as you can get, I'd rate the Aston a 2.5. It's clean, comfortable, is home to a great staff, the grounds are nice, and it's a few-minute drive to all that the Kaanapali area has to offer, which is a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: zacaramarketing
Reviews.Content: We were here for a wedding/vacation for 8 nights and had a great time. The 2 bedroom condo on 9th floor was a very comfortable ocean view unit with plenty of space for the 6 adults ranging from 19-49 years of age. The restaurant/bar was fine, the grounds lovely and staff fantastic! Everything was easily accessible with our car or via public transport, which was like $2/day??? We could also walk to several other properties to check out their bars and such. The boardwalk was also great for walking/jogging each day. We could not have been more pleased with our stay and would certainly stay again. It is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families...maybe not for couples”
Reviews.Author: lmingras
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week in June 2011. We didn't have any problems with the hotel and it was actually a pleasant surprise how nice it was. The room size was great and having a full kitchen and washer/dryer was extremely convenient. Everything was very clean and even though we didn't get an ocean view, we could still see the ocean from our room. After reading other hotel websites reviews, this hotel is definitely a good bang for your buck. There were a few drawbacks, but none that were too major. 1. First off, the place was crawling with kids...it's great if you want to bring your family because you can definitely save money with the kitchen, but the kids were a little annoying at times. There are 2 pools and they both were pretty busy. The garden pool was a little quieter, however, when the kids took over with rafts and pool toys, it got a little overwhelming. 2. The restaurant at the hotel was awful. We dined there numerous times and the service is bad (waiters are really slow), and the food is pretty average. The only plus to the restaurant was the happy hour which had mai tais for 4.50! 3. The beach is very narrow in this area of Kaanapali. The amount of space of sand was very short and it got really crowded near the hotel. you also couldn't take long beach walks because there were rocks that prevented you from going past a certain point on the beach. 4. If you don't get an ocean view room, the bedrooms are kind of noisy. The windows of the bedrooms share the wall with the hallway to the hotel so if people walk by at 6am, you hear every step they take and every word they say. With drawbacks aside, I thought this resort was a great deal and I'm happy I was able to experience it. I'm not sure if my husband and I were to come again that we would stay there since it was so family oriented, but if you are bringing your kids along, you should definitely consider this place. The grounds were very well maintained and the staff was very nice. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sueellen1971
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed with our stay here! We arrived tired from long flight, we ate at the restaurant , it was great food and nice view of the ocean. The room was big, clean and even had a washer and dryer. Rooms had been upgraded with new granite counter tops and appliances. The grounds were nicely groomed, staff friendly , great location too. Be sure and book a massage on the beach right on the hotel property, unbelievable experience!! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect for a family getaway”
Reviews.Author: dykes26
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui and stayed at the Aston Shores. This condo resort is a very affordable place to stay at while enjoying Maui. It has some good amenities to offer. Service was excellent. We called house keeping repeatedly for more towels, rice cookers etc. and they were always prompt and smiled. They have a nice front desk staff and helpful people around the pool/ beach area. Can't beat the value as the rooms were nicely appointed, had a full kitchen (saved a fortune on breakfast and lunch- we used that savings for dinner out) Grounds were nice and the pool and beach area were great. My only complaint is a mandatory $19 fee for things that should be included. The fee paid for used of the TV, safe, PS 2 and rental of DVD's and parking. Sleep quality is decent. Single pained windows let the sound of people walking by at night echo through the room. These people were talking normally but it got loud at times. The facility is well kept and clean We had lunch at the restaurant one day. The service was freindly, food OK. We really didnt use the pool or spa. Id stay here again with family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family spot”
Reviews.Author: luv2btravln
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Aston Kaanapali Shores and it did not disappoint. Our family of four rented the independently owned condo (unit #259) through VRBO. I was happier this stay because I knew ahead of time which condo we would have. When you book directly through the resort, the condo you end up with may be a bit worn (as was the case on our first stay). The only reason I gave it a 4 is because the beach is not the best for swimming. However, it is a fairly quick drive to some great swim/snorkel spots. The grounds are well maintained and perfect for a family that does not like the crowds. One resort over seemed much more crowded by the pool area. If you are like my family and enjoy the convenience of home (kitchen, separate bedrooms, etc), this is a great spot. We don't need the best pools or beaches as we spend most of our time out. The view from the lanai was a perfect spot to have a bottle of wine and relax at the end of a very busy day.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Maui, loved Kaanapali Shores!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotmomjd
Reviews.Content: Our very first trip to Maui. Went with husband and 19 year old daughter. First advice: skip Costco! For us, it was a waste of time and money!! Right accross the street from Kaanapali shores is a grocery store with everything and almost identical prices. That is just my opinion. Got checked in, front desk not super friendly, but ok. The guys that help you with your luggage are the BEST! they were so friendly and helpful with tips on where to go and how to find beaches we were looking for -thanks Hal! TIP THEM when you leave!!! Our room was 8th floor, carpet ok, couch very uncomfortable as a pull out bed,they didn't do much in the way of cleaning, but the view was GREAT!! Loved Gary at the restaurant and Diane at the bar! Definately try the Happy Hour mai tais!!! Good food and resonably priced. Excellent beach for sun bathing and boogie boarding but as stated in past posts, watch out for the rocks and coral!! One guy cut his hand snorkeling when the wave pushed him down - 14 stitches! There are way better snorkeling sites. We swam with the sea turtles at Hanoa Bay for free!! Go early. Watch out for the Sugar Cane Spiders in the outhouses!!!! We will definately go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we expected. So disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: lavashot1
Reviews.Content: The carpeting and furniture were worn and outdated. Housekeeping did not get to our room until the afternoon. Sheets on the pull out sofa were stained or soiled. Housekeeping was on the light side which basically included fresh towels and light dusting and linen change after the third day. Our room was never dusted and the sheets not changed during our stay. Stray cats were throughout the parking garage and courtyard. We were very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay...easy on the budget.”
Reviews.Author: S.Fong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores as part of our package deal from Pleasant Holidays. It was one of the more inexpensive resorts but didn't jeopardize the quality. Their rooms accommodate a family of five where some may not take more than four. Located right on the beach just north of Kaanapali beach. The resort was very quiet despite the fact that this place seems to be occupied primarily by large families. There are two pools and two hot tub/spas both of which are very clean and well maintained. The beach is literally right next to the main pool. The room is spacious and clean. Full kitchen is included with pots, pans, plates, and glasses provided. Our stay was very comfortable. The service could be better. For example, we had to call maintenance because of a chirping smoke detector...no one came. Good place to stay with large families...and is easy on the budget. Those that prefer more luxury should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I love AKS More and More every year!!! Cant wait to be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Livin4adventure
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AKS 6/7-6/14 with my family of 4 (2 adults & 2 Children). This was our 3rd year to Maui and our 3rd stay at the wonderful AKS. We havent stayed anywhere else nor do we intend to. Our check in was easy and upon my arrival my name was on a screen posted on the wall and I guess it is something new they are doing for returning guest, special occasions and owners. It made me feel special to be remembered. The bell hop was very helpful and settling in was a breeze! Our Suite was beautiful and updated.The Kitchen was fully stocked with everything you need to cook, which was very helpful when you have a toddler. Although our view was partially of a roof top we didnt mind everything was so nice and the view was still stunning!! There was also a bunch of delivery trucks that would come in the early morning dropping of supplies to the hotel next to AKS, you could hear it from our bedroom, we didnt mind cause we needed to wake up anyway. It was sort of our own personal alarm clock. LOL. We enjoyed the Resturant on mulitiple occasions, mostly for lunch and it was delicious everytime. We also enjoyed the Free Hula Dance they host at the resturant on Wed. evenings is was very entertaining and really fun for my children to see. They offer free punch and $3 Mai Tis for guest viewing. This year they allowed lawn chairs on the sand which was really nice to be able to relax on the sand by the beach. Good swimming and snorkeling right in front of the resort. They have 2 pools but we only used the pool in the garden with the turtles, it was really nice at night and perfect for my chilldren. The grounds were absolutly beautiful and relaxing you never felt crowded even though I feel they were probably pretty booked. The Koi Ponds were a favorite for my children we stoppped by to visit them every morning. The Lobby is amazing, we didnt use the Expedia Desk but I am sure they were very helpful! I have to give a VERY special shout out to the Security Guard he helped us when we had some car troubles not to mention he took our family picture for us at sunset in front of the beach a memory we will hold dear for years to come. We had just the most AMAZING time and we are always sad to leave, AKS feels like our home away from home and we hope to come year after year and create family memories for a lifetime. Thank you AKS!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ROOM”
Reviews.Author: panthurdreams
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget and needed to stay close to the Royal Lahaina Resort (which doesn't have Kama'aina rates at that location) where my cousin from Wyoming was staying. We've had many experiences with the Aston Maui Lu and decided to try this Aston. We purchased the cheapest room we could (garden view) for the one night. When we arrived to check-in we found out we received a free upgrade to the ocean view...however when we got to the room & realized we were upgraded to the Penthouse! We were so taken back by this (we barely ever worry about getting a expensive room cause we are out and about enjoying the islands), but had a blast. The penthouse was about 3x bigger than my apartment back on O`ahu!! We had a blast and what a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service on Maui”
Reviews.Author: MauiRick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are heading home tomorrow after a weeks vacation at the Kaanapali Shores Resort. The fabulous service we receive keeps us coming back. The resort has the friendliest staff on Maui. From the moment you enter the lobby they make feel comfortable and relaxed. One of our most memorable experiences was the wonderful dinner we had at the Beach Club Restaurant. The night manager Marlene prepared a special table for us and our server Kassy took great care of us. The entire team made us feel like we were the only two people in the restaurant. Be sure to try the seafood sampler or the fresh catch of the day and finish with the bread pudding. You will not be disappointed. The food was awesome, but the people made the difference. You can tell the restaurant management cares about making every guests experience one that they will not soon forget. We can't wait to return to sample some of their other dishes. Also be sure to look out for Mike the security guard at sunset. He is also a photographer and offers to take pictures for everyone on the beach. He is a super nice man and he takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: azkym
Reviews.Content: Traveled for the first time to Maui with my 9 yr old daughter, my 71 yr old mother, my sister and her 17 yr old daughter. We were thrilled with the 2 bdrm/2ba. condo we stayed in. Recently remodeled with white tile and new furniture. The kitchen had granite counters and updated cabinets and was fully stocked (no food) with glasses, plates, pans silverware. Our view was amazing of the beach and ocean. I suspect because we traveled at the end of May, many kids were still in school so it was fairly quiet. It was a gorgeous condo, and the sofa bed was actually comfortable!! We are hoping to go back very soon and will request this same condo. It was wonderful!! The grounds were beautiful too, and the on sight restaurant was delicious. We did not have one bad meal there, as a matter of fact we did not have a bad meal anywhere while we were in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh, wonderful ocean view!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkBonBon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in November , 2010. We paid extra to upgrade our room to an oceanview and were very pleased. The room really wasn't a room it was an apartment with a full kitchen and separate bedroom., even had a washer and dryer in the unit. Great lanai overlooking the water. The staff was pleasant and courteous. The only problem was they did not make up our room and we had to call everyday to get maid service. I brought this to the attention of the front desk upon checkout and they looked into the matter. As it turned out the "make up room" insert was an older one they no longer use and the maids thought we were requesting privacy. For the inconvenience they gave us a credit to our bill of $50.00. We thought the food at the restaurant was fine. Other reviews of the restaurant were not so favorable but we had no problem with the food or service. The maui french onion soup is the best onion soup I've ever had and I've had several even in Paris! The hotel is right on a beach and other resorts and restaurants are within walking distance right along the beach. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Kalmmaui
Reviews.Content: As a 28 year resident on Maui, I can assure you that this is a perfect location. We recently spent a long weekend here with family that was visiting from the mainland. It wasn't the first time we stayed here, but all the pistons were firing on this weekend. Perfect location, perfect company, and perfect weather! I should have written a review sooner, but here we go! It doesn't matter if you are traveling with family or just a couple looking for a romantic get-a-way, Aston Kaanapali Shores has all you need and more. It's located on the far end of Kaanapali, adjacent to what I consider the most beautiful beach on Maui. The Beachclub restaurant serves breakfast, lunch and dinner and the food is very good. They have a day camp for kids that is perfect for allowing the parents a day of relaxation! The workout room is very nice and clean with upgraded equipment. You can enjoy a massage on property as well as a full service beauty salon. Across the street is a little shopping mall with a very large grocery store, a few little restaurants and more. It's a short stroll across the street! Wow! There are so many positives about this property I could go on for days. From the moment you arrive you will feel the Aloha the the friendly staff extends. It's obvious that management takes care of their employees and that the staff is genuinely happy! The rooms are very clean, spacious with all the amenities of home and the beds are super comfortable (that's coming from someone who is very picky about her bed!) Nice spacious lanais with breathtaking views of Molokai and Lanai in the distance. The beach is beatiful and snorkeling is amazing. It is also a great place for body boarding and surfing. If you are in to long early morning or sunset walks on the beach, it's a two minitue walk across a parking lot to Kaanapali's "Airport Beach." Back when I lived in the area, the beach was overtaken by Kiawe trees that prohibited you from walking the full stretch of that beautiful beach. It has since been cleaned up and you can stroll on the beach or utilize the boardwalk. Be sure to wear your swim suit as the water is so gorgious you will want to jump in at some point. Oh, and bring your snorkel gear. There is lots of coral and fish on the north end and in the middle it sandy and you will most likely see some Manarays! Can you tell I love this place! I trust that you will too!!!! Go....I am positive you will not be disappointed! Love, love, love it!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: nyc York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: rads_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing and the staff was extremely helpful! The lobby is beautiful and our room was spectacular! I could see the ocean from the bathroom! It was huge, well equipped and comfortable in every way possible. We ate breakfast in the room every day which would not have been possible if we hadn't had a kitchen as well stocked as ours. It was like being at home but with a host of people to do all your dirty work!! The beach itself was amazing and the pool and the restaurant right by it were great too. Its also convenient to have the supermarket and a snorkel bob's right across the street - so we did'nt have to drive anywhere to get our food supplies/ snorkling equipment I know Maui would have rocked no matter where we stayed but I have to say I enjoyed it even more because of how convenient and luxurious the hotel and the staff made it.

Reviews.Title: “good family condo at fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: Snorkel2C
Reviews.Content: We are family of 6 (1 toddler and 3 teenagers -great to have the pullout sofa bed). Overall, our stay was very nice. We had an oceanview 2bed/2 bath condo with full kitchen. We were satisfied with the condo, and for the great price. Our only complaints are: dark corridors need better lighting for walking to the unit at night, washer and dryer and A/C both were very very noisy (difficult to sleep), the gas BBQ grill was great except it was at an odd location near the tennis court instead of near the pool or the beach ( I actually felt a little unsafe being the one person standing there in a somewhat dark area as I was grilling for my family) and the hotel has 1 tonge chained to 1 grill but none for the other 2 grills (unless they somehow had disappeared). However, the 2 pools were great with towel service. Everything else was excellent. The beach is great for walk but has a lot of rocks and it is also close to a sewage outlet so I don't recommend swimming, especially for little ones (I did not see this on other reviews before booking so I hope this helps).

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cityboy_nz
Reviews.Content: The check in process was easy and the staff were friendly. We had a 1 bedroom gardenview unit, I was surprised at it's large size, was like an apartment incl a washing machine and drier which came in handy. From the balcony the view of the gardens was lovely, we could also see the beach which was a nice surprise. I assume these unit's are peoples own condo's which are managed by the resort, the decor was a little old fashioned or retro, I saw in the unit next door and it had been updated quite a bit. However there was plenty of space which was really nice. I found the "Expedia" breakfast really informative and ended up booking a Luau through them. I found their staff to be very helpful and not only on tour related topics. There is a supermarket accross the road, very handy, we went and got some delicious steaks and oven fries to cook back at the unit, however there was no oven tray to cook the fries in which was a little surprising, however we made do and had a lovely dinner watching the sunset from our balcony. The beach area is nice, although the area in front of the hotel is not really swimming area as it's mostly full of coral, we took a short drive up to Napili and discovered a lovely public beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but inhospitable staff with little handicapped access”
Reviews.Author: DaisysMum_11
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with my 80 year old mother to celebrate her birthday. She had a walker and handicapped parking permit. We were located in a lovely unit by the beach but the parking area for our wing had no handicapped parking. This meant a long walk for her in her walker - even if we pulled to the building entrance for her. The staff were very corporate in their approach - the concierge isn't a concierge - they are a sales rep for Expedia to sell add-on tours. They seemed to resent calling the airport on our behalf to ask about baggage and they didn't seem to know anything about the island that wasn't a packaged tour. Disappointing. Great venue, but little service for the price of a resort. We still had to pay $9 per day to park and the only thing the hotel did for us during our stay was to provide a single slice of ice cream cake for 'free' when we had our mother's birthday at the beach restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Mnree7
Reviews.Content: The Aston Kaanapali has beautiful grounds and we had a great time there. The pool is big and steps from the beach, with a restaurant and pool bar for drinks/food. We ate there several times and it was reasonably priced with good food. I recommend the crabcakes and mahi mahi sandwich. The beach itself is very short and there are some rocks in the water which was fine for us, but if you are looking for a large beach you should probably go further down. The Aston is at the end of long strip of hotels so the beach ends there too, which makes it peaceful actually. You can walk to all the other hotels and bars/restaurants easily. There is a beach bar/restaurant called Duke's that is a ten minute walk and really good for later on in the night (Aston Bar closes at 9:30) One thing I have to stress is that the ocean room is totally worth the extra money. We originally had a garden view room, realized it was facing a parking lot and immediately paid the extra for the upgrade to ocean view. The room we were then given had a breathtaking view and it made our whole trip. It isn't even that much more really, if you compare it to other hotels. Overall, we would recommend the Aston Kaanapali. It has enough to keep you occupied but with access to many hotels nearby. Lahaina is a 10 minute drive but we found that to be very over priced and touristy. Whaler's village is about a 20 minutes walk from the Aston on the beach, and they have some good restaurants. Cane and Taro's had great sushi, and the Hula Bar looked like a great place to grab a drink. We will definitely be back-- Maui is gorgeous!!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed...”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl1118
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews, my family and I were excited to finally arrive at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. The lobby was beautiful and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful upon our arrival. On the way to our room we walked down a dark, dingy hallway which was such a letdown when compared to the lobby. We had a one-bedroom garden view condo with an updated kitchen, however that is where the updates end. Lighting was nonexistent in the hallway as well as the bedroom and the carpets and walls were in dire need of a cleaning. The room overall just didn't feel clean. I was a little nervous about the noise from the birds in the morning, but the birds were nothing compared to the buses that woke us up at 5:30am every morning. This hotel has all the amenities one would expect, however they all have a price (including the in-room safe, the fitness center and the business center). On a more positive note the grounds, pools and beach are beautiful and the in-room washer and dryer were definitely a plus. Unfortunately the negatives outweigh the positives and we won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort for the needs of our 20 friends & family members!!”
Reviews.Author: Broncor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKS for 12 nights in a gorgeous 2 bedroom Aloha Suite and loved every moment of it!! We were getting married on April 21st (a week into our trip) and got the big suite so that we could host our family & friends in our room (and on the wrap-around lanai with amazing views) many evenings. (Our two-year old doesn't do so well at restaurants or bars!) It worked out great for that, with the kitchen and many seating areas. They'd sometimes come up for coffee, too, to see the whales in the distance. Everyone stayed at the resort, ranging from a studio to a 2 bedroom and EVERYONE was very pleased with their rooms. Staff were very helpful, like the bellhops with their shopping carts for all our groceries from Costco and Safeway. Restaurant food was yummy, too! Enjoyed getting Eggs Benedict to go and eating on our patio! Beach was fine - good patch of sandy bottom for swimming just down the beach a bit, and EXCELLENT snorkeling just out from there (which we didn't discover until our last day - stupid us!!!) We were there for Easter, and the resort put on a big Easter egg hunt for the kids, which was awesome. Loved sitting by the pool (right by the ocean) and sipping on delicious Mai Tais... Lots of cool places to go exploring nearby, too: 5 minute drive to the Kaanapali Beach strip (fun at sunset), 5 minute drive the other way to the Kapalua area, 10 minute drive to the town of Lahaina.... and across the street from the resort is a strip mall with good pizza , Subway, market and other shops/cafes. Ahhhh....it was all so great. Can't wait to go back!! We would definitely recommend this resort. A note to brides: As far as we understood, we couldn't get married on any beach in the Kaanapali area (a new law since 2008), so we had our ceremony on Keawakapu Beach in the Wailea area (an hour's drive). We didn't mind, as it gave our guests a chance to see a different area and it was wonderful. But you might want to check with the hotel.... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- We will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: chf0729
Reviews.Content: Just loved it- from the friendly service checking in and out, the convenient location near Lahaina and stores nearby, and the wonderful condo we had that was in pristine condition.. Loved the grounds and amenities.. Room had a wonderful lanai and felt like oceanfront view... It did include a PS2 but on games.. didn't stay long enough to look into it.. but rentals of games would be a nice touch if not available yet.. teenage son would have loved that..

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo and good location near Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: glanpher9
Reviews.Content: We arrived on April 30 and checked into a room we weren't happy with. Noticed a few other reviews have said the same thing- wonder if we're all being put into the same condo and complaining about it! It was a one bedroom ocean view (which turned out to be a side view overlooking a not very attractive canal.) The room smelled musty and felt dirty, including the sofa and rug. The next morning we asked to be moved and they were very accommodating and we were moved to a great room on the seventh floor with an even better view- we were able to watch the sunset from our balcony/patio. The room was much nicer, clean and comfortable, nothing fancy, and we were much happier after the change. The grounds of this resort are lovely, and the pools and the hot tubs are great. Only ate in the restaurant once for breakfast and it was good The only complaint I have about my vacation is the lousy weather we're having- and that's not the hotel's fault! Hope next time we come we see some blue sky. The last couple of days we've gotten up early and headed to South Maui- it was a bit better down there- snorkeled at the Kamaole Beach Parks which are good, easy snorkeling sites for amateurs like us.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Polarbear001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKS for three nights for our anniversary. The resort is beauitiful and the value and location can't be beat. The only issue we had was a musty odor in our first room. We went to the front desk and informed the receptionist (cant recall a name, very nice and friendly woman) told us she told us to "go relax and enjoy our vacation" they will take care of moving all our bags and food to a new room. Returning from the beach a couple hours later we found that they had moved us up three floors to a room with a even better view. Other than that it was a wonderful experience staying at AKS. Everyone was friendly and smiling from the parking attendant to the grounds maintanence crew. For the location, value, all the amenities, wonderfull staff we would reccomend this hotel and would return ourselves. Mahalo nui loa AKS for the memories and great stay. One more thing....... I've seen people post stuff like "rocky beach and expensive food at the restauraunt" I just wanted to say to everyone... EVERYTHING in Maui is expensive and there are like BEACHES every quarter mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: happyasaclam_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath ocean view condo with a loft. The loft also had a library. The loft was great for the 3 teenage girls. There were 7 of us and we had plenty of space for everyone. The Aston Kaanpali Shores was recently renovated. We had a full kitchen with top of the line appliances and granite countertops. There were also 4 flat screen panel TV's in our condo. It was so clear we could see Oahu from our lanai one day. The staff was friendly and our requests were met with an immediate response. The Beach Club Restaurant on property was very good and had a variety of food as well as reasonable prices. There was even a happy hour. Times Grocery Store across the street had choice meat at reasonable prices. We were also located near the Mauibus Stop which came in handy when 5 people took the minivan to Hana. There was also a coffee stand in the lobby, a spa and beauty salon, a fitness center, a kids program as well as an internet center. There was free wi-fi for our laptop. Although the beach was small, it was great for snorkeling and scuba diving. There was even a free scuba lesson in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Families”
Reviews.Author: prairiegirl11
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 18-28. We really enjoyed our stay at this resort. The grounds were beautiful and the staff were helpful. We spent all of our pooltime at the garden pool, which was the perfect pool for our young boys. [Our only complaint is that there were only 2 covered cabana's by this pool and during our stay a family rented the both of them for the duration of the week leaving us to find minimal shade.] We also loved our evening swims by the light of the tiki torches - so relaxing. We ate at the restaurant and found it to be adequate - with our favorite meal being breakfast. We rented our 2 bedroom oceanfront through VRBO and found it to be very dated and in need of repair. However, it was clean and comfortable enough. The fact that it was oceanfront made up for the unit being a little shabby. This is no reflextion on the resort however, as we walked by many very nice looking suites. We will be back to this resort in the future, but likely in a different unit.

Reviews.Title: “Falls short in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Graeme56
Reviews.Content: Couldnt recommmend this resort - There were just too many things that weren't up to scratch. Check in proceeded relatively smoothly but was not at all friendly - it seemed a chore to provide the most basic additional information regarding the resort. Administrative mistakes too numerous to mention here continued daily throughout our stay. The room (1 bedroom Oceanview) had a beautiful outlook but was only partially refurbished, had a musty odour and didnt 'feel' clean. The grounds are very nicely landscaped with lovely oceanfront position and beach area. There are 2 pools and spas but with wall to wall kids are a challenge to enjoy - Would be enhanced with adults only areas. The Beachhouse restaurant food was just OK, overpriced for the quality and service. Bar was good but only staffed by one during happy hour ! A method in their madness, Im sure. The resort has a coffee shop which, again, is just OK with a very limited breakfast selection. Its only open for breakfast ! Yes, thats right - open from 7am to 11am. What resort has a coffeee shop that closes at 11.00am ?? This one !! All in all, with the level of service at barely satisfactory, a similar general standard of amenity and numerous other better resort options in as good or better locations, the Aston Kaanapali Shores just does not pass muster.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would return!”
Reviews.Author: BriannaF0706
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after leaving the Aston Paki Maui because we weren't happy there and WOW, what a difference. The staff was friendly, the rooms were great and the resort is beautiful. The beach is literally steps away! I was very, very impressed and will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Condo!”
Reviews.Author: vineyardchick
Reviews.Content: Selected this condo a part of a AAA Hawaii package.. Expected a "used" condo & got much more. Checkin easy, appropriate info provided, staff pleasant. Unit assigned on 7th floor as expected but better! Huge, spacious, clean 1 Bedroom unit w/ ocean view comfortable, quiet in spite of many families staying here. Enjoyed ocean view, palm trees from lanai. Only issue was locking lanai doors. I couldn't get them to lock but hubby did. Kitchen area large, clean, all usual cooking utensils ready for use. In unit washer/dryer a plus since we packed anticipating doing laundry at least once.. Had dinner here once at night of checkin-good meal, pleasant professional staff. Oceanfroont pool & hot tub gets crowded later in day. I wouldn't go in hot tub-too many kids.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at AKS”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time during spring break with our 9 and 11 year old daughters. Again, we had had a great stay. Front desk staff was accomodating and friendly when we didn't like our first room assignment (ground floor) and moved us up. The room had some upgrades (appliances, counters, bathrooms) and was nice. The TV's could use upgrading, as they are still old, small tube tv's and we couldn't plug our ipad into them to watch movies. Also, the wifi was okay, but really slow at times. The bed was not the best...I could feel it every time my DH moved and turned. But, the sound of the ocean waves all night made for a very relaxing sleep despite that! The housekeeping was nice, and always tried to work around our schedule. The biggest recommendation I'd make would be to please, please initiate a recycling program! I hate that there was no blue box in the room. Recyclables should not go in the garbage...keep Maui beautiful! :) The grounds are just gorgeous, spacious and spotless. Kudos to the gardening crew that keep it up! Little kids loved to play on the grassy area between the restaurant and the kids pool. As mentioned in other reviews, the beach is not great for swimming as it's a bit rocky. Still nice to sit (lounges on the beach, very nice), build sand castles, and snorkel. The keiki pool is really nice for kids (and thus parents). I'd definately recommend this hotel for others, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: steelton
Reviews.Content: We've actually been here twice before - once on our honeymoon in August 2003 and again in April 2010, when my wife and I took our 8-year-old niece along with us. We've just booked another trip to Maui for the end of April. We thought about looking for a different place to stay, but just couldn't give up the Aston Kaanapali Shores. Getting a condo-style room allows us to save a ton of money as opposed to a regular hotel. The washer-dryer combo means we don't have to pack as much clothing, which makes a big difference in airline baggage fees. The full-service kitchen allows you the option of a home-cooked meal or just sandwiches and snacks, meaning you can save even more instead of eating out for every meal. The lanai was one of my favorite things about the Aston Kaanapali Shores, as I could lay out on it and read while hearing and smelling the ocean on the warm breezes. The room, bed, etc. were pretty standard. Nothing spectacular, but not a problem either. The only real negative we saw between the first and second stays was the beach. I remembered it being much nicer the first time we stayed. On the 2010 trip, it was rocky and kind of inhospitable compared to most of the beaches on Maui. The one bright spot about the beach was that we were able to do some whale watching from the pool on the spring trip. They also have activities for kids and a free Hawaiian show while we were there. Oh, the parking can also get expensive, but I believe that would be the same at any hotel. Overall, if you don't have a budget to worry about, I'm sure you can find some better options. But, if like most of us, you don't have an unlimited amount of money to spend, Aston Kaanapali Shores helps make a Maui vacation a bit more affordable.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: WI - A long drive/flight to everything
Reviews.Title: “Great overall resort”
Reviews.Author: rocknut
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, koi pond and stream are unbelievable. Pools are also nice, I thought the water was fine but it was also very warm during our stay. Quiet condo / room ( # 514) Beach is narrow in front of the resort. but walk 100' left and its better. Great little surf break in the channel marked by bouys to the left also. New Tennis and shuffle board courts. They also have 3 gas BBQ grills set up West of the tennis courts. Groceries are right across the street. Great eclectic coffee shop across the street also. If you book your excursions thru the expedia rep on site you can get all the rental stuff at the pool for free. We took advantage of this for our snorkeling gear and boogie boards.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and an amazing value”
Reviews.Author: lcash
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. Very clean and beautiful room(2 bedroom,2 bath, ocean view 823) perfect view, Gorgeous updates granite,stainless steel,vessel sinks, stone tiled floor,flat screen tv's in all our rooms. We usually spend a lot on a hotel but we decided to go down one grade to have money for all the very expensive excursions we wanted to do. With 2 teens and one 11 year old, its all adult prices for almost everything. My daughter had stayed with friends before at the 5 star down the beach and said our room was just as nice as the other hotel, almost identical. Very beautiful grounds,clean,very friendly staff. Ate at restaurant for breakfast,(amazing bananas foster pacakes) and for lunch a couple of times. Great food everytime. Pools (2) were smallish but during our spring break they were surprisingly uncrowded. Always found 5 chairs next to each other. They do ask that you don't chair save, there is no need. They do let you take pool towels off the premisis to any tour. I hate sneaking towels and here you don't have to. Hotel shops sold almost everything you might need. Very pricy however. If you are fine paying $5 for a quart of milk its very convenient. We ended up shopping across the street for groceries, a very short walk. Small strip mall has a very good grocerie store-big and clean,normal prices. Same strip mall has a good pizza place-pizza paradiso-AWESOME super friendly guys in there, and another restaurant Java Jazz-crazy eclectic decor-dim romantic lighting, naked barbies hanging from everywhere, interesting original artwork and hundreds of polaroids cover the walls!! The kids were looking around like this is the weirdest place they have ever been in. Really friendly staff with great food. We went in this place often. Loved it!! Open earlier than anything (6:30)for coffee and breakfast--Amazing fresh Kona coffee. In same strip mall,Great nail salon, my 2 daughters and I one afternoon got mani/pedis-$40 combo price. The only negative with this hotel I can mention, but it is simply a personal preference, is the beach. My teenagers would rather be in the ocean, out in the waves. The beach directly in front of the hotel is splattered with lava rocks. ranging in size from 12 inches long to massive boulders every 10 feet or so. You just can't boogie board or swim deep very safely. Younger kids were having fun and even playing with the rocks moving them around. We decided to go a little further down the beach in front of the other hotel where things are less rocky. We took the surfing lessons there and had a great time. We all stood up the first time! We also did the free SCUBA in the pool instruction(available everyday starting at 9:30) and then liked it so much, did the one hour ocean dive after. $70 per person but worth it. The kids did this 2 days in a row (not just for adults- my 10 year old who is a very good competitive swimmer was allowed to participate) they all loved it , fish and tons of TURTLES. Amazing photos taken by the instructor available to buy $40 on CD after your dive. We went down the beach, too long to walk,4 minute car ride, to whalers village. Really nice shopping area. Upscale(Louis Vuitton, mixed with lots of food choices and fun t-shirt and souv shops. ) Went there often. One day we just went to Whalers area in the morning and went to the beach there. Now THIS is the gorgeous beach we were hoping for. Big, clean all sand no rocks, big waves. The kids had a blast. Bought sandwiches and ate lunch on the beach. Spent lots in the shops. Very beautiful 5 star hotels here. Maui Westin and Ka'anapali Alli. Would recommend those 2 hotels for the beach and grounds. We also did the Westin's Polynesian Luau. There are so many luaus to choose from. This one was one of the more expensive ones. I liked the family style table service this one offered. I just didn't feel like the massive buffet line of the other luaus. Pricing for this one for age 12 and over includes all alcohol. It would have been nice to have a kids price ages 12-20. Also right on the beach with the beautiful sunset. We did the premium seating which was front row. I think it was worth it. So many other tables were very far back. Not sure what kind of view they had. Good food. good show. It got breezy and a bit chilly through the evening(bring a sweater) Overall had an amazing vacation. The kids loved it. The area is not cheap. I don't think you can do Maui on a budget really if you have older kids, want to do all kinds of sporty adventures and eat out most days I Would, however,highly recommend this hotel and area of Maui to any family. It was worth the money to have tons of fun memories.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, loved the grounds”
Reviews.Author: kramsugs
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent and friendly. Short walk down the beach offers a nice sandy entrance to the ocean. Ate at the Beach Club a few times. It was fine. We tried Mamma's ribs and chicken. "Awesome BBQ" We also enjoyed a casual dinner at Maui Brewing Co. (very reasonable). Kimo's in Laihana is always the best for fine dinning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: MCH13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the family-friendly Aston for a few days in March and found it to be fine, if not perfect. There is no particular "wow" factor, but it suited our vacation needs well enough. The interior grounds are nice, with pretty gardens and multiple pools and hot tubs. Our suite was pleasant, furnished adequately to make our own breakfast in the morning. Parking was always available, though you have to pay for it. The town of Lahaina is a few minutes away and offers plenty of restaurant and activity options. A strip mall across the street offered a grocery option for some of the guests who wanted to provide some of their own food. The narrow beach is fine for sunbathing and walking, but the waters on that stretch of beach (which extend through the neighboring resorts) are filled with rocks. We had to pick our way through them to get into water deep enough for a swim, and still took some scrapes and scratches. Another note is that it takes 45-min/1 hour to get from Lahaina to Kahului and the main airport. The distance is actually short, but most of the roads have only one or two lanes and traffic is often leisurely. It's a scenic drive, but for guests who plan to see the island and do a lot of tours, there could be a lot of time in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: krejci22
Reviews.Content: We just completed our vacation to Hawaii and stayed at this Aston. I will say I was not pleased with the first room choice (room 604) which was listed as an Ocean view. Not in my book. If I am paying for ocean view, I dont want Obstructed view and a very limited ocean view. I let the front desk know this and Elsa, the hotel manager, switched us to room 504, and it was better than expected. Large rooms, good service. We had two little ones with us and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: rykelmom
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Kaanapali Shores and had a great time. The room had a full kitchen as well as washer and dryer which was great! Our room had an ocean view and it was nice waking up to the sound of the ocean and birds every morning. The staff was kind and helpful. With two pools and the ocean just steps away this is a great resort to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Will book here again!”
Reviews.Author: akgeochicky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores in room #709 - a one bedroom with kitchenette and w/d. We had a wonderful stay. I spent a lot of time researching where our family should stay (we have a 3 year old) and I would definitely book here again. The rooms were CLEAN, well appointed, pretty quiet, and comfortable. They have A/C, black out curtains, and daily room service. The location is really nice - There is a great, fair priced grocery store across the street - walking distance, even with a 3 year old. And Pizza Paradiso is GREAT - which is also across the street. We LOVED the grounds for kids - lots of open grassy areas to run around in. The garden pool was perfect for lil ones. I would highly recommend this place for families with kids - everyday our son met new friends to play with. But if you are traveling without kids - I would also highly recommend this place too! In past reviews I read that the staff was 'cold and unhelpful'. We found that to be far from the truth - they were polite and professional. They helped us with any questions or requests that we had. The only cons that we found (and they are very small) was that they do not have DVD players in the rooms, the stereo didn't work, and the bed was very, very firm. It was nice having a restaurant on site - but we found it pricey and very average - we ate there twice. We were very happy with our stay and would write more - but if you have any questions feel free to email me!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place for small kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: msjen141
Reviews.Content: We just got back and we had an amazing time at this hotel. Full kitchen (including oven, real size coffee maker, dishwasher); packed light and ran a load of laundry every day right in the room; shopped at the organic store about a mile down the road towards Napili (on the right, called Farmer's Market); kids ate free for lunch at hotel restaurant; $100 restaurant/bar credit (we used ours for pina coladas by the pool; Happy hour every day from 3-5:30); garden pool is perfect for kids, only 4 feet deep; we had room 746, the ocean view was beautiful, saw whales, got a great breeze through the room all day long by opening slider and bedroom window. Ate breakfast in every morning, saved money on food for sure. Would definitely go back, trying to convince grandparents to buy a condo there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Facing the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: jaf62
Reviews.Content: This property served our needs well. We were traveling with our two girls, age 11 and 15, and loved having a separate bedroom and bathroom for them as well as a full kitchen and washer/dryer. We loved facing the ocean and being able to see the sunset (and a few rainbows) right from our room. We left the windows open at night to hear the crash of the surf. The location was very convenient to Kaanapali proper, Lahaina and anywhere else we wanted to go. There is a Snorkel Bob's right across the street as well as a supermarket which was super convenient. There is easy access to a great running/walking route along the beach in Kaanapali which we used and therefore didn't have to pay for the fitness center on the property. We could find parking in the lot near our room easily which was very convenient for us. The pool and hot tub were fine (actually there were two of each but we only used the main one) though the hot tub was often filled with teenagers. The beds were comfortable and we liked having daily maid service. On the negative side, the carpeting and sofa are in need of replacement and the lighting in the room--all florescent bulbs--was very dim in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Return Guests”
Reviews.Author: TravelingD
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this wonderful property. Stayed up front in a 2 Bedroom. Nicely upgraded and great view. Perfect for our family of 4. The grounds are beautiful and the property is well cared for. The staff at the Shores is friendly and professional. Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm comin' back!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaCasper
Reviews.Content: This was a great place. With the bar and restaurant poolside you couldn't ask for more. We were there when the "tsunami" hit and I was very impressed how the hotel kept us updated through the phone and loud speaker in the room. I traveled with my family, spouse and three children, all young adults, and they enjoyed it immensely as well. Location was excellent and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “RETURN VISIT - PLEASANTLY SURPRISED”
Reviews.Author: dulllady
Reviews.Content: This trip was a Christmas gift from my husband and I to our daughter, son-in-law and 3 year old grandchild. We were given an upgrade to Aloha Suite 2 bedroom oceanfront and I must say this was one of the best rooms/condos we have ever stayed at. The proximity of the ocean and view from wrap around balcony was amazing. We saw whales all day long and sometimes they were pretty close. This unit is about 2000 sq ft and it has a nice kitchen, master bedroom and bath, loads of closet space - couldn't ask for anything more in a room. The beds were not perfect, not the quality of bedding many new properties have or upgraded to but certainly not a major problem. Northing like the sound of the ocean day or night and also the birds at the resort were very vocal. All of the staff were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful and this started at the Front Desk, Bellman and Service Staff at the restaurant. The staff also handled the tsunami emergency very well. They were shortstaffed the day after, because many roads were not open but they managed very well. The location is great - strip mall across the street with grocery, coffee shop and restaurants. Their is a small convenience store right at the property if you do not want to drive out for something. The Costco right by the airport is a great stop to load up on supplies for your stay. There are many great restaurants within a short driving distance from the property and the restaurant at the property was great for breakfast and lunch. Sorry we did not try the Kaanapali Shores restaurant for dinner but many around the pool said it was good. The beach is rocky, but good for snorkeling and just a short walk down the beach for less rocks. It is just a short drive if you want to go to a larger sand beach. The resort has done a good job maintaining and improving the property over the years and I would not hesitate recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel155019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first few days in Maui. The rooms were very nice. We had a condo overlooking the pools but you could see the beach. The two bedroom was spacious with flat screen televisions in every room. The grounds were lovely and there are lots of services. There is a grocery store across the street and there is an expedia activity centre in the lobby that can assist you with booking things to do. There is a fitness centre that is pretty good but you have to pay $10.00 every time you use it. You also have to pay for parking, I think it was $15.00 per day. If you are going to stay there you should ask about the room ahead of time. We went back there for our last night and the two bedroom suite was much smaller and was not updated with flat screen televisions. Also be careful with the the Aston properties. They are not all of the same quality. We stayed at the Aston Maui Banyan and it was terrible, if I could have given it no stars I would have. There is a restaurant that overlooks the ocean that was good, not gourmet but good and kids eat for free up until 5 p.m. We went on a nice sunset dinner cruise at Lahina Harbour which was great and the food was too. I wasn't expecting such good quality on a boat. You should also be sure not to miss the Maui aquarium. it was well worth the 40 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff very helpful and made the experience so much more enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: dtwmiller
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the front desk upgraded me from the standard room to a 1 bedroom garden view. It was a wonderful surprise and came with a full kitchen (which I didn't even use), living room and very nice bathroom. Also had a stackable washer and dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Mauifan2010
Reviews.Content: This condo is a very nice condo for our family. It had a full kitchen, unfortunately some of the cupboard doors were locked. The condo had its own laundry facility, which was used daily, due to the fact it was a stacked washer and dryer. We were a family of 5. The service staff were great.
