The rooms were cleaned daily and the staff were very considerate when we were in the room. You barely knew they were there when they cleaned while we were in the room...very efficient. The only complaint I had is that the toilet would run if you forgot to make sure the handle went back up. We went for dinner once at the restaurant; the food and service were good. I would defenitely stay here again if we brought our family.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance, warm service, impeccable maintenance”
Reviews.Author: markincc
Reviews.Content: Well-suited to families or couples looking for a quality alternative to the more snobby hotels to the south. Warm atmosphere, great location (right on the beach, at the north end of the less-crowded stretch of Kaanapali beach), great ocean views from the lanai in the upper rooms. Beautiful, well-maintained, unpretentious grounds. All the services and amenities you'd expect in an upscale hotel, but very reasonably priced. Lots of kids, but not kid-noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: acsaw
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel/condo based on Trip Advisor reviews and were so glad we did. We went with our 9 and 11 year old kids and this resort was perfect for our family. One bedroom condo with full kitchen and washer and dryer was perfect for all of our needs. Kitchen allowed us to have several meals in the condo. Pools and grounds were great. Resort will loan you boogie boards and beach chairs to make the trips to local beaches even more perfect. Nearby Subway is run by a darling family who really takes good care of your order! Times market allows you to stock the kitchen with goodies at reasonable prices and is within walking distance. We will go back to this resort again! Unit 946 was perfect in every way! Parking is $9 per day in the lot, no option (only real downside). Also skip the recommended Drums of the Pacific Luau at the Hyatt. Total waste of money!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gingersnap830
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely, two bedroom ocean view suite -- it was gorgeous -- freshly decorated, and while there were two minor issues with the room when we checked in, they were corrected immediately. The location is awesome -- across the street from a small strip mall that includes a breakfast nook and a grocery store. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful from check-in to check-out! The only negative is that we had to follow up with the maid on several occasions to sweep the lanai or replace items such as coffee in the room. They always responded cheerfully and immediately. So, I could stay here again and again without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect as you could get”
Reviews.Author: Randy049
Reviews.Content: Our overall opinion of Kaanapali Shores was outstanding, the staff was exceptional, and we will try to arrange another visit. Requests for information concerning tours and local island attractions were eagerly supplied by hotel staff members and the Expedia Local Expert personnel. The Bell service individual met us at the door as we drove up to check in and provided a wealth of local information before we even reached our room. Despite "tips" from people on the internet and in guide books about the islands advising that activities would be cheaper if not booked through the hotel, the reverse was true. There were savings realized by utilizing the Expedia Local Expert desks at Kaanapali Shores rather than booking them through he internet or at other locations. Expedia personnel also worked quickly to resolve a problem with a certain tour and provided a speedy refund. The entire staff at Kaanapali Shores displayed a "can do" and friendly attitude, the room was quite comfortable and spacious, and we were able to watch whales from the room's balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: SamWiltshire_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week and were happy with this hotel. I emailed before we arrived asking for a sea view as close to the sea as possible and, although not the 180 degrees view i would of liked we had a lovely view of the sea. The reception areas of the hotel were very nice but i was a little disappointed with the corridors which accessed rooms and shops. They were in need of a little TLC but it certainly didnt taint my opinion of the hotel. In general the hotel was very clean. Whilst i thought the gardens were very nice i didnt quite appreciate in the photos before i booked just how many balconys would be over looking it. Not a great hotel if you like a little privacy. We ate in the restaurant once and the food was fine but the happy hour cocktails were definately a winner. The 2 pools are relatively small but the children still loved them. Our room - 606 - one bed, was a great size with a big enough kitchen. Our king size bed was very comfortable and the children had aqueen size sofa bed in the lounge which was also very comfortable. The balcony was a great size. The hotels rooms are at an angle to the sea so part of our view was the staggered room infront and then the sea. If completely uninterupted views are what you like then this possibly is not the hotel for you. We chose this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor and i feel that they were 100% spot on. Kaananapoli is a very busy resort with lots of big hotels on the sea front. The hotel is situated about a 30 min walk along the beach to the main shoppiing area. Lahaina is a lovely twon, 10 min drive away, and well worth a visit. It has a quaint feel to it with lots of great arty shops to browse among. If you are going to Maui to see the whales then you only have to open your curtains (with sea view) to see them. There are said to be 6,000 in the waters between Dec and April and we saw loads. We also took a boat trip to snorkel in an extinct volcano crater (Molokini) and we swam with sea turtles. If you are prepared to to a time share presentation (2 hours of hard sell) then you can make a good saving in trips. All along Lahaina strip shops are selling trips at a great discount. Make sure you know what you are lettiing yourself in for - we saved about $300 by doing this. We hired GyPSy sat nav from Steve in Lahaina for our road trip to Hana. It was like having our own tour guide in the car along with history and stories of where we were going. It also told you the best things to see and where to park. Fantastic. We also took the helicopter trip around the island. Sadly it was too cloudy to see the volcano (book early in day as clouds come in more as day goes on) so we ended up vising neighbouring islands. An amazing trip but next time would leave my 5 year old behind as she fell asleep for half of it. Be prepared to spend a lot of money in Maui as it is not cheap. An amazing vacation - i would recommend Maui to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Watch which room you get!”
Reviews.Author: DudeMom211
Reviews.Content: We got a "deal" through Hotwire for this hotel. We ended up on the back wing with a view of the parking lot. VERY NOISY ... garbage trucks early in the morning, week wackers all day. We could catch a glimpse of the ocean from the very corner of our Lani. Other parts of the hotel facing the garden area looked nice, but too many people to enjoy. The room wasn't very clean ... lots of sand on the sofa and carpet when we checked in. Another disapointment was the $9/day parking charge and $2.50 a day for use of the in-room safe .... this is my 5th trip to Maui and the first time I've been charged for either. The kitchen was not well equiped for cooking much .... we ended up buying a cheap aluminum pan so we could broil fish in the oven. The hotel has a barbeque area way in back by the service entrance and parking garage and was not aesthetically pleasing .... while most nearby hotels had barbeque areas in the gardens. The plus about this hotel is its location ... a short walk to the Beach Walk ... shopping and good coffee at Java Jazz across the street. I don't know how much you would have to pay to get a good room here but watch out for the "deals". We will not be back ... not our kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price, but watch which room you get”
Reviews.Author: wrldhkr
Reviews.Content: My beau and I stayed at the Shores last week for 2 nights as part of a longer Maui vacation. First impression is an attractive mid-range hotel, nicely landscaped, about 10 stories. All the rooms are actually privately owned condos from what I gathered, which the hotel manages and rents out. We did not notice a large difference in the furnishings or decor of the rooms we saw. We stayed in room 636, which is in the rear wing. We looked out over parking lots and trees to the neighboring condo bldgs, which were lower in height so there was a small glimpse of the next island. Definitely not an 'ocean view' room, but at least a very green view. It was spacious enough for 2 - entry hall, with bathroom to the right with an outer sink and then door to tub/toilet room; then kitchen on right with lots of counter space, cabinets, full fridge; kitchen open to rest of room which had a bed right next to the kitchen counter, facing a couch, TV hutch, and the balcony. We did not notice much noise except for the birds and occasional car noise, and were able to keep our balcony door open all night for fresh air and breezes. I did wear ear plugs as I'm a very light sleeper, but I usually do when traveling anywhere. My partner did not and slept fine. Two friends stayed in 909, a 1 bedroom, which faced in towards the open garden/pool area of the hotel and had awesome views of the ocean and the whales that were very active during our trip. 909 had a large living room, kitchen, and balcony. Nice room. Unfortunately, our two other friends had a very bad experience with their rooms. Both got non-kitchen rooms on the lowest 2 floors. They had only 1 small window which opened just a few inches, and air conditioners that were mounted INTO the room, so the noise from the units was loud all night. They had no fridges, and the hotel did a terrible job helping them with this. One of them asked to at least have ice (there was an ice bucket in the room) but the hotel has NO ice machines! Finally after one friend went to the housekeeping office and asked for ice, a housekeeper took them to a recently vacated room (apparently still a mess with stuff everywhere) and let them get some ice from that room's freezer. Both friends said they felt like they were in basement rooms; one described it as a 'dungeon'. Other than that, I would rate the service as variable - the lady who checked us in was not friendly, but the gentlemen who checked us out was exceedingly nice. We did not use any other facilities or the restaurants. Parking in the hotel parking garage is $9/day. The beach is steep and narrow in front of the hotel, not that great for swimming - see my other reviews for better beaches. We also did two boat trips (whale watching out of Lahina and snorkling out of Kihei) and I will review those, as well as the different towns we visited - Lahaina, Kihei, Pa'ia. Overall, it is a nice hotel, comfortable, but make sure you get an upper room for a view. Kitchen-equipped rooms are nicer from what we saw. This area is a 'hotel zone' with hotel after hotel for miles along the coast, so if you want to see more local areas of Maui plan to drive somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Impression”
Reviews.Author: momtravelswith3
Reviews.Content: This property offers a very good first impression as soon as you drive in the driveway. It has a very welcoming lobby area and beautiful landscaping throughout the property. It has a real tropical resort feel. Check-in was friendly and they even have a TV over the check-in desk with your name on it welcoming you to the resort. The front desk here is operational 24 hours. There is a free Polynesian Show by the pool once per week with fruit punch. This resort is very family friendly, an active resort, still serene, but can feel very comfortable here with kids. I had a gardenview (partial oceanview too) 1 bedroom condo. I was very happy and satisfied with my condo, it had been updated recently with new counters, appliances all appeared brand new and furniture was very pleasing. Kitchen was fully equipped with dishes, soap and diswasher. My room also had a washer and dryer. A Condo is a tough thing to specifically comment on in Maui, as Aston manages the property but most of the units are individually owned and it really depends on the owners and what they have done to keep the unit up. Some are very updated and some are not. I suppose the one good thing about booking with Aston directly is that if you receive a room you are unhappy with you can ask to change to another, but we were lucky and were thrilled with our unit. The Lanai was spacious with a table and 2 chairs and a lay down lawnchair. Having coffee and breakfast on the Lanai each morning was a highlite of our trip. There is a $9 per night parking fee. Fee for safe was $1.50 ish / night. In room high speed is FREE, I found it quite good except early morning when I am guessing a lot of people were checking email and overloading the server. No bother, I just waited a bit and tried again. Expedia is onsite to book tours and offers new arriving guests a free presentation with a nice continental breakfast on their first morning. I enjoyed this being my first time to Maui it was quite informative and not pushy in any way. There are two pools each with a hot tub. The garden pool is really pretty and quite shallow, but not heated. Close by there is a large open grass space with lots of sun loungers to enjoy the outdoors. The ocean pool is deeper and is heated, which my 9 year old very much appreciated! By the oceanpool is a bar and the restaurant. Did not eat in the restaurant, but checked the menu and it looked appealing and reasonably priced. Drinks were overpriced at the bar $7.50 for a very small cocktail. I did not see any BBQ's at this property. The beach in front of the resort is fairly narrow and rocky, a short stroll south gets a better beach. It is too far up to walk to Blackrock or Whalers. There are tennis courts that looked very nice, quite possibly recently resurfaced. Across the street, easy walk, there is a grocery store, pizza and Mexican Restaurant. I really enjoyed my stay at this resort. It is a little farther north on Kaanapali Beach than I would have liked, but I would still stay here in the future as I loved the property and all of the extra amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location!”
Reviews.Author: Nade70
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Kaanapali Shores and I can say the location can't be beat. This time we went through a private condo owner and stayed in a one bedroom condo with a view, which was spectacular. The year previous we booked through Costco and had a two bedroom unit with the same spectacular view. I would say our experience with booking through Costco was better, it afforded us with daily maid service, the private owner did not without additional cost. There are two pools, we only used the one next to the beach, small, but did the job. As stated, the location really can't be beat. From the pool area, you can see the ocean, and if lucky enough, the whales passing by! You can lay on the beach, walk, run, swim and boogie board all within a few minutes from your unit. I would recommend requesting an updated unit whether searching from a private owner or a company. The units have fully equiped kitchens, washer/dryer, wi-fi, and balcony's. There is a grocery store right across the street and down the street a market with organic foods, a great coffee company "Kick A**" coffee and a place to rent your snorkel/boogie boards.....also a park right across the street on the water. Great location for your morning walk/run. The staff at the resort are pleasant and always ready to assist you with your needs. We brought our children ages 18 and 10, they both had a blast and were able to enjoy the ammenities the hotel had to offer. My only complaint is that they charge you a daily user fee for the fitness room, I think 10 dollars per day or some deal you can do for a full week. You are also charged for parking....9 dollars per day, I suppose that is pretty standard for any hotel/resort in that area.

Reviews.Title: “definitely 3 star property, great value, clean just a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family of 4 just spent a week here. hands down a great value. property is a bit worn and gardens not as extensive as neighboring hotels. we had a 2 bedroom condo type unit. definitely request an ocean view, it is worth the extra cost. rooms are great. well appointed kitchens, flat screen tv's and spacious. only complaint is rugs need updating. restaurant is terrible, but there are so many good options it did not matter. last day there grounds crew came out around 10:30 am to mow the lawns and moved people so they could mow grass.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE..”
Reviews.Author: TRL_11
Reviews.Content: We were put into a room on the third floor - WHAT A DUMP!!! After much complaining we were finally put up to the fifth floor - what a difference. Not an amazing suite, but a very nice, comfortable, updated suite. How can they charge the same price for those units - there has to be a standard set on updating units. The pictures on their website are VERY misleading. But I will admit, once we complained enough, the service we received was good. But also - be aware - the "kids stay and eat free" - a shame - they only eat free if you eat during certain hours - which does not include breakfast or dinner!?!? Also, they eat free if they eat at the beach front pool, but not if you take it to the shallow kids pool about 20 feet away?!?! Great location - not a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: coldcanucks4
Reviews.Content: What a well appointed suite we had in this hotel! Dishwasher, full stove and fridge, washer and dryer, microwave- all the comforts of home right there. Lots of dishes, equipment, and pots. All rooms faced the ocean which could be seen from most of the garden view rooms (which were much cheaper). Lanai had chairs and table.Garden was gorgeous, and very well kept. The beach was beautiful in that spot, and lots of whales were swimming close by. Two big pools and a small hot tub filled the space between hotel garden and beach. Restaurant was good. Several stores and services right in the hotel including activities desk (expedia), book exchange / library, snack shop, business centre. On the grounds were tennis courts with equipment available free at front desk. Right across the street was a huge grocery store and several shops and restaurants. Close to many other shopping centres and interesting places to explore. Only downside was the free wi-fi worked only sporadically in the room. Staff were helpful and courteous. It was a very family-friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely LOVED this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJan
Reviews.Content: This resort had everything to make us comfortable. The units were clean, the staff very knowledeable, friendly, and hard working. Also, great amenities - beautiful grounds, two swimming pools, two hot tubs, a great restaurant and a beautiful beach to walk and, of course, a great ocean to swim in. There is a work out room and wi-fi available. We loved the fact that you could order "take-out" from the restaurant. We also loved the location on Maui. Close to grocery stores, shopping and other neat things to do.

Reviews.Title: “RELAX AND ENJOY”
Reviews.Author: forofus
Reviews.Content: Great place to relax,bus stop next door,shopping centre up the road with a cheap supermarket.Pool and restuarant at your doorstep as well as the beach,what more do you need? A must do is sunrise at the volcano and the bike ride down the volcano (DO IT ! )

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with 4yr old and one year old”
Reviews.Author: bandrauto
Reviews.Content: They have 2 pools, one is only 4 feet deep, so that made it nice for the beginner swimmer 4 year old. The local owners were friendly, kind. Very close to the beach. Room 161 was great for us ; it was ocean front and had a grassy yard so the kids could play. The room was nice, not super fancy but we were not looking for super fancy, it was perfect for the family of 4. Nice granite counters, updated appliances. If you are on a honeymoon and looking for higher scale, this might not be your place. Secure parking lot, easy access to the neighboring resort for coffee, better restaurant / lunch.snacks. Had a great time and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Maui Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CookieManitoba
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 2 couples that spent Jan.30th- Feb.10th in a 2 bedroom (#517) gardenview condo unit. Condo was well outfitted with what we needed and we appreciated the partial ocean view from the balcony that afforded a grand view of whale activity out in the water. Entire property is clean and well kept- smoking is severely restricted to designated areas-Thank you! Parking and in room safe use is charged daily and well worth the extra fee.Gym privilege is also available for extra $$.The property is well situated- close to Times Grocery, the Fish and the Farmer's Markets should you choose to do a bit of your own meal prep in condo. On site Expedia has a great morning breakfast introductory presentation (NOT CONNECTED WITH TIME SHARE) and we booked several excursions through the rep. The Hana bus tour was a must with our amazing driver/guide Pu. Pilot, Emery gave us an awesome hour long helicopter view of the island. We took advantage of the Molokini crater snorkel excusion with Captain Buzz and crew and enjoyed a Pacific Whale Foundation Sunset Dinner Cruise. The guys were fortunate enough to participate in an ocean fishing trip booked through Garret with Fuzzy and Co. of Die Hard Fishing out of Lahaina Harbour- caught mahi mahi and ahi that they were able to bring back to share with family (froze and brought a bit home as well). We took advantage of our car rental for island exploration on our own (GPS was initially a big help) and discovered some great snorkelling sites with fish and turtles. There were whales splashing, blowing and breaching when on or near water as it's humpback season!! We would like to especially acknowledge all staff at the Shores- they are competent, helpful, cheerful and efficient as they tend to their duties. If Maui is on your bucket list as it was on ours, then THE SHORES IS A GREAT CHOICE!! Mahalo!! -Four Happy Canadians

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it's cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Jenpher
Reviews.Content: I can't really complain so much, because the price was right! Something like $169/night. We stayed in the hotel part of it, room 237B (though I'm not sure if there is really a difference) and the room was clean, but very small. No lanai - just a window that didn't open, no ice maker anywhere around, no mini-fridge, dated (though they remodeled the bathroom). Overall, not horrible - but not anywhere you want to stay for a "nice" vacation! Pay the extra $ if you're looking for a romantic getaway, stay here if you just want "acceptable."

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dudums
Reviews.Content: The minute I walked into the Lobby I was thoroughly impressed and right away felt on vacation. The decor, the outside landscape, the room was excellent. It was a Hawaii Saver Studio with Kitchen. The Kitchen had a full marble counter, full size fridge and stove, Towels and dishsoap provided, even coffee packets. Ours didn't have any bowls to make salad or fruit salad with and they brought them right away, so service was great.Did the orientation the next morning and learned a lot about the Island and it's activities. They're were coupon books given to us at the hotel for discounts, we ended up on the 9th floor and had a wonderful view of the ocean. I never had any problems getting a chair either at the pool side or on the beach. We only ate dinner twice at the restaurant and it was fine, although I wasn't used to everything being drenched in butter, so watch what you order and if you don't want those extra calories, maybe if you asked they would do it differently. Fitness room was excellent for cardio, some of the other machines I wasn't totally familiar with, but great machines anyway. Store's inside the Hotel were reasonably priced. There's a wonderful store across the street, along with a bar, pizza place and a few other things. Free Hula lessons on Tuesday, Wednesday a show at the waterfront, we missed it and free scuba lessons in the pool everyday. So I surely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alexstiletto
Reviews.Content: There were very few disappointments with out stay at Aston Kaanapali Shores. Great rooms, great amenities, good service, good location, I would definitely recommend it, and am certainly considering returning. A few things to point out: 1. Its worth going to the activities sales pitch on your first morning, if only for the beginning to hear about the good beaches nearby. We didn't do any of the activities though. 2. There are no umbrellas around the pools or on the beach, which was a bit annoying. We kept having to move around to get shade form the palm trees. 3. The restaurant's food isn't that great. 4. We had an 11pm flight on our check out date, and after check out, we spent a day on the beach and used the hospitality suite to shower in before our flight. This was amazing! It was SO nice that this had this suite available for an hour to clean yourself up before flying. 5. The hotel is quiet, and there were children there, but not too many, which was nice as the noise levels weren't too high. 6. Their beach is ok, but rocky if you want to swim. Walk left down the beach for about 10-15 minutes and you'll get a better beach area, more secluded and nicer place to swim. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oceanfront resort”
Reviews.Author: Holly088
Reviews.Content: Several friends and I recently stayed at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores condos, just north of Lahaina, on the northwest shore of Maui. The resort was well-run, had several pools and hot tubs, plus it was right on the beach. Our oceanview 2-bedroom condo was just one unit back from the oceanfront, so the view over the pool to the beach and ocean was great! I'd suggest asking for at least 3rd floor and as close to the ocean as you can get (some rooms were back much further with lesser views). The condo was well-equipped and decorated. There are several small stores for clothing/souvenir/food/forgotten items purchases, plus a gym and a VERY expensive computer room. For less expensive options for all of these items except the gym, there's a shopping strip mall just across the street. I'd return here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “This resort is great for families”
Reviews.Author: sungolfvacations
Reviews.Content: I would say this resort is great for families or people who enjoy active life styles, who want a nice clean well maintained hotel/condo that wonâ€™t break the bank. The only negatives is the internet service with shakent is not great, I could only get good service in the lobby, and there is a $40.00 fee per week to use the fitness facility.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: daprice1
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out this hotel provided outstanding service. Everyone was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. The hotel and grounds are kept beautifully. The restaurant has a nice menu with local offerings. The view from our room was amazing - rainbows and whales every morning! The room would sleep 8 with renovated bathrooms and a new kitchen along with a washer and dryer. This is defintely a family friendly resort but with lots for those of us beyond the young family phase.

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities inside, fair outside”
Reviews.Author: midms
Reviews.Content: This condo resort has been renovated in the last 5 years or so and the rooms are in very good condition in addition to being spacious. They are fully equipped with all kitchen appliances and have nice balconies. The outside amenities including swimming pools, restaurant and beach are fair at best. The swimming pools are small, inadequate for the size of the resort, the beach in front of the hotel is narrow with very few chairs and the restaurant is very basic. The staff helps but not very willing and there are a lot of rules.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WAussie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 28th Dec to 31 Dec in a 2 bed condo. We were given a ground floor unit that had ocean glimpses.Loved that we could walk out the door to either pool or the beach, left the doors open and enjoyed the view of the gardens, especially at night as it was all lit up. Didnt use the pools as there were heaps of young children but we also prefer the beach which was fine for a bit of sunbaking and a swim, also great for a sunset walk. We found the condo easily large enough for 2 adults and our 20yrold daughter and 18 yr old son.Kitchen was great with all utensils. Loved that it had a washer and dryer, and we found the 2 bathrooms, bedroom decor etc all to be of a really good standard. Free wifi anywhere in the unit including sitting out on the verandah was great. Would also recommend the staff at the Expedia desk who were fantastic, we wanted to go on the Molokini snorkel trip but as I hadnt realised how busy it would be hadnt pre booked.They must have run every company and more but with no luck, we went on a whale watching trip instead which was awesome.The gentlemen at the desk provided me with a map and his 3 favourite spots to snorkel and we hired some gear and went to Napili to snorkle instead. We really liked the location as we had hired a car and found it central for either Lahaina or Napili, whalers etc.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: IamJ33
Reviews.Content: very nice stay, roomy condo, beautiful grounds. 2 pools, 2 hot tubs. lots of room for kids to play. grocery store across the street. open market within walking distance. small beach, but adequate. nice quiet vacation at the Aston Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: karenhampel
Reviews.Content: Visited with my husband, two-and-a-half year old and in laws. Stayed in a two bedroom condo which was perfect for being able to put the little one down and come back out to socialize. Loved the convenience of having the pool and beach both so close, as well as a kitchen and grocery store right across the street. There's also a great coffee shop across the street that beats the one in the lobby. Some people have mentioned the beach being rocky and rough. My two year old was content to play on the beach all day. We did not let him go in the water by himself because there are significant waves, but there are signs all over warning about the strong undertow and waves, so should not be a shock to anyone. My husband wore shoes when he went in a bit farther because there is a fair bit of coral around. But it was a great beach to hang out on. I had been concerned about the lack of info. on the pools online and it would have to say they are great for kids in general, but not the little ones. There is nowhere that they can stand up on their own. That would be my biggest recommendation to this place aside from updating rooms. Make one of the pools a little more kid friendly given that it seems to be a big place for families.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: unitas1952
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Friendly staff, esp Vangie at front desk. Upgraded on arrival at no cost. Clean. Comfy. WILL go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort of a condo with the amenities of a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: rodericf12350
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here based largely on TripAvisor reviews and were not dissapointed. The 2 bedroom garden view we rented was very large with a full kitchen high quality cabinets, terrific showers, and good beds. The in suite laundry is invaluable. The hotel has excellent security, beautiful grounds with no traffic noise at all. It is a 5 minute drive to Lahaina and its shopping and assorted restaurants, or if you wish to eat at "home" there are some great supermarkets as close as across the street. The icing on the cake for us was the helpful and freindly staff, especially Consierge Andrea Wallace, who really went above and beyond!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GailonMaui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores last night so we could attend opening day of the Hyundai Golf Tournament. What a fabulous resort! The location is perfect, halfway between Kapalua and Lahaina. The unit we stayed in had been nicely upgraded and had an ocean view. The whole property was well maintained and clean. We will definitely stay here again. They have a very friendly front desk staff, they were all helpful, as were the parking attendants and porters.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely recommend and stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: itsdvines
Reviews.Content: I vacationed on Maui with my 3 teenage kids (19, 18 & 14). I wanted something with a kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, maid service and on a user friendly beach that was also affordable. Aston Kaanapali Shores not only met all my criteria, it exceeded my expectations. The room was huge. Flat screen, HD TV's in both bedrooms and the living room. Though I booked a Garden View, we were upgraded to an Ocean View at no additional charge. The room also had a washer and dryer which came in very handy. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The entire property is non-smoking, which is great. There is free Wi-Fi. There's a great little coffee/muffin/danish cart on site for morning specialty coffees. There are 2 stores on the property that sell everything from snorkel gear to refrigerated foods. The only criticism we had was the food at the on-site restaurant wasn't good. But having the kitchen, plus Whalers Village and Lahaina being so close, made it no big deal. When we got home, my daughter realized she forgot her MAC AC cable. these are $80 new. I called the hotel and not only did housekeeping turn it in, but they had already mailed it out to us. I was very impressed with that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room(602) Great view”
Reviews.Author: BobStefonowicz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui. We loved Maui and our Hotel room (condo) made it even more enjoyable. We had a great room (suite) with a great view. We would recommend this facility to anyone. Our overall impression was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: fencermom
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much but got upgraded to a ocean view - Condo 804. It was amazing! Great views of the ocean and it had been upgraded with granite, stainless and the bathrooms were amazing. Tasteful decor and two lanais. All sorts of closet space and drawers. I could tell the contractors were in a bit of a hurry when they did the remodel - loose drawer handles, magified mirror placed such that it was inoperable in the master - but it didn't take away from the experience. We didn't cook - at all. Coffee-only one bag provided for the whole stay. Biggest complaint was the tiny hard pillows - that hurt my neck.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: rdburrus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding! The grounds were very well kept, the rooms were very clean and updated. We stayed in Room 327 and 127, both were great! Both rooms were right close to the street so you did get some noise coming off of that and did wake me up early a few mornings. The balcony looked into the garden which was very nice. There were a lot of birds that were very noisy early mornings and did wake up some of the people in the room. The grocery store right across the street was very convenient and the pizza shop in the same strip center was very good. We never ate at the hotel restaurant, but heard good things about it. The beach is very rocky in front of the hotel, so I would suggest getting water shoes and then you will be fine. The snorkeling was pretty good, just need to swim out a little ways where it gets a little deeper. I would suggest booking a snorkel trip to Molokini from the Expedia concierge located at the hotel by the pool. If you book it there they will give you a free snorkel set for the week which will save you about $35. The hotel is close to Lahaina which has many great restaurants and great shopping. When I go back to Maui I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great sunset views”
Reviews.Author: rkjoyal
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with extended family (14 of us) in three units. Units were very clean and well laid out. Hotel is right on the beach. Staff was extremely friendly. The ocean views and sunsets were simply awesome. We appreciated the full size grocery store and small restaurants conveniently across the street. Restaurant and bar on site with very good food and prices typical of the area. Internet speed was not as fast as at home, but nobody complained, instead, we golfed, zip lined, toured the island, submarine tour, dinner out, comedy magic show, luau, snorkel cruise, cocktail cruise, swam in the ocean, enjoyed the pool, hot tub, the bar at happy hour and the beautiful sunsets. It was a fantastic vacation with family and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Keep Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: FollowEmersonaround
Reviews.Content: Of the twelve times I've stayed on Maui I have stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores the most. The rooms are always clean, comfortable and up to date. Most of the rooms that they consider "Garden View" actually have a distant ocean view! The grounds are immaculate and the staff is always friendly and accomadating. I do not travel with children, but I can see this would be a good choice for families. I have always chosen the Condominium rooms here and have never been disapointed. By the way, my first stay here was 1986 and they have kept the hotel fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: CardFan55000
Reviews.Content: Last year, 2009, my wife and I visited Maui to celebrate my retirement. A friend told me about the outstanding experience he and his wife had shared at a resort which had been recommended to them. The name of the resort was Aston Kaanapali Shores. We trusted his opinion, so we booked Aston Kaanapali Shores for our visit. We had such an amazing time we decided to find a way to return in 2010. From all this, I am in a position not simply to report on how wonderful Aston Kaanapali Shores is, but that the comfort, kindness from their staff, facilities, pools, cleanliness, hospitality, views, and so much more, is consistent. From the moment you arrive and see the beautiful facade, you know you are in for a treat. When you go to the front desk and are treated in such a special way, you immediately begin to understand what aloha really means. Once you walk into your accommodations, you know you are in for a comfortable stay. As you make your way through the lobby and into the gardens, you sincerely get blown away by the wow factor. There are many extra touches as well that I can't imagine you would find anyplace else. For example, every evening at sunset, many of the guests meet outside by the beach to share in the breathtaking site of the sun setting in one of the most beautiful environmentss the world has to offer. The experience is not unlike when all the angels meet for sunset in the movie, "City of Angels." And to capture that perfect moment, Security Guard Michael is usually close by to photograph the experience with your camera so you can remember the experience for a lifetime. Aston Kaanapali Shores truly is paradise found.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around and still a great place”
Reviews.Author: ESS0912
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront suite and upon checkin were upgraded to an even larger suite. Huge and lovely! (Years ago we had booked a garden-view unit and were upgraded to an oceanfront 2BR unit.) The views of Lanai and Molokai from our balcony were lovely. I mentioned that we were return visitors but the checkin lady apparently did not hear me (we were supposed to get a bottle of wine and a box of candy. They made good on the candy the day we left but I couldn't take wine with me to the airport.) The hotel is convenient to anything you'd like to do in the area, including visiting Whaler's Village (shopping center), restaurants, golfing, snorkeling, etc. A big plus is that right across the street is a full-service supermarket. We purchased food for breakfast and some dinners, since we had a full kitchen. We ate dinner several nights in the hotel restaurant; the food was adequate and the service satisfactory. It was very convenient not to have to leave the grounds. The two pools were clean and comfortable, and the grounds well kept and lovely. An "orientation" talk our first morning by Expedia was nothing more than a ploy to market their trips. However, if you're not familiar with Maui, this talk would be helpful. Overall, I would definitely return to Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “All you need in one place :-)”
Reviews.Author: Shena_2010
Reviews.Content: I Love this place! Staff is awesome! Great for families, yet still perfect for honey mooners! It is a place that you can stay for any occasion! Ready to come again!

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks”
Reviews.Author: rallyn1035
Reviews.Content: Reataurant had $16.00 cheeeseburgers w/tax and tip, charged excessivly for parking, TV's are very old and outdated, not even flat screens, kitched utinsils absurd, frying pan 8" size, mixing bowls very small, A/C didn't work right, no bathroom fans, charged for thr crappy fitness center, couldn't use the phone,numbers worn off, terrible service when something was not working, took many calls. They charge for a safe...Lighting uses very small energy effieient light bulbs, unit dark,dismal... So a low rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “great location, amenities and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Melani48
Reviews.Content: We went on a trip with 14 family members. We had three condos between us. The two bedroom oceanview condo was spacious and very nice. Housekeeping came in every day to make beds and wash floors, and every third day for a deeper clean. Pool restaurant/bar had a good variety of daytime snacks/meals and a nice dinner menu. Prices for drinks were pretty reasonable considering where we were. Location was great - right across the street from a grocery store and some restaurants, and centrally located to all the great activities. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time with our family - would do it again!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjfoster43
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time - loved the pool and the beach it was so close. This was a trip that we had been waiting for a long time to take. My kids are older so it was easier to do things with them and enjoy our time with them. This was my first trip back in 31 years, first for my husband and kids and they definately want to come back. Thanks so much. Mahalo Joyce Foster

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Flyingreg
Reviews.Content: We are staying here the week of 21-27 November, and have enjoyed our accomodations. They aren't the newest around, but very comfortable for the money. Upon checkin, the receptionist asked if we would like to upgrade from our "oceanview" to an "oceanfront" for $150 extra a night. I said too much, upon which she went to the back to her "supervisor", and offered $100 a night. I accepted, and glad I did. Suite 502 is fantastic, and the balcony is a huge wraparound balcony that was well worth the view and space. Rooms have been clean and reasonably stocked. We've cooked most meals in our suite, with no issues on cookware, etc. It would be nice to have flatscreen t.v.'s, but alas, we didn't come to Maui to watch much T.V. The kids would like to have a little newer pool style, but all in all, not bad. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion”
Reviews.Author: buddpennie
Reviews.Content: 'Had a wonderful 10 days! We were given an upgrade to a room with an ocean view simply because it was available. Love, love the elevators as they come and go often...no wasted time waiting for 'em! We'll visit again! Only downside was paying for parking and use of the in room safe. 'Understand the parking, but not the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TravvySavvy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last minute flight/hotel package with Pleasant Holidays. Air+hotel for 4 nights, plus 3 days free airport parking = $920 total. We originally reserved a studio condo, and for that low package price, weren't expecting too much. From other trip advisor reviews, we called ahead and requested a renovated condo. When we arrived, not only was our condo renovated (bathroom and kitchen), we were also upgraded for free to a one bedroom. Everything was nice, not slick and retro chic, but definitely clean, making for a comfortable and wonderful stay. Our garden view room even had a peek a boo view of the ocean. Easy location, the beach was good, and there are so many beaches within an easy drive that we made it to many. Staff was nice, though we didn't have many requests. We even took a free scuba diving lesson in the pool. Close to restaurants and supermarkets so you could eat or cook whatever you wanted. There was a freak power outage in Lahaina and my husband managed to escape from the elevator with no emergency lights and a non-functional call button (no lights in the stairwells either), but even then our stay was so nice that we just shook it off and kept it moving.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne668988
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, the hotel was wonderful, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom on the penthouse floor, which was completely renovated, which was a wonderful surprise for us. The beach walk was a wonderful way to start our day, the only con was having to pay $9 a day for parking and & $2.50 for a safe!!! would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkyMaypo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores for 4 nights in early November 2010. There were 4 of us in our 2 bedroom condo. The grounds are meticulous. 2 pools and hat tubs outside. RIght on the beach. Convenient, very short drive to Lahaina town. Parking garage on premises. Excellent tennis courts. Less than 5 minute drive to the nearest golf course. THe condo was very well maintained with an equipped kitchen, too. Staff very friendly. I'd go back again if staying in Kaanapalli. BTW--Go the the Feast at Lele in Lahaina. The luau is great!!!!! Expensive but great.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good value”
Reviews.Author: Tenacity28
Reviews.Content: This is not your top of the notch five star hotel, but for the price, it is a great value. The place is right on the beach. You can walk to the beach from the condo. The amenity is okay though. The swimming pool is kind of small compared to other nearby resorts. The BBQ area is right next to the parking lot, not on the beach like other resorts. The room we had is a garden view suite with a fully equipped kitchen. It's very spacious for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place for young families”
Reviews.Author: ibuprophenor
Reviews.Content: sMy wife and I went to AKS in March 2010 with our 1 year old son. Since this was our first trip with our little one we were extra cautious about safety and security. We definitely recommend AKS for the following reasons: 1) Decent sized condo with all the basic amenities. 2) One can see the beach from their 'ocean-view' rooms ... I used to think ocean view would mean uninterrupted view of the ocean, but was told by the front desk that at AKS, ocean-view meant you would be facing the ocean but the view would also include some buildings and trees. But this didn't turn out that bad because the beach is 5 min walk and so, one can basically access the beach easily enough. 3) Good clean restaurant serving quality food ... and it wasn't that expensive either. And the restaurants don't charge for kids. 4) Staff were generally helpful and especially the expedia guides that help you get tickets for the luaus etc. 5) Not far from FRONT STREET ... that little shopping area is amazing. Lots of restaurants and shops ... felt like Europe. 6) For people with kids, there is a big grocery store across the road from the complex ... very handy. 7) Beautiful tropical garden they created in the middle of the complex. Some of the downsides are: 1) Beach not very impressive. Don't get me wrong ... it is very nice but lacks a few features. For one, it is rocky, so going into the water is not easy. Secondly, there are not a lot of cabanas and ones available are also a little expensive to rent. 2) Small pools - they have 2. On the whole, it was a pretty decent resort. Having said that if I go to Maui again I will consider a different resort, just for variety! .

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very affordable BUT watch out for the birds.”
Reviews.Author: Blondi77
Reviews.Content: This place was great overall. It was very affordable, great location but you must be aware that the birds that hang out there are so noisy that you might not get that full night of sleep you dreamed about. The birds are the only negative thing I can say about the hotel and its not the hotels fault. The birds love all the water and trees which are all over the grounds and unfortunately right under a majority of the rooms. It's not consistent but enough to annoy a traveler. You kind of get used to them. We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room, Service, and Grounds. I would recommend to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: HELLOPittMeadows
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. Our room was an updated room with beautiful furniture. We traveled here with three small Children aged 1-7 they were very accommodating. The water was a little rocky but nothing to complain about. The food at the restaurant was amazing. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel! I had an amazing trip. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Parents 45th Anniversary w/family”
Reviews.Author: Harleykitty
Reviews.Content: We booked through costco 2 rooms ...2bed/2bath oceanview ...room #s were 723 &623 These rooms were great ...clean..nice...view of garden and ocean ...granite in both kitchens ...one had wood flooring and one had carpet 723 had a king in one bedroom and a queen /king in the other ...623 had 1 king and 2 twins...even the pull out couch was comfortable ..nice thick mattress ...the beach was great and we did some snokling in front ...but be very careful ..my brother in law cut his foot the first day on the reef in front of the hotel ...10 stitches later... if you plan to swim walk down a little where all the water is clear and it is perfect for swimming ..book excursions & luaus through Boss Frogs these guys will save you some $$$ ...also there is a grocery store across the street and a great little resturant/bar

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: vimaury
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Hawaii yesterday. This hotel is simply awesome. The condo is complete with everything you will need for your stay. Wife and I brought our kids along and the full kitchen and washer and dryer were very helpful for us. The whole staff was very helpful and especially Susan, the Expedia concierge by the beachfront pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Room 842 / Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: vacationperson1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Kaanapali Shores Hotel in Maui. We had a great time there. They have a really nice garden there and its very well groomed. Here are the pros and cons of this hotel - Pros - - its beautiful and well maintained - there is a restaurant on site so you don't have to drive to dinner - staff are friendly - in the heart of kaanapali Cons - - parking costs $$ - have to pay to use their gym - pools are small and crowded usually - security guard takes job a little too seriously at night and looks at guests like they are stealing. They should eliminate the security guard for this place because if people want to walk around the hotel, they should be allowed anyways. The security guard will stare everyone down, even if you are there with your wife looking at the Koi pond. Makes you uncomfortable. As far as our room #842 goes, its a privately owned unit so when you rent it out, you won't get maid service the whole week. Its strange because the service was included in our bill but you don't get the service.. You have to get in the habit of making your own bed. Besides that , you tend to run out of items by the end of the week and if you want more , you have to call in for soap, etc. The room itself was nice , king bed, nice view, nice a/c , nice shower, everything.

Reviews.Title: “A VACATION TO REMEMBER”
Reviews.Author: cindywashington
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped foot on to this amazing resort we felt like we were in heaven. The grounds are so lovely and very well kept.The rooms were very nice and well stocked. All the staff is very nice and helpful. The pools were so great ( fresh water pools)one of them looks out to the beach. OHHH... the beach, its wonderful the water is so warm and the snorkling right off shore is breathtaking. We also did some body boarding what a blast. the hula show on wednesday nights was so much fun to watch.The restaurant was really good and the prices for food and drink are very resonable.I have to mention Sara at the Expedia booth (by the pool ) She so nice and she helps us with out with booking our luau ( royal lahinana luau) it is really good and lots of fun.Thanks Sara.We can not wait to come back to maui and i know our search for a place to stay will be right back to this amazing resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelkd12
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Kaanapali Shores - normally at Kaanapali Alii or Whaler - and I was so impressed - from the moment of check in - the friendly staff let you know that they were glad you chose their property. The room, 1 bedroom oceanview, was great and very spacious. Had a fantastic oceanview both from the lviing room and bedroom and the drapes were lined so very comfortable to sleep. Kitchen was well equipped. The cleanliness of the unit and the entire property was evident and the friendliness of each individual member of the staff showed that the take pride in their jobs. I did have to work during this stay - but what a way to work - wifi was included and I set up my office at the table and worked away or tried to - I definitely stopped many times to enjoy the view - I would recommend this highly to couples, families or in my case - first time traveling alone - and feeling like I was at home - but of course - with a view!

Reviews.Title: “A Top Notch Hotel/Resort to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: PnSAkey
Reviews.Content: The Aston is an all around wonderful place to stay when you visit Maui. My wife and I came to Maui to celebrate our anniversary and enjoyed every minute we stayed at the Aston Shores. The staff was very helpful and friendly; while the hotel itself was very comfortable and plush. The pools and spas were very lovely and the resort was right on the beach so a magnificiant sunset was to be seen every day. This was one of the best places we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: GnJSoAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Ka'anapali Shores for 16 nights and 15 days and the stay was EPIC. We also were married 10.10.10 on the beach right out back of the premises. Everything went very smooth and the staff was exceptionally courteous. We felt right at home the enitre stay and found it extremely difficult to leave. Extra kudos to the maid serivce. They we're the earliest maid service we'd ever received, showing up promptly every morning with smiles to brighten our day! They even allowed us to sleep in a few days after a couple long nights in Lahaina. :) They still came back and handled everything with extra care. Keep up the good work and pray for us to rack in more cash so we can visit sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky3851
Reviews.Content: I loved KS! We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom ocean view. The ocean view was much nicer than I had expected! The entire resort was clean and friendly! Everyone cared about whether we were enjoying our stay. The beach was wonderful as well as the the two pools and hot tubs. We went to a few other hotels just to compare and each time, we came back feeling fortunate to be at the KS. Many of the other hotels seemed big and less friendly. KS felt more like a family atmosphere. We never found any place we went of the property crowded. We enjoyed the more intimate atmosphere. We will definitely be coming back to Maui and we will stay at the Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Ian606
Reviews.Content: Room was great. Service was great. Location was great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My wedding plus family was great!”
Reviews.Author: DeePlusThree
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with family including my own two young children and found this hotel to be the perfect balance of comfortable, convenient, fun and relaxing. I have stayed at the Westin in Maui (before kids) and I have to say, this was definitely the way to go with kids. The kitchen was kept immaculate (with drawers that slowed before fully closing- a true blessing when you have a toddler that likes to quickly open and shut everything in sight), the barbeque area was a life- and money-saver to have good food without eating outside every day, the on-site restaurant was good (minimal cost, children ate lunch free), the activities coordinator helped with booking a sunset cruise that was fantastic! I had about 20 guests and all enjoyed their stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: bopdave
Reviews.Content: I have to say I did extensive research before booking with kaanapali reort. I came here with my new bride and we were immediatly upgraded to an ocean view condo. Everything was perfect. Full ocean view overlooking the garden pool in room 633. Could not have asked for more ! Service was great from the front desk to the security guard to the bellhop! Ray was our bellhop and he was first class ! He took all our luggage and all our groceries to our room. Mike waas the security guard and he was more than happy to take multiple pics for us on the expansive beach in front of our hotel. I have to mention Dave who trained me to scuba dive for free and then took us into the ocean for a dive that was unbelieveable ! I have pics to prove it ! I have no negative comments as our room was huge, clean, just perfect ! We are planning our next trip to maui and it will certainly be at the Kaanapali shores. Food at the beachside restaurant was greatand the Mai tais were eyewatering.... Everything was perfect. No complaints... Thankyou kaanapali shores !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Maui, we want to go back already”
Reviews.Author: tracijr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores for 4 nights from 9/27-10/1/10. It was FANTASTIC! We had a one bedroom ocean view room and the room was wonderful. I booked the hotel through Expedia with a package deal. I contacted the hotel direcly before the trip to request a recently remodeled, upper floor room. We got exactly that. Granite counters, newly done bathroom, fantastic view of the ocean ... I would go back in a heartbeat. The only downside was that the area surrounding the resort (once you get out on the highway) had a foul odor, like sewage. It wasn't constant, but there was definitely a funk at various times throught our stay. The beach was nice, but as noted in some other reviews we read before our stay, it is VERY rocky just off shore, but much smoother just a short way down the beach in front of the neighboring resort. One other note, the parking is quite a walk down the hallway from the ocean view/front rooms, but that's a small price to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Birdowski
Reviews.Content: We really loved this place, so much that I almost didn't want to write this review so I could keep it a secret! We were more than happy with our stay here. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and lush. The hotel is right on an nice little beach. We spent our time going from one of the two pools to the beach all day. There was a nice area for swimming in the ocean right in front of the hotel. The hotel is nicely isolated, while still being close to a grocery store and a few places to eat/get coffee. Our room was also really nice. We had a standard one bedroom, we loved having a kitchen and took full advantage making Guava-ritas all week long. This saved us money and we had fun doing it. The sunsets were amazing and we watched them every night. I would definitely go back in a heart beat! The hotel was quiet, except for these cute noisy little birds that would have a party in the trees every sunset. The staff was very nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kacrates
Reviews.Content: The Aston was very beautiful,the staff was very friendly and helpful.You can not smoke in any of the rooms and must go down to the "smoking areas".But that was not a problem with me.But if you chose to smoke on your Lani be very careful,the security guard takes his job very serious and it's a $400. fine if you get caught.The only thing is the birds have there times messed up just like most of the travelers.They like to sing in the middle of the night.It looks like they are doing more remodeling in some of the condo's.But ours was just great.All stainless steel appl.,granite in kitchen and bathes. Very updated.Will defiantly stay there again.Hopefully in the near future.Hawaii is gods country. There is a 9.00 parking fee but this is standard for Maui as all the beaches are public so anyone can park at any hotel or condo unit and walk to the beach.The price is included when you check in to the condo.Not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, wonderful owners”
Reviews.Author: LookingToRetire
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at Kaanapali Shores Resort. Both times we rented from the same owner but different units. We love the resort and the condo (we have booked 5 nights in May 2011, same owner different again ... need I say more .. lol) The resort staff is very helpful and pleasant. The restaurant is above average. There is a strip mall across the street for shopping and take-out. This resort located on the northwest shore is centrally located to the lulus and Warren's Magic show <a must see>. The tours pickup at the hotel lobby. We will be returning every year in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is awesome”
Reviews.Author: DonBritton
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this resort. The rooms / suites have all the ammenaties of a condo, in a resort setting. The staff was very friendlyand attentive, from the time we checked in and throughout the entire stay. The security guard remembered our names, and greeted us every evening, and took our picture during the sunset!! I rate this a 5 star in every possible way. We are planning to revisit the resort within six months. It was sad to leave, but as they say, you never say goodbye, only see you later. We recommend this resort with all our heart!!

Reviews.Title: “Remembering it's a condo and not resort, then it's pretty good”
Reviews.Author: cpyoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 346 which is a 1 bedroom suite. Overall and good stay. Just remember it's a condo, not a resort so don't compare with that and it's the only reason why it's a 3 out of 5 stars. Front desk service was good when we checked in or when we had questions. Plase was pretty clean. Small resort but had what's needed. The 2 pools aren't very big but it wasn't busy at all during Septemer and pretty much had access to it at all times if we wanted. Though, I have to admit we spent most of our time beach hopping and checking out the island than at the place. Fitness centre was decent. Internet would cut out now and then so if you're going for business, probably not good for you. Sleep accomadations were decent. Room was garden facing but that refers to the balcony off the living room area, not the bedroom. The window in there was more a sky window you can't see out of and since that faced the front of the hotel and beside the resort next door, it was noisy at times but bareable. Again, we weren't planning on spending much time there. Beach small but since majority of the beaches on Maui are public access, we were planning on checking out the other beaches anyways. Kitchen was adequate with everything you need. Grocery store conveniently across the street. We intentially picked a condo resort not only because it's cheaper but so we can make our own breakfasts and pack lunch/snacks to bring on the road when needed. Microwave above the stove didn't work, including the vent/fan for the stove. They did provide a 2nd microwave though. Washing machine leaked once with soap suds and all but we didn't even use it. Must have been a leak in the pipe from one of the suites either above or below us. Called it in and took several hours for them to come but was done by the time we left and came back after dinner. Resturant onsite was convenient but service was REALLY slow so don't go if you're in a rush. Overall, a decent place with good value for the price you pay, clean and comfortable. Again, not bad if you remember it's a condo and not a hotel resort. Would recommend if you're just looking for a comfortable, afforadable place to stay that's not far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Our Toddler and Us”
Reviews.Author: AbbieDahl
Reviews.Content: Our 10 day stay at KS was great! We rented a 2 bed, 2 bath ocean front condo (361) directly from the owner through VRBO. The ocean was less than 40 feet from our lanai and we could hear the waves even with the glass doors closed. Condo had A/C, too. The kitchen was outdated and carpet was kind of gross, but the beds were very comfortable and the view more than made up for any faults. Be warned: if you rent directly from the owner housekeeping is NOT included so you'll be making your bed and washing your own towels. This was a suprise to us when we arrived. We ate in the restaurant a few times and the food was good (coconut coleslaw!) The pools were very clean and always lots of lounge chairs available, but there was not much shade. Grocery store right across the street and Farmers Market on M/W/F mornings just down the road made it easy to eat in the room with our 2 year old. The beach is a little small, but that was fine for us. It was easy for our 2 year old to walk to water to splash in the waves. There is a reef along the beach and my husband said it was good snorkling. There were also free lounge chairs on the beach. Maui Grill at Whalers Village and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co in Lahaina are both very family friendly (lots of strollers and toddlers) and have good food. We would stay here again, but book directly through the hotel next time. It was kind of a drag washing towels during our vacation, and we had to rent a crib from a private company instead of getting a free one from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindym2955
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my mother and we rented a one bedroom hote. Got an ocean view on the 5th floor which we were very satisfied with. The room was decorated very nicely, clean, and the king size bed was quite comfortable. The accessability to shopping and everything else we were interested in was great!. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, and the pools were wonderful. We were quite pleased to see that the ocean front pool was heated and quite warm. Loved our stay there and would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: kreeves2
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded when we got there from a hotel room to a one bedroom condo. We had a partial view of the ocean. Very nice place. The beach was small, but we are not beach people. It had two hot tubs and two pools. It was easy access to get around. Very nice, clean place with friendly staff. Very, very helpful with anything we asked. We would stay there again. A small shopping mall across the street with a little grocery store, some little restaurants and a few other things. There is a mall not far from the hotel that also has a grocery store, restaurant and clothes shopping. It was about a 30 minute ride to the pier where we took a snorkle boat trip. Maui is beautiful. You can do a lot or as little and be satified. We drove the road to Hana. We had a rental car. It is a long ride and sometimes the road is narrow and a very slow drive (no more than 30 miles per hour at most) but it was a good trip and we are glad we did it. Not much when you get up there. One little restaurant and a couple little shops. But you are going for the views and not shopping! I would stay at Aston hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Do some research before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: kozmobug
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Maui and the third time we stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. Our first visit was in April 2008, the door to my bedroom would not close. We phoned the front desk to get it repaired but no one ever came to fix it. We had an ocean view and it was great because we were able to see the whales. The second year we stayed there was in September 09 and the room we were assigned again had an ocean view which was spectacular. Only real problem was that the room we stayed in must have been converted to a two bedroom and the door locked automatically from the inside which made it difficult since we both didn't go to bed at the same time. The second bedroom the windows didn't open and it was always hot in there. This year we went in September and we were really disappointed. Our flight arrived earlier than we had expected so we picked up our rental car and a few groceries. By the time we got to the resort it was after noon and we had to wait to have our room cleaned supposedly. When we got into the room there was still hair from the previous tenants on the bathroom floor. The carpet was filthy and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time, the sliding glass door didn't close completely, one of the pillows to the chairs had a rip in the side of it. Housekeeping started coming in at 9 o'clock while we were still there. Later on in the week they would come later and they did a poor job of cleaning. All they pretty much did was replace our towels and throw out the trash and make the beds. They left sand on the floor and hair was left on the floors and in the tub. It was disgusting. Next year we will be staying somewhere else. Other than that they have great accommodations although I wouldn't recommend the restaurant unless you're too tired and don't want to go somehwere else to eat. Although there's a great pizza place across the street that we would highly recommend Pizza Paradiso, otherwise make arrangements to cook your own food or eat somewhere else. It's very pricey and the food is pretty blah. Oh and the beach in front of the resort was littered with cigarette butts that was gross!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy a beautiful and peaceful beachfront setting at a great value.”
Reviews.Author: joelhome
Reviews.Content: The long span of sandy beach and friendly waters enticed us from morning to night. The sounds we heard and sights we saw were those of nature, not of crowds. The staff was very friendly, and the grounds were colorful and well-groomed. We discovered a gem in the restaurant on property with its varied and well-priced breakfast, lunch and dinner menus. My husband and I were so blessed to have been able to stay here. We leave refreshed and renewed. By the way, the Aloha Suite has one of the most spectacular views we have ever had, and we have had numerous visits to the islands during the last 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Couples or Family”
Reviews.Author: MadAboutMaui
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort twice and each time the accomodations, service and ambiance was wonderful. The location is perfect; the staff was friendly, helpful but stayed out of your way. The exercise facility had up to date equipment and well maintaned. The view of the beach was awesome; just moments to sand, sun and snorkeling. Houskeeping kept our place clean above our expectations, however we would always wash our own dishes after meals... since a family with children eat throughout the day and leftover food should not sit around waiting for housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Suite VS Suite”
Reviews.Author: patty094
Reviews.Content: Well, we stay this summer in a ocean front Aloha Suite and it was beautiful, large and clean. Except the carpet was warn lots of traffic in this room, housekeeping was terrible the hotel/condo said daily cleaning service this is why we liked this location except it was not the case housekeeping really didn't do much of anything. yes, they made bed did clean stove top but did not do dishes. all in all it was a large room for 4 adults and the location was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value--enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: KenaBeana
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and our first stay at a Aston Resort. On arrival the bellhops were very friendly and we had a 10 minute check -in to our room. We had a garden view room which looked out over the pools and if we angled well enough, we could see the ocean from our Lanai. We had a recently renovated room, which had a beautiful granite kitchen with new applliances and a pretty bathroom with all new fixtures, granite counters and tile floors. The bedroom itself was cozy with a TV...bed was a bit uncomfortable, but we were soooo tired after being out all day, it was not difficult for us to fall asleep. The only thing about the room I would complain about is the carpet...it was in desperate need of a deep steam clean, but other than that, it was great! Hotel location is pretty decent for most of the happening places on West Maui. The beach off the resort was "okay"...but we didn't even spend any time on it. The waves were a little too rough for our taste and there were some rocks and things in the sand. We drove to Whaler's Village and spent time at Kaanapali Beach, Old Airport Beach and then drove North and spent time at Kapula Beach...which we highly recommend! Especially if you snorkel! Nice, clear, calm little beach. Hotel Restaurant was disgusting. We ate most of our meals in our condo. We made packed lunches for the day and cooked when we got back in the evening. But one night after the "road to hana" we were exhausted to decided to get food from the restuarant. It was not good. Would not recommend. There is a grocery store across the street from the hotel. Items are pricey, but most things in Maui are..but still can save you quite a bit of money by eating your own groceries. A meal for a couple at a sit down restaurant would easily cost us $50 a meal if we ate out. Overall, our stay was great! We weren't in our room much, but when we were in there, we were pretty happy with it and Maui is an island with so much to do...who would want to be in your room all the time? If that's the kind of vacation we wanted, we would of stayed at the Ritz Carolton or the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for on shore snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: gauravp
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Hawaii & the Kaanapali beach area is great for first time visitors. Aston Kanapali Shores is located at a pretty convinient location. There is a grocerry store right across the street, along with a dive shop & a copy center & a mexican cantina. The hotel itself is very well kept, clean lawns, nicely decorated lobby area and small little waterfall and a small fish pond (fishes were missing). We booked our trip through Costco and paid for a garden view but ended up getting what looked like a semi garden semi ocean view which was nice. We had a two bed room suite with a pull out sofa and a fully equiped kitchen plus washer - dryer. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. There is resturant on location which we did not eat at but the pricing seemed reasonably priced. $9 per day parking onsite plus pay per user internet stations are available. Expedia has a Local Expert booth in this hotel which offeres free first morning breakfast along with tips for activities to do around the island. We signed up for the Royal Lahaina Luau & the Molokini snorkeling trip through them which seems reasonablly priced. If you go to Maui don't miss the early morning snorkeling trip to the Molokini crater.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sralston
Reviews.Content: Older rooms but comfortable and clean. Could use some updating. One restaurant on grounds but not the greatest. Small rocky beach but there are chairs on grass just above the ocean which are relaxing. A couple small stores. Covered parking. Would highly recommend having a rental vehicle for transportation. Island has lots to see but very little within walking distance. Pool areas we nice but smaller. Over all decent value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: AmyLynn230
Reviews.Content: When traveling with a group, the rooms secured by the booking agent are often sketchy and budget-oriented. Not this place. This was an amazing hotel/condo right on the beach. While it is about 2 miles down the road from Kaanapali Beach, it has its own beach area, and had great access to shuttles to go to the other beach or Whalers Village. The suites were great - full kitchens, rich woodwork, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: seattlelite40
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation to Maui! We stayed at Kaanapali Shores for 8 nights- although we opted to rent it directly from the owner. We decided we didn't want to chance which room we would get. The staff was incredible! Kudos to Michael the Security Guard!!! He was always there to take a picture, answer a question, or ask how you day was! I can't say enough about him and how great he is at taking pictures of families by the beach- or pool. Be sure to look him up when visiting Kaanapali Shores. BTW- Michael, my pics came out Fabulous! The food was good and affordable and their drinks were tasty. The ONLY negative part of our trip was our experience with Expedia and booking an excursion. The boat we booked was highly recommended by Expedia. We were not as pleased- the brochure they had was years old, and most of the information (including the picture of the boat) was not accurate. Just be sure to do your homework, all of the rest of our excursions (we booked ourselves) were super! We will be back Kaanapali Shores, keep up the good work! The staff made the stay incredible- be sure to compliment them all~

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay there again!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimbro41
