Reviews.Content: I will say that the rooms were nice. The check in service was good. That is it! Their customer service was terrible! They lied about children staying, playing, and eating free. There is a $25 per child fee to participate in the children activities. Children do not eat breakfast or dinner free. They can eat free between the hours of 11a-4p. You have to pay to park at the hotel. You have to pay to use the fitness center. You have to pay to use tennis rackets. The beach at the resort is terrible once you get into the water. The beach is LOADED with rocks. These rocks hurt your feet! It is REALLY bad. The hotels to the left and right of you are the same way. The pool was ok, it could have been a little warmer. My dryer in my room broke and took two days to fix. The toliet clogged twice and the first response time was 40 plus minutes and the second time they came in about 20 minutes. The internet was very slow and shut down a few times during my stay. The water was turned off for 90 minutes while I was there. This happened right in the middle of my childs shower, so I had to use our drinking water to rinse her off. The hotel staff ergency was not there. The bellman were slow bringing your luggage to the room. Once I got back home, I was offered a big one night free stay at their resort(s)! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?!?!? I live in the midwest. I'm gonna fly all the way to Maui and stay there for one night?!?!??! NOT WORTH MY TIME! STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE PEOPLE.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tammy67WestBend_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a 2 bed/2 bath condo. Coming from a 1 room suite in Oahu, this felt like heaven. We had an ocean view condo, but were right next to the ocean front rooms. The place couldn't have been more perfect for us. We seem to spend a lot of money on bottled water while on vacation, so were pleasantly surprised to have a fridge with water and ice maker in the door! Also got $100 to spend at the on-site restaurant that was a part of our Funjet package. We found the beach a little less rocky and less wavey south of the property which was about a 5 minute walk (less crowded too). My husband, who is a runner, found a path between the beach and hotels which was nice. Across the street is a coffee shop, Subway and a couple other restaurants in addition to the grocery store. This resort exceeded my expectations. I would have no trouble recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: MomInChico
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have written on T.A., but decided I should take the time to rave about the Aston Ka'anapali Shores. It is a great property, casual enough for families with small kids, but with enough amenities to feel like you are getting the full resort experience. Our room (2bed, 2bath condo, 9th floor, full ocean view) was slightly worn, but the view was so amazing, it didn't matter at all. My hubby and I travelled with our two kids (1 and 4) and my mother-in-law. What we loved best: --the grounds: beautiful! Definitely has the "old Hawaii" feel. --the pools...two of them, one just steps from the beach --the restaurant (the fact that there was one, the food was so-so) --the people (the staff was sooo nice. On our final day the security guard saw us attempting to take family photos and offered to take them. What we didn't like: --can't think of anything... Recommendations: --walk to the Ka'anapali Beach Club next door. Their restaurant is fun (live music) and the food is very good. If you have toddlers, they also might like a ride up the glass elevator. --If you decide to do the "Sugar Cane Train" maybe have one parent take the kids and the other parent can have some relaxation by the pool. It is a fun train ride, but the scenery is nothing special (it runs parallel to the road). --go to the park that is on Ka'anapli Beach and next to the Westin Villas. There is free parking and the beach is awesome. There's restrooms and a grassy area, also some shady spots on the beach. --in Lahaina, Bubba Gump's (i know very touristy) is fun for kids and the service was excellent and the food was very good ...better than the other places we dined on Front Street. --for souveniers...hit an ABC store. Prices are competitive and the quality seemed better than Hilo Hatties.... --try the fruit sorbets on sale at the restaurant at the resort. We enjoyed them as our almost-daily snack. --don't miss the hula show by the pool at the resort on Wednesday evenings. A free show! Beats paying $100 for a luau (in my opinion). --Safety. Always felt safe at this resort. If I had teens and pre-teens, I would have let them run free on the resort grounds. Overall, a great resort. Perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: sunsetcocktail
Reviews.Content: Great location with enough to do for Kids. Easy access to rest of island. Clean friendly great facilities and staff. Beach narrow but still fun. pools great. Rainbows everyday!

Reviews.Title: “EXTRADINARY!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlelindylouwhooo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the BEST one we stayed in while visiting the state of Hawaii!!!! We were in Oahu, Maui and the Big Island. I LOVED this hotel!!! Our room was great it had a washer and dryer a kitchenette (all appliences were Black!!! Like mine at home!!) It was clean, clean, clean!! The employees were friendly and helpful!!! We will stay here again!!! We loved our stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great end to a wonderful honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kammy_nl
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great place for families. The units are roomy, nicely detailed, clean and quiet. We would definitely stay here again. The honesty and quality of the staff , especially housekeeping, is something worth noting. My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Kaanapali Shores as part of our 17 day honeymoon in Hawaii. During our stay we enjoyed the resort... food & drink, pools and the beach! After arriving home I realized that I didn't have the pouch that contained my jewelry. I really thought that I would never see my jewelry again. After contacting the resort I was directed to housekeeping. After describing the pouch and contents it was confirmed that it had been found in the room after we left. I was then told that the pouch would be mailed to me. Within an hour I received a call from a gentleman who was putting the package together to mail it out. In Saturday morning's mail it arrived! I opened the package and was happy to see my pouch - with all of it contents!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and adequate if you need to save money.”
Reviews.Author: kmjm10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the AKS for 7 days this August and found it to be sufficient since we were saving money coming to a destination wedding at the Royal Lahaina. Here's the good, bad and ugly of our opinion: GOOD: Staff was incredibly friendly. We always had our questions answered and even the friendly servers in the on-site restaurant helped us with tips on tours and such. The pools are great. There are two. One is chlorinated and the other salt water. The salt has a great view of the beach and is deeper. The "garden pool" is shallower and perfect for small children and parents. The atmosphere is wonderful in the garden area as well. There are small stores on site, but a short drive toward Lahaina and you'll find a Safeway if you're looking for food and other needs. BAD: They are currently doing renovations, but even some of the "renovated" rooms need some work. We don't expect anything but a clean, well-kept room... frills aren't necessary, but we were disappointed in the limited housekeeping tasks each day (made bed and took out trash, new towels in b'room). Vacuuming seemed to be on the "extra" list. And having a toddler who loves Cheerios called for vacuuming daily. We didn't get replenished coffee packets so we could have coffee each morning, just the first day. And surfaces were not wiped down. During the day, we had to nap with our toddler and heard no ocean waves... just the pounding and sawing of the renovations, also the condo next door had interesting people in the middle of the night making noise. Advice: get an ocean view room no matter the cost. UGLY: The bathtub. They said they recently put skid mats down on all the tubs during renovation, but one of the corners wasn't sticking and I saw what was underneath. Ugh. Needless to say, we showered with our little one the entire week. I wouldn't put her bottom on the tub floor. They claimed it was glue, but I know of no black glue out there. It looked like mildew. I put in a service call and never got a response other than an explanation. No one came to fix it. I have to say the vacuuming goes in the ugly category as well. And PLEASE vacuum UNDER the bed as well. Another ugly. It is definitely basic and a money saver, but Maui does nickel and dime you with fees and such here and there at the hotel and about town. We probably won't return to this particular location, but it wasn't a totally negative experience at all. Great beaches, snorkeling and activities and the people are very friendly. If in Lahaina... try a more upscale hotel if you're into cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “better then I expected”
Reviews.Author: nursemom7746
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel. I consider myself a bit of a hotel snob and I was a little worried about what to expect. I am very happy to say that I was pleasently suprised. Very clean, close to quick resturants and grocery store. The beach is just steps away from your back door and lots of lounge chairs to lay out by the pool or beach. Really the only 2 bad things that I have to say was that the shower head was extremely hard and was not adjustable....felt like needles.....very painful when you have a sun burn, and there is a beautifuI area of trees and plants by the pool and twice a day, hundreds of birds decide to visit. During this time (usually 6am and 8pm) the birds squack and make an extreme amount of noise...something really should be done about this. Never the less I would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'CalGal
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Shores was perfect for our extended family reunion. We had 25 people--ages 3-84--spread out in 8 units, so we got a real feel for the facilities. My folks had the Aloha suite, and we all ate in it 5 nights (paper plates and sharing utensils, chairs and such.) One night, we even had a party with a hula dancer and a singer requested by my stepfather and the space was worked really well. (Henry Allen did the old Hawaiian songs like Beyond the Reef and Tiny Bubbles--message me if you want the reference). Several of us had rooms right next to the Aloha suite, so we kept our doors propped and wandered from room to room as needed. Pros: Perfect location for our group. Close distance to great snorkling (Black Rock south and Napili Bay and Honolua Bay north) and boogie boarding (Fleming Beach). 2 hotels down started the great beach path for the runners and walkers. Nice to have a good beach out the door for families. Great to have reasonable (by Hawaii standards) grocery store across the street, along with Snorkle Bobs, video store, etc. Close to Kaanapali for the luau, shopping etc and 10 min from Lahaina. Facilities: Three year old loved the pool. Older kids spent more time on the beach. 18 year old hung out in the hot tub every night with other college age kids. Parents loved the happy hour. Everyone enjoyed the onsite hula show on Wed evenings. Great views from the condos. All of us used the washer dryer units. Service was friendly and helpful. Big enough so there was something for all of us, but small enough so we could let the older kids and teens wander without worrying. Cons: Yes, the hall carpets are stained, the internet is slow and you can't always get a beach chair. We would lie on our towels or go in the water and soon one would open up. The Aloha spirit is the most important factor of a Hawaiian vacation---so don't forget to catch that after you arrive or you have missed the best value on Maui. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, excellent service, great value.....will be back for sure.”
Reviews.Author: purse-n-pass
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores and had a wonderful time. The room was great, spacious and well appointed. Picky as I can get at times, the cleanliness exceeded my expectations. The entire staff was welcoming and we were always greeted with smiles and a warm aloha whenever we encountered them. It was great having all the amenities at the resort and the on site restaurant more than satisfied our appetites. The grounds were well maintained and having two pools and spas was convenient. Yeah, so parking was $9 per day, and there was a fee for the fitness center, but unlike some of the other places I've stayed where you're forced to pay a resort fee in upwards of $25 per day whether you use it or not, at least if you don't utilize some of these services, you don't pay for it. We enjoyed ourselves and have already booked our reservations to return in January. Thanks for a wonderful stay and making me feel like a queen for two weeks!

Reviews.Title: “The resort was alright, but the reviews we read before going were a little generous.”
Reviews.Author: diosa_del_sol
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay for 2 weeks so we chose the best place we could find at the price point that would allow us to stay that long without breaking the bank. Most of the rooms in this complex are owned and rented back through the management company. We chose to rent a unit that was rented 'by owner' on a well known for rent by owner website. Most of the units were recently renovated, however the hallways still had the same old stained carpet that had been there for years. Our unit was pretty worn out and way overdue for a remodel, but it did have a great view over the pool and of the ocean. We chose it because it was close to $100 less per night than renting direct for a similar view. There were other units rented direct throught the owner that looked very nice. The main pool was quite small. Most days, however, it didn't seem overcrowded. The beach was nice and sandy, but at high tide it got a bit small. The beach in front of the resort nexxt door was much larger. This resort was overall great for kids. There is a decent place to snorkel right from the resort if you don't want to drive somewhere to find snorkeling, also in front of the resort next door. The service at the bar and restaurant were very good and the prices were reasonable. It's just a short 10 minute walk down the beach to Dukes Canoe Club. This is a new location for Dukes and is getting discovered so if you're going for dinner you will want to make reservations. Overall, I just have to say you generally get what you pay for and I would say that was true of our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: soccermomonvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores from 7-5 to 7-15 with our daughters, 15 and 19, and 19 year-old friend. We thought the one bedroom would be adequate when we booked, because we weren't sure about the friend coming. When we arrived for check-in, we asked for an upgrade (we were willing to pay for it) and were told no upgrades were available until the following week. We then were given a first-floor room. I asked if there wasn't another room available on a higher floor because I was worried about privacy and bugs getting in the room. I was told to come to the front desk in the morning. That made no sense to me. So we get to the room fully intending to call in the morning for a different room. We had room 110, which is on the side facing the other resort. Opening our lanai door, we were about 100 yards away from the ocean and had a beautiful view so decided to make due. The kids gave up on the sofa bed because they could feel every spring. We called in for a roll-away and it was a little better. They opted to sleep on the couch most nights. On the other hand, the bed in our bedroom was very comfortable. When we first got in the room, the toilet started overflowing. We called the desk and they sent a security guard with a plunger and he waited outside while I plunged the toilet. I thought they should have done this for us. We have stayed here once before. Last time, maid service was much better. This time they were in and out in less than five minutes and came very late in the afternoon except on the last day when they came in and threw out all the rest of our food before we even checked out. This was about 11:00 and check-out is at 12:00. My husband was out BBQing lunch. They didn't sweep our floors very well if at all, so there was sand everywhere. They would leave us 2 towels every day, so I had to call for more towels every day. They won't throw the dishes in the dishwasher either, which surprised me. When we first got in the room, the dishwasher had been run, but all the clean dishes were still in the dishwasher for us to put away someone else's dishes. The condos do have dishes and silverware, but not very many pots and pans and very few cooking utensils. With the five of us we cooked a lot so it was inconvenient. We used the BBQ grills over by the tennis courts. They are pretty far away. It was nicely set up though. The grills were small but there were 3 of them. We stayed at other resorts where their BBQ areas were in beautiful locations. This is back behind the parking structure. They have so many grass areas it would be nice to have the grills out there. My guess is they don't want to take business away from the restaurant. Speaking of the restaurant, we have eaten here several times before so were looking forward to it for a meal or two. We ate breakfast there one day and husband ordered buffalo wings at the pool and it was just alright. Didn't find it necessary to eat there again. Their drinks are way overpriced. I highly recommend that you do the free scuba class that Mike Drazkowski has at the pool every day at 10:00. This allows you to do a resort dive with him. We dove with him for about $80 a person for about a 45 minute dive. He is an awesome guy and really took care of us. He has a really cool camera that takes amazing pictures that he puts on CD for you and brings back the next morning. I can't remember how much it was for the pics. I believe it was $40 but worth it. We didn't rent one, but the cabanas by the pool and beach are only $20 per day. They have a snowcone machine by the bar so when I went to buy a drink, I saw it and made one. They about came unglued. I apologized, but there was no sign saying not to use it. Would I stay here again? It was adequate and reasonably priced with the kids, would have been much better in a 2 bedroom. If it was just my husband and I, I don't think we would stay here. If you have any questions, feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ur7x
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time to Maui and the 5th time to Ka'anapli Shores. In short, you will not find a better value anywhere on the Ka'anapli/Napili coast. We booked a two bedroom unit (413) and it was beautifully updated with new bathrooms, new appliances and granite counter tops. All of the one and two bedroom units here are complete with in suite washer/dryer which means you can pack light. Our family of four has no trouble doing a two week holiday with 3 medium bags. The kids love having their own room, and the two bedroom units have two twin beds in the second room which is important for our kids. The free internet could be faster, but hey you are in Hawaii, get out of the room and enjoy paradise, you can surf the internet at home, in Hawaii you can surf for real! We normally book a garden view room, the garden here is a lovely collection of native plants and palm trees that attract native birds that "sing" every night at sunset. My children are 9 and 11 and they love the garden pool which is more for the little kids but they also felt comfortable in the large pool by the ocean. The grounds of the complex are beautiful and are perfectly manicured. The beach club restaurant (on site) has amazing and reasonable breakfasts for the days when you are just want to relax and just have someone cook for you... The bacon cheeseburgers are some of the best I have had anywhere. (hint Hawaiian beef is local, free range, and really good) The beach at this part of Ka'anapli (the northern end) is rather narrow and at high tide is all but gone. But this is not a problem, you can actually walk to Black Rock (its a long way but the kids and I did it) or you can drive for 5 minutes to one of literally dozens of perfect beaches: Napili, Kapalua, DT Fleming, and "A" Beach are some of our favorites. This complex is in the heart of everything, you are across the street from shops, restaurants and a supermarket, It is a 5 minute drive North to comfort food and the arts and crafts fare in Napili and a 5 minute drive south to the fancy shops and fine dinning in Whalers Village. As I noted this was our 5th visit, there will likely be a 6th and a 7th. We have looked for a complex with better value and we have not been able to find one. Special thanks must be made to the front desk staff who help us out with a hospitality suite on our last day where we could shower and get ready for a 11:00pm flight out. We also love the night security guard who goes a long way to help maintain the quiet family atmosphere after 10:00pm, he actually remembers and recognizes us and took the time to stop to take our "annual" family picture with the Hawaiian sunset. A great place with great staff, see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/grounds, good value, so-so rooms--need better bedding”
Reviews.Author: TheRatPack5
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st stop of our 10 days in Hawaii (5 in Maui, 5 in Ohua). The localtion is great, close to the little town of Lahaina (10 min, at most ,south). I liked the grounds, the beach was fine, pool etc. Cleaning staff were freindly and did a good job. Our 2 bdrm was ok, but as previous reviews said, in need of carpet replacement, bldg powerwash/repaint, etc. For example our masterbath door was a slider that was hanging from the top only--it swings freely at bttm and knocks against the wall. Almost impossible not to disturb your sleeping spouse. Rms need freshing, paint/bedding, carpets, etc. Had medium sized flat panels that worked great. Kitchen was small/sparse, but usable. Pullout couch matress was thin and my 16 yr old opted to sleep on the couch vs deal with the brace bar that ran across supporting matress. All in all, I think it was fine, but could be great with a room makeover. Close to alittle shopping center across street, 10 min drive to alittle town with a grocery store, close to great shore snorkel beaches, nice restaurant and beautiful grounts/courtyard. Not like the Hilton Grand Waikian on Ohau, but not as costly either.

Reviews.Title: “Overall- very nice review- going to tell you what I wish we were told.”
Reviews.Author: rkraushar
Reviews.Content: Aston Kaanapali Shores was a nice pick overall. A few things I was unable to find out that I would like to point out for others. LOCATION: This hotel is North of Black Rock and the Whalers Village. I called the hotel, but all they kept telling me is they were a part of Kaanapali beaches. You cannot walk to Whalers Village Shopping area. You can drive there in about 5 min though for the great beaches, food, and shopping. BEACHES: The beach at the hotel is beautiful & sandy, HOWEVER once in the water, it is very rocky. You need aqua socks and they conveniently sell them at the hotel store. The beach is two hotels long. Plenty of room for family and snorkeling. THE HOTEL: The hotel does have a nice little kitchen; however, it did not have all of the cooking utensils needed, but enough to get by. There is a grocery store across the street you can walk to with reasonably cheap prices so you can cook meals in the kitchen, much easier than stocking up at Costco/Walmart near the airport. The hotel restaurant is open until 9:00PM and you can call "to-go" orders and the prices are great! Also they have really good food. We were able to get a crib within 5 minutes of checking in for our baby at no-charge! HOTEL SERVICE: The maid service out-right sucks as you have read in other reviews. But if you stay on them, you can get towels and soap daily from a reminder phone call. (I made 4 calls in 7 nights there). Very Friendly, just not quite on top of things. The hotel personnel are very friendly! They did have construction in the room above us that started at 8AM every morning so no sleeping-in. They do have a fitness center at $10/day or $40/week. Parking was $9.00/day as well. SWIMMING POOLS: The pools were great; there are two, and plenty of towels and sunshine. LOCATION: North of the hotel is a little shopping area with fresh fruit, etc. Very cool, can walk to it. Lahaina is about a 10 min drive, very easy. Overall, a very safe, family-friendly atmosphere and I would stay there again! I mean, come-on, its Hawaii !!

Reviews.Title: “Overall was ok, but maid service was poor and carpet had stains all over it.”
Reviews.Author: mdobran
Reviews.Content: The front desk, concierge, and maintenance were all welcoming. They provided fast services. The check-in and out were fast and organized. The concierge staff were very helpful. Maintenance staff were fast and resolved our room problem in a timely manner. The only negative was the maid services. They would not get to our room until 3 pm and would be in there for 5 minutes tops. If we would ask the maid for extra towels, they would respond "Is that all you need? You don't need your room cleaned?" They didn't sound like they like their jobs or motivated to clean our room. The rooms were ok for the price, but there were stains all over the carpet. They could have the room a little more presentable by cleaning the carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...staff is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jenn8029
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Kaanapali shores! Make sure to have the security guard, Michael, take sunset pictures for you. He takes amazing pictures and is super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karenhernandezca
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. The staff was really nice, and the condo and view from the lani was great. The only complaint that I have is the second day there my Ipod went missing out of my bedroom. After housekeeping made our beds. I went down to the front desk and filled out a report with Kim. I really thought that the insurance co. would pay some money for replacement cost. But I was told I was pretty much out of luck. I admit that I didn't use the safe in the room. But my husband and friend were in the living room when housekeeping came in and I really didn't think I needed to lock up my Ipod.I would still come back to this hotel. But I won't be leaving anything laying around in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, easy access & good parking.”
Reviews.Author: sur4mom
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite and upgraded to a 2 bedroom, 2 bath at check in. With 3 teenagers, that was a good decision. I wish that I knew that they had great towels that they let you take with you because I wouldn't have brought my own. Lots of towels and pillows! Very comfortable, seemed to be newly updated. They were resurfacing the tennis courts while we were there. Close to groceries, rentals, some restaurants. 3 TV's, washer, dryer, good size shampoo, soap, coffee, laundry det, etc. Store in hotel also had food, condiments, etc. Didn't see any grills by the pools but weren't grilling either. Very good accomodations. Bar closes at 10. Amazing fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: dinosaurdad
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty averge, but fairly priced. Guests were mostly families and honeymooners. Thought we would get a prime room location booking 8 months in advance, but did not. Ocean view was still great and it was nice being near the elevator. Be sure to ask for a renovated room and an upper floor. Rooms are smaller than the pictures lead you to believe. Clean enough if you don't look to close. Pro: Friendly helpful staff. Everyone was great. Nice kitchen with new appliances. Normal-sized fridge with ice-maker. Quiet at night even though we were near the elevator. Small washer and dryer in room. Hair dryer, iron, ironing board. Nice bathrooms, but no ventilation. Daily towels, sheets every 3 days Good restaurant, but the bar is expensive. Excellent happy hour at the resort next door. Shopping carts available to haul your groceries up. Stores across the street. 3 TVs kept everyone happy Beautiful grounds and gardens. Good place for families with kids. 4 ft pool for the little ones. 7 ft pool for the big kids. Free boarding pass printing on computers near lobby. Two hot tubs, nicely hot and very hot. Paper towels, dishwasher soap was replaced when out, but laundry detergent was not. Didn't know this policy so we bought our own. Con: $9 a day to park. Why not just up the room price by $9 and give guests a pass? $2.50 a day to use the tiny room safe. Never heard of a place charging for basic security. Very tight parking spaces (same all over Maui). Picked up a couple of door dings on the rental car. Had to climb in/out the passenger side a few times. Wireless service is horrible. I don't think they are aware of how many people travel with computers these days. ShakaNet, their provider, has all their routers set to channels 1 or 6, which is wrong. There are 11 channels, why not use them all or distribute them for non-interfering 1, 6, and 11? The place is showing its age. Many areas could use a good power washing. Pool is very small compared to other resorts in the area. Kids complained about murky pool water, but it was fine a couple of days later. Probably trade-wind blown sand and dust. Only staff can use the baggage cart. Either pay them or haul luggage yourself. Other resorts have plenty of baggage carts for guest use. Carpeting in room was stained and dirty. Provided pillows are tiny and soft. Bring your own if you have room. Not a good swimming beach due to rocks and coral. Rip tide warning signs near hotel which everyone ignored. Kaanapali beach appears to be about 1/3rd the size it was 15 years ago due to erosion. Don't go by any beach pictures you see unless they are recent. Better beaches are a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Maui Lodging Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ironmanvol
Reviews.Content: My wife, 23 year old daughter and I spent the last week of June 2010 at the Aston Kaanapali Shores (AKS) in Maui. This was our sixth visit to Maui, and our fourth stay at AKS, going back some 27 years to 1983. I was pleasantly surprised to find that AKS is currently in the best condition I have ever seen it. I had reserved a â€œDeluxe Ocean Viewâ€� two-bedroom condo via the Internet on the AKS website for $254 per night plus tax. When we arrived, the desk clerk was very nice, and asked if we would be interested in upgrading to an ocean front two bedroom suite for an additional $150 per nigh plus tax. We didnâ€™t want to spend the extra money, but decided to look at both rooms and then decide. Our original assigned room was # 723. It was a nice room that had been remodeled fairly recently, and had a decent sized balcony (aka lanai in Hawaii) with a nice view of the ocean, as well as about 100 yards of hotel grounds in between the room and the beach. We were told that the room was 1235 square feet in size. We decided to just look at the other room, although those dollar signs were flashing in my eyes big-time. Well, all it took was a glimpse of the ocean front room (Room 501) to convince us that it was worth the extra $150 per night (plus tax, of course). It was a beautiful 2005 square foot suite with granite counter-tops in the full kitchen, a big living room, two full baths, a great master bedroom opening onto the balcony, and a good sized second bedroom. Both bedrooms had king-size beds, and I assume that the sofa in the living room was a convertible, although we didnâ€™t need it. When we took a look at the view and the huge lanai, we were sold. The unit is a corner unit on the southwest corner of the building with a huge wrap-around balcony that is probably 200 - 250 square feet by itself. The unobstructed view began at due north, and swept around the entire 180 degree beachfront to the west, over the pool area to the south, and over the rest of the AKS grounds, ending at the lush green mountains to the east. Around 5 PM almost every evening, we watched a rainbow form in front of the mountains to the east, and then turned west to watch a beautiful Maui sunset as the big orange ball set over Lanai. ASK has two buildings. One building, the much smaller of the two, which is south of the larger building, has two ocean front rooms per floor (ending in 61) along with seven other rooms per floor. I believe it has five floors. Those two ocean front rooms are 1233 square feet each. We were in the larger building (9 floors). There are two ocean front rooms per floor (designated by the floor number followed by 01 and 02), and approximately 50 other rooms per floor. Rooms designated -02 have views to the north and west, and the rooms designated -01 are to the south and west. Those two ocean front rooms are called the Aloha Suites on every floor, I believe. I personally think the -01 rooms have the better view over the -02 rooms. Both have better views than the ocean front rooms in the smaller building. Our final cost per night for the room including all taxes and the $9.00 daily parking fee was $463.17 per night. Obviously that is quite steep, but it was for a two bedroom apartment, and by Hawaii standards, it really wasnâ€™t terribly high. Plus, we received a $125 â€œ50 plusâ€� credit against our mai-tai bill for being old! Unfortunately, the bar bill was considerably larger.... The food in the Beach Club restaurant is OK, but nothing to write home about. The bartender makes great mai-tais, and happy hour is from 3:30 to 5:30PM I think. The pool is big enough , and there are ample chairs for guests to expose their bodies to the ever-present UV rays. There are a number of Mynah birds that think they own the place, as well as any food you might be munching on, and on occasion, they might choose to â€œdrop-inâ€� on you while you dine or sunbathe. Unfortunately, that seems to be the case no matter where you go in Hawaii nowadays. Finally, if you book a room at AKS, be sure to request a recently remodeled/upgraded room, as there are apparently some rooms there that have not been remodeled for many years.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: grandmapooh53
Reviews.Content: We just spent our 16th wedding anniversary at Aston Kaanapali Shores. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We were met immediately by bell staff. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. Often, when just passing by the desk, we were greeted with a friendly "aloha". My husband had my gift shipped to the hotel ahead of time and the front desk staff were helpful to him in the arrangements. The location provides a great view is just about every direction. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Definitely added to the "tropical experience". The koi pond and waterfalls are soothing and peaceful. The restaurant on site serves delicious food. Prices weren't too bad and the food was always outstanding as was the service. The room was clean and nicely decorated with a feeling of old Hawaii. The bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in. Never had a bad night's sleep there. Only complaint was there was no music. Only a cheap clock radio with poor reception so if you like music, definitely take your own. Pool was small but adequate. Great view from both pools. Nice lawn area for playing on. Plenty of lounge chairs. Not many tables though. Everything you could possibly want is close by. Our only other complaint would be one of the female parking attendants was often abrupt and rude. Otherwise, all the staff are exceptional! Beach was small, but adequate. As other reviewers have said, you can always walk or take a cab. The drivers were quick and well informed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a large family.”
Reviews.Author: Jedosca
Reviews.Content: This place is a condo, so what makes it good is that you can buy and prepare some of your own meals. It is located with anything you need with in steps outside your complex. The downside is the beach is very short and rocky. But as we found in Hawaii, many places are like that. We are used to the Gulf and Caribbean beaches. The pools are just average. but I didn't go to Hawaii for that. Overall I felt like for the price it was a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect family resort...”
Reviews.Author: crzylife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 and we're greeted right away by the Bell Hop. Service was all around fantastic at this resort. We were even taking pictures and even the security guard offered to take our picture so we could all be in. We stayed in Room 804. It had an oceanview, far better than expected. The room was beautiful w/ black granite coutertops and stainless appliances. It was freshly updated and they did a great job. There were 2 pools and the kid pool in the garden only foes up to 4ft deep, so that was nice for my young boys ages 6 and 8. The stores on site made it very convenient. The food at the restaraunt there was pretty good, nothing that great but the staff there were friendly and we ate lunch there almost every day. Kids eat free lunch there w/ a paying adult so that was nice. We loved the beach right out front, I don't know what some of these other reviewers are saying about it being small. Maybe it was the time of year?? It seemed just right for us and is a lot nicer than other areas on Maui. We preferred this beach over Kapulua (Ritz Carlton beach). About a 5 minute walk to your left is Dukes restaurant. If you stay here, walking down to Dukes is a must. Its a beautiful walk along the beach and you can have dinner under straw cabanas w/ lit tiki torces. We made it down there a couple of times. Service there was also good and the cocktails were strong. I could go on and on about how great this resort was, but then I'd be here all night. I came home and thanked our travel agent as it was her who recommended this place. We will be returning to stay here from now on. The photo is the view from our bedroom. There was full oceanview out of all the windows. Thanks Aston Kaanapali in making this the best vacation this family has ever had. See you next year. Family of 4 from Oregon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Aston”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: If you canâ€™t afford any of the mega resorts on Maui (Westin, Marriott, etc.), then the Aston Kaasapali Shoes is a pleasant alternative. The other Aston properties had absolutely horrible reviews, that is why we chose this one. Our stay was pleasant. The condos are very clean and spacious and have a washer dryer!! The lobby is open, airy with tropical waterfalls. My two complaints: The check-in process took forever and if you arrive before 3 p.m., you likely will not be able to get your room as they will tell you it isnâ€™t ready. Also the hallways have low ceilings and reminded me of a dormitory. Also they charge $9 for parking, which is a rip off, but I think all the resorts charge a daily parking fee. Actually there seemed to be a fee for everything â€“ parking, gym, room safe â€¦ The beach the property fronts is not one of the nicest beaches, but if you are like us exploring the top sites on the island, it wonâ€™t matter! Would stay here again for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem - Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneFeeFee
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice by our travel agent. Firstly 2 little annoyances - smokers beware there is no smoking on the balconies, you are shunned away to a smokers corner, which actually was fun as you got to meet other shunned smokers! Secondly a $200 hold of a credit card was required. Even though we had paid for our room upfront, my husband put his card down, however as he was directed by me before we left Australia to let Westpac know we would be travelling overseas he did not, result, card blocked, which was very annoying as the front desk rang about 10 times to get another card no, this was ontop of Hertz wanting a $200 credit card hold, so all foreigners travelling to Hawaii, have some cash up your sleeve, so you are not embarrased the way we were. I tried to put the Hertz $200 onto my ANZ visa, but because it was still in my maiden name and I had no photo ID for that card, turned out to be a huge problem, especially when you are sleep deprived after 20 hours on the go. Anyway we loved our time in Mauri the Kaanapali Shores was excellent, beautiful location, great restaurant, and everyone was very helpful. Would have loved to have a massage on the beach but ran out of time. Would definetely stay here again. Also Wifi was awesome, worked 1st time and was very quick and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, exceptional staff with excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: WStock
Reviews.Content: Our family rented 2, two bedroom condos for 4 adults and two teens and one pre-teen child. Ours was an oceanview on the top floor and the second was gardenview. Both were very comfortable and updated. Both large lanais had lovely views. The staff went out of their way to be helpful when we requested fans ( we like to sleep to white noise), a blender and when we came home from the store with a boogie board the bellman told us that they had a storage room and he then supplied us with three boards and beach chairs. Wow, now that is outstanding service! Also the beds were extremely comfortable and supportive. We own a Stearns and Foster at home and my back felt better each morning from their foundations. The accommodations for our family vacation was awesome and we would definitely return. Hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location”
Reviews.Author: m1ke3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. If you tell them its your honeymoon, they're likely to send you up a free bottle of champagne. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and a good location. I would definitely recommend staying in West Maui if its your first trip to Maui, that seems to be the most happening part of Maui and is close to anything you need. We stopped at Walmart near the airport after we arrived for the week to save money on food expenses. There is also a grocery store across the street that you can walk to. The beach there is not one you would want to spend much time on, other than to catch a nice sunset at the end of the day. However, there are TONS of great beaches in Maui, and plenty within a reasonable driving distance of this condo. Downtown Lahaina is about a 10 minute drive, and definitely worth a visit. Don't forget they DO charge for parking.. I think it was about $9/day. I think that's common though among most hotels. We also stayed one night in Hana during our tour of Hana Highway. We stayed at Joe's place for $50. Its definitely not luxurious, but a place to sleep if you're looking to save money. Hotel Hana is super expensive. We did splurge on a convertible rental car, though, which I would highly recommend to anyone as you are going to be doing so much driving and the scenery is just beautiful and its so much nicer with the top down. I would HIGHLY recommend anyone vacationing in Maui to get a travel book because there are so many beautiful sights and places to go that you should definitely plan your trip ahead of time to make sure you fit in everything most important to you. I used "Maui Revealed," by Andrew Doughty. It was very helpful in making the most of our vacation, and it was funny how many other tourists I saw walking around or sitting at the beach with their nose in that book. Have fun! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Parker1206
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were there for 5 nights. The room was so spacious, we could have had a few more people! The grounds were fantastic, many picture opportunities. The staff was also amazing. From the moment we checked in, we NEVER had one bad experience with anyone! We ate at the restaraunt everyday, we shopped in the little store, we had maintenance come by because we didnt know how to operate the ac, just fantastic people. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: MikeSF
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good place. It's got nice grounds and it's right on the beach (the beach is too rocky and rough to swim in, though). It has two good sized pools. The fitness center is OK. The room we stayed in (338) looked like it had been renovated and had a full kitchen. Some of the common areas (like the hallways) are badly in need of an update, but overall I thought it was a pretty good hotel for the money. They do nickel and dime you on everything ($2.50 for the safe, $9 for parking, $10 to use the gym, etc). Also, the cafe in the lobby is terrible, so skip that.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron007
Reviews.Content: The room was like a home away from home! Had everything you could possibly need in the resort(resaurant,gift shop, coffe bar, grocery items, clothing, and about anything else you might need).I will deffinately be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: loribubba
Reviews.Content: The property has beautiful grounds with two great pools to accomodate both kids and adults. We had a beautiful ocean front condo that exceeded our expectations. The room/property was clean and the staff friendly and accomodating. My 9-year-olds loved the Hawaiian Show put on every Wednesday free for guests. We especially loved the location. Most properties along Kaanapali Beach are on top of each, but the Kaanapali Shores is a bit further north and not surrounded by other big properties. It was in great walking distance, however, to everything...we especially loved the short walk to Duke's restaurant...along the beach. The property is also conveniently located across the street from a great super market. I would definately stay at this property again and highly recommend to anyong wanting to visit to Maui!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Rocky beach, Pools and Hot Tub Great!”
Reviews.Author: mauilovermomoftwo
Reviews.Content: We traveled with my mother in law w/ cancer and her husband and my two daughters 9 and 14. They had a blast. They loved the pools and hot tubs. The beach wasn't very swimable due to coral. I had a beach front massage that was to die for! Loved it. This was our second vacation to Maui. We drove up to Napili though almost every day for the awesome beach so I think we are staying there this Novemeber. The room was great. If you have kids or aging parents request the bottom floor. It was very spacious and service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected, great for a young family”
Reviews.Author: jm2bad
Reviews.Content: Stayed in studio suite 934 with wife and young child. Was expected garden view, but actually recieved partial ocean view. Parking lot directly below the balcony, but grassy area, palm trees, canal, and ocean were all directly in front of us. Room was a little dated, but clean and functional. Frig was circa 1950's so it was a little louder than what we expected. In a 1 or 2 bedroom this probably wouldn't be a problem, but being a light sleeper, it kept waking me up. That said, after a couple of days, we got used to it. Room was cleaned daily. We couldn't quite figure out the schedule which made it a little difficult with a small child. One day around 10, the next around 3. Two other areas of possible concern are parking and internet. Parking is a little tight, but still better than most of the rest of the island. The $9 daily charge is not out of line with the surrounding areas. I would rather it was built into the package price because I had being nickled and dimed with add-ons. The free internet was nice, though connection speed was a little slow at our end of the building. I actually got better reception by moving the laptop to the bathroom. Nothing to really complain about. Hotel staff were all friendly and professional. The grounds were neat, clean and inviting. The pools are rather basic, but more than adequate for the family. Having a grocery store directly across the street was helpful for families looking to eat in. All in all, AKS is not the 5 star resort down the street, but for those on a budget, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with some Cons”
Reviews.Author: itisvacationtime
Reviews.Content: The resort is very clean and well maintained. The checkin process was smooth. We stayed for 6 nights at a one bedroom garden view on the third floor, which we can walk out to root top parking easily. Our unit's kitchen and bath have been update. The TVs and furitures are out dated. The sofa bed's cushions have no support without skinking straight down. When I booked the garden view room, I was wondering why it is less expansive than the standard one bedroom with view of the next door resort. Now I know. Because the resort's garden is designed in a way that birds (Many) congergate at 5am and 6pm and noise begins. They are very loud even with the windows closed. We got used to the noise after two days. Here is link to the floor plan. We stay at the C unit. http://kaanapali-shores.com/kaanapali-shores2.htm If you stay in the non-garden view room, you will hear les of the noise. If you room faces the next door resort, you will cars coming in/out. The papakea side of the resort is where the garbage pickup and laundary facilities located, so smell can be a problem. WE noticed that when we took a walk on that side. Beach is rocky and much of a beach. Smokers tend to hang around at this location. I would say from the balck rock to this section of tMaui the beach will be rocky, windy and rough wave. On the other side of the black rock, the beach is awesome and nice and you have to pay a premium on hotel. The shop in the resort has reasonable price as compare to the supermarket across the street. Maui has Walmark, kmart, longs, safeway, costco, wholefoods. so do you homework on what you want . Overall, we still managed to have a relaxing time. Feel free to email if you have question.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but location a bit boring for us.”
Reviews.Author: travelerwithbabies17
Reviews.Content: PROS: My husband, and my two small children (ages 2yrs and 7 months) just came back from Maui yesterday and I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the hotel. We stayed in a newly renovated 1 bedroom suite. We were very happy with the room. There's also a free 1 hour hula show by the pool area on Wednesday nights. The garden pool was great because one of us could swim in the pool and the other could kick around a ball with my 2 yr old and still be close to each other. Staff was very friendly - especially Mike, the security guard who took some AMAZING family pictures for us on our camera. CONS: The beach on the other hand was disappointing. VERY narrow and rocky. If you walk a bit to the left, you will find a bigger beach, but still VERY small, quiet, and quite frankly BORING. The "boardwalk" along the beach that takes you to Whalers Village (shopping center) doesn't begin at this hotel, so you have to drive there. Also, on Tuesday night the restaurant/bar by the pool closed at 8:30pm!!!! Overall, my husband and I (who are both 30 years old) found Maui to be really BORING. We have been to Waikiki twice before and both choose it over Maui any day. Oahu has everything that Maui has (beautiful beaches, snorkeling, tourist attractions, luaus, etc etc) AND it doesnt completely shut down after 9:00pm, which is what we found all over Maui - (while in Maui last week, we stayed in Lahaina, Kaanapali, Kihei and Kapalua). Yes, Oahu is busier, but if you like that sort of thing, like we do, then Oahu is the place for you.... oh and we were the youngest people (besides some small children) that we saw at the hotel. Everyone was very old - no offence. Yes- I would recommend this hotel to a friend if they wanted to go to Maui. But, No - I wouldnt recommend Maui over Oahu simply because it was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ORTravel7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kaanapali Shores the first week of May and had a great time. It was our second time at this resort; the first time was in 2007 for our 20th anniversary. At check in-we upgraded from a garden view room to an ocean view for about $300. It was well worth the price. We had a great view from the 7th floor of the ocean, beach, and pool from every room in the condo-including the kitchen. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and courteous. The security guard even offered to take our picture together numerous times throughout our stay-it is nice to have pictures of us together. The pools and grounds were beautiful and well kept. At night they light the tiki torches which make the grounds beautiful. The sunsets on the beach in front of the pool area canâ€™t be beat. They have happy hour at the restaurant by the pool from 3-5 with $4-$5 drink specials, which was nice. The hotel next door, Kaanapali Beach Club, has a great happy hour from 5-7 which is a quick 1-minute walk on the beach or walkway. We did this numerous times. They have built a walkway that begins at the Hanoa Kai resort (about 3 hotels away) that goes all the way to Whalers Village and beyond. We walked every morning from our resort to Whalers Village which was about 5 Â½ miles total. What a beautiful walk! The only negative that I can think of is that the beach in front of the resort has disappeared! Three years ago, the beach was about 40 feet wide and we sat on the lounge chairs every evening to watch the sunset and drink mai-taiâ€™s. This time, there was only about 4 feet of beach. Iâ€™m not sure what has caused this. All in all, this is a great resort and feels like home within a couple of days. Would definitely recommend this resort and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: ILuvtotravel48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon here over spring break and we really enjoyed the hotel. It is beautifully landscaped. When we checked in and told the front desk that we were on our honeymoon they immediately had a bottle of champagne sent to our room. We had a very nice room which had been recently remodeled. There were marble countertops and nice furnishings. The bathroom was a nice size and had also been remodeled. We had an ocean view room that had a view from both the bedroom and the livingroom. Our lanai had nice furniture and a beautiful view. The parking garage was nice and convenient. Even though we had to pay to park it was reasonable for the area. We ate once at the onsite restaurant. It was good but the waiter seemed to be a little annoyed that we only ordered an appetizer to share. It was late and we just needed a snack before bedtime. Maybe he was just having a bad day!! All in all the place was very nice and a great deal for the price. The beach in front of the hotel was rocky, but we just went down the road to Whaler's Station and paid to park and shopped, ate and went to Kaanapali Beach. Since we ate and shopped there our parking was validated and we never had to pay parking. I recommend that you eat lunch at the Hula Grill there. We ate lunch with our feet in the sand and the view of the ocean was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Kaanapali Shores!”
Reviews.Author: justbeachy2
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maui with a group of 80 people for our wedding. The Kaanapali Shores went above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic stay. I booked 30 rooms for our group and requested renovated rooms. Check in was smooth, and everyone got renovated rooms as we had requested! The grounds were beautiful, the pools were awesome and the views were spectacular! The restaurant on site had great food, and prices were good as well. I would HIGHLY recommend the Kaanapali Shores!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: mauichick10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKS April 20-26 and upgraded to the Aloha Suite room 802. The price was worth it! Breathtaking views, huge wrap around lani! It was amazing!! The room was another story. Sadly, this was not an upgraded unit. It was stuck in the 1980's, kitchen and bathrooms need to be updated. The master bathroom had a 2x2 inch hole in the tile (with hair and fabric sticking to it) The down blanket had blood on it. The carpet was filthy. Yes, I am very forgiving, after all it is a beach hotel. I came knowing that we might get an older unit in the Aloha Suites and it was a trade off for the view/lani. The location is great, all the amenities you could need. Staff was kind and accomadating. Beach infront of hotel is rocky and water is dangerous. A 10 min stroll towards black rock is a nice beach with calm water and family friendly enviroment. Great walking path that starts infront of Honua Kai resort. Dukes at Honua Kai has the best bananna-mac pancakes! A great menu and wonderful view. Just be sure to ask if you are in an updated room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii 2010”
Reviews.Author: KKTenEyck
Reviews.Content: Beautiful condo with a fabulous ocean view! The staff was wonderful! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel / dangerous waters”
Reviews.Author: tayana_bug
Reviews.Content: The hotel and area are fantastic. The hotel staff are unbelievable. This trip was amazing until one early afternoon my boyfriend and father were snorkeling out front of the hotel. There is a riptide that pulled my boyfriend who is 20 out into the sea. There were rescue teams for 3 days searching and he wasn't found; neither was his snorkel. Aston Hotels Kaanapali Shores were so helpful to us. They brought us everything we needed while sitting on the beach waiting for the return of our loved one. They also provided food and drinks to the rescue teams. After the last day of the search they helped us put together a beautiful memorial on the beach in front of the riptide. It is so heart breaking that we lost him in such a beautiful place and at such a young age but we are very thankful for the efforts put in by the hotel staff and the rescuers. THANK YOU! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! I do though suggest swimming with a flotation device; no matter how old you are a flotation device can save your life!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gardens”
Reviews.Author: kevnik1
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this resort. It had all the ammenities you needed. We own a timeshare at the Maui Marriott and this resort really did compare. It may not have had the massive swimming pool but as far as the rest ot it well worth the money. Not to mention the location was nice. Easy trip to Kapalua or Whalers village. We would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “perfect family place”
Reviews.Author: rfv2010
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a great vacation @ Ka'anapali Shores. we rented a 2 bdroom 2bath condo. staying in a condo with kids is the perfect way to go. This was so roomy and in great condition. The kitchen has just the basics, but we managed just fine. All of the hotel staff was very friendly, the lobby is beautiful and so are the grounds.this is a great place to stay with kids-2 pools to pick from and a huge grassy area to play ball on. the down side is the beach right out in front of the hotel is very rocky and extremely rough ocean. so long story short, i would definetly reccommend this hotel if you have kids and you don't mind walking or driving to a safer/nicer beach. if you are looking for a quiet resort and excellent beach you may want to stay elsewhere. i hope you find this helpful! ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on the Beach, but not likely to return.”
Reviews.Author: MnTLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April, with our two teenagers. The hotel was recommended by a travel agent, when we were initially looking in Lahaina. It is a relatively short drive from/to Lahaina. We were looking for something that would be beach friendly for the kids. The hotel is situated right on the beach, and the views are incredible. The lobby area is very pretty, and the staff were very nice. We had a "garden view" one-bedroom on the seventh floor, which also looked straight out over the ocean. The sunsets were beautiful. The room was clean. My husband and I slept in the bedroom, while the kids had the couch in the living room area. The bedroom was right against the walkway, and we could hear everything and everyone who went by. Also, the pillows were extremely uncomfortable, as they were the little square pillows as opposed to standard size. A good portion of the resorts are in Ka'anapli. The beach area in front of our hotel was beautiful, but the water was a little too rough and rocky to go snorkeling. Also, it seems because the Ka'anapali area is a bit more northerly, it gets more rain than the areas that are farther south. At least it did in April when we were at the hotel. The hotel has a fitness center, which actually looked quite nice. However, an additional fee of $10/per day/per person seemed rather ridiculous on top of the room rate. Also, the hotel does charge for parking, per day. It just seemed like a way to nickel and dime guests. Overall, the hotel was beautiful, the staff was wonderful, the hotel restaurant's food was good (we ate breakfast there several times). However, for a family with active kids, the location was a little farther removed than we would have preferred.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Elly53
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Wednesday from a one week vacation at the Kaanapali Shores. Everything was great ..from check in to check out. Liz at the front desk was very nice and helpful, just as all the staff were. We upgraded to an ocean view room with no problems. The beach was a bit rocky right in front of the resort but if you go a few steps south down the beach you will find it perfect for swimming and snorkeling. Right across the street is a little strip mall with a grocery store for anything you might need. It is only a five minute drive into Lahania with grocery stores, restaurants and shops. We took a drive south to Khei and really enjoyed our day down there. I would pack my packs and without hesitation stay again at the Aston Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “perhaps you'll have better luck”
Reviews.Author: travelbug3371
Reviews.Content: I came to Maui to plan my wedding at this destination. I choose this property based on price and positive reviews. I had arranged for a garden view room for the 3 of us as this was a working holiday. The smell in the first room was like someone had cooked fish in the room. I tried to switch rooms but none were available. We slept with the patio doors open all night. To be fair, the smell was only in the kitchen and did get better (somewhat). Though I doubt it would have fully disappeared. We moved the next day from the 5th floor to the 4th floor. This room looked much the same. On the positive side, the condo's are spacious and the bedding clean. However, when we returned from a long day of planning, we found cockroaches in the kitchen. There were about 15 roaches in various stages of death. They had obviously sprayed or contacted some sort of poison. There were roaches in the dishwasher. I realize that tropical locations have bugs but I didn't feel like spending part of my time cleaning up dead bugs and not feeling like I could use the kitchen. We moved to the Royal Lahaina and were much happier. Overall the hotel is dated and the outside could use a cleaning. It is painted a dark yellow and the area near the elevators was a bit depressing. There are dark hallways off the main outdoor hallway leading to your room. These too could use a cleaning. The staff seemed disinterested in their jobs. When we went to check out (5 days early), the staff did not say anything although they must have been aware of the problems as my travel agent had arranged to move us. Lastly, there is no real beach. I have children coming to the wedding and it is more of a small walking strip of sand than a beach. I cannot comment on the pools except to say they looked o.k. and people were using them. I talked to another gentleman at the orientation meeting and he mentioned the elevator was broken on his side of the hotel. The birds were loud in the mornings starting at 3am. This is more of a problem if sleeping on the pull out bed in the living room and yes... you can hear the delivery trucks in the morning although this is not terrible. On the positive side, the rooms seemed, ironically, otherwise clean. The breakfast was o.k. and my mother loved the coffee. The grounds were beautiful. There was free wi-fi though it is slow. Parking is 10 dollars but it is the same at the Royal Lahaina (no free wi-fi but it is much faster at the royal lahaina 10/day) If this is all you can afford, perhaps you wish to take a chance as others seem happy in other reviews. I'll never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost heaven”
Reviews.Author: namlerf
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Ka'anapali Shores. The resort is busy and yet quiet. That, I feel, is one advantage of the combination of condos and hotel rental rooms. The lobby, garden, restaurant, pool and beach areas are easily accessible to one another and beautiful. Service friendly without being cloying. The room I was in, 910, was palatial with a splendid view. I loved having the washer/dryer in the room because this stay came at the end of a long trip and I was able to launder and iron my clothes conveniently. That meant I could pack fewer clothes and not end up sitting in a hot laundry room watching them spin around. All the big things are right with this hotel and most of the little things. To me the bed and pillows, though beautiful, were a little soft. However, I still slept well enough. If you are reading this and have never been to Maui, well, you gotta go. Do expect strong trade winds, like 50 mph gusts, if you go at the end of March. Maui is very different from the Waikiki scene. Small, mostly empty, sometimes secluded beaches all over the place if you just walk a little way from the hotels. Gorgeous mountains worth driving to. Fabulous surfing if you know where to go. I love Honolulu for a lot of reasons, including the Aston condo hotel I stay at when I am there, but this is really the place for a relaxing vacation and you won't find a nicer place to stay than the Ka'anapali Shores. At least that's what I felt on my first visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Pay for little things.”
Reviews.Author: simcity17
Reviews.Content: To keep it short and sweet, this was a great place to stay. We got the condo so we could cook. Extremely happy with the level of service provided by the staff. You do have to pay for little services like tennis and self-parking but it is still a great place to stay. I was travelling with 3 other friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for a Reasonable Maui Price”
Reviews.Author: Weather_Guru
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Kaanapali Shores in September for the last 3 years. In fact, we were married at this resort back in 2007. It is really a laid back family resort. It doesn't match up with the luxury resorts, but at the same time you don't have to fork over your life savings or feel like the resort is way too uppity. The staff are friendly. There are many things to do. The beach is relatively quiet (at least in September). The ocean at that point is a little rocky as you go out a little ways so it is not the best beach on Maui, but laying out is a joy and you can get in the ocean to cool off without any problems. I believe most of the rooms have kitchens which is one thing we like. We usually get groceries to save a little money rather than eat out all the time which can get very spendy. I have been very impressed that the resort has recognized our name as a return customer and has tried to put us in the same room each time which we have enjoyed thoroughly. There is something about returning to your previous room that is somewhat nostalgic for us. Normally, there is a $100 hotel credit that you can use at the resort and we typically use it at the small restaurant there. It is a nice restaurant that overlooks the pool area and out to the beach. The food is good...nothing earth-shattering special, but it is nice to have breakfast there in the morning or a light lunch. Overall, we love returning to this place and hope to do it on a yearly basis!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ! Great location and family friendly amenities”
Reviews.Author: Bostraveler403
Reviews.Content: Mahalo to the staff at Aston Kaanapali Shores ! The resort was the perfect home base from which to explore Maui. We spent a lot of time enjoying the two pools and watching the sunset. The resort is very convenient in North Kaanapali nestled between Kaanapali and the great beaches at Napili and Kapalua. The room was beautiful with a full kitchen and spacious lanai from which we were able to watch the whales swim by. We stayed in a one bedroom oceanfront unit. Both the size of the room and the excellent view far exceeded our expectations. The grounds are especailly beautiful at night ! We really enjoyed the full resort amenities such as an excellent restaurant and stores as well as the ability to prepare meals in our beautiful room. Aston Kaanapali Shores was the perfect resort for our trip to Maui !

Reviews.Title: “Aston helped make my dream trip a reality!”
Reviews.Author: debjacks
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Maui was a much anticipated getaway! I was very apprehensive about the accomodations, however upon check-in my worries melted away! From the friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the entire property to the magnificent room/views we were living our dream vacation! We were traveling with 2 teens, as well as our 2 year-old. We stayed in the Aloha Suite which was beautiful! We watched whales during the day from the comfort of our private lanai (balcony). The accomodations fit our family perfectly... add the ocean front view and it was BETTER than home!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for the perfect place to stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia523
Reviews.Content: Anytime you have the "best experience ever" at a hotel, there is always that nagging question in the back of your mind whether or not you just lucked out on that particular trip, or is that how it is all the time. This resort does it right every time! We have been coming to the Aston Kaanapali Shores for several years now, and have never been disappointed. We always get a warm welcome as we check in, and that feeling continues for the entire time we are there. It is a genuine attitude by the staff. The smiles are real and easily given. It becomes obvious, very soon after you have been there for even a day, that these folks love what they are doing-and they do it better than anyone else! As for the resort itself: The reception and lobby areas are beautiful. The grounds are lush and perfectly landscaped. There is a giant atrium of birds just after you leave the lobby area, which is so unique! There is a koi pond by one of the pools, and the other pool is adjacent to a lovely sandy stretch of beach. I think one of our favorite times of day is when they light the tiki torches just before sunset. There is a gym ( never personally used, even though I probably should have!) and they even have a business center. If you want to buy a lei before you go out to dinner, they have a flower shop. If you've forgotten the suntan lotion, they have a great little store that seems to have everything-(seriously, it is amazing what they have managed to stock this little store with!) If you need something you can't find at the "little store" (can't imagine), you can always run across the street to the supermarket. The restaurant is down by the beach and has an excellent menu, starting with wonderful choices for breakfast (early bird specials for breakfast when we were there last) right through dinner. The menu has a little bit of something for everyone, and is reasonably priced for being so convenient and so close to the beach. There is an activities desk that has all kinds of suggestions for spending your time. They aren't the least bit pushy about the tours, just helpful. There are different classes such as lei making, offered from time to time, along with a manager's party on Wednesdays. Too much to list everything it has, and it seems like each year we go they have added something new . I would, and have, recommended this resort to many of our friends and family. It really has it all, but most importantly, they make us feel as though they are really happy that we chose to spend our vacation time with them.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MzMSM
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our honeymoon & were very impressed!!! very clean, luxurious looking, awesome views everywhere we went, offered many things on site, gift shop, gym, spa, 2 pools, concierge ... my ONLY complaint was that we were told by our travel agent that if we mentioned that we were honeymooners, that we would be upgraded & given a free bottle of champagne. when we did that @ check-in, it took the staff 3 days to deliver our champagne. not to mention me having to call the front desk 2 times to remind them. bed was a little small, but we managed.we had a garden view rm. next time, when we bring our 4 yr olds, id prefer sometime a lot closer to the pool & beach front & ground level. very,very nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a week.”
Reviews.Author: Mikey98296
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews about this hotel months ago, my wife and our friends booked the Aston Kaanapali Shores. Overall, this is a decent hotel for a decent price. Pulling up to the hotel, you get the feeling that this place will be a slice of heaven. Parts of it are, some not so much. Upon checking in, many of the staff seemed to be just going through the motions, barely looking up at you. The front desk is off to the side so you are really looking at some of the beautiful flowers and garden areas. We were told that we were upgraded from a standard room to a studio. The only real difference is a small kitchen area with no lighting. The only light came from the range hood. If you were here with a family and looked to save a few dollars by eating in a little, this would be just fine. Our view was of a parking lot, a irrigation ditch and another property. The loud noises from trucks, and service people was a distraction. The restaurant on site is nothing major to talk about. A bit overpriced in my opinion. As for the bar - I don't drink but my friends stated that the drinks were weak, overpriced and that the service was not friendly. The oceanfront pool was nice and the view was great. The small beach was nice but the shoreline is very rocky. I would not recommend going out into the water from the beach. One nice thing is that you can walk along the beach down to other properties including Ka'anapali. Other items about the hotel - Parking is a bit expensive but with in and out privileges, it's not that bad. The hotel is just a few minutes north of downtown Lahaina which makes dinner and shopping easy. I liked the fact that it is a Non-smoking property and didn't come across anyone smoking. There are shops on the property for almost anything you might want, from clothing to sundries. The free wi-fi is very spotty and can be a hassle at times. I think the idea of the weaker routers is that you should be enjoying the weather instead of being online. Overall, if you are looking to sit by a nice pool and enjoy the sun, you are in the right place. If you are looking for great service and an amazing hotel experience you might want to look at Kaanapali or Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: alisa_phillips_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores over February break 2010. We were upgraded to the Aloha suite!! What an awesome room!! It had 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, a full kitchen, a living room and a wrap around lanai!!

Reviews.Title: “Merely an OK place. Not on Kaanapali Beach. Rocky beach. Uncomfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: lvbches1
Reviews.Content: This is just an average place. The mattresses in all of our units were very uncomfortable; we had to buy foam pads to sleep on them. We had to firmly request the allotted every-third-day cleaning and re-supplying of dishwashing detergent (no more laundry detergent allowed, no matter now long you stay - but hand soap works fine in washer). If we didn't remind them of the cleaning schedule, and insist, all the housekeeping staff would do was change the towels and sometimes sweep. Contrary to the name and to what they tell you at booking, the Aston Kaanapali Shores IS NOT on Kaanapali Beach. You have to drive south to get to that beach. There were no activities (except a mai-tai Wednesday - we don't drink and non-alcoholic drinks aren't free, so had to skip it) when we were there, so I'm not sure what other reviewers are referring to with references to lei-making, etc. Would have been fun.... Who doesn't love lei? We were supposed to have a free upgrade, but that didn't happen. We were supposed to have an ocean view, but we weren't granted that, either. The gardens are beautiful, however, so the view was lovely, regardless. There is waterfall, which is lovely and sounds peaceful; it's surrounded by brilliant flowers. There is a lot of noise from delivery trucks very early in the mornings if you are facing the condo properties on either side of this Aston, so the middle section is best to avoid excess noise. There is entirely too much smoking. All around the perimeter there will be clusters of smokers. There is no way to get to the beach without being assaulted by cigaretter smoke. A better system for the rabid smokers needs to be established and enforced. Michael was great. He has detailed maps and lots of advice for sites to visit. He was the best asset the AKS has. Some of the front desk staff were nice; some were not. (So, try again later if the first lady you speak with won't accomodate a simple request.) The restaurant was so-so (both food and service) and rather expensive. Great views of the beautiful ocean, though. The promised free in-room Wi-fi rarely worked. So beware. The pay-for-use Shaka net downstairs didn't work either. Staff refers you to an 800 number for both issues; no human ever answered. The units were nice. Some were more updated than others. Basic kitchen equipment was provided. Better, less rocky beaches are to be found elsewhere. This one has high surf and reefs, so it isn't ideal for kids. The beach and mountains are beautiful. This is true no matter where you stay. There are more brilliant shades of blue and green on Maui (and the rest of Hawaii) than we had ever seen. You would want to have a car.
