The parking fees are annoying, as the condo owners already pay for that service. So renters are paying again. You can opt out of the safe fee. Expedia activities - shop around. Most things are available cheaper elsewhere. Overall, I would guardedly recommend this property to friends, subject to notice of the above issues, if they could get it at a really good price. Otherwise, look farther south. It's great to have the extra room a condo provides. Just do plenty of research to find the right one for you.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in HI”
Reviews.Author: DavelovesKaanapali
Reviews.Content: Me, my to younger sisters, and parents went to Kaanapali for a week. It was so amazing, they redid the place with in two years and it is so modern and above average!! The two pools where the best pools in Maui, and the restaurant was great. The $9 parking was a little pricey, but other wise everything had a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: valpete
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights in March 2010. The property is about 45 minutes from the airport. Once we arrived, we initially received probably the worst condo in the place, dark dingy and right off the parking lot. We were not happy and needless to say the night staff did not seem to concerned about it. In the morning we even thought about looking into moving to another place completely until we inquired at the font desk about an upgrade. They did have an ocean view unit available for a minimal upgrade price so we took it. We moved later that day and were very satisfied. The complex is large, very nice to have a restauarnat on the grounds that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food is ok, but not bad. We swam in both pools, the beach pool was heated and the garden pool was not. We did not use any of the amenities such as acitivities desk, etc but we did have great wait service at the beach side pool for lunch and drinks while laying around. The rooms are ok, you have to ask for an updated unit and even though we did, the first place was clearly not updated, but our second condo was. The resort for the most part is quiet. The on site shops are nice and the grocery store across the street came in handy. Not too crazy about the $9 a night for parking but that seems pretty standard or the fact you had to pay to use the health club. The free high speed innternet was spotty. All in all a great place, we would return!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Escape the Dakota Winter”
Reviews.Author: Dan091
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent location to escape the winter weather of the Dakotas. We found the room to be clean, well furnished, excellent ocean view, nice beach, excellent pool area, and convenient parking. The staff was very friendly and cordial. I really enjoying the facilities available for grilling. March was an excellent time to whale watch!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, great location”
Reviews.Author: Retiredandloveit
Reviews.Content: This condo/resort is located about 45 minutes from the main Maui airport on the western shore. A popular location just north of the whaling epicenter of the late 19th century - Lahaina. The facility is beautiful - beautiful grounds, nice pool area, a nice restaurant (reasonably priced) overlooking the pool and ocean. Our studio room was very adequate. The bed was comfortable, bathroom area very large and all worked well, it had a full kitchen which was minimally stocked ( a few plates, glasses, some silverware, a few pots). Our main purpose for our week was to relax and catch some sun. The pool area served us well. We did takes some drives around Maui - perhaps 8 hour round trip with a lunch stop to Hana (far eastern shore) and back. Beautiful adventurous drive with many switchbacks and one lane bridges. There is a large grocery store across the street along with Subway, Mexican restaurant, Pizza Hut within blocks along with other restaurants. Lahaina, about 5-10 minutes south is a very interesting old whaling center with the usual tourist stops/restaurants. We took a whale watching adventure out of Lahaina harbor and saw many whales up close - marvelous! I did some beautiful snorkeling in a county park just north 5 minutes in Napili We found the Kaanapali Shores a great location, reasonably priced, and very adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - watch for the riptide!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Richardson
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous, great kitchen, good housekeeping, very clean. Didn't use the pools but they looked nice. The restaurant was terrific for breakfast, dinner was only "ok". We booked various excursions through the "local expedia" rep at the pool and consistently got better prices from him than anyone else we met up with. Our teenagers did the 4 hour zipline package for $150 and the whole family took surf lesson for $49.99 each. Great deals. The one item that I'm surprised no one has mentioned is the wicked riptide that runs on the left side of this properties beach....and there is no mention of it ANYWHERE on Aston's grounds. From the beach you can see 3 bouys out in the water, which makes most people think 'great place to swim to'. If you walk to the adjoinging property, they have a sign up warning that this is a riptide zone. A young man from our hometown disappeared there this year. There is a cairn set up right under the warning sign. Needless to say...we opted not to use this beach the entire time we were there and never saw anyone swimming during our stay. The waves were high and the rip was so obvious that you could watch it from shore. I'm not usually a paranoid mom. So....the snorkelling was fabulous at Honalua Bay, just a 5 minute drive north. We saw turtles, puffer fish, needle fish, and all kinds of reef life. This is our 8th trip to Maui and as much as I thought the resort was great....the beach and rip tide had me just a little freaked out.

Reviews.Title: “My 4th stay at AKS was as good or better than my first 3 times there”
Reviews.Author: Dougandobrien
Reviews.Content: I have had the good fortune to stay at the Aston Kaanapali Shores (AKS) 4 times. Once as a teenager, once as a honeymooner, once for my wife's 30th birthday (sans children) and this last time for my wife's 40th birthday (with children). As usual AKS was a very economical option without skimping on the experience while visiting Maui. The restaurant prices were very reasonable for Maui. The pools and grounds were well cared for and provided many relaxing hours. The views from our room of Molokai and Lanai are amazing. The sound of the waves were very relaxing. And, we saw more whales from our room than we did on this same trip while staying in Wailea. I will definitely stay at AKS again. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Best value for location!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie_in_Simi
Reviews.Content: I loved the Aston Ka'anapali Shores! First, I went alone. As a woman, I had to learn to travel by myself when my first husband passed away. After a couple of times, it became easy...in fact, I do enjoy traveling alone. You don't have to worry about other people wanting to do things that you don't care about and vise versa, etc. Maybe that's a little selfish but, I find it both refreshing and rewarding. Besides, I've never felt lonely on a solo trip! Anyway, when I was choosing a place to stay, I was interested in being able to make my own food if I wanted, and location was key as well. Oh, and the price...Maui can be pretty pricey and I was looking for a bargain. The Aston Ka'anapali Shores fit the bill perfectly. I chose the standard studio with kitchen. I didn't really care about having an ocean view because I planned on being out and about. But, I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my room after check in! I had a lovely view of Molokai. What a treat to sit on the Lanai, early in the morning, with my coffee & papaya breakfast, just enjoying the fresh air and the beautiful view. Sure, I did also have a nice view of the rooftop of the condo property next door, but I honestly didn't 'see' that. I only saw the ocean and the island. Heavenly. The hotel staff were all just wonderful - friendly and helpful at all times. They do charge for parking, as do all the resorts in the area. But, I have to say, they charge less than any other property I was interested in, so that wasn't a concern for me. The room? Clean, crisp and fairly larger than I expected. The kitchen - I really expected more of a kitchenette - was nice! Full sized refrigerator/freezer, electric range, microwave oven, coffee maker (also, full sized!) and had all the utensils, table ware, etc. Very, very nice! Right across from the Aston is a Star Market - great for picking up Maui or Kona coffee, milk, cereal, fresh fruit and Island specialties like poke (including Korean-style with chili & kim chi...yum!) from the deli. Perfect location! The bed was comfortable, the bath was pretty standard with a tub/shower combo...but, again, everything was clean and spotless. I did not use the pool, but the beach right in back of the property is beautiful. I haven't been swimming in the ocean in awhile and I had an absolute blast! I had forgotten that it was so much fun. They provide lounge chairs and a shower to rinse off the sand, too. There's a small workout room off the lobby, a sundries store, a place to pick up 'resort wear' and a restaurant: The Beach Club Restaurant is on the property and has a beautiful view of the ocean. It's open and airy. The staff are all very friendly and courteous. The prime rib dinner was said by a couple of people (staff) to be the best and best value on the Island. I decided to try it and was disappointed but, then again, who goes to Hawai'i for prime rib? I think I'll stick to Vegas for that from now on. For eating out, you're really close to Lahaina Town (don't miss the Old Lahaina Luau!), Whalers Villiage, etc. All in all, I would recommend the Aston Ka'anapali Shores to anyone looking for a nice place, close to Lahaina Town, etc. It would be perfect for families - you can save a lot by cooking for yourselves rather than eating every meal out. It was great for me, a solo traveler. It's nice for couples, too...As a matter of fact, I will be heading back this May (2010) with my husband...we're REALLY looking forward to it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, parents and kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: BBB0198
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip 2 days ago and I wish I was still there. The resort was much nicer than I expected. Staff were helpful and freindly. It has a restuarant but we never ate there. Food smelled delicious! The pools were great, our condo (which we booked through VRBO.com, listing #192133) was great. It had been recently updated, nice kitchen and bathrooms and the beds were very comfortable. We were able to watch the whales from the balcony! What a terrific trip. Our kids were too small to play in the water at the beach at the hotel. The waves were too strong, but Baby Beach is 5 mins away and is protected by reef of some sort, the water is almost still. I highly reccomend it for familes with younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: AnnPhyllis
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were upgraded from ocean view to ocean front. Grounds are beautiful. Two pools plus lounge chairs on beachfront. Great place to whale watch from lanai. We had a two room condo, which included washer and dryer, air conditioning, & kitchen. Place was really large. Booked trip through Costco, which a friend told me you can't beat their prices and she was right. Grocery store across straight but the Safeway down the road is a lot cheaper. Snorkeling at black rock is great!! Park at Beach Parking Garage before Whalers village.

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed, but professional staff a big plus”
Reviews.Author: TomasSF
Reviews.Content: Because of tips from Trip Advisor, when we checked in we requested a change from the older section to the updated section. We had to wait, but did get the updated section. We had a studio that had attractive decor and was very comfortable except for the rock-hard bed that left us stiff and achy the next morning. We were able to open the sliding doors and listen to the wind and rain. Our view was partial, but fine for our short stay. The staff is very professional, including the restaurant. The restaurant is just so-so, but fine if you just want a burger for your kids. You do have to pay for parking ($9 per day). Expedia has an activities desk there and they will try to get you to sign up for a lot of activities, but the Expedia staff is knowedgeable. I would compare prices, though. Overall, we had a pleasant experience and would probably return - after we checked on the firmness of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jake1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kaanapali Shores in Lahaina for my trip in Feb 2010. I stayed in one of their studios. I actually stayed on the 3rd floor and had direct access to parking on that level. So I didn't have to go through the hotel for any reason except when I wanted to. The room was very updated as far as the kitchen and bathroom go. Kitchen was well equipped with anything you would need to cook meals. The main room(tv room, bedroom) seemed a little outdated as far as the furniture and carpet goes. But it was comfortable and very quiet. Front desk employees were very friendly. One recommendation I have is if you buy anything at the gift shop(the apparel store) try it on 1st. They are sticklers and will not bend the rules on accepting returns. They resolved my issue by getting in a replacement item, but just an FYI. Another great thing was they have wireless in the rooms which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, hotel needs some upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: SpartanKnitter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the last part of our honeymoon. We got a studio so we could eat some meals in, but that never happened. The kitchen was small, and the room even smaller for a studio. Everything was clean and we had a great view from our balcony. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating, but it could use some updates. The only complaints we had are that the sliding glass door for our balcony had issues locking and everything seemed to have serious wear, especially the bathroom area. There also aren't any fans in the bathroom, so it makes it very steamy and slippery when you shower. Parking was also an issue, as there is a fee of $9.00 a night. We weren't prepared for this part, but we made do. The beach, is right behind the resort, but there really isn't a whole lot of beach area. They do have a large yard where you can sun bathe. The restaurant is seriously overpriced, but just about everything in Maui is. We would have liked to have been closer to the shops, but we had a rental car, so rather than walking, we drove. If you don't like kids, I wouldn't recommend this place because kids stay and eat free, so there are a lot of families there. It didn't bother us, but we didn't stay around the hotel much. Overall, we really liked this place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you aren't a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Travelista001
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect- close to a supermarket and farmer's market, small local restaurants, and away from the hustle and bustle. Rooms were clean, had a.c. and wi-fi plus washer and dryer and a decent amount of kitchenware to use, which was nice since the hotel's restaurant had bad food the (one and only) time we went. Beach was quiet, and great for a morning run as there was barely anyone else around. Wish the gym was free to use and that those who did use the hot tubs would be more quiet at night. Also, that the windows were thicker so I wasn't bothered every sunrise/set by the birds outside which woke me up every day. Other than that the stay was good, not much interaction with staff, pleasant facilities and probably will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Swim with care”
Reviews.Author: sherpajon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. We had a one bedroom suite near the beach end facing west. The room was just as represented, clean and comfortable. All staff were great. We are ocean swimmers though so were disappointed that the ocean in front of the hotel is very shallow reef. However by walking along the beach just south of the property there is a sand channel. It is marked by 3 large bouys. This is actually a public access beach/ocean area. It is also a potential DEATH TRAP!!! If you were to enter it from the top side and were reading the signs very carefully you would learn that the buoys indicate a Riptide area. The sign is very specific about the danger and what to do if you are caught in it. BUT,, this sign is not visable if you enter the beach area or water from the Aston Kaanapali property. Upon check in you will be required to initial that you are aware that it can be dangerous to swim in the ocean. The hotel should give you a copy of what the sign reads and get you to initial that and give you a copy to have. We are excellent swimmers and did not run into any problems but only had to deal with extra current and not an actual riptide undertow which unfortuately for one 20 year old snorkeler took his life while we were there. For me this area provided the best body boarding I had anywhere on the island. The current took me out without having to bash through any breakers and then by just paddling south out of the channel 60 - 80 feet I was right in the path of crowning swells that would give me a great ride back to the beach. Public surfing lessons are also run from this location, although they would only go out into the water a short distance. SMOKING is my only compaint towards the hotel. The designated smoking area is north of the beach but in reality the entire beach area has smoking on it. The hotel has placed large sand ashtrays for their butts, I would guess to stop them from being littered in the sand but it does send the message that smoking is permitted on the beach. I would suggest that the hotel split the beach area 50/50 and enforce the non smoking side. My largest compliment goes to the hotels relaxed beach towel program. Towels are available beside both pools on the honor system. Just take and return as needed. Thank you for this!

Reviews.Title: “returned home rested and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: sierra_auska
Reviews.Content: After 5 weeks of travelling the mainland my partner and I were really looking forward to staying in a place that wasn't all that ritzy but felt more like home after so long in hotel rooms. Ka'anapali Shores fir the bill perfectly. We got a very reasonable rate online and found staying in a place with a kitchen and lounge area the smartest way to conclude our travels. Other guests in the hotel were friendly and you would find yourself sitting on the beach chatting with people from all over the world. I love Maui for its simplicity and Ka'anapali reflects this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, nice rooms, wonderful family venue”
Reviews.Author: littlered3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over the years and really love it. Our rooms have always been lovely and we have stayed in ocean view, ocean front and garden and loved them all. The staff have always been friendly and helpful. The rooms have full kitchen facilities, which we appreciate. There are 2 nice pools with a pretty park like grassy area. We have dined in the restaurant, which has very good food. There is a bar with a waite staff at one of the pools. The beach is not very wide, compared to others, but has plenty of room for kids to make sand castles, watch the whales and lounges are provided for sun bathers. Parking is not a problem, although you do have to pay for it. They have a couple of little shops for food, clothing, spa, salon, and a florist. Each day of the week they have activities for guests such as lei making and hula lessons, among other things. There is a grocery store, Subway, Mexican food, etc across the street. The hotel is located close to the Cannery Mall and Whaler's Village and less than 10 minutes from Lahaina. We are over 50 and considered seniors, so if available at check in, get a room upgrade. We really recommend this for couples or people with children. We will continue to go here when we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful condo, beautiful surroundings, good service, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: TexasToddy
Reviews.Content: We had a garden view condo on the 4th floor, overlooked the pool, short walk to the restaurant and beach. Staff very helpful, lots of chaise lounges avail for use in garden and beach area. Try the stuffed papaya for lunch at the restaurant, yum. I checked prices all over Maui as we toured, the store at the hotel has lowest prices on souvenirs. Grocery store right across the street, within walking distance, hotel store also has supplies. We loved our room, can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great. Place”
Reviews.Author: travelduchess25
Reviews.Content: My husband daughter and myself stayed for one week Jan 18 -Jan 27 and had an excellent time, rooms very clean and spaceous, however our roomwas facing the ocean in the middle of the court yard -727-and every morning we awoke to the sound of what sounds like thousands of birds just screeching this is every single morning at 5.00am if not earlier, so if you are not an early riser......fair warning!.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful stay at Ka'anapali Shores!”
Reviews.Author: a_bells
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been here twice now. If you are looking for a wonderful condo hotel, this is it. The condo's are spacious and have everything you could ever need. The views are beautiful and the property is gorgeous. You simply can not beat the value. There is a hotel across the street, but your best bet/value for groceries is going to be the safeway up the road (head back towards Lahaina and it will be on your right). Don't hesitate booking here. We just adore it. TRAVELER TIP: If it is your first time to the island, buy/borrow "MAUI REVEALED" it is our Maui bible. You definitely need this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RayGreatFallsMontana
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were very good. It was the best family vacation everything for all ages. We had our 3 yr. old grandson perfect for him, as well as the adults.(7 people in all) The grocery store and pizza parlor across the street was an added bonus. The pizza parlor was very good and the java jazz offered good sandwiches and salads. We cooked in the condo most of the time and that worked out great! Saved alot of money on food that way. We were on the 8th floor had a beautiful view and with an end unit it was great. The condo was clean and nicely furnished. Plenty of room for all. We definitely would recommend it to others and we would stay there again. Ahola and Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back:)”
Reviews.Author: A_FALCON_BROWN
Reviews.Content: The room/suite was much lager than I had thought. Love having a washer & dryer in room. Ask front desk for a blender if there isn't one in your room:) Great snorkeling right infront of the hotel. It was our honeymoon and we stayed for two weeks, we were so comfortable and felt like we had everthing we needed. Loved being able to bus to Lahaina and/or Whaler's Village for drinks and cheap cab home. Even though we rented a car for day trips it's nice to be able to go out near by and not worry about driving. Loved Kaanapali Shores....can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A truly relaxing resort!”
Reviews.Author: EpicureTraveller_181
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! It had very much a resort environment which made it very relaxing and luxurious - especially at that price! I did a lot of research prior to booking this hotel, and this place is truly a great value. It is modern, clean and our room was newly renovated. The front desk concierge and the activities concierge were extremely helpful. We were upgraded from a room to a suite, which had a very nice view. Also the beach felt very private and serene. Btw, the restaurant on site had a great ambience, but the food was so-so (although very convenient). From this location, you can easily access larger beaches (when in the mood), and all the great attractions of Maui. I LOVED this hotel and cannot wait to go back. On a side note, I highly recommend renting a car in Maui; it is a true tropical island that you need to explore for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: JimKansasCity
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the ocean view condos. Nice living room, kitchenette, everything we needed. We knew about pay to park and the prices in the restaurant, but no worse than the rest of Maui. We did the couples massage, and the activity desk got us a great deal with Blue Hawaiian Helicopters. Two pools, two whirlpools, nice beach with lounge chairs with sunshade.

Reviews.Title: “For the money you'll be hard pressed to beat this blend of amenities.”
Reviews.Author: BoxerMom100
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Jan 18, leaving tomorrow morning the 22nd. Didn't quite know what to expect. When we arrived they had us in Room 148. Absolutely gorgeous remodel, complete with stainless appliances, granite, new cabinets, tile floor, etc. Husband wondered if something up a few floors was available. Staff happily allowed us to look at room 333, explaining it wasn't updated, but we could have it if we wanted. Both rooms were garden view. This second room allowed up to leave the slider open all night and catch the wonderful breeze, and the lovely sound of the waterfall! While it was outdated, it was spotless and more than served. Plus it had a flat screen TV in the front room...not that it got much use. But you know, eventually it does get dark, even in Maui. The restaurant is one of the terrific buys, when you eat at a few places in Maui, you'll understand and the food it quite good. Grounds are spotless. Staff very pleasant and responsive. We absolutely will use this place as our base when in Maui. But it is family friendly and if kids bug you, don't come here. The beach may not be primo by snorkel standards, but gee its a very short drive to many that are.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - WHAT AN EXCELLENT VACATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: Goest-Ryeter
Reviews.Content: Everything went perfect during our stay at the Kaanapali Shores. ROOM: We had a great view of the ocean and the island Lana'i. The rooms were nicely decorated and furnished. The Lanai had a table, two chairs and a lounge chair. There were two televisions with cable TV. The Kitchen had all the necessary appliances including a dishwasher, a microwave and utensils. Our room even had a washer and dryer. SERVICE: All of the employees were pleasant and responsive to our requests. The housekeeping thoroughly cleaned the rooms everyday. There is an activities desk and and a Pleasant Holidays desk on the grounds to reserve activities. LOCATION: Right on the beach. It is located close to Lahaina, Kaapalua, and other hotels in Kaanapali Beach. It is also not too far from Maalaea Bay. There is a small mall across the street. The mall had a 24 hour grocery store, pizza, Mexican Restaurant, and a jazz bar. Everything seemed so close. Driving around Maui was not a problem. It was relaxing not being in the middle of the action. HOTEL: There are two stores on the site, a real estate company, day spa, and exercise room. Again, everything downstairs was nicely decorated. The parking in and out was very convenient. GROUNDS: The entire grounds of the Kaanapali Shores were immaculately manicured. The garden area is beautiful. There are two pools, however, one pool was closed for maintenance. DINING: There is coffee bar that sells coffee and a few danishes. The other restaurant is near the beach. We had a tasty dinner with a great view of the ocean. I will plan on staying at the Kaanapali Shores when I return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Mamaluvsmaui
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Maui with our young children ages 10 and 12 over our Christmas break. This was to celebrate our 15 year wedding anniversary and also a surprise for our children for Christmas. I have to say that upon arrival we were quite pleased with the hotel. The hotel itself is very well maintained with beautiful landscaping. We chose a single room which included a bedroom with a queen size bed, full size kitchen with dishwasher and refrigerator, sofa bed, dining room table and a washing machine and dryer. The room was updated and very well kept with granite countertops and new appliances. The decorations were very tropical and pretty. Our room(#841) overlooked the garden and pool area which was beautiful although a bit noisy in the morning with the birds chirping. It was nice to sit on the lanai in the morning before we got our day started. I believe that no matter what type of room you get you are guaranteed a beautiful view. My husband loved the view of the hills and valleys across the street from the hotel. There are two pools at the hotel and they were both very nice. A short walk from the garden area and you are on the beach. Very nice beach, not crowded at all and there were plenty of lounge chairs available for relaxing. As other people have said there is a nice store across the street to stock up on groceries and also the sundry in the hotel had all the supplies you could need as well. The staff were very friendly and helpful and there was a very nice security guard named Mike that helped us out alot with our questions about the area. Overall I would recommend this hotel. You can't beat the price and quality. I would also recommend a car. There are alot of places to see and alot of things to do on Maui and it is alot easier with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of where you book!!!”
Reviews.Author: cradlemom
Reviews.Content: We made a spontaneous decision to go to Maui for the after Christmas holidays. I had stayed years ago at the Kaanapali Beach hotel on the south side of black rock, then called the Kaanapali Shores. I assumed it was still called the same and booked a week for my family. After sending in the deposit I was informed that the Kaanapali Shores is now a condo located north of black rock on a substandard beach, full of rocks and coral and completely unsuited to swimming or boogie boarding. Since we had committed 2 nights deposit at the Kaanapali Shores, we arrived there prepared to have a good time. The resort is relaxed, with little kids teeming from every angle. The main pool is good., no waterfalls or slides, but well kept. Our condo was a two bedroom condo with a beautiful kitchen, and two bedrooms. The beds felt like glorified army cots. Very HARD. There is a supermarket 2 minutes walk across the street from the hotel, as well as a fantastic pizza place and subway, so you dont need a car . The staff were friendly. Here is the only negative : I left my diamond and gold necklace in the room safe for the entire stay. The day we left my husband opened the safe and took out the money, but inadvertently left the necklace in the safe. We left the room, with the safe unlocked as requested. Upon our arrival at the Westin Kaanapali Resort, we realized that the necklace was still in the safe. We called the Aston and they called housekeeping, who reported that NOTHING was in the safe. I later spoke with Kim, the manager of the property, who went to our room to personally check out the safe. By that time it was empty. I filed a police report with Lahaina Police, who basically told me I would never get my necklace back...I hate so say this, because I am a social worker, and a democrat, but the only people in our room after my husband and I was the housekeeping staff...room 613. I guess the lesson here is to NEVER bring valuable jewelry to the island...buy their 6.99 shell necklaces instead...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RHW4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our Honeymoon in Maui and this hotel really was brilliant!! The staff are really helpful and friendly, the rooms are great with really comfortable beds, good facilities etc. The beach is gorgeous and not very busy at all, with free sun loungers provided. The restauraunt in the hotel is really good quality, although doesn't have very much variety for vegetarians, but is affordable. There are a few shops in the hotel which is very useful, and a supermarket across the street and petrol station practically next door. The parking is $9 a day, which for hawaii is quite reasonable, and there are lots of spaces. You really do need a rental car to get around the island as I don't think there is any public transport, but if you are planning on basing yourself at the hotel, you will be fine without one. It is about 40 mins for the main airport (kahului)and our taxi cost about $95. There is a shuttle that you can book as well which is sligtly cheaper. There is really nothing I can say to fault this hotel, it really was amazing value with brilliant service - the perfect place to stay in Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “R & R at it's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: GreenEyezInCali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores in one of their 2 bedroom Ocean Front units. It was absolutely awesome. The staff was very friendly. There are 2 pools and a restaurant along with a coffee bar. Each unit is fully equipped with all you would need for your stay. The Beachfront units are the ones to go for. It made our vacation to sit relaxing on the lanai, reading a book, watching the sun set or just having. The master bedroom is also ocean front with the 2nd bedroom and bath.

Reviews.Title: “A great romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: mtnhilife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Aston Kaanapali Shores for our 21st wedding anniversary and loved every minute of it. We had planned to do a lot more sight-seeing but the hotel and grounds were so beautiful we decided to spend more time relaxing right where we were. What can I say but that we loved it all; the shopping, landscaping and grounds, the restaurant had great food and wine at very good prices and excellant service, the pools and spa and a fantastic beach with amazing Hawaiian sunsets to enjoy as well as very classy decor for the entire hotel and our room. The hotel staff were outgoing and friendly helping us to make the most of our trip. We were pleased to discover that a guest book in our room showed that past guests had positive comments and experiences too. What a place!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, especially with kids.”
Reviews.Author: todddster
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip on the spur of the moment as the price seemed to good to be true. We stayed for 6 days and had a blast. Flight was smooth, didn't have a car ready at the rental agency (Budget) so they gave us a free 2 car upgrade (Ford Escape), and the drive to the Hotel was great. Check-in was smooth into our 1 bedroom. First room we had was a bit noisy, so I asked to change and we received a fabulous room on the 4th floor with a partial ocean view. Full kitchen was very nice for saving a few bucks on eating out. We have 2 children, 10 & 11, and they had no problems with the sofa sleeper, though they are not the best quality mattresses. Adults may find them a bit uncomfortable. We don't eat fast food so we didn't take advantage of the kids eat free as often as we could have. Also, it ended at 4:00 pm, which is early for dinner. The pool was good, but if you're looking for the huge multi-level with waterfalls, look further. This is a standard pool, but still fun for the kids. The beach isn't worth snorkeling in, but a few minutes up or down the road will lead to some of the best snorkeling on the island. Pacific Whale foundation Lahaina snorkeling tour was best and the staff was great. Overall, this trip was great. My kids did not want to go home. If you're not into the huge resort atmosphere, then this is the place. Very friendly and priced just right. I would recommend planning your excursions ahead of time, but you might want to wait to book them on the island. You run the risk of them being booked, but we found some of the best prices after we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, couldn't have asked for a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shorty20Pa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week on Maui at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! The staff was excellent! Everyone was very friendly and they would all say hello to you when you passed them in the hallway, coming out of the elevator, or wherever. The restaurant had great food for a reasonable price (for Hawaii!). We ate there 5 times, I believe. Twice for breakfast and dinner, and once for lunch, and the service was always great. The beach was very nice, there was a big shade tree at the far end and (normally) plenty of lounge chairs to choose from. One time we went down and there were no open chairs, so the pool staff let us take some from the pool area (which is right behind the beach). The gardens were beautiful, and we personally had no trouble with the chirping birds. We couldn't even hear them in the morning with the bedroom door closed. As for the rooms, ours was excellent. Comfortable bed, flat screen tvs, big comfy couch, marble countertops, full kitchen, a washer/dryer and a great view of the gardens from the lanai. There is no vent in the bathroom though, but we just kept the door open when we showered, so it wasn't a big deal. As for the $9 a day parking, yes, it would be ideal if you didn't have to pay that, but we had just come from Waikiki Beach the week before where we had to pay around $120 for the week to park, so to us it wasn't that awful. Also, the cleaning staff came everyday, so it was nice to come back and have the bed made and fresh towels. To sum up, we had a wonderful time, and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great service; worth the realtively low price.”
Reviews.Author: delvis43
Reviews.Content: Pros: Like all the resorts, it's 30 seconds to the beach. The on-site restaurant has decent food at reasonable prices. The staff is extremely friendly. The first morning concierge presentation is extremely helpful without trying to hard-sell you the attractions, many of which they offer nice discounts for. Very spacious--even for the studio--with a full-sized dining table, big couch, and a nice outdoor patio. Cons: The mattress was quite old, with huge indentations and was moderately uncomfortable. The televisions are in rather poor shape. Our kitchen "In-Sink-Erator" was not working. The hood fan over the stove was not working (although a second, working microwave was in the room). No ventilation in bathrooms. I will never be on board with $9.00/day parking (I mean, just change your room rates and tell us parking is free. The deception would be better than feeling like you're getting robbed.) Overall: When we travel, our needs are fairly minimal--we are "gimme a bed in a box" kind of people. This place is decent, they just need to update some of the furnishings and the hallway carpets. For the relatively low price, I would rate it slightly above average. If you are looking for a cozy, broken-in place where you are simply going to be making a few meals and sleeping, you'll be just fine here. If you are looking for the "lap of luxury" no-holds-barred comfortable resort experience, I wouldn't recommend it. Also, one negative review I read complained about the excessive noise from the wild birds in the courtyard, but we found the noise to be quite nice--different and exotic, nice to wake up to.

Reviews.Title: “Condo w/all the amenities of a hotel, great staff & grounds,on the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: dkmauicondo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aston Kaanapali Shores for our anniversary the room was wonderful ocean front you could hear the waves from the room the view was great. The units at the hotel were all renovated we had granite counters, oversized tubs/showers in both bathrooms, the beds were comfortable, the furnishings and decor warm and up to date with a tropical Tommy Bahama feel. The staff at the front desk and activities desk were smiling and happy to help with any questions. The restaurant was convienent and the food was good at reasonable prices, the servicers were nice and helpful. Great Breakfast and the Prime Rib is a speciality. The grounds were beautiful and tropical, there is beach and the ocean is right in front, 2 pools and 2 spas this is a great place with everything you need to make your staff perfect for a roomantic get away if it is just two of you or for a family (they have a childrens prograom at the property). 5 minutes from Kaanapali Golf Courses or the other direction to Kapalua for Golf, 10 minutes to Lahaina. We would recommend Kaanapali Shores to our friends and family and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hckydevl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores for 3 nights while in Maui. We had an ocean view condo. The condo was large in size with 1 bedroom, a large kitchen stocked, and a washer/dryer. The view from the lanai was great, we could see the pool and the ocean. There are chairs with canopys at the pool that can be rented for the day for a small fee. The beach at the condo was great, there are lounge chairs on the sand. It is a large beach compared to some of the other resorts. There are 2 pools at the resort, neither one was very crowded. Overall we had a great time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: mmracer
Reviews.Content: Love this place! I have stayed here before and plan to do so again. They always make every time special! The people are always friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The views are awesome! I really enjoy sitting on the lanai and looking out over the water at the spectacular sunsets or early morning relaxing with my first cup of hot tea while I watch the waves! Or walking on the beach right in front of the hotel! They have just about everything either there at the hotel or close by. They have a large gift shop/convenience store and right across the street is the Times Grocery Store (it used to be the Star Market) Great restaurant - try their Loco Moco for breakfast! There is even a fitness center and a game room for the kids! The rooms are very large and have all the comforts of home. Try the massage! It was soooo relaxing after a long day! And we were able to catch their hula show by the pool! I would definitely recommend this place to all my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great value! Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: KMillerNewYork
Reviews.Content: Very attractive lobby and grounds. Right on the beach. Had a restaurant with outdoor bar, salon, stores, florist and great concierge. Must attend the talk on the first morning, given with complimentary continental breakfast, with home baked goods, which tells you what you want to see on the island. We had a 1 bedroom, with a lanai with an ocean view, that was very spacious for my husband and me. Walk to supermarket and eateries. Very close to golf courses, Whaler's Village, Front Street shopping, and beautiful Kapalua. Will recommend and would go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: VTH0kiegirl
Reviews.Content: After reviewing numerous hotels in Maui and searching for the best value, I chose this hotel and was extremely pleased. Everything seemed very new, clean and it was in a great location close to Lahaina. Right on the beach, 2 nice pools and beautiful grounds. We arrived early and were able to check in before noon and they even gave us a late check out on the day of our departure. I wasn't able to find this before I went, but parking was $9/day. I was just traveling with my spouse, but there were lots of families there which seemed to be having a great time as well. Overall, great experience and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Amewsme
Reviews.Content: Our party of three stayed at Kaanapali Shores for 11 nights (Oct 26 - Nov 6). This was our third visit to the KS and all expectation were met or exceeded. This year we stayed in unit 458 and 454 and both loft units were gorgeous. We had three bedrooms, two bathrooms and gourmet kitchen. We had booked a two bedroom ocean view and as my mother is vision impaired, I called ahead to speak with Tiffany, the reservations mgr, to book a ground floor unit or a unit close to an elevator. Unfortunately, all units were booked. My second choice was a loft unit and Tiffany came through with flying colours! Thank you Tiffany for your kindess and extra care - so much appreciated. The complex is very well kept, the gardens are exceptional and all staff are kind and willing to assist. Our first unit was 458 and on our second day the appliances (all top of the line) began to fail. We knew these situations can happen and pointed no blame to the management. Each time we called the front desk a maintenance person was sent immediately to assist (within 10 minutes). After the third incident, I visited the front desk and another unit was immediately offered. Within 30 minutes we moved to unit 454, another loft. We were very happy and pointed no blame for the appliances failiing - it could have been us as they were pretty fancy. I have to say that the complex has not changed much over the past years and the management is working very hard to upgrade. There are units still in need of renos, therefore I would suggest calling ahead and requesting an updated unit. If I were to offer any suggestions, I would say the hallways, especially near the sundries store, gym and Beachside Casuals require new carpet. Unfortunately, they are old and worn-out and give the impression the entire complex is out-of-date. The beach is wonderful and there was always a lounge available. There are points of entry where there is coral, however, the entry point between the KS and the Beach Club is sandy and great for kids and seniors as waves tend to break around this point. It was beyond me why other patrons gathered around the rough entries. Perhaps they just needed to explore a bit? The KS offers the best bang for your buck - a casual atmosphere, beach front property, hotel service with condo living and a staff who go the extra mile if you require assistance. Thank you Kim, Tiffany and the other gals at the front end - we will be back again next year and I hope to see you there! Mahalo from Karen, Theresa and Carmen from Vancouver, BC

Reviews.Title: “What a Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Palapalai
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an oceanfront high 3 star or 4 star hotel/condo with a refrigerator and a coffee pot, not much to ask. The Kaanapali Shores seemed to fit the bill and was just next to the real resort area of Kaanapali. The condo was right out of the 80s, only those 80's laminate cabinets were chipped and the laminate was pulling off in places. The corners of the walls were beat up after years of use... but not from vacuuming! We were there twice when the room was serviced, a 5 or 10 minute visit at most - no vacuuming the bedroom or living area, no wet mopping the tile floor, and often no washcloths were left. I needed to washcloths to wash my feet after walking around inside! The black enamel paint was worn off of the previously white soap dish, which was in the middle of a dark brown tile over a white tub. There was carpeting in the hallway of the shop area that was so worn you couldn't make out the original pattern. The poolside chairs were mold stained. Need I go on.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gilbert251
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean condo. Excellent view of ocean. New hd tv was installed while we were there. Washer/dryer in unit was a pleasant surprise. Very freindly staff. Very nice beach. Restaurant had good food and great service. Grounds are very well maintained and pleasant to walk around. Expedia.com has onsite people to help set up tours. They were very helpful and gave us excellent advice. Set up great tours for us with very good rates. Best of all free wireless internet . Would stay there again if I return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: sactosally
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores in September 2009. It's located just north of the main strip of hotels on Kaanapali beach. We booked a package deal (air, room, car) for a studio with kitchen. The room was huge (room 430)! In fact, I asked the bell man if it was a studio or 1 bedroom. He confirmed our room assignment was correct. It had a full bedroom (queen bed), closet, living room, dining table, 2 flat screen tvs, balcony, washer and dryer in the unit and a full kitchen. Wireless internet was free. There is a charge for parking. The garage was right near our room, so it was convenient for us. The kitchen was modern with granite counters, smooth top stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher, full sized fridge, toaster and coffee maker. Dinnerware, silverware, cooking utensils, pots, pans, glasses are all included. In fact, there was coffee, dishwashing soap, paper towels and laundry soap in the unit, too. It was so handy to have the washer/dryer. All of this made our eight day stay very comfortable. As for maid service, they service the towels, garbage, make beds and do a general cleaning every day. Bed linens are changed every 3rd day, I think. Toiletries were replenished daily. The pool area is small, but clean. The hotel is right on the beach, so that's the best place to be anyway. We ate at the hotel restaurant twice and the food was fine. They have a few shops on the property (real estate office, sundries store, clothing store, coffee/breakfast kiosk). Take advantage of the free coupon book they give you when you arrive. There is also a magazine in the room that has several coupons. We got a bunch of free with purchase items, including two beach towels, two T-shirts, earrings, a discount on a boogie board purchase and food discounts in the local area. Speaking of food, there is a 24 hour grocery store across the street. Their prices are less than Safeway (we made a few comparisons). Next time, we'll bring a few staples from home like peanut butter, canned items, cereal, pasta and rice. Prices are pretty steep. Another option is to stop by Costco as you leave the airport to stock up on the basics. Overall, this is a very comfortable place to stay for a reasonable price. It's not just a condo where you don't really have the amenities of a hotel. It's not so huge that you feel dwarfed in resortville. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “On The Beach”
Reviews.Author: Zandhdad
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms, wonderful views. Right on the beach with sea turtles just off shore. Able to walk on beach for long distance both ways. Reef right there so safe for kids to swim. Bring aqua socks or buy there as reef is hard on the feet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!!”
Reviews.Author: andip2575
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 2 month old and enjoyed our trip very much. The condos provided everything we needed for our 10 night stay. The grounds were very pretty and we were told there was great snorkeling just off our beach. The beach was not as nice as some of the other local areas but still a nice walk in the morning. If you are wanting to see more of the tourist attractions it is a further drive to get to the well known places(Road to Hana, Crator, and the Sunrise Mountain) but for a nice realxing time at the beach and pool this condo is perfect! I thought is was very clean, maid service everyday with fresh towels, and a grocery store right across the street. Only complaint is paying for daily parking $9 per day. I think they should include it in your stay or not charge for it. Everyone needs a car at the condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ablazze
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Kaanapali Shores Oct 13-26/09 ,We really had a great time and we would like to thank the all the staff for making it pleasureable ,The Hotel was very clean and the grounds were very well kept ,We would Highly recommend to anyone to visit ,Once again Thanks Pete Sheila Christian Stephanie Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bikerboy808
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend business trip to Maui and stayed at your great hotel. I stayed in a beautifully appointed and spacious one bedroom unit that provided me with everything I needed. Every staff I came into contact with greeted me with a friendly smile and Aloha. Each evening when I returned from my meetings and dinner, I would enjoy strolling around your beautifully landscaped grounds and along the beach. My only complaint is that I didn't have more time to spend at your hotel to enjoy your great facilities. Mahalo for a great stay and keep up the great work! I look forward to my next stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “This is the true meaning of aloha”
Reviews.Author: Aceman1234
Reviews.Content: It looked like they were running energy efficient light bulbs in the rooms, the staff was very friendly, the parking was easy, the grounds were beautiful! And free WiFi was available and Fast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would still be there today, if we could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this condo. I've stayed in a half dozen or more condos on Maui and other Hawaiian Islands, and the Aston Kaanapali Shores is by far my favorite. For an online booking rate of around $155/night, we were upgraded to a 2-bedroom penthouse condo. Wow! So much room, a beautifully renovated apartment-style suite that was tastefully decorated and supremely comfortable. Modern kitchen and washer/dryer, too. The outdoor pool was comfortably heated and the front desk staff were cheerfully efficient. The only complaint I have is the expensive overnight parking, but apart from that, it was perfect. A piece of advice to those considering staying here: the beach here in Honokowai is not great, but Kapalua's gorgeous golden strands are just a short drive northbound.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at the Ka'anapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: McBoots
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ka'anapali Shores from Oct. 2-Oct. 9. We had a standard 1-bedroom condo (#628) that I booked on Orbitz. I didn't upgrade to an ocean/garden view as we didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the condo (which we didn't). Condo - I had called to reserve an updated room which I was told was not guranteed. We were pleasantly surprised to find that we got an updated room. The kitchen had new cabinets, and there were granite countertops in both the kitchen and bathroom. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated. Also, it had a W/D which was very useful (you have to buy your own laundry deter.). Beach was OK, but was scattered with leaves at times. Not a huge deal, but there are nicer beaches close by. We didn't use the fitness center as they charge $10/day - a rip-off. FYI - they charge for parking everyday which we were told is common. Buy groceries in Kahului, as the Star Market is outrageous! We had a $100 food voucher for the hotel restaurant. It's good, but not great. Recommendations - We ate at Kimos (great), The Rusty Harpoon (great), Aloha Mixed Plate (great), Cheeseburger in Paradise (tourist trap - skip it). Go to Front Street in Lahaina. Great little shops & restaurants right by the water. Definitely drive the Road to Hana. Start early and pack lots of snacks and water. Don't forget the bug spray and wear a swimsuit if you want to swim next to a waterfall. Go to the North end of the island to swim in the Olivine pools and see the Blowhole.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: Starkerama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores for 6 nights. The lobby is lovely as are the grounds and pools. And it's very nice having a restaurant/bar on-site as well. When we checked in, we were given room 235 which had badly stained carpets, was very in need of updating/repair and had bugs crawling on the kitchen counter and bathroom floor. Needless to say, we asked for another room. The staff was very accommodating but we couldn't have another room until the next day so we ate out and spent as little time in the room as possible. Our next room (750) was much better. Clean, no bugs and an updated bathroom as well as ocean view. The kitchen was a little shy of utensils/pots and pans required. The hotel staff was always very friendly whether at the front desk, bell desk or restaurant and the grounds were very nice. I just do think the hotel should have put customers in the room we first had. Outdated I have no problem with, but bugs are absolutely unacceptable. I think we would try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: ladybug96
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently returned from a lovely time in Maui. We spent "ONLY" 6 nights at the Aston Ka'anapali Shores. Not enough time to see and do everything. My 1st visit. Check in was smooth, our room on the 7th floor had a nice view of the ocean and gardens. We had a clean condo kitchen room with all the comforts needed for our stay. There were two nice pools to choose from altho the lounge chairs could use some cleaning or replacing as they look tired. The one restaurant was good and we tried it for breakfast and lunch, with excellent service. It was not at all crowded during the week we were there-the end of Sept, first week of Oct. Several stores on site, the staff seemed bored!!! We took advantage of a coupon in our packet for a 2for1 Luau and went to the Sheraton Luau...awesome!!! We also had a $100 coupon towards our hotel food and drink. No timeshare visit required altho it was there if you wanted, but no one bothered us.. Didn't like the daily parking charge due at end of stay.The resort was centrally located and not too far from Lahaina where we drove to each evening for dinner. We were there to relax and unwind and it was what we did. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Meanstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May for week long honeymoon. Very large room/suite with living room, full kitchen and bedroom. Staff was accomodating moved us from the 2nd floor to the fifth floor. (pretty garden area at the back of hotel, however, it is extremely noisy at night due to the birds that roost there!) Walkway on the beach to Whaler's village/black rock made a nice daily stoll. Would not reccommend hotel restaurant for anything more than breakfast. Aside from walks along the beach path, a car is a necessity to enjoy Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: carolinagurl82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our honeymoon at the Aston Kaanapali Shores in Maui. We had an amazing experience and can not wait to go back next summer. The hotel was very conveniently located to grocery stores, shopping, etc. The view from our hotel room was amazing. The service was great, and the hotel was gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Beautiful and relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: diltzc
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for a wedding. The hotel was just goreous. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge staff were very knowlegeable and a great help in recommending and planing activities. The hotel had 2 pools and 2 hot tubes to chose from. There was also a huge grass area that several families took advantage of to allow the younger children a place to run and play. We stayed in the 1 bedroom garden view suite. The hotel was graious enough to let us use a roll away so my youngest daughter slept out on the balcony every night under the stars. We had a waterfall right outside our balcony so she slept to the sound of water every night - very relaxing. The hotel provided lounge chairs on the beach for the guests to use. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise for Extended Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mrachcb
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than my extended family and was upgraded to an Ocean View room on the 8th floor. The service was excellent and the view was spectacular. The room was perfect for my family of 4. We had a 1 bedroom condo with a kitchen and pullout couch. My kids enjoyed sleeping on the pull-out couch and building forts with the pillows. The kitchen was a little out dated, but functioned well. I liked the Free High Speed Internet, although it was slower certain times of the day. The grounds were nicely maintained. It's in a nice location. It was minutes drive to Whaler's Village (going south) and minutes drive from Honolua Bay(going North) to watch some of the pro women surfers. The beach was not the best one, but still good for swimming, surfing and kiteboarding. The kids really enjoyed the pool. We did not use the fitness center, but we did buy pool stuff at the little shop. When my family arrived, they were able to put some of our rooms together, but not all, which I was a bit disappointed in, but it was no worries. We all were able to have a great time together by the pool and hot tub areas. The best thing about this hotel is the value for the money. It provided what I thought was the most for the money paid. I am looking forward to coming back in November 2009.

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL PARADISE, A TRIP NOT TO BE MISSED.”
Reviews.Author: jshe
Reviews.Content: This trip was all we could ask for and more. We read several reviews before booking and decided overall reviews were good. The beach is just amazing. Gold sand, the water is beautiful, beaches are clean. The hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are much nicer than expected. We got the studio, was very nice and spacious. A rental car is a must. We got married at makena cove, beautiful area. The sights are all great. The helicopter ride is great, a little pricey but worth it, sunset dinner cruise was a bust we thought it wld be nice and romantic, not at all. They put you with other couples and terrible music. Going north is great, huge cliffs with lots of lookout points over the ocean. I've been many places and Maui is the most beautiful place Ive ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Paradise Tainted”
Reviews.Author: jlkslk85
Reviews.Content: There are so many wonderful things to share about Maui, but first I need to share a bad experience in hopes of savings those reading this review some anger and frustration. We spent 8 glorious days in Maui earlier this month. Upon arrival, we decided to book some shore excursions through what we believed to be the hotel. The kiosk location is in the lobby of the hotel. There were four of us traveling together and between us, we purchased approximately $1,000 in activities. We were told by the concierge that we could save $100 per couple by attending a 90 MINUTE timeshare presentation at the hotel next door. We were reluctant at first, but decided that it was worth 90 minutes of our time to save $200. The name of the timeshare company is Diamond Resorts International. Upon arrival, we told our salesperson that we had no interest in buying a timeshare unit as we have children in college. After suffering through the disorganized presentation by the salesperson, the 20 minute movie, and a guided tour of 2 rooms, we again told the salesperson that we were not interested. She would not take no for an answer. She brought her manager over and we were treated very rudely by him. We had fulfilled our end of the bargain. We had already wasted 2 Â½ hours on this presentation which we were told would only take 1 Â½ hours. Holds had been placed on our debit and credit cards for the $100 should we not attend. After two days, the holds fell off. A full week after returning from the trip, the $100 was placed back on the debit card with no explanation. Phone calls to the resort were immediately forwarded to â€œExpediaâ€� â€“ who we then discovered ran the kiosk located in the lobby. The female manager, Lillia, was rude, unprofessional and disrespectful and she only returned calls after she was called approximately 5 times. When she reluctantly admitted that we had in fact attended the presentation and should not be charged the $100 fee, she agreed to refund the charge. Quite to the contrary, she charged it AGAIN, and now the account had been debited by $200. Although she denied ever having made the second charge, bank records clearly indicate that a second charge was made and it was confirmed by the bank. Wire fraud, plain and simple. Unauthorized debits to a guestâ€™s checking account. Itâ€™s a sickening feeling to think that someone thousands of miles away can remove money from your checking account with no permission to do so. The only way to see that no future unauthorized charges were made from the account was to cancel the card and have a new card issued. Phone calls to the manager of the Aston Kaâ€™anapali Shores, Mark, were never returned, although Iâ€™m 100% certain that a response from the hotel will follow this review â€“ an empty, unsympathetic apology at best, if even that. We spent a lot of money on this vacation and a good portion of that money went to the Aston for our accommodations. We expected more from them and they should stand behind their guests, even if their vacation has ended and they have gone home. We will be back to Maui next year, although we will not stay at this hotel because of this experience. Maui is paradise. Should you wish to take a helicopter tour of the island, we would recommend Blue Hawaiian. Nothing compares to the breathtaking scenery you will observe while flying over this beautiful island. The Road to Hana is a must. Allow plenty of time and stop frequently to take in the gorgeous waterfalls and stunning scenery. Lahaina is a very fun town, full of unique gift stores and restaurants. Bubba Gumpâ€™s is a delicious and affordable â€“ and ask for â€œBenâ€� to be your waiter â€“ he is top notch. Should you wish to snorkel or just want to go for a boat ride, we would recommend the Maui Magic. The crew is wonderful and will see to it that you have an amazing trip and show you plenty of interesting things while on your tour. We did a luau at the Royal Lahaina and were disappointed. We heard other guests commenting on how much they enjoyed the Old Lahaina and the Hyatt luaus and we will definitely see one of those next year. If you have not purchased the book Maui Revealed, do so soon. It contains unbiased articles, photographs, maps and tips for your stay. Maui is truly heaven on earth. Do not waste one minute of it sitting through a time share presentation, especially one with Diamond Resorts International. Spend your time in paradise relaxing and taking in all that Maui has to offer and stay somewhere other than the Aston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday spot- come on, it's Maui!”
Reviews.Author: mlmackay
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week at Kaanapali Shores. We rented a condo from a private owner, and therefore didn't have access to the resort paid/payable facilities such as scuba lessons etc. However this didn't detract from the overall experience. What a fantastic place to take your family. Our one bedroom condo was on the second floor, just near the pool. The lanai was spacious, and the doors opened wide onto it, allowing the outdoors in. Size wise, the lounge/dining room area was spacious, kitchen functional with great appliances and the bathroom roomy. Shower fantastic!. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable, and storage facilities ample. The grounds are immaculate, very neat and beautifully landscaped. Plenty of room to run around on the lawns, or park your sunlounge under a swaying palm for some shade. The pools are great, the main pool is great for all ages, with ample shallow end and a good deep end for floating with a mai-tai during happy hour. The garden pool is quite and child friendly with a secluded hot tub near by. Had dinner at the resort, as well as several light breakfasts. The keiki (children's) menu is adequate, however some veggies would be appreciated! (Fries not included...) The beach has been commented on in other posts about the rocks. If you have young children (under 12), the beach in front of the resort is fine. Even at low tide, there was at least 20 feet to swim or snorkel in. As other people have commented, go for a short stroll up the beach and you will find a clear space to go out further. Views of the adjourning islands are spectacular, shade available and sunsets have to be seen to be believed! The facilities surrounding the resort are great. The Star Market will supply everything you need (but is a bit pricey), there is an ABC store 2 minute walk away towards Napali, and the fish supplier is worth trying. Also Snorkel Bobs are over the road, and very helpful & friendly to rent gear from. The new shops in Lahania opposite Cannery Mall have a great farmers market store. Overall, highly recommended, cannot wait to come back again. Yes there are small things which annoy, such as parking charge, but the garage is safe & well lit, close to elevators & hallways, and as said in the title, you are in MAUI !

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay -- More Than Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ceeshel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the week of August 23, 2009. Our unit was quiet, clean, comfortable -- more than adquate for our needs. Kitchen was stocked with cookware, dinnerware, etc. We bought a few grocery items from the Safeway store down the road and cooked our own breakfasts and lunches (although we later discovered a small store just across the street). Staff was very helpful. Whenever I called for extra towels, etc., they were delivered right away. Property has a nice open area near the registration desk that looks out to the quaint waterfall. This was my favorite place to sit and relax. Can also watch the flat screen TV there. Enjoyed the free Wednesday hula show at the ocean pool. Property is on the beach so it was nice for a romantic evening stroll. Also, we put a couple of lounge chairs on the sand and enjoyed the ocean sounds at night. Our unit was on the seventh floor and had a partial ocean view. We enjoyed our daily lunches out on the balcony. A couple of minor items: cookware was NOT of the non-stick variety; and had to let the shower run for several minutes before the water was hot enough. Moderately priced -- thought it was a good value. All in all, a good place to stay. I plan on bringing my mother and daughter here in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel crummy room”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Hawaii and this hotel was nice but the room was crummy. This was a condo. The room needed updating. Old microwave and the range was in need of repair. They did have a washer and dryer which we used. Bedroom was small and the headboard of our bed was on the wall where the elevator shaft was. You could hear the elevator going up and down. Luckily we were tired of touring the island it didnâ€™t take long to fall asleep. The room was also very dark not enough lighting. We went through Costco and I am sure if we paid full price for the room we would have gotten a much nicer room. The room was clean that was itâ€™s good points. Our room also over looked a large trash dumpster. I left a note under the ownerâ€™s personal closet door and told them they need to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “The place exceeded our expectations and we'll definitely stay there on our next visit.”
Reviews.Author: walden08
Reviews.Content: We found great hotel accommodations, grounds, beach area, pools, and staff at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. We just spent 3 nights and 4 days at this hotel with another couple for our vacation and all of us had a wonderful time. Everything exceeded our expectations. The staff were friendly and the services first class from the moment we arrived until we left. We'd definitely go back to this place on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice beach, rooms improving”
Reviews.Author: tinymogul
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Kaanapali Shores. It's clear that since Aston took over they're putting money into the property. The grounds are nice and well maintained. The beach is decent, but narrow and not as expansive as the beach a mile or so to the south. That said, there's some great snorkeling right off shore (we saw a lot of fish and a couple Green Sea Turtles up close and personal). We loved that fact that all rooms have complete kitchens, this made our stay much more reasonable since we didn't have to eat out at every meal. We had the unique opportunity to experience both the Studios and 2 Bedroom Suites. Both are comfortable and roomy. They are slowly making over the property so be sure to ask for a renovated room. The studio my wife and I shared was 'pre renovation' and while the kitchen was functional the cabinets and appliances were date and in need of an upgrade. The two bedroom was very roomy and comfortable. We had the upgraded kitchen and it was a much nicer experience. Overall, the quality of the units are what you might expect in a standard apartment complex, not top of the line but functional and practical. The two bedroom is roomy enough for a family to stay comfortably. We shared with another couple and they pushed the twin beds together to make a queen...not the greatest solution but it worked. Free Wireless Internet was a nice plus. Some of the amenities, like the Wedding Gazebo and Spa are functional but not luxurious. Good alternatives if that's what your budget can afford. My biggest beef was that they charged us for parking...I understand that they need to charge for parking otherwise non-guests might take advantage of their lot but when you're already charging me over $140 per night, do you really need to hit me up for another $9 to park my rental car? I was not pleased to see that on my bill when we checked out. T

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Suite is uncomprimizing and unparalled”
Reviews.Author: erniemit
Reviews.Content: You will never long for more if you pick this establishment on Maui. The rooms and the views can not be beat anywhere. We upgraded to the Aloha suite after checking into a two bedroom suite, and it was well worth it. We've never been in a better suite anywhere...ever. The on-site restaurant is convenient and excellent, but you will also want to venture out, and the greatest restaurants on the island are in Whalers Village mall and in downtown Lahaina nearby. The best snorkeling and scuba is only a backstroke away from the beach at this property...I saw turtles, clorful fish, coral, lobsters, and much more without having to charter a boat or get on a bus. My wife loved the spa, and the whole family learned to scuba for free in the pool where they generously gave a class every morning to the guests that sign up. The Mai-Tais are happy hour priced every afternoon at the bar between the pools and the staff make you feel at home. I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds...get an updated room”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2009 and found the hotel to be okay. Some of the rooms are upgraded ..some are not. They seemed to be having trouble with the fridges in some of the rooms as they were freezing everything in sight. Our kitchen was literally falling apart, Keep your food bills from Costo etc and the staff will credit your account. I wish that the rooms had been more evenly upgraded, rather than the lobby being so grand. In the end we paid extra for an upgraded room, and noticed that other couples seemed to be doing the same at the front desk as well. Do not go to the time share presentation at the Kaanapali Beach club... high pressure sales and not worth saving a few dollars on any excursions you may plan. Good luck on getting an upgraded room. Busy in BC

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, but not great, resort in a decent location.”
Reviews.Author: SkyLordHeuksa
Reviews.Content: That wasn't a very glowing title, but I think it captures the essence of this place rather well. Given the alternatives in Kaanapali, the price we paid was very much in line with our experience. Let me start with the good stuff. First, the hotel staff (front desk and housekeeping) were very nice and very accomodating. If we needed something they were all over it. The room was adequate. Since we were outdoors most of the time, all we needed was a place to sleep, eat breakfast and do our laundry. In that sense it was very good. However, I definitely would not buy a time share here. The construction seemed cheap and the walls were thin. When housekeeping rolled a cart down the hallway our shelves shook! We weren't planning to live there, though, so that wasn't a show-stopper. We had an ocean view, which was great. A lot of reviewers complain about the birds but that didn't bother us a bit. They're noisy when they roost in the evening, but only for about an hour. Not a big deal. We loved the $100 credit for hotel services. The pools were nice and the hotel is across the street from a market, which was very convenient. On the not so great side, the grounds need upkeep. We noticed missing tiles in the hot tub, missing grout around the pools, etc. Also, the beach in front isn't the best. If you walk up the shoreline it gets a lot better. Again, not a big deal unless you have small children and don't want to hike with them. One thing to watch out for is the "orientation" they offer on your first full day. They push hard for you to show up for the continental breakfast and free drawing. This is basically a pitch for different island activities. We purchased a few and later learned that we could have purchased essentially the same packages for much less in Lahina. So, you might check out Lahina first to compare deals. There is also a timeshare pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Kannapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: travel0723
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to West Maui. Once again, we rented directly from an owner. The complex is basically shaped like a horseshoe. I was originally set on an ocean front view, but ended up with a good deal on a 1br condo which is at the farthest point from the shore in the U of the horseshoe, #933. KS has a very nice landscaped courtyard with two pools, numerous trees, and even a mini walk-through tropical path. There is a waterfall and 'stream' in this sculptured landscape which provides a constant sound of running water directly under the lanai. In the morning and evening the mynah birds create quite a commotion in the trees just over the waterfall. There is also a wedding gazebo within these trees. btw, some rooms' view might be compromised by these same trees. If view is important to you, ask for 7th floor or higher.We were on the ninth floor which gave us a great view over the courtyard and out to the ocean and the sunsets. The walk to the pool and beach through this courtyard was quite pleasant. The lobby is open and is nicely decorated. The advantage, in my opinion, of dealing directly with the owner is that you know exactly what room you are getting rather than spinning the wheel to see what Aston will give you.. After reviewing some listings and pictures, I called the owners. After talking with the owner, I could tell which owners I would want to rent from.
