By the way, with the down economy, you may find that individual owners are much more flexible with their pricing. The resort management companies, like Aston, will probably not be. In addition, they pose as owners on vrbo.com but it's easy to spot their listings because they have no specifics or personal feel. The unit itself was up to date and everything worked well. The kitchen was well equipped with any utensils you would need for cooking a meal. We had a problem with the a/c but this was resolved by the building management fairly quickly. The main queen bed was an extra, extra-firm, the sofa sleeper a little on the soft side. For those of us with older eyes, I found the bedroom lighting ( two low-wattage lamps ) to be insufficient. At the KS, don't expect great wireless internet which is useful for looking up places to go etc. You had to be in a certain place in the room to get good reception but even then it would just drop mysteriously and then come back. For one dinner, we visited the KS restaurant. We found the prices about normal for a hotel in Maui. I had a fresh Mahi-mahi dinner for about $25. There were lots of families at the KS. The pool area was active during the day and so was the beach. They also have a seperate shallow pool for the little ones. There are two hottubs, one at the main pool, the other in a semi-secluded area. Many guests used the restaurant for lunch and dinner. During the day, you can make orders poolside. The restaurant faces the pool area. There is a $9/day parking fee. In general, I despise add-on fees such as these, but the $9 isn't bad when compared to $20 'resort fees' charged elsewhere. Because we rented directly from the owner, there were no other fees. There is a garage which is open to all guests which is a plus during rain or if you want the car cool when you get ready to go somewhere. We were initially concerned about the arrival of Tropical Storm Felicia so we went to Haleakala on our first full day and were pleasantly surprised by a clear mountaintop and an unusually warm 61. But by the time we left it was clouding up. Best time to go is in the early morning ( or sunrise if you're really determined ). Take water, jackets and a full tank of gas. When Felicia finally meandered into town, all we really got was an afternoon of heavy drizzle. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at KS. Based on the number of families I saw with kids of all ages, I would say this is a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this immensely”
Reviews.Author: Karen981
Reviews.Content: We arrived after booking several condos for a 50th wedding anniversary celebration. I had asked for updated rooms near each other. We were greeted by very friendly helpful staff and assigned room sll together on the same floor. One of our condos was not updated but the rest were very nice. THe grandchildren really enjoyed their time on the beach and in the pools. Everything about the hotel was very clean and well kept. We had a stool not flushing properly one moring and maintenance staff was there very quickly and fixed it. This condo was in a good location for many of our activities on the island. We were just very pleased with the accomodations and would highly recommend it to friends in fact already have.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: sotrabhouston
Reviews.Content: We took our family on vacation to Maui - our 7 year old, 17, 19 year old children and 22 year old family friend. We rented a 2 bedroom condo - and it was absolutely wonderful! We had a king master suite with large bathroom, a large bedroom with 2 twin beds and the living area with a sofa-sleeper, plus another bathroom with shower. TV in the living area AND in the master bedroom. There was a breakfast bar, dining table and complete kitchen - coffee pot, blender, all utensils for eating and cooking, pots, pans, flat surface cook top oven, microwave, huge fridge with ice/water in door. And the biggest plus was the washer and dryer unit right in the condo! The hotel lobby is beautiful and the shops are very reasonable - not like most resort areas where they know they have you there and rip you off! Pools were very nice - we didn't use them, as the ocean was right there and our 7 year old loved being able to walk to the sand in less than 3 minutes from our room. Concierge (Dave & Pili) were very helpful with booking things for us and telling us what time to leave to be there on time, where to get surf boards for the 2 older boys (Wayno was great), etc. Restaurant had a nice offering, served breakfast, lunch and dinner. Poolside rental was nice for snorkeling gear/boogie boards. Towels were readily available, as were beach chairs. Landscaping was beautiful. Everyone agreed it was one of, if not, the best vacations we have taken. We'll be back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, beautiful premises, great staff”
Reviews.Author: From_ND
Reviews.Content: The seven of us stayed in a 2-bedroom (#727) and 1-bedroom (#731) ocean-view condos. The rooms were way better than we expected. The view was breath-taking with the mountain to the east and the ocean to the west. The kids snorkeled right outside the motel. The restaurant was very good. The rooms were clean and well-kept. Everything was included in the kitchen from silverware to dish detergent and dish rag. The appliances (including dishwasher) were modern. The concierge service was wonderful on the premises. There is a 45 minute informational session every morning. This is NOT a time-share session. This is a must to take in if you want to find out all there is. You won't find out everything over the internet. There is a botanical garden on the premises. Make sure to take in the Maui Eco-Adventures Rainforest/Waterfall Hike. Eat at Kimos, Kobes and Cool Cat Cafe in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Very Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: rwinters1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aston for 1 week and found it very kid friendly. My kids lived in the pool and in the ocean and had a great time. Two little boys can be pretty energetic, but there wasn't one time during our stay where anyone said a thing. The attitude seemed to be 'let the kids have a good time', The hotel is fine,but not fancy, but with a family it's good the thing. The only downside was we left some things in our room and the hotel has been incapable of mailing them to us. I called several times to housekeeping, each time a new person answers, they say they've got our things, but nothing happens. Bottom line, great place to have a good time, but you're on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: db46
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here three times, all in 2 bedroom units. We keep coming back. This trip was the best thus far. We were in a 4th floor, partial-ocean view unit that had 2 bedrooms PLUS a third loft bedroom with spiral stairs leading up (see pics). All counter tops/table tops/chest tops etc. were granite. Tile floors (except in the bedrooms) were beautiful. Stainless steel appliances were a nice touch. The pool bar is the best in the islands! Happy hour from 3-5:30 serves the best Mai Tai's on Maui; poolside, ocean side, breeze always blowing, what could be better?? Beware the "free" internet access though. Performance is slow, if existent at all. Their i'net pipe adequately supports 50-60 connections, at most (I had to call customer support). They do have 'pay' terminals and 'pay' printing ($0.20/min or $0.35/page) but I did not experience these for performance. Since they have hundreds of units, this gets to be a problem at times (like after dinner.) I will stay here again though. On-site restaurant is very good and reasonable, but other options are just across the street (one with free live entertainment) as well as a grocery store. A Farmers Market is just 2 blocks down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: IslandHoppers69
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a great place to stay for the price. We weren't expecting much going out but were surprised by the quality of the grounds and room when we arrived. The kitchen was recently remodeled and the room fit our needs nicely. We didn't have much of a view in the room we stayed in, but we really weren't there much. When we were there, we weren't concerned about the view ;). Our door opened up directly to the parking garage, which we enjoyed for quick pitstops back at the room to change. The hotel is very close to Lahaina and is in a very beautiful part of the island. There are wonderful beaches and snorkeling all around the hotel. I saw some complain of the rocky beach, but we thought it was great. The sand on the beach is fine, very smooth and soft. Once you get in the ocean, the coral starts immediately, so not great for swimming around. I really enjoyed it myself, being able to snorkel right in front of your hotel. There were some really cool fish out there and huge eels, haha. If you want to swim, walk about a football field north. When we go back to Maui, we will be staying here again. We did see some of the old kitchen equipment out back, so do make sure you request a remodeled room, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting; good value”
Reviews.Author: pactrip09
Reviews.Content: We had a ground floor suite for 4 days, and it was very nice and fit us perfectly. The washer/dryer were small, but greatly appreciated since we were 1 week into a 3 week trip. The nearby grocery (Star Markets) is very convenient, and provided our breakfast and lunch foods, including local mangos, papayas, pineapple, etc. (if only Frito-Lay would distribute the amazingly tasty Maui Onion Potato Chips, and Meadow Gold would sell POG - passion/orange/guava - juice, in the midwest!!). The beach is quite nice, and while the snorkeling in front of the hotel is not great, there is some decent coral a little to the south (although getting in and out can be dicey with any surf at all). The hotel location worked very well for us. This was the nicest hotel we stayed in during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Incrediable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emmieruth02
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absoultely beautiful both inside and out. Busses were easily accessible to go to town. The rooms were amazing and fully stocked with whatever you needed. Good stores- including grocery- across the street. The pools were clean and the grounds were beyond beautiful. The staff were very friendly and helpful in answering any question. Overall, it was an amazing hotel and we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest, but worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: AdrianP33
Reviews.Content: For the price this place is a good deal. The space in the rooms are great, and having a kitchen is nice. Of course the furniture and room itself is a little outdated or rundown. But the balcony is a pretty decent view from most rooms, and the restaurant was nice to enjoy a drink or a bite to eat. The beach seemed like a good location but was a bit rocky here and there. We found better hotels with way better beach fronts for not too much more. I'd say this is a good place for people with kids, a good way to say money, but if you're just a couple you might wanna stay some place nicer. Nice grounds, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, all the rooms are suites”
Reviews.Author: JMK19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali shores on our honeymoon. We loved having the kitchen and balcony with views of the ocean. The pools were nice and what we expected. The only negatives would be the beach isn't the nicest and it always seemed noisy in the hallway near the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!! A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: KookieMan
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Kaanapali Shores property. The room was very nice, comfortable and very clean. The grounds were extremely beautiful and well kept. We especially enjoyed relaxing by your garden view pool. They even had a hula pool-side show!! We had one very minor issue with the sofa bed on our first night. Mark, who had checked us in when we first arrived, was sensitive and courteous when we had called the front desk to report the problem. He immediately had us moved to another room and were pleasantly surprised to find that he upgraded us to an ocean view room for the inconvenience! He went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable. He even recommended a great place to eat earlier in the day!! The staff was very friendly and helpful and always had smiles on their faces. I will definitely stay at this resort again and will highly recommend it to anyone who plans to visit Maui. This resort is a well kept secret...you never get the feeling that it's over crowded like the higher priced hotels down the street (we visited those during lunch one day and found that we kept bumping into folks due to the crowds). This one is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “It was absolutely fabulous and we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Secretgardenr
Reviews.Content: The condo was very spacious and we had everything we needed!! I would plan my week better down to the very last detail. Breakfast at Charleys was good in Hana. I would get a earlier start on the Hana highway. I enjoyed the plush Hana rainforest and would have taken more time for hiking there. The whale watching cruise and cocktail cruise were worth every penny. I loved Lahaina and the Luau at the Hyatt Regency was great. You just couldn't sample all the food it was so plentiful. Loved Maui and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Realistic Travelers”
Reviews.Author: 9-0-nylon
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good value. Very accommodating staff. Great place for families. Room was clean and housekeeping staff very helpful. Oceanfront location. 24-hour grocery store across the street. Garage parking included in room rates. Agent on site for scheduling most island activities at discounted rates. Washer/dryer in room in suites. Cons: Birds in courtyard will make you half crazy starting at 4:30 am unless your doors/windows are closed, a/c is running and exhaust fans on to drown them in white noise. You will be nickeled and dimed for virtually everything (even the room safe at $2.50/night and shade at the pool). Fitness center is also an added expense, but this doesnâ€™t seem to be much of an issue for most of the intended market, at least judging by the average gut size and relative lack of activity of most guests at the time of our visit! Restaurant food quality does not justify the high prices. Very small beach in front of hotel. No onsite coffee available until 6:30 am. INSIDER TIP #1: Book directly with the hotel by phone and negotiate to get the lowest rate instead of using online agents. We booked through Expedia and were sold an Oceanfront 2 bedroom suite, which has the largest floor plan n the complex. However, when we arrived, we learned that all of these 2000 square foot units were out of service for renovations, thus ending up with our family of seven in an oceanview room that realistically could only accommodate 4 comfortably. No upgrades were offered by the staff, saying that nothing else was available at the time. The management told us that Expedia booked the largest room available at the time of booking, a subtlety we would not have known when we booked. INSIDER TIP #2: Book the resort dive course. The divemaster, Mike, was amazing, friendly and masterful. The dive was fabulous, right off the beach with seat turtles, small sharks and lots of fish. Worth every cent, even if you never dive again. And this is coming from an advanced certified diver with > 25 years of diving experience who took the course to get his 13 year old son a first look at scuba. INSIDER TIP #3: As first-time Hawaii visitors, we were drawn in part by the purported friendliness of the native islanders. Reality check: it doesnâ€™t exist. Whether it is due to cultural issues or to long term exposure to mainland tourists, we were almost uniformly treated by islanders with faint hostility and at times overt hatred, even towards our young children. As native southwesterners, we are used to easy friendliness, accommodation and genuine good manners in our home state. These no longer exist in Hawaii, as far as we can tell. So, the Aloha stuff is just a business pitch to get you on the island. Itâ€™s not a reason not to go to Hawaii, but donâ€™t expect a hula-eyed native to place a lei around your neck when you step off the plane. Instead she may just try to strangle you. Do expect a plump, surly, mean eyed airport traffic-lady to tell you that she doesnâ€™t care what your question is, just get your rental vehicle â€œoff-propertyâ€� now! And do expect many service people to do the same, from parking lot attendants, to store clerks to security guards. Makes you wonder if your are in New York City! It's the same attitude towards mainland Americans that I've encountered in many Caribbean nations and in many nations in south Asia as well as Europe. Sad, given that Hawaii is one of the 'United States'. ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: yOrOOmaha
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a seven day trip to Maui where we stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. We arrived to a very nice renovated condo on the 2nd floor w/ a full remodeled kitchen, pull-out couch, washer/dryer, and 1 bed 1 bath with a view of the garden. Its really not worth the extra money for an ocean view because the grounds and gardens are absolutely gorgeous and the resort is right on the beach. The maids do come every day and clean the rooms. The staff at this resort is very aloha-friendly and will help you with any problem that arises. The pools at the the hotel are nice, but can be a bit crowded during the afternoons. The beach in front of the hotel is a bit rocky but if you travel down south on the beach in front of the pink hotel there is some great swim and snorkeling spots. Remember that Hawaii is very expensive and the restaurant at this hotel is no exception. We recommend that you shop at the Star Market or one of the many ABC Stores and try to eat in your condo for breakfast and lunch and go out to eat for dinner. We also reccomend to go into Lahaina for lunch and dinner on Front Street, there are many great restaurants like BJ's, Bubba Gumps, and Hard Rock Cafe. Also, go to the orientation breakfast the hotel holds on your first morning, they help you plan out your week at a discounted price thanks to Expedia local experts. There is also a very helpful Expedia Local Expert by the main pool who also offers discounts and great advice on what to do in Maui. Its true that Kaanapali Shores is no Ritz-Carlton but fun activities are right next to the hotel and, at least for our purpose in this vacation, you only spend time in your room to sleep and eat. Definately recommend for the budget family/traveler. Here are some travel trips if you do visit Maui: 1) Snorkel. We recommend the Pacific Whale Foundations snorkel tour to Molokini Crater and Turtle Arches. The water is amazingly clear even 50 ft down. 2) Go on a helicopter ride. If you can afford it, definately take the time to see the beauty of Maui and Moloka'i from the air. Unforgettable views. 3) Rent a car. Everything is 1000 times easier and more accessible if you rent a car. We had a nice convertable (recommend) 4) Do a luau. They are a great experience and a must when visiting Hawaii. They all offer a great show and dinner. Make sure to book at least 48 hours in advance though! (Three months in advance if you plan on going to Old Lahaina.) 5) Go on a Sunset Dinner/Cocktail Cruise. We went on this the last night in Maui and really takes away from the "I have to leave tomorrow" depression. Very romantic for all the couples and honeymooners out there. I hope this information was helpful for everybody going to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place for Us.”
Reviews.Author: scubavacations
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here twice(2002 and 2004). On a recent trip(2008) I decided to book another resort further north. Big mistake. Three days into our trip I knew it. I missed the beautiful views of the garden, the friendly and polite staff, the restraunt, the sundry shop and the beach right out my door. I know when I return this October to Maui there is only one place I want to stay...Ka'anapali Shores. I would never stay anywhere else. I also like the proximity to Lahaina where we Scuba. I just can not say enough about the experiences we have had here.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good food, decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Local808
Reviews.Content: We checked-in at 7:30pm on July 3rd, and the front desk staff were very polite & helpful. Our first room on the south side of the resort looked like it badly needed upgrading, and had a broken sofabed which was needed because my in-laws had tagged along for the trip. When I called the front desk, they immediately moved us to another 1-bedroom room on the North side of the resort, where the rooms were newly refurbished, with new appliances, cabinets, clean washer/dryer, internet, Ironing Board/Iron, Hair Dryer, safe, etc. This room was fantastic, and quite large. The beach was ok, but had a pretty good undertow that was a bit much for young children, but then again, the majority of the beaches in the Kaanapali/Lahaina area are very rocky, and there are very few sandy beaches (this being one of them). The food & service at the hotel's restaurant were both well above average, which was a pleasant suprise. The food was fresh, and served within 10 minutes of ordering. I had to carry my tired 3-year old so my wife could eat, so our waitress was kind enough to put a heat shield over my plate to keep my food warm, and placed the au-jus for my prime rib in an insulated cup, all without my knowing or asking. Great service, and great food. The housekeeping staff was also very attentive and helpful. I called the front desk to ask for 4 more sets of towels, and it was delivered to our room within 15 minutes. I called again the next morning to swap out our towels, and again they were delivered in less than 15 minutes. Again, great service. Regarding the other complaints people have had: -the $9/day parking: You are advised of this cost up-front on their website and when you check-in. All the other hotels charge more for their daily parking, so what's the problem? - Cost fo the food: This is MAUI - everything is expensive. If you want to prepare your own meals, there is a Star Market across the street and a Safeway Market down the road. There are also tons of small eateries in Kaanapali & Lahaina. -Condition of the rooms: I would agree that the rooms on the south side of the hotel are very dated, and the walkways are very dark at night. If you can, ask for a room on the North side of the hotel, which are all newly refurbished. The difference is night and day. -View from the room: What can I say? It's either going to be mountain/parking, garden or Ocean view. You get what you pay for. -Traffic: This is Kaanapali. One way in, and one way out, through the most visited areas on Maui. Unless you want to drive North through 250 winding turns through Kahakuloa, which I wouldn't suggest. -Bed comfort level: The bed in the bedroom was very comfortable. The Sofa bed wasn't very comfy, but the point here is that it's meant to be a sofa, and not a perfect bed. Put the sofabed mattress on the floor for better support. Other Comments: The 2 pools are clean, uncrowded, and great. We didn't have any trouble finding open loungers. The bell desk attendants were very helpful, and went out of their way to assist us. Highly recommend this resort to everyone, especially families with young children. Large, well-manicured garden/lawn area next to one of the pools where kids can run around and not get into trouble. The resort lacks room service, but you can order take-out from the resort restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Photos not real”
Reviews.Author: Complaints
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the photos of the tour were not what we saw. The first room was very nice, just too much stuff and the loft was unusual. The room we stayed in was DIRTY and the carpet had to be cleaned while we were there. The furniture was old. The grounds were beautiful, most of the people were great. The crib was not there when we arrived. We were told "They were waiting for us to arrive to make sure we wanted it." I would not recommend it on the cleanliness and decor of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent resort, horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Bwinn
Reviews.Content: After traveling fourteen hours with a six month old to Maui we arrived at 4:30pm Maui time to the resort, stood in line for twenty minutes to check in, and were then told our room wasn't ready despite the fact that the check in time is 3pm. They apologized and gave us three free drink coupons. After waiting about another thirty minutes with several other groups of people whose rooms were not ready either, we were allowed to check in and our room was upgraded from garden to ocean view due to the delay and from a one bedroom to a two bedroom. Room was slightly dated, but decent and clean. We called down three times for crib which the front desk said was on its way up, but it never came. The next day the staff never brought fresh towels, so I went and found a maid in the service area. When I asked her for three towels to replace the ones we had used, she said "no" and indicated the maximum number of new towels per room was two- even though there were three of us in the room. Check out envolved another twenty minute wait. The hotel is simply too large for just two people to man the front desk. There was a line most of the time I passed the desk. The $9 per day extra parking fee is automatically added to your bill which I didn't like either. The grounds are very nice. The beach is medium. The pools are good. The restaurant food is ok, the drinks were very good. They have a modest business center that had a per minute charge. There was free internet in the rooms. Minor complaint was very basic cable on tv with no guide. Location is decent. You can walk to a grocery store accross the street with a few other modest shops and places to eat. The gyro at the pizza place across the street is amazing. If the staff had been more focused on service, I would have suggested staying at the resort. As it is, I wouldn't return there again.

Reviews.Title: “a slice of heaven.....”
Reviews.Author: guinnesssdad
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived, we knew we were home.....we were on the 8th floor, ocean view....waking up each morning to the view was breathtaking....our condo was georgous, new kitchen and bath.....staff was so friendly, attending to all of our needs...we are looking forward to coming back in november...thank you kaanapali shores for a wonderful vacation....carole marcaletti / todd mccarthy burlingame, california

Reviews.Title: “Loved Kaanapali Shores!!”
Reviews.Author: Goldie95
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sister and had a great time soaking up the sun by the pool. The condo was great and so was the food. Did some snorkeling, but mostly just relaxed. Thanks to the staff for taking good care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean rooms!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joyness
Reviews.Content: We booked a return visit to this hotel because we had stayed on our honeymoon and were pleased with our visit. Upon arriving, we noticed that our room just "felt" dirty. After further inspection, we realized that we would have to sweep up all of the pubic hairs off of the floor in the bathroom. My husband just about puked. When we tried to explain to the front desk, they offered to move us into a different room, but with a lot of luggage and a baby this was not an option. Housekeeping was also offered, but a mere cleaning from them, would not have done the job. The place needed to have a carpet shampoo, thorough dusting, even the kitchen had stains ALL over the walls/ceiling from food?? I kept my flip-flops on the entire time! Also, the beds were very uncomfortable. I think that some of the rooms have been updated, but not 350!! On a positive note, it is inexpensive and has a nice beach.

Reviews.Title: “Take the Spruce!”
Reviews.Author: vickiesque
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a garden-view room--which I am sure was lovelier than a view of the parking lot. The one-bedroom condo was very comfortable. The equipped kitchen was a boon. The location on a beach with good snorkeling was ideal. My only gripe is the hotel offered little help when the road was closed one night due to fire and we were stuck with no where to spend the night, They could have made arrangements with other hotels but they did not.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation with family”
Reviews.Author: Mikefromcanton
Reviews.Content: This was our 19th trip & stay at the Aston Kaanapali Shores in Maui. We've stayed at 2 - 5 star Hotels in the past, one in Wailea. We choose to stay at the Aston because it's a great place to vacation with your family. It's a condo so you have all the amenities of a home. It is competitively priced and offers great value with the amenities, location near Lahaina & shopping, and on Kaanapali Beach. The Aston people are great from the reservation desk, to check in, the lounge, restaurant, and management team. They remember our names and treat us like family. It offers 2 pools (one for children), a nice beach, great snorkeling in front of the hotel, great view of the sunset, and good food in the restaurant. It has several activity desks so that any site seeing, cruises etc can be arranged without having to go off property. Free scuba lessons are offered daily. My son-in-law and daughter went out on a dive with the instructor, Mike, and came back with some incredible pictures. Our room was beautiful and well maintained. It had granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, a great view of the grounds and ocean, and plenty of room for our family. One final point, although I think this is a great place to vacation with your children, my wife and I stay there when we travel without our children and grandchildren....it's all of the above, but most important the great / friendly people that make up Aston team...Annie, Diane, Lloyd, Kassy, Mark, Liz, Nora, Jing, Mark & Scott just to name a few

Reviews.Title: “Quality depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: Louise_1980
Reviews.Content: Our last four nights at the Aston Kaanapali Shores were fabulous. We had an unbelievable view of the ocean. Our room was tastefully decorated and very bright. The beds were very comfortable. We could not be happier. However, the first night was horrible. It started at the front desk where they kept on trying to sell us an oceanfront room for only $120 extra per night. We said we were not interested. The person at the front desk then showed me on the resort map where the room I had booked would be. I told this person immediately that that room could not possibly be ocean view. It was far away from the ocean, on too low a floor, and did not even face the ocean. I was told that if you can see the ocean from the balcony, it was ocean view. Once again they tried to sell me the oceanfront room, showing me the difference on the map. I was skeptical, but we went up to our room anyway. It was dark, dreary, and dingy. It was updated, but it looked like they had just put a ton of ugly granite in a thirty year old room. The carpet was stained. The second bedroom had windows in it like a basement where no light came in. Yes you could see the ocean. You literally had to go to the edge of the balcony and see a flash of blue through two palm trees. It did not match what the Kaanapali Shores showed on its web site as an example of an ocean view room. I travel a lot and have been to Hawaii several times. I do tons of research on the Internet before I book a room. I have always been happy with where I have stayed. We usually splurge on ocean view rooms because we like to sit out on the balcony and watch the waves, so we know exactly what to expect. To Kaanapali Shores' credit, I called the front desk and said that we were not happy with the room. They said they could move us, but not until the next night. The beds were terrible. One of my boys slept on the floor. The other slept on the couch. The resort was nice enough to move us to a great room the next day, but not until 3:00 p.m. This room was higher up, not ocean front, but with a beautiful view. The beds were great. This room had exactly the same furniture as the first. I think the view, new carpeting, nice beds, and a sunnier location made it seem like a million dollar room. So, I cannot recommend the Kaanapali Shores if you do not know where you are going to be located. Obviously it depends on who owns the unit and the care they put into this unit. I would have left this hotel the first night if I was stuck with the first room. There are many other beautiful places to stay on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very good relaxed-atmosphere family hotel with great beach”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousMom63
Reviews.Content: Our party of 20 had 4 hotel rooms which were supposed to be in close proximity with garden views; however we ended up spaced wildly apart with only one having a nice view at all. Otherwise, we were very happy and this place fit our lifestyle well - casual and comfortable, easy, so close to a very kid-friendly beach, fun pools... We visited some other hotels that seemed much more busy/chaotic and we were all in agreement we liked ours best. Just triple check that they give you the room you ask for. Grocery store right across the street. We had rooms with kitchens & laundry machines. All worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: BobCArizona
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the stay here. It had all the features of the bigger hotels (ocean view, nice beach, maid service, on-site restaurant) but with the added benefit of a full kitchen. Although we did eat a couple of times at the restaurant and a couple of times off property, we were able to save a lot of money by preparing our own meals in our room. The staff was very attentive and the property was spotless. We took the recommendations of the staff for the couple of times we ate off-site & their suggestions were great. We have the same server in the on-site restaurant and their service was 5 star. I will definately return for a longer stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: cnaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores for 7 days at the end of May in a two bed/two bath condo. We had a group of 7, including 2 kids (ages 7 & 10). We stayed in room 453 which was on the top floor of our block and it had a loft. Although too hot to sleep up there of a night, the kids utilised it during the day. It became â€œtheir areaâ€� and we were quite happy as they could leave it messy and it wouldnâ€™t impact on everyone else. The condo was great. It was handy having our own kitchen and the washer/dryer was really useful. The view from the balcony was of the gorgeous grounds, garden pool and the ocean. The Star Market and pizza place across the road from the resort were useful conveniences to have nearby. The resortâ€™s grounds were immaculate and we enjoyed having the choice of two pools and the beach. The snorkelling was great, particularly out near the buoys. However you didn't have to go out that far to see the fish. We took snorkelling equipment from home (Australia) however you can pick it up over there for around the same price. We recommend reef shoes as well, to avoid cutting your feet on the coral. There are pool/beach towels supplied at the pool which is really handy. The staff at the resort were great. We had a small issue with plumbing and, after ringing for help, it was fixed within 30 minutes. The restaurant at the resort was good â€“ although we did find it a bit expensive for dinner. It was great having Lahaina close by as it has a really good choice of restaurants. We hired a car for the week and were really glad that we did. This allowed us the convenience of touring the island at our own pace. Parking at the resort was $9 per day. A lot of people talk about the road to Hana. Personally, we wouldnâ€™t rave about it. But we would agree that you should allocate a full day to do this. We would highly recommend the drive up to see the Haleakala National Park. Take a sweater though â€“ it was freezing!!! We would highly recommend the Kaanapali Shores and look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “View to die for!”
Reviews.Author: pegwag
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the oceanfront unit on 5th floor. It was newly remodeled with beautiful decor and HUGE! The wrap around lanai was the perfect spot to read and listen to the ocean right below, also watch the polynesian show by the pool below. The grounds were beautiful and we also loved the restaurant right on the property. Kaanapali Shores is very conveniently located with grocery story right across the street. We highly recomment using their concierge. They steered us to a different luau than we had planned and saved us money. The ocean front pool was a bit crowded, and the beach area wasn't very wide, but we still loved every minute of being there. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Always Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: CAROttawa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at KS numerous times, including the last three years in a row. It is so conveniently located, truly some of the most beautiful grounds in all of Maui, and well laid out and clean suites. It feels like a luxury resort with suites, without the cost! The beach is very sandy, large with incredible sunsets. I recommend this resort to all vacationing in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Kleeart
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio for 5 nights on our honeymoon and it was the best value. When I first walked in I was pleasantly surprised at the decor of the lobby and the friendliness of the hotel staff. Since it was our honeymoon we got upgraded to a nicer room and treated with Champagne. The champagne wasn't the greatest (can't expect that much) but we made some yummy mimosas. On our first night we enjoyed a free hula show by the pool. Our stay was perfect because we had a lot of activities planned in Maui and it was easy to get in and out, compared to staying at a huge resort. The location was perfect. We would drive to nearby Lahaina to get some groceries. It was also convenient to dine at their Beach Club Restaurant after a long day. Their crab cakes are delicious! I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the great accommodations and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: kilakilahawaii
Reviews.Content: From the general manager to the reservation office to the front desk our thanks to all. Our stay at the Aston Kaanapali Shores was most appreciated because of assistance from the entire hotel staff. Reservation assistance, spacious room accommodations, locality to the tournament golf course and accommodating requests like a rice cooker for us local folks made being the coach of our high school golf team a very fun filled rewarding event. Having to return a second week in a row to accommodate yet a second team to the championships was made less stressful because Aston Kaanapali Shores was able to put into storage bulky items which I would have had to repack and bring on my second return trip the following week. Being allowed a late check out provided our athletes time to shower and change into more comfortable clothing to make our return home trip more pleasant. As we say in Hawaii, Mahalo Nui Loa (Thank you, very much)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, grounds and value!”
Reviews.Author: screen_name_two
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 nights here and I was impressed with the lush grounds and the room we stayed in. I thought the location was great since we could walk to the Star Market and Maui Dive Shop, and of course the beach! In short I thought this was a great hotel/resort at a great price. We went to the breakfast put on by Pleasant Holidays at a different location our first morning there and I had mixed feelings about that. There were some good deals and some giveaways, but I did not think their prices were all that great. I guess if you plan to book a lot of activities it might be worth your time. They had a pineapple package where they said they worked out a deal with the airlines where you do not have to pay the $15 to check the box in. It ends up that deal is good no matter where you buy the pineapples from, so I thought Pleasant was a little (purposely) misleading with this statement. I would suggest you find some time for breakfast at Gazebos in Napili if you enjoy a good breakfast. We shared the Big Kahuna and the Banana mac full-stack -- what a great combo!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, relaxing atmosphere, and priced right.”
Reviews.Author: Seathyme
Reviews.Content: A great alternative to the huge resort atmosphere. Beautiful ocean views within easy access of most Maui attractions. Do a lot or do little. The condos are clean and nicley decorated. Concierge services are available. After being at a convention at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu, this was a welcomed change. Would recommend Kaanapale Shores to couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mamaof5blessings
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated our 15th anniversary with a stay in Maui, HI at the Aston Kaanapali Shores Resort. I do not normally write reviews but I felt compelled to after such an amazing stay at this resort. Our vacation truly was wonderful from start to finish. The staff was extremely welcoming and accomodating, our 1 bedroom condo with full kitchen and W/D was recently remodeled and beautiful, the grounds of the hotel are stunning, and the restaurant food and wait staff were superb. The ladscaping of the grounds is beautiful with a true garden feel We felt pampered and relaxed, it was everything we had anticipated! We intend to come back in a few years with our 5 children. We highly recomment the Aston Kaanapali Shores Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: GeoladyAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Studio with a partial ocean view. The unit had a nice garden view in addition to a glimpse of the ocean. Parking was convenient and the beach was nice, a little rocky, but you could avoid those spots. My adult daughter & I had massages by the sea and the onsite Expedia people were also convenient. Maui is expensive, so this place was a good value ($151 plus $9/nite parking). The only problem was the unpredictable maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo - Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: Treeworshipper
Reviews.Content: This is our family's second trip here. The first time we came, we stayed 11 days (2005) and 17 days this year. We have stayed both times in Unit 259 which is rented through an offsite rental company. We are guaranteed to have *the* room we saw on the internet that way! Anyway, this unit is totally new inside with beautiful furnishings and a killer view! We had extended family come visit us for a total of 5 people in the 2 bed 2 bath unit on this trip. It was great - everyone had plenty of room. We visited a different beach everyday! Then we would come back and relax in one of the pools for an amazing sunset! A really good natural foods market is cleverly disguised as "The Farmer's Market" just right up the road. It is a full service market with deli for Veg & GF or other allergen folks. We also shopped at the Organic/Natural foods stores in Paia and Kahului (when coming from the Airport, good place to stop). The store in Paia was the most accommodating for the GF, and I even found GF Banana Bread there! We love Kaanapali Shores and will continue to frequent it whenever we can afford to return. Staff is very polite - John was super, and it was good to see him still there 4 years later!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Golf, restaurants, supermarket. Perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: superb0wls
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing, tv in every room. Restaurants, market, golf courses were very close. Great place to stay, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: jfm1042
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at Kaanapali Shores. We had 5 people in a two bedroom ocean view condo. Room was clean and had everything we needed. Staff was the friendliest I have seen. Beach was ok for swimming and snorkeling was excellent. Also snorkeled black rock and that too was excellent. Grocery store across the street was good and there is an ABC store just up the street. There is a lot to do on Kaanapali Beach. Parasailing was good, but kind of boring. We took surf lessons from Royal Hawaiian Surf academy and they were excellent. I would highly recommend them. Kimos is an excellent restaurant for both lunch and dinner. We also ate at Moose Mcgillycuddy's and found the service was good as was the food. I was dissappointed in cheeseburger in paradise in Lahanina. They had poor service and the food was not that great. We did an 8 hour charter fishing trip with Aerial Sport fishing. They are located in the Lahaina Harbor. We had an excellent trip and caught a lot of Ono and Mahi Mahi. Also went to the Old Lahaina Luau. I would go if you can. It was a great experience. A little pricey but it does include a great meal and all the drinks you can drink...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient condo for staying put but gets windy in February”
Reviews.Author: DIYTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the condo through Hawaiian Air package. I paid extra for a oceanview unit. I got a free upgrade to a 2-room unit on arrival. However, the unit was on the building as the main entrance. It was probably 200 yard away from the beach. There were a garden, two swmming pools and a restaurant between our building and the beach. Eventhough we were on the sixth floor, we could only see some ocean from the lanai. I learned that the "Oceanside" units are the ones with the real view. Like other reviews pointed out, there were a lot of birds in the garden in early and late hours. You need to keep the window shut if you don't want to be awaken with the bird noises. Everything was clean and in proper working order inside the condo. Having two bedrooms, two bathrooms and washer/dryer turned out be really convenient. The kids swimming pool is reasonable big. However, it did get cold in late afternoon when the sun was blocked by surrounding buildings. It was very windy in the Kaanapali area late afternoon during our stay. It was too cold for us to swim in the pool or the beach after 5 pm. The beach was very nice. The sand was soft and not too crowded. The width of the beach is a bit narrow especially in high tide. For swimming and snorkeling, you have to walk 50 yard south to find the opening in the rock/reef. Snorkeling was good especially for beginner. What we like most was the surrounding area. It was pretty laid back compared to Kihei. We could get good value foods and groceries within walking distance. There is a good pizza/sub place, a large groceries store and a snorkel gear rental shop just across the street. 5 minutes walk north, you can get fresh poke from the fish market, good fusion chinese/hawaiian/western takeout and fresh produce from the farmer market. Line was short at all those places. If you want to stay put to relax, avoid the busy Kihei and don't need to eat fancy restaurants, this might be a good place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying there”
Reviews.Author: rus5898
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 people, including one infant and toddler, stayed at this resort for 10 nights. Overall we've had a very good experience with this place and would stay there again. Pros: 1. Convenient location. It is located on a west shore beach within a walking distance to a convenience store. This was very handy as we had to buy food and supplies for our small children almost everyday. 2. Recently renovated rooms are very nice. Of course there is a chance that you may not get one when you check in. 3. Great view even from garden view rooms. We did not expect much from our garden view room, but upon arrival we were surprized to find out that the view was great and we could easily see the ocean from our rooms and from the balcony. 4. Clean and nicely landscaped hotel grounds that include 2 pools, hot tubs, small ponds, grass lawns, etc. 5. An excellent snorkelling place called "Kahekili Beach Park" is relatively close. It is about 20 minutes walk or a 5 minutes drive from the resort. 6. There is a free wireless internet access. Cons: 1. The parking fee is $9 per day and there is a fee of $2.50 per day for using the in-room safe. 2. Hotel does a regular room treatment against cockroaches. We did not see any cockroaches before the treatment, but we saw a few small ones after the room treatment. 3. The public access printer in the lobby did not work when I had to print out the boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: 67firebird
Reviews.Content: From the welcoming lobby, plush grounds, spacious, comfortable rooms, and gorgeous ocean views, this hotel has it all! The room we had was beautifully decorated with newer appointments, full kitchen with cookware, washer/dryer in room, and romantic walk-out balcony to view the spectacular ocean sunsets. If you want to eat in, sit on the balcony and drink your coffee, or just lounge in one of the 2 pools or hot tubs, it's here. The beach was sandy and just on the other side of the hotel grounds. The on-site Expedia staff was more than happy to book you on a Maui adventure to snorkel, helicopter ride, eat at a luau or ride a zip line. The hotel staff was accommodating and took care of everything from cleaning the room to delivering a complimentary bottle of wine for our anniversary. The hotel restaurant served up decent food and was nice for eating dinner and watching the sunset. The two outdoor pools were warm, clean and popular - very kid-friendly. Guests we met were generally friendly and helpful when discussing what adventures they found fun and which ones weren't. Probably the only complaint I had was that the in-room TV's were a little small (< 25 inch) and not flat screen/LCD. Heartily recommend this hotel for individuals and/or families.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as Waikoloa Colony Villas”
Reviews.Author: jandra10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores from May 11th till May 16th. Coming from the Waikoloa Colony Villas, our rooms were very disappointing in comparison. The resort it self is gorgeous and the staff also was great, it was just our rooms that were not up to par. We had to 2 - 2 bed/2 bath condos. They were on the 2nd floor. The condo I stayed in was very old. The kitchen needs a complete renovation. The stove had to be from at least the 80's as well as the cabinets. Our bathrooms looked even more dated and worn out. To top it off we saw several roaches, so we had to call the front desk and have the room fumigated. The other condo where the rest of my family stayed at had pretty much the same outdated look, but no roaches but we did come back one day from being out and my father's bed was on the floor. We called housekeeping and within 10 mins a maintance man was there to fix it. The bedframe had broken so he immediatley went and brought back another one. Also the bathroom door in the masterbed kept falling of the hinges, so that had to be fixed as well. In general, i would recommend this resort. As I said the resort and the staff were a true delight. i would just be weary of the conditions of the room, I would suggest that Aston require that all the condos be at the same level of appearance and maintance.

Reviews.Title: “OK for price, but service and rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: maui-goldisgood
Reviews.Content: The Pros- Resort is close to star market and other services...Pizza Paradisio that is just across the street is really tasty. The larger pool next to the ocean/ restaurant is warmer than the kiddy pool. The garden is very nice if you want to hear birds chirping and not feel the sun beating on you. House keeping is very friendly. The pool next door to the Kaanapali Shores is really awesome and huge...it even has a slide that my two year old went down solo that lands into a kiddy pool. BBQ grills by the Tennis courts are a plus The Cons- 9.00 a day parking is a burn. Drinks are too expensive and watered down. Beach in front of hotel is rocky. Some rooms are in need of upgrade and repair. Kids eat for free policy is a joke. Overall, our stay at this resort was not pleasant There is a no smoking policy on the resort grounds...which is good, but the only people you see smoking are some of the employees who do it in the parking structure our crouched behind parked cars out in front of the Hotel. A plastic (two foot by two foot) bathroom tile from the ceiling feel and hit my two year old in the face causing a slight laceration. Another tile fell and hit my wife while in the shower...no damage to her. We asked for a different room but was given the response of "we only have rooms that you will have to pay extra for left"...which I doubted because tourism is way down in Maui and is evident at this resort by the few numbers pf people. Kids eat for free between 11:30 AM and 4:30 PM but here is the catch, you have to eat inside the restaurant, that is connected to the pool, and with a paying adult. The kids meal is not free if you get it delivered outside at the pool like everyone else does between the hours of 1130 and 430 pm when pool activity is greatest. You cant get the kids meal for free if you want to take it back to the room. So, I thought maybe we would sit down and get our meal delivered to the table, pay, ask for to-go boxes and then go outside to the pool to eat...no dice. Server said she would charge us the kids meal. I argued that if we eat here then take some to go but walk out a different door towards the lobby she would not charge us for the kids meal? she then said yes she would not charge us. This policy is insulting as a guest who intended to to take advantage of the kids eat for free program. I think the resorts intention was to make this program as inconvienent as possible so you would not dine at the restaurant and therefore not allow kids to get a free meal. The Air Conditioning did not work properly for our first two nights at the resort. I sweated it out the first night but on the second day I asked for it to be serviced. By the time we got back from a night of local shopping, we returned to the room it still had not been serviced. I continued to wait until the third day and finally they came and fixed the A/C. We prepaid our trip through orbitz for a stay of 18 nights at this resort. We come to Maui every 6 Months for 2-3 weeks per stay and based on our experience at this resort, I would have reservations about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo experience, great location, walking distance to wonderful beaches!”
Reviews.Author: travelalotCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on a very last minute trip. We were very happy with our stay. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are very spacious, and its in a very good location. There is a grocery store across the street with some other cafe stores and a dive shop. The hotel also has a decent restaurant with typical prices for Hawaii. On average $20/plate., I don't recommend their omelettes for breakfast but everything else I had was good. Also, I would make sure your room is not a parking lot room. We were lucky and got upgraded to a garden room but I saw the parking lot view rooms and they are not as nice. The beach is okay but if you want less waves, calmer water, and less rocks, then you can just walk about 15 minutes down the shore and you have a some really nice beaches. Overall the hotel is really nice and a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “What a long strange trip it's been.”
Reviews.Author: thescottishgurl
Reviews.Content: Not happy that you can't smoke anywhere but the beach or public sidewalks not on the property. They also make you sign a non-smoking agreement, and if you smoke on the property you have to pay a 425 dollar fine. They also don't tell you about the 241 dollar charge they hold on your credit card which won't be credited back for 14 days for "possible" room usages. We also had to be moved to a different room due to cockroaches in the room. The staff was friendly and the rooms looked nice, though. Beach access was great and location to activities was good. Their luau was unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaneohe96744
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ka'anapali Shores for the Boys Hawaii State Golf Champioinship and the rooms were great, very roomy and well equipped. Staff was excellent and always accommodating. All requests were met with no problems. Very good location and easy access to the golf course and food shopping.

Reviews.Title: “So sad to leave paradise”
Reviews.Author: sdfishgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit us perfectly. We loved the gardens and our lanai overlooking the gardens and the ocean. There was a palm tree almost touching our lanai and the birds would perch on the fronds begging for food. My husband is a bird guy, so he loved that. We rented room 643 from Kaanapali Beach Properties. The condo owner was kind enough to stock the room with great beach chairs, boogie boards, Hawaiian music and a Maui Revealed travel book (the book is a must for Maui visitors). The beach was a bit small, but we liked snorkeling a different beach everyday so it didn't matter. We also liked the convience of the Star Market across the street and the farmers market nearby. By the way, the Annabelle and Warren Magic show was a hoot. We laughed for two hours straight. We would recommend this hotel to all. There were a lot of families here, so I assume it's very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay very much”
Reviews.Author: tvitvi
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. Our main reason we stayed in Maui was to play golf, and so it was very useful for us that the hotel was located within a few minutes from everything. I enjoyed having a kitchen in the room; it made our trip easier.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Kaanapali Shores on Maui no ka oi”
Reviews.Author: 808golfer
Reviews.Content: Ranks up there with Regency in Chiang Mai. We have been inspired to remodel our condo after staying 3 nights in a fabulous luxurious 2 bedroom condo at Aston.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay with beautiful ocean view from Room 704”
Reviews.Author: LAanna13
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed for a 4 day weekend at the Kaanapali Shores. We asked for an upgraded ocean view room and that is exactly what we got with room 704. For the 3 of us, the 2 bedroom condo was perfect. We had 2 bathrooms to share which is a must with 3 women. The kitchen was upgraded with granite counters and we stopped at Costco on the way to stock up on the basics. The living room was perfect to hang out and lounge in and the washer and dryer was a plus. There are 2 pools at the complex. I preferred the garden pool as it was less crowded and more quiet, although most of the babies and young children come to this pool. The proximity of the market and shops across the street was super convenient. We discovered the bus to Whaler's village our last night which is also an affordable way to get around. You can also get a bus from Whaler's Village to Lahaina - they stop running at 8:45 p.m. so if you stay out later you'll have to cab back. I would definitely recommend staying here if you are looking for a mellow, no frills stay. The rooms are spacious and amenities are conveniently close. A lot of families with children stay here so if you are not wanting that scene you will probably not like it here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: rainbow1004
Reviews.Content: The stay at the Kaanapali Shores made our family vacation made more speical than we planned! Since we had a 6 month old baby, we wanted to make sure that our stay, especially with baby, is comfortable. The room was generously spacious and clean. Because room has kitchen and all the utensil we needed, it was so much easier to prepare the baby food.This was the main reason we didn't want to go to a hotel, but decided to stay at a condo. Also, the housekeeping staff was very friendly and their timely response to our request impressed us. Their service level was 5 star hotel level! Although the weather was too cold for us to go into the water, because of the ocean front location, we could enjoy the ocean view and beautiful Maui. Overall it was a perfact stay for adults and babies.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: lcbPortland_or
Reviews.Content: i had a person i work with recommond kaanapali shores hotel and i stayed a week on spring break with my wife and daughter and her boy friend in a 2 bdrm 2 bath. i felt like i was at a 4star hotel in Paradise. the staff and facilities were excellent and i can't wait to go back again. of course Maui was fantastic also. strongly suggest the Merriman Restaurant in Kapalua

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation but small beach and limited night life!”
Reviews.Author: Dee011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to Hawaii. We stayed in a 1 bed condo. We had booked a basic 1 bed but were upgraded to an ocean view condo and were given a lovely bottle of champagne to congratulate us on our marriage. The condo was very big, every need covered in the kitchen however we were a little disappointed by the size of the beach. On the website the beach looks about twice the width if not bigger - personally I think it was a camera trick to make it look bigger! Also the restaurant and bar in the complex closes at 9.30pm. There is nothing else for night time within walking distance i.e. restaurants or bars. The Whalers Village is a 10 minute bus ride away and this has a few restaurants and bars and there are other hotels close by to the Whalers Village where you could perhaps have a bite to eat or a drink, however most bars close at 10.30pm. The bus is only once every hour but it is always on time and has you to The Whalers Village in 10 minutes but it finished up early so you have to get a taxi back. Alternatively you can drive somewhere but we both wanted to relax with a drink so we found the Aston Kaanapali Shores a bit isolating for night time. We would recommend it to families as opposed to singles or honeymooners who want a bit of a night life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay with our kids”
Reviews.Author: trilinearmipmap
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed previously at the Kaanapali Shores in December 2007 and at that time a only gave it three out of five because there were issues with the room maintenance and appliances. This time we stayed in a two bedroom oceanview room for 10 days in Aprill 2009. The room had been renovated, all of the appliances, fittings, TV's, plumbing, etc. were in good working order. We cooked all the meals for us and 4 kids and the kitchen was quite practical and usable for a long stay with a family. The beach was nice. What we hadn't realized with our last stay was if you head to the beach and go left 50 yards you will hit a nice sandy coral-free area that is great for swimming. We snorkeled right off the beach and were in the pools every day. We had quite a good view over the pool beach and ocean. Several times while on the beach in front of the hotel we saw Humpback whales spouting and breaching. The only downside was the towels were not well stocked at the pools. The kiddie pool never had any towels stocked. The adult pool was often out of towels. We had to trek to the front desk to get towels for the pool. Other than that everything was great. Overall this is a very nice place for a family with small kids to stay. We will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This is paradise”
Reviews.Author: Maggiepie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days (after five days in Waikiki). Room was basically a condo setup. Living/Dining room combo. Full kitchen with dishes, pots, pans, utensil etc. Grocery store across the street. View from 7th floor "garden view" was great. We could watch the whales from there. Beach was small but enjoyable. Only a ten minute drive into Lahina which is a great little town for eating and shopping. Be sure to eat at the Aloha Plate behind the Cannery Mall - a very short drive. Took Pacific Whale watch tour too. A truly relaxing place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay if you're more about exploring the island and spending money on adventure, not accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: 2007honeymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during our honeymoon in Oct. 2007. We selected this place (still ResortQuest at the time) with the help of our travel agent. We were looking for somewhere clean, friendly, moderately priced, and on the beach. We got everything we asked for! Majority of our time was spent exploring the island. Perfect for us! The staff was great from what I remember- very helpful with questions about booking a luau, parking costs, etc. We had heard honeymooners could ask for a room upgrade and if available, it would be provided. Upgrade wasn't available when we first checked in, so we enjoyed our garden view for a few days, and had a good laugh at the vocal-ness of the birds... yes, they are pretty loud with the lanai door open, toward afternoon, but it really didn't bother us. Mid-week, we were able to upgrade to a partial ocean view room-- which meant we were looking at the ocean, the pool, the clubhouse, and the garden. We liked it, as we were that much closer to the ocean and the pool. We met some terrific people of ALL ages during happy hour by the pool, and the happy hour itself was fun- different specials everyday. The grounds had two pools and some nice little walking paths. And, the beach is right there, and it was beautiful and not too crowded. Our travel itinerary was pretty varied- sunset cocktail cruise, snorkeling (both guided tour and hopping in the water randomly), surfing, luau, beach lounging, Road to Hana (yes, it's a full day. Leave early, pack a cooler), some shopping (had a blast at the local markets, didn't really go to the boutiques), and some great restaurants (thank you tripadvisor restaurant forums!). All in all, you get what you pay for. We wanted to spend our money ON the island, not on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Windy location, but Perfect Accomodations for Five of Us”
Reviews.Author: DestinyNewMexico
Reviews.Content: We needed a two bedroom to accomodate my husband, 6 yr old and I and mother-in-law and adult son. We researched various hotels/condos in Maui, we kept coming up with Kaanapali Shores. We only stayed two nights. This property allows two night stays, most other condo-style accomodations required three or more night. We would have had to book two separate rooms if we stayed in most of the hotels on the beaches. This would have added up to much more than this condo. It was very clean, it served its purpose. We had plenty of room. Our son did complain that the twin bed in the second bedroom was very uncomfortable; however, the king bed in the Master bedroom was great. We tried the pool several times. The wind was really whirling around the property, whose grounds were beautiful. We went to Black Rock a mile or so away, drove and the wind was not there. This is around the Sheraton and enjoy that beach very much. We attended the Hyatt Drums of the Pacific luau and enjoyed that luxurious property as well. It had a shopping area within and was one of the most luxurious hotels that I have been in. If only my husband and I, we would definitely stay next time at the Hyatt or Sheraton. We did enjoy the Kaanapali/Lahaina area, but would have liked to explore the other side of the island by the airport, which appeared to have more of the restaurants and shopping that we would have enjoyed. Kaanapali Shores is good for accommodations if condo space is required; otherwise, stay at one of the beautiful hotels.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing, great service, nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: emmedog
Reviews.Content: This resort was the perfect blend of hotel-like service with the ammenities of a condo that are so helpful to have wihen you are traveling with a small child. We loved having a separate bedroom and a kitchen while also enjoying daily room cleaning services, an on site restaurant, and concierge services. The only feedback would be to separate the concierge services from the tour booking. We had to wait in line to ask directions and they seemed less helpful than if we were booking a paid tour.

Reviews.Title: “Still fantastic after all these years!”
Reviews.Author: welovehawaii2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Kaanapali Shores (our 5th or 6th time?) from April 4 to April 11. There were 8 of us, and we had two of the 2-bedroom suites. Our stay was absolutely excellent, again. My wife and I are already planning a return trip in September, and we will be staying here again. This facility is probably the best value for the buck on the entire island. The rooms, especially the renovated ones, are very nice and the beds are extremely comfortable. The grounds and common areas are impecably maintained. And the staff is friendly and attentive. Diane in the bar is awesome, and Myron in the restaurant is hilarious! A word about the restaurant...it is somewhat expensive, but quite a bit less so than at the other nice hotels. Dining in Lahaina, depending on where you go, is not going to cost much less. So if you're tired and don't want to hop in the car, the food is quite good and reasonably priced by Maui standards. The last reviewer commented on a very narrow beach. We were here in October and the beach was at least twice as deep from the property line to the water. I suspect the winter tides have sucked alot of the sand away, but it will be back in a few months. If you're looking for a really nice place for your vacation but have to watch the budget a bit, this is the place. We highly recommend it to everyone. Mahalo for reading, and aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here...”
Reviews.Author: miiyuk00
Reviews.Content: When we checked in at the front desk we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite and it was the best ever...I had two teenagers and my two younger kids with me .We had our own space to do whatever we wanted.The staff were very friendly and helpful. Denise T. and Family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time - nice location / good staff”
Reviews.Author: doyleb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores from March 22nd through March 29th. The hotel was easy to find and the grounds were very well maintained. Check in was a breeze and due to low occupancy we were able to upgrade our 2nd floor garden view room to an ocean view room on the 6th floor - room 606, for an additional but discounted fee. We told the person at the check in desk it was our anniversary and he sent a bottle of champagne to our room later that afternoon - a very nice touch. We parked the car and took our bags up to the room. The condo was nicely furnished, and appeared to be recently remodeled. The furniture was comfortable and there was plenty of space for all of our things. The lanai looked out over the north side of the building, so no sunset views, but we were close enough to the waterâ€™s edge that we still had great views of the water and the lanai was very private. The property just north of the Kaanapali Shores is a 3 story, apartment-like property that we partially looked over. We were able to sleep with the lanai door open at night and could hear the sounds of the waves from our bedroom. The bath was nicely apportioned, with amenities provided. Our only complaint about the room was that it took me 4 days to figure out how to pry the bedroom window open so we could hear the sounds from the ocean better at night! The staff was friendly and efficient. Our towels were replaced daily and the room straightened and the bed made by the cleaning staff. The room was fully cleaned with the trash removed on Wednesday. The compact washer / dryer came in handy and we purchased additional laundry soap from the sundries shop on the ground floor as needed. We had one dinner and one breakfast in the hotel restaurant and the food was good quality â€“ not spectacular, but not bad either. The wait and bar staff was very nice and provided very good service. We didnâ€™t see any evidence of rodents or bugs our entire stay. Again this is not a 5 star hotel and for the money I think it was very good value. The strip mall just across the road from the hotel was in easy walking distance. We went grocery shopping there several times for breakfast items and once for dinner. We also ate at Pizza Paradiso one evening. The pizza was good and reasonably priced â€“ again not spectacular, but reasonable value for the money on Maui. The grounds were well kept and the pool clean. We attended the Wednesday 5:00 PM hula on the pool deck and again it was nice â€“ not spectacular, but entertaining. We did not use the gym as $10 per person per day was a bit much, but we did experience a couples massage on the beach. It was not the most relaxing experience we've ever had as it was quite windy that afternoon and the tent we were in - with flaps closed for a smidge of privacy - seemed at times like it would do it's best 'Wizard of Oz' imitation and fly away. We stayed grounded and enjoyed the massages as best we could. We would definitely stay there again and may consider doing so for my wifeâ€™s parentâ€™s 60th anniversary next year.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: monsteve21
Reviews.Content: I went with this hotel since it had a lot of reviews and the scores were generally high. The fact that it listed 900 square feet and a full kitchen was the biggest attraction. My wife, myself and our three girls (4, 6, and 8) went from 3/23 - 3/30. I was a little worried since the price was one of the lowest out there. After doing a lot of research and reading through countless reviews, I took the chance. Boy am I glad I did. Not only is this place a great price, but our room was AWESOME. When it says living room, one bedroom and a full kitchen, they are not lying. Plenty of room, a home away from home. The bed was comfortable, the kitchen looked like it had all new appliances, and there was just plenty of room for this family of 5. The Internet connection was at 100% and I never had an issue connecting. The main pool was warm, and the kiddy pool was great for the kids (little cold). This place is located right on the beach, everyday we would walk to the ocean without any shoes on any of us. The beach was clean and the views were spectacular. You did have to walk a little way down to reach a sandy entrance to the ocean, but it was great snorkeling (albeit I am a beginner). The lobby and the grounds were immaculate, right down to the nightly tiki lighting. The restaurant there was adequate, and the food was decent. I miss sitting on the lanai and seeing the sun set. Two things I would change: More availability of towels, and a little friendlier at the front desk. Butch runs a great place and I would definitely refer to my family and friends. Any vacation of mine will be stayed at this hotel. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, beauty, and variety for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: Twinkie13
Reviews.Content: We had a large group going for a 1 week vacation. 4 families, 2 with kids ages 5 mo -10 yr stayed in 1-Bedrooms, and the other in a studio. While we had the "Garden View" , on the 5th floor we could see both: the lush trees and flowers as well as the ocean and even the susnset. I loved the fact that they never ran out of beach towels, and we didn't have to deal with signing them out, or making sure to return them by the end of the day. Don't miss the huge Koy fish in the pond! The 2 pools were perfect for all ages. One was kidney shaped with a depth of 3 ft all around, the other was 3ft-6ft? gated and more for adults, although they also had scooba lessons in there during the day. There were 2 hot tubs, one on the side of the kidney pool (a bit too hot at times), and the other right next to regular pool (perfect temp). There was also a short-grass open lawn area where you could lay, relax, or run around with the kids. By the evening both pools were warm and very pleasant after being out in the sun all day. Beyond the pool, a few steps took you down to a narrow strip of beach where the water was a bit rocky. But, just 200 feet to the left there was a more sandy area where you could walk out, swim and snorkel. I saw 5-6 varieties of fish and was still able to stand (about 4 feet in). While they rent out eqipment, it's smarter to just drive to Lahaina and buy the snorkel gear. They have 1 restaurant and we went there for lunch twice. Everything was good, I recommend the fish tacos, coconut shrimp salad, and the amazing Rum-soaked Bread Pudding. But, if you order a pizza on the kids menu, you may get a Hot Pocket instead. From their Snack manu, the eggrolls and both chicken wings were also very good. The staff was friendly and accomodating. We had 2 cribs for the babies in the family. Room cleaning was very efficient, except for one day. Plenty of space, nice decor..nothing posh or modern, but clean and sturdy. No sense of old..no mold, mildew or cracking...great condition. Location: about 45 minutes from the major aiport. Lahaina and the shoppes are about 10-15 minutes away. Black Rock beach was only a 5 minute drive and had the best snorkeling with giant Turtles and beautiful, calm, clear water. The beach is public, but is adjacent to the Sheraton. So, overall, a great experience and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cdolezar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a perfect honeymoon in Maui! The hotel was perfect and we loved our one bedroom suite it was a home away from home. Having a washer and dryer in our room was great! The hotel room was cleaned everyday and the staff was great. We only had to call for towels once and they came in 15 minutes. There is so much to do in Maui. We went ziplining, did a helecopter ride, spent a day in Oahu, snorkeled and more. The location of the hotel is peaceful and quiet. There is a grocery store across the street which was great for picking up food and drinks. The prices in Maui are not as expensive as they are made out to be we ate out everyday. One tip RENT A CAR!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Stressful”
Reviews.Author: Choked09
Reviews.Content: This review portains to the ability to change dates. My wife and I booked a vacation at the Kaanapali Shores a few months back. We booked both the hotel and flight with the resort for the reason of convenience. My wife got a new job and was not able to take time off til September. In the past I had switched flights at no cost as long as it was 24 hours notice. To make a long story short I was on the phone talking to ResortQuest, NorthWest Airlines ( the biggest crooks of them all), world wide travel, and expedia for 7 hours over the span of 2 days. The change ended up costing just under $800! including $250 to change the dates (not the type of room, just the dates) for the hotel. If you need a vacation with the ability to be flexible for unforseen events DO NOT BOOK HERE! The change cost a 1/3 of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back!”
