Reviews.Author: fran_9572
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a privately owned condo at Kaanapali Shores last week and had a fabulous time. (www.Islandstay.net) The amenities in the condo as well as at the resort were awesome. The condo was clean, the king sized bed was very comfortable, the shower was always warm and the WiFi always worked. Great ocean view! The grounds were well kept, nice landscape, BBQ and tennis court onsite. There is a nice restaurant/bar if you want to grab something, both food and drink were good. Property is close to Kapalua, Kaanapali and Lahaina. Local grocery store across the street and Safeway 5 minutes away. We had a fabulous time and did not want to leave! We will definitely go back to Kaanapali Shores and highly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “beautifully renovated one bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiViv
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Kaanapali Shores. This condo resort has been around for a long time, but I was pleasantly surprised at the beautifully renovated room we had. We booked an oceanview one bedroom suite with Resortquest. Nice tropical furniture, new carpet & floors, modern kitchen and bathroom with granite countertops. The best part was that we had a gorgeous ocean view from every room (except the bathroom). We could see the whales from our lanai. The king bed was very comfortable, and my son had a good sleep on the pull out sofabed in the livingroom. He was disappointed that there was no DVD player in the room (not all the units have one). We bought some groceries at safeway and enjoyed having breakfast on the lanai. There is a grocery store across from the Kaanapali Shores as well, but it is not as nice as Safeway. Also, we went to the Mexican restaurant in the small plaza across the street and was not impressed at all - food was mediocre, served on paper plates, and very small portions. The beach in front of the Kaanapali Shores was good for snorkelling. For sandy access, just walk to the left a bit to get away from the rocks. There are 2 pools - we swam in the pool by the beach and it was nice and warm! (not all of the hotels heat their pools). We did not eat at the restaurant by the pool but it looked very nice and was usually quite full. I would recommend only booking the oceanview one bedroom suites (or higher category) at this resort, or you may get stuck overlooking the parking lot or the garden pool which is very noisy with birds.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Maui with Baby”
Reviews.Author: Ashesval
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights in a 1 bedroom suite with an ocean room. We had our 8 month old with us and the size of the suites, along with a kitchen and laundry made it so much easier for us. The hotel is large, but it never seems crowded and the visitors and owners staying at the hotel are very nice and talkative. The service was great overall. The hotel is almost connected to this great boardwalk that you can walk all the way up to Whalers Village on. You can connect near the Mahana from the beach. It was hard to swim in front of the hotel on the beach, but Kaanapali is so long that you don't have to walk far to find a nice spot, and it isn't very crowded at all. The restaurant was pretty good and it had a nice look and feel to it, including a great view. The poolside service bar was under construction when we were there so we heard some renovation noises while at the beach pool. Some of the suites are undergoing renovations as well, so sometimes you hear some noise. There was a large skip below our room where we could hear tradespeople dumping old toilets and whatnot into. At first I was a bit annoyed, but it wasn't noisy all the time and I understand that renos are needed at this hotel. I saw two cockroaches but they were both already dead so no big deal. The ocean view was ok... not as great as I expected, but I guess you pay for what you get. Most ocean view rooms at other hotels along Kaanapali cost a lot more. We stayed in room 612. We didn't rent a car until the last three days of the trip from Budget down the road from the hotel and found that we didn't really need to mostly because of the baby and not wanting to go too far. It was a very child friendly hotel and very safe. I enjoyed the pizza place across the way very much. Not sure if I would stay here again, but that is only because I don't like to stay at places more than once in most cases. Maui was also very windy when we were there. I wish it had been a bit warmer but oh well, better than back home!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a family Hawaiian vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bikernanak
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Shores is the perfect mix of location, affordability and beauty! We had purchased a package from a travel site, were originally booked in another property, and then blessed with an upgrade to Kaanapali Shores upon our arrival! We were greeted by bellmen to help with our luggage and checked in quickly. The lobby is open and breezy, with a view to a bubbling waterfall and beautiful tropical foliage. Tiki lamps are lit nightly to the sound of a shell horn. The grounds are neatly kept, with a variety of flowers and foliage, and the two pools and two spas are pristeen clean. The larger and very spacious pool and spa are right on the beach, with a glass wind wall, a walk way and just a few steps separating them from the sand and ocean! The restaurant was a little pricey for every day, but great for our first breakfast and a treat, with pool and ocean views from the table. The one charge that surprised us was the $9.00/day parking fee--not mentioned in any printed or spoken information we received. Our rooms were spacious and comfortable, with sliding doors and screens so we could not only feel the breeze but hear the surf and smell the wonderful ocean air. We took pictures of rainbows and saw whales spout and one breach and roll, all from our bedroom window. We needed a crib for the 1-year-old, and it did seem a bit too small for him, but would work for a younger child. We would definitely return to this property!

Reviews.Title: “The room was nasty”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagain97
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in room 924. It is like a 1980 Days Inn. The cabinets are patched, the molding is cracked, The tile in the shower was stained. Out second night we came home at about 10 and there was a note that we had to move because of a leaky pipe. we moved down the hall to a very nice room.But they should not try to rent out that room especially when the place is not crowded. The next night there was no hot water. and the next night there was no water at all (broken water main).

Reviews.Title: “Decent, not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: PegCityGal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay at this property. The location of the property is relatively well situated, with a short drive to Lahaina. We found this property to be very windy, it appears to be on a point of sorts and the wind howls alot of the day. We were at different properties closer to Lahaina during those windy days, and it seemed to be distinct to the Shores as the other locations weren't nearly as windy. As is well documented here, the birds at this resort can be unbearable and you can almost set your watch to them daily. However, when we moved to a 2 bedroom unit closer to the ocean, they didn't seem to be as bad. The pool area is mediocre, it fills up very quickly during the day with lots of kids and families. The beach here while close, is very rocky and swimming isn't great here either. The restaurant was ok, but nothing to write home about. However they were very accomodating when we needed to store a large cake in one of their fridges. It was great to have bbq facilities on site, and we made good use of the bbq area on a few nights - a nice touch. The fee for parking is outrageous and quite ridiculous really. Not sure why that would be and seems like a total cash grab. The rooms were nice, it was enjoyable to have the use of a large, (and in our case - updated) kitchen with most amenities. The two bedroom provided enough room for the 6 in our party. Only thing i would change for the rooms, would be a bigger couch in the living room. Not that one watches a lot of TV in Maui, but there were a plethora of channels on the tv here. Nice large changing area in the master bedroom and quite comfortable beds. Overall, after a few days here, we realized the resort definitely caters to families and to seniors. Our group of twelve were 4 50-somethings and 8 25-35's. This resort lacks a good bar to enjoy a late evening cocktail in, it seems everyone retires to their rooms after dinner, and it would have been nice to have a place to go instead of the room for a drink. The bus service into Lahaina is great, but the concierge doesn't really seem to be well versed on the schedules or much about it...this was frustrating. It was somewhat annoying to have to transfer at Whalers Village and pay yet another dollar to get into Lahaina, I realize this doesn't have much to do with the resort itself, but more about it's location. A one way taxi into Lahaina is about $22 - a little steep for a short 10 minute ride. We were able to visit other properties closer to Lahaina, and when we return to Maui, will most likely give them a try. We enjoyed the large, open pool areas of the Marriott, Westin & Hyatt, and the varied bars also offered at this location. We realize the price will certainly reflect these amenities at these specific properties, but after staying @ the Shores, we realized we were looking for more of a ''resort'' feel versus what is a strong family oriented resort at the Shores. Mike from Scorpion dive school was excellent and the free pool side daily lessons was a real plus. He was a pleasure to learn from. We paid $79 for a walk in sea dive, which was good value for money. We enjoyed our time here, and overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Home away from Home; we've been twice and will go back.”
Reviews.Author: aspalek
Reviews.Content: When we stayed here the first time, we felt the same way as another reviewer - it was nice, but we wanted to try somewhere else. Now that we have stayed at one of the fancier resorts on Kaanapali Beach, I really appreciate this place for what it offers. No, it's not on the greatest beach (it's narrow). No, it doesn't have a fancy water slide. But it is a great, low-key place. The service is friendly. The one bedroom suite has a king bed, and a pullout sofa in the living room. Central A/C, a nice big lanai with a table and chairs and a chaise lounge. The kitchen is nothing fancy but great to have. If you have kids, they eat free at the onsite restaurant for lunch, which is nice. The pools are kept warm, we even swam at night. Quite unlike the huge pool at the megaresort, which was beautiful but icy. The space in the condos is quite nice, and i never heard my neighbors (also unlike at the fancy resort). There is a big lawn in the middle away from the 2 pools, which is nice to run around on if you're a kid. There is a nice feeling of space because of that. There is a grocery type store, and a beach supplies store, both well stocked and convenient. The other great thing we discovered on this trip was the Honokawai Farmer's market, which takes place just up the road on Mon,Wed,Fri. You can pick out a coconut and they will cut it open for you so you can drink the water (very fun for kids). They also sell local fruit, awesome guacamole and other treats. It is not something you will find in Kaanapali. When we shopped there, we felt like locals. The other new thing is that due to the construction of the Westin Villas, there is now a boardwalk/path that you can use: I was able to take great walks every morning, with a beach view, stopping to whale watch. It was really nice. In short, I would totally recommend this to anyone wishing to stay in the area. It's a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, would return but want to try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: wally181
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Kaanapali Shores from Feb. 14 - 19, our room was excellent although we did not rent through Resort Quest or Aston but through VRBO. The grounds where excellent but we found much nicer beaches in other areas of the island. The location was okay, luckly we had a car rental the entire stay and where able to check out other beaches. I would return for the room we had but not the beach in front. We also where traveling with other family members that had a room on the north side of the hotel, there lani had no sun and was very windy I would not recommend staying on that side of the hotel, they did have a mouse friend but only saw it once, we did not.

Reviews.Title: “lots of whales in Maui, will use different hotel property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We would not probably recommend this hotel to our friends, nor will we likely stay there in the future. Our stay was 12/21/08 to 12/31/08. The resort was not full during Christmas probably due to the economy. The staff was cordial and pleasant when we encountered them and the overall grounds were well kept. We had a mouse in our condo on Christmas day. The Manager on duty Lauren indicated housekeeping would be up to remove it. I did not make a stink when I reported our issue as they had 3 newly arriving couples at the front desk. (We understand things can and do happenâ€¦) I expected the front desk to call and say we are sorry or acknowledge the issue that night or the next day. I actually felt the need to leave a light on at night for the remainder of our stay so as not to step on another unwanted guest. I am not sure if the management did not care because the room and trip had already been paid for in advance or if the management simply just did not care. Maybe finding mice in the rooms is a common occurance on the islands. When we checked out someone asked how our stay was, so we told our mouse story and that gentleman did comp our parking fee for the week.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets about recommending this place”
Reviews.Author: CalSD_traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through a travel agent as package. First of all, you need to get your expectations in order. This place is not the Ritz- Carlton. Some people expect it to be and then get disappointed. This is a first rate resort, but it's not priced or advertised to compete against the luxury resorts. Having said that, this resort is very nice indeed. It has all the amenities you would expect from an upscale resort. There is a gym (for a fee, unfortunately), 2 pools that get somewhat crowded during the day, a sauna, a decent restaurant, a beachfront location, tennis, and barbecues available for grilling your own food. Rooms: We had a 2 bedroom condo with a kitchen. The rooms were owned by someone else who rented it out while they were not there. I would say the rooms were on par with a Hilton Garden Inn or that type of hotel. Some rooms were upgraded with granite counters but ours was not. The rooms are comfortable and spacious enough by most standards and came with a washer/dryer which was convenient. Service: Service at the resort is very good. Housekeeping was responsive to our requests and we were greeted by staff members if we saw one in the hallway. The front desk staff were courteous, helpful, and cheerful. We're not demanding travelers so I guess that's why we were so satisfied. Location: Fantastic. The resort is in Honokowai, just north of Kaanapali. Across the street is a super market and some decent but not spectacular restaurants. It was a quick 10 minute drive to Lahaina. The hotel was set back far enough so that you couldn't hear the street noise. I really liked this location a lot. Value: If you can get a package deal and the 2 bedroom condo, it's perfect for families. Cooking in the room and doing your own laundry will save a few dollars for a nice night out later on. Overall, we had a great time and would recommend this resort to others. I don't give many five stars except to Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton, etc. so this says a lot of about how I feel. Pros: Location and value. Internet was free, but it wasn't high speed. Cons: Service can be slow at times. Pool occasionally gets crowded. Quite a bit of nickel and diming, but it was expected so I can't complain much. Ex: parking fees, gym fees, room safe fees. Note: The reviewer has a family with 2 young kids. They travel twice a year and have stayed in the full range of resorts from crummy to five-star so they generally know what they are getting into. We have tried to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Shores Rapture”
Reviews.Author: docdirt
Reviews.Content: My Family and I (8 people) completely enjoyed 2 - 2 bedroom ocean front suites. Bedrooms and Living Rooms were huge and better than well furnished and appointed. Fantastic balconey(s) views (180 degrees) of the ocean, beach, swimming pool, WHALES, and other islands. (The View photo is my new computer screen saver!!) Great full- sized kitchens with all the necessary equipment and modern appliances. Master between was very large with a huge closet/dressing/ and bathroom area. Good sized second bedrooms and bathrooms. Staff and service personnel were very attentive. Hotel grounds are just lovely. Restuarant was excellent. We will return in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: veronica1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. I can not imagine a better honeymoon. The staff were very nice and the resort was very clean. Our condo was I believe on the 7th floor and it had a breathtaking view. It was great to have our own kitchen and washer/dryer. We did not spend much time in the room as were were exploring the beaches and the island. The location is great and the beach was very quiet and not crowded at all. The only con was that the pool was being renovated at the time so were were unable to use it. Besides that a WONDERFUL vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BasedInSeattle
Reviews.Content: Large, comfortable, clean room. Loved having a kitchen and washer/dryer in the room - we stayed for 10 days and those amenities were very nice. The restaurant had reasonable food with a quirky-but-really-nice staff. There is a beach on site - if you are a snorkeler follow the three bouies out to get to the good stuff (I got some nice pics of a huge sea turtle with a disposable underwater camera I bought on-site). There is a dive shop across the street to rent snorkeling equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Mamma--Great Place”
Reviews.Author: pekemartin
Reviews.Content: GOT A NICE UPGRADE, updated 2 bedroom 2 bath, #345, overlooking the garden & waterfall etc, only negative is VERY noisy birds in the late afternoon & night, shopping center across the street & has a good supply of things needed in the room. Wasen't given much details on the exact location, butt it was close to a HUGE construction site, & look for the 2 big crains in the air, as the place does not set of the main road. Wish I was back there already

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: huckfinn66
Reviews.Content: We have visited Maui three times, and each time we stay at the Kaanapali Shores Hotel. The reason we choose this hotel is simple; It's a great location at a great price with great amenities. By choosing a suite you get a comfortable bedroom, living room, kitchen... and most importantly an in-room washer and dryer. This makes packing a lot easier (and cheaper considering the weight limits the airlines are enforcing). The staff has always been Excellent. Very friendly and helpful. Our rooms have always been clean and nicely kept. The grounds have also always been well maintained. The hotel is located on Kaanapali Beach, which is breathtaking. Each day we would walk the beach as the sun rose, and each day we were able to see whales from the shore (Traveled January-March). From the beach you also have a gorgeous view of two other islands - Lanai and Molikai. It is very romantic - and the best way we've found to unwind from our hectic daily lives. The hotel is minutes away from Lahaina - a fun town to shop and dine in, and where most whale watching and other tours originate from. Also, for convenience sake, it is across the street from a grocery store, Subway, and pizza place - something which came in very handy. it was nice to be able to just walk to these places. Maui is one of our favorite places, and the Kaanapali Shores is the perfect place for us to stay. The convenience, price, service and beauty of the place make it a natural choice for us. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: davidnluci
Reviews.Content: January 2009. Spent 10 relaxing days here. The staff were exceptional friendly and cheerful. the rooms are very comfortable, very clean ( no bugs). Nice large full kitchen. Washer and dryer. We were on the 8th floor above the lush gardens with a partial beach view. The noisiest thing to deal with was the birds at sunset and sunrise. Nice reasonably priced restuarant on site. Convienent location, easy to find from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: seaoceanlover
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our friends stayed at this hotel from January 13-20, 2009. We had two separate one bedroom condos not too far away from each other. The rooms were to be expected for a 3.5 star hotel, a bit older, but clean and had a comfortable king size bed and great pillows. The hotel staff were very friendly and gave advice about what to do and how to get to there. Our party rented a car from the airport and went to Costco to buy our week's worth of food before we set off to find the hotel. There is also a grocery store across the street from the hotel (which was convenient for grabbing a few things) although the prices are much higher then Costco. We went to the morning presentation which we did find informative, although do not expect too much of the breakfast because it is donuts and fruit and if you do not get there in time for the food it could be ate up. It is true about the rocky beach in front of the hotel but we found that our water shoes worked great. One thing that I wished we did the first day was rent the boogie boards (we waited and rented them later but to get the full use out of the rental you should rent them right away and they help when you are swimming with those big waves. You can rent them for a cheap weekly price across the street at the strip mall right next to the grocery store. Our second night we went to the Old Lahaina Luau. It was a beautiful setting, had great food and impressive dancing. I would suggest if you want to learn more about the culture and the history of the islands go to this luau, you will not be disappointed! There are a number of beaches not too far away that you can just drive to from the hotel. I suggest for your first trip, drive up around Kahana. If you want a great beach with parking, bathrooms and great waves for body boarding go to D.T. Fleming beach. Also if you continue up highway 30 there are a number of look offs and beaches to stop off at, great little drive. The whalers village is about a five minute drive from the hotel and if you want to walk it is about an hour. Park in the parking lot but make sure if you eat or buy anything there get your parking validated. There are two excellent shore front restaurants at the village to eat at and the prices were reasonable. We personally found that shopping along Front street in Lahaina was the best and cheapest. Also, along these shops are booths that book trips, the prices were much lower then the prices on the internet or through the hotel; we had already booked our trips so we did not investigate those but it might be worth while to look into during your first few days, prehaps you may save some money. We booked our Molokini and Turtle snorkel cruise through the hotel and it was great. We were booked with Pacific Whale foundation, which is an eco friendly operator and monies go to the non profit pacific whale foundation. The staff, food and drinks were great. And the trip to turtle arches was great, saw a number of turtles, one came so close I could have reached out and touched it. You could check them out on-line and see if the prices are different then offered through the hotel. The road to Hana...well it is an experience and a beautiful one at that. But it is a full day adventure so be prepared to go for the whole day. Make sure you pack some snacks and drinks for the ride and fill up on gas before you go. The main attraction about the trip is the road itself and the views. We brought a map and was hoping to easily find the stop offs indicated on the map but that was not easy because the road does not have any signs on it indicating were things are until closer to Hana. Therefore I would suggest buying the Road to Hana CD, I read that it gives you suggestions on where to stop and it will also be good to have something playing in the car because we could not get any radio stations to come in. Black beach is great near Hana and we all really enjoyed the Lava Tube walk. There are a number of golf courses near to the hotel that are beautiful. Prices are a little over two hundred dollars for the morning but if you book a twilight rate (after 1:00pm, the price drops quite a bit). Overall the trip was awesome, loved Maui and after driving around the island we all agreed that this hotel and its location was the nicest on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: livetwotravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute trip through vacation-maui.com in mid-December and had a great time. We stayed in #732-a 1Bd 1ba condo-which had a nice partial ocean view and all the amenities a couple would need for a 6 night stay. The pools/hot tubs at the hotel are kept clean and the beachfront is good, but can be a bit dicey for swimming. It's best to venture toward Black Rock for calmer waters. The grounds of the hotel are also nicely maintained. Don't miss the happy hour mai tais at Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina-also great food!-or the banana-mac nut pancakes with special whipped topping at Gazebo for breakfast in Napili-you'll never be the same! We took the Four Winds to Molikini and ended up trying snuba, which was fun. We ventured out on our own many days-Big Beach-near Wailea- is great, especially if it's a bit rainy in Lahaina, and Honolua Bay provided ok snorkeling. We drove from Kapalua around the North of the island to Pa'ia town, via the help of our Maui Revealed book, for nice stops (banana bread and the 'Iao Needle) and great scenery. The one lane road is an experience! If you can splurge, DO NOT miss Mama's Fish House in Pa'ia town for a meal. It is truly a culinary experience. We also went to Warren & Annabelle's dinner/magic show in lieu of a luau. Entertaining and good drinks. Good trip, but not long enough. Would snorkel next time at the Fishbowl/La Perouse Bay and relax more. Maybe even stay in Kihei for a more local experience. Still craving those pancakes! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: ljoshau
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Hawaii to get away from the freezing cold of a Northern Wisconsin winter. Our stay at the Resort Quest Kaanapali Shores resort was wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to plan our extracurricular activities from within the resort through the Expedia concierge. The resort was beautiful. The grounds were well kept, and secure. There was a grocery store convienently near by. The beach was perfect. We were able to snorkel right in front of the resort, and find many tropical fish and sea turtles. All in all, a great destination for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: KansasReviewer
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom garden view. Great value for the price. Our unit was nicely furnished. The gardens and pool areas were really nice and landscaped well. supermarket across the street was very convenient. Sundries shop and souvenir shop on ground level were competitively priced and open late. The beach in front of kaanapali shores is really rocky but a short walk to the East provides a much nicer swimming area. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this property. Parking was very affordable compared to other properties. The Kaanapali area of Maui is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Maui and Kaanapali Shores Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 days (10 nites). We had booked at a great rate a 2 BR Garden View, but when we showed up they had us for an Ocean view at same price. Then they gave me a deal I couldn't refuse, the Aloha Suite 2 BR, closest to the Ocean on the first floor, for a fair price more (business apparently down some due to economy, I'm sure normally I never would have got such a great price on the Aloha Suite). This suite is very, very large and spacious, with its patio maybe 10 feet from the sidewalk, then another 50 or so feet of beach to the ocean. On the patio it was like being on the beach with covered "parking" for my bod and no one other than family members next to me, being right at the ocean!!! Suite was modern, neutral colors, top appliances, washer and drier, most comfortable beds. Totally top notch. Daily maid service excellent and fast. Now grounds and pool are not as luxurious as some of the higher rent properties, but the room, patio and ocean are whatsmost important, along with affordable price (relatively, given high prices of everything in Maui). We were so happy there that none of us wanted to go back to Phoenix, and now in Phoenix we all wish we were living in Kannapal Shores in Maui!!@@ Really great for a family!!!@@@

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Maui!”
Reviews.Author: twingles72
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, my husband and 3 kids (ages 10, 8 and 8) stayed at the Kaanapali Shores Dec. 6 -16, 2008. We had a wonderful time in Maui! This hotel was recommened to us by a friend and we booked our trip through a travel agent. We stayed in a 2 bedroom oceanview suite (room 714). The general setup of the hotel was perfect for us, however there were some little things that amounted up to something bigger that bothered us about it. I've listed below everything in Pros and Cons. Pros: -The washer/dryer in the room was a lifesaver for us! Yes, it was old and noisy but it worked and was better than going to a laundry mat. -The staff were very friendly. -Having the two pools was nice to choose from. There were lots of lounge chairs and they were kept clean, as were the grounds. The landscaping was very nicely done. -Being right on the beah was great. We walked the beach in both directions and the Kaanapali Shores had by far the nicest kept beach. -It was nice to have the convienience of Expedia on-site. -Having wireless was great. However, the best reception was out on the lanai, so we either had to use our laptop out there or very close to the sliding glass doors. -The convienence of having a grocery store right across the street was wonderful. Cons: -The pool towel service was very poor. Half of the time there weren't towels and when there were, the towels were either dirty or stained. They were actually very gross to use. -The maid service was inconsistent. One day it was early in the morning and another day we came back from time out at the beach/pool around 4:30 to find the maids just arriving at our room. We were wanting to get ready to go out for dinner. It would have been nice to have it done at the same time each day. -The construction/renovation noise! The hotel was undergoing renovations while we were there. My husband works as a general contractor and his comment was "If I wanted to listen to a skil saw, I would have stayed home." -Speaking of renovations... we were able to see from the outside all the rooms that had been updated. However ours was NOT one of those nice rooms with granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, beautiful millwork for cupboards. We were in a room that looked like it was straight out of the 80's. The carpet was dingy and old. The kitchen appliances were older. The microwave didn't work. The only thing that looked new was the tile surround in the bathrooms. However the tile on the floors was moldy. The shower drain in the ensuite bathtub didn't work. And TWICE we had to call maintenance when the toilet in the main bathroom overflowed. All the shelving in both the kitchen and bathrooms were basically plywood that had been painted. -We were booked into an "ocean view suite". Yes we had a view of the ocean, however it was more like a "garden view" because our room was right outside the garden. It was a beautiful garden though! -Parking was $9.00 a day We booked this trip back in May of 2008. After spending all that money and having been reserved into that type of room that far aheah, I would have liked a newer, updated room. I have read some of the management's responses, and I don't feel that I should be penalized for booking through the safety and security of a travel agent (and my friend!) as opposed to if I had booked straight through ResortQuest. Plus, my travel agent had a better deal than what ResortQuest could offer. All in all, we had a wonderful trip. We made the best of it. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends on the condition that they ask specifically for an updated room. Like I said at the beginning of this review... this hotel setup was great for our family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Very Merry Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: LassieTroy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 2-week stay at Kaanapali Shores. We booked 3 condos in all -- 1 for us and 1 each for both our sons and their families. There were 11 of us in all. All units were supposed to be gardenview, our sons' were 2-bedroom units because of their families. I read many of the reviews before we left and was somewhat apprehensive. Upon our arrival, I did not feel well because of some bad airport food and more or less fell into bed. By morning, when I felt better and looked around more, it was obvious, we had not been given renovated units -- but ours seemed sufficient , though dated, and very clean. The view from our balcony was very pretty. When our second son arrived several days later, he was given the choice of an upgraded ocean front renovated unit for what seemed like a nominal fee or the unit his family was originally assigned. He and his wife looked at both units and decided to spend the extra money and took the ocean front renovated unit. It was beautiful and we could see the vast difference in renovated and non-renovated units. I checked with the desk later to see if our other son's family could also get a renovated unit and there was no problem at all getting them moved, and there was no charge. They were moved up higher up above the trees, so they had a partial view of the ocean, and their unit was beautiful also. Housekeeping was wonderful and very cooperative about helping them get moved. All we had to do was ask. Since I didn't intend to use the kitchen much anyway and our bathroom was just fine, my husband and I stayed in our original unit, but I'm sure we could have been moved if we would have asked. It was Christmas time, so Santa was there for the children. Pictures could be taken with him and the kids could decorate their picture frames. We were given lights to decorate our balconies however we wanted. Some people were very creative! We were treated to egg nog and cookies one evening. The lobby and grounds at the resort are just as beautiful as described by others on this website. It was a pleasure to walk through them. We ate at the restaurant occasionally and thought it was pretty good and wasn't any more expensive than most of the restaurants in the area. Kids only eat free for lunch! We enjoyed the beach, but there are reefs but you can learn to look out for them. It's not as traumatic as some make it out to be. Fleming Beach is just up the road about 10 minutes and there are no rocks there. The pizza place across the street is excellent and there is a MacDonald's 5 minutes away. The Star Market is good if you need something on the run, but Safeway's prices are much better. Kaanapali Shores is great for kids. Our grandkids loved it. They could swim and run and play. Beach chairs are at a premium, so you need to get there early in the morning if you want anywhere to sit for the rest of the day. Beach towels were abundant. We stay at timeshares frequently and never have maid service. What a treat! The staff is so nice too! If I'd change anything I'd include the parking fee in the room charge rather than making it separate. I'd also replace the light bulbs with a higher watt bulb. The dark shades, especially in the bedroom make it difficult to see. All in all, I don't know why I was so worried. I guess some people are never satisifed. This was perfect for us and was a vacation we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED”
Reviews.Author: ArmonkMom
Reviews.Content: Our family travels very large. We were 2 adults, 2 tweens, 2 teens and grandma. The 2 bedroom 2 bath unit housed all of us perfectly. Unit 259 was clean and well stocked. We could not have had a better experience (our 3rd) in Maui. Well, if only the weather would've cooperated...............

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Vacation experience!!”
Reviews.Author: ststravelservice
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent by occupation, so whenever I do get a chance to take a vacation I like to pick destinations and properties that I sell to my clients. My husband and I found the Kaanapali Shores to be most impressive. We had a one bedroom ocean view condo unit. It was spacious, full kitchen facilities, daily maid service, washer/dryer and a very friendly staff. The grounds were immaculate with a wonderful concierge service and we were able to book our whale watch trip and car rental right from the travel agency located at the hotel. I would recommend that any one booking this property also book a car for your entire stay so that you can come and go and grocery shop at the local stores with ease. Also, the hotel is located on Kaanapal Beach, so we walked the entire beach down to the Royal Lahaina each day. It was great! Great for families, wonderful pool area and restaurant. Full service is the word!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was great!!”
Reviews.Author: GCAuburn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Kaanapali Shores. We were in a 2-bedroom Ocean Front Aloha Suite (#602). Our room was very nice and very roomy. We had 5 adults and a baby (they brought in a crib) staying and were not crowded at all. The views from our balcony were amazing. Just a few small things..we felt the price we were paying should have included the amenities of the hotel. Having to pay $9 a day to park and $2.50 a day to use the safe in our room was a little pricey. Also, our group would have used the fitness room. However, $10 per day PER PERSON is ridiculous~ Overall, we had a wonderful vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to experience Maui”
Reviews.Author: Consuela604
Reviews.Content: My family of 4, including 2 teenagers, stayed in a 2 bdr oceanview unit (#915) from Dec 14 - 22. The unit was very clean, spacious and had a great view. We enjoyed watching the whales every day and saw dolphins and monk seals on a few occasions as well. We walked to black rock every day and I would say that the beach in front of Kaanapali Shores was one of the nicest compared to some of the others along the 2 km stretch of beach. We were expecting 2 twin beds in the second bedroom but there was a double bed. Since we arrived VERY late (thank you Air Canada) we used the pullout couch which proved to be surprisingly comfortable so the kids alternated and it worked out fine. The daily housekeeping was great and the public areas were clean, modern, and well maintained. The free wireless internet was sometimes hard to get a connection but we found that taking the computer to the lanai worked best. I would definitely stay here again, and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a family-oriented, oceanfront property.

Reviews.Title: “WAY below my expectations”
Reviews.Author: w00tTang
Reviews.Content: In Lahaina for business for a week, and was really expecting a nice stay based on the reviews. However, I was very, very disappointed in this hotel. My room looked like a page out of the 70's that has not been updated since. I made a list of the following issues: Only internet offered was wireless. It was free, but you got what you paid for. Signal was * terrible *, and considering I was there for work it was essentially worthless. Forget staying connected to your corporate VPN. In addition, the company that runs their internet support (which I called twice) had me on hold for 20 min both times, and I never even got to speak to an agent. Appliances looked run down, and like they were purchased in the 70's. 2 of the 4 oven burners were worthless as they were too off-balance to use. Over half of the dishes that I tried to use out of the cupboard were dirty. The carpet was dingy and stained throughout. The tiles in the shower were dirty and moldy, and outside of the tub the tiles were cracked and corroded. The shower sprayed from a leak at the top so that if you did not make a tight seal between the shower curtain and the wall, the toilet and floor outside of the shower would get soaked. The plastic knob that adjusts the water temp in the shower was broken so that I was stuck with the temp of the water, which fortunately was at least luke-warm. Both the shower drain and the bathroom sink drain backed up each time I used them. There were lots of little bugs, the gnat-y kind that you see around rotten fruit. They were incredibly annoying and ubiquitous. You had to pay $9/day for parking. The hotel tries to convince you this is a great deal by telling you "you can come in and out as many times a day as you like" All-around tacky and out-dated design. The birds! Oh my god, the birds! The numerous trees in the courtyard of the hotel apparently attract THOUSANDS of birds in the morning and evening hours, and the cacophony was so loud that I literally had to close the sliding glass doors to have a conversation on the phone. I have never heard such a loud assembly of birds in my life. Luckily my bedroom was on the opposite side of the room from the courtyard, or I would not have been able to sleep past whatever time in the a.m. they started to congregate. Now, to be fair, there was a few positive things about the hotel: Nice lobby. Friendly staff. VERY conveniently located across the street from restaurants, coffee shop, grocery store, dive shop, and bar. All in all, a very disappointing experience. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a gem!”
Reviews.Author: lbdsdraper
Reviews.Content: from the moment we entered the lobby, we were treated like family! We stayed in room 156, just steps from the ocean. Room is beautiful, grounds are immaculate, and staff is awesome. Front desk just informed me because of our late departure we were welcome to use a room to change in before our latenight flight, so that we could enjoy the beach all day. Kids programs were available for $25 a day. This place is great! Thanks for making our stay absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Price”
Reviews.Author: teevs2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 814. Overall: Ok for the price you pay. Cleanliness: Room was great with clean bathroom, kitchen etc. View: It is an ocean view room, the ocean view is good, but is partially blocked by another wall. Another drawback was that if you look down at the street, there is a big garbage container which is not very nice too look at. Service: Service was good, no complaints Extra charges: $2.50/day for room locker, but it's optional. $9/day for car parking. Hotel Restaurant: Called "Beach Club". We ate breakfast and dinner....food was below average, won't recommend. Would rather go out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Despite many positive reviews - don't ignore the negatives”
Reviews.Author: hermitchness
Reviews.Content: It is important to know that this facility has a very high concentration of guests at any one time. This makes it typically very crowded and noisy. As some reviewers mentioned, the pools are small, hot tubs limited, and all are usually crowded. The facility is largely dated - although our kitchen had new appliances, the covering in the tub and on the tile walls in the bathroom was peeling off. Additionally, the walls are poorly insulated. Moreover, we found it difficult to sleep with the light from the parking lot coming in the bedroom window, the people coming and going at all hours, and the noise. Overall, if you have ever lived in a very large, multi-floor apartment complex wtih many children, you will know what to expect. If you have never lived under those conditions, don't look for this to be an intimate, quiet place with a nice beach.

Reviews.Title: “Former Travel Agent gives it 2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: ihearttheocean
Reviews.Content: As a former travel agent for many years you can be sure I did my homework making sure I was getting the best value for my money...and Kaanapali Shores did not disappoint! I was impressed with everything about it, from check in, to parking, to the room, to the pools and the beach. The Expedia had many activities that we were able to book right on site, as well as rent snorkel equipment and boogie boards. The only drawback was that my son also cut his foot the first day on the rocks and coral in the ocean right out front. Perhaps a sign warning the guests of this might be appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room location”
Reviews.Author: MauiLoverCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Kaanapali Shores was arranged by Carolyn at AAA, Newark, CA. This was our first trip back to Maui in 32 years and we loved every minute. We hated to leave! We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit which overlooked the beach. The view was fantastic from the lanai. We were able to spot a whale! The kitchen and baths were better than we have in our home! It seems like it had been recently renovated. The restaurant was very good and convenient. The location is very convenient to the Whaler's Village area and to Lahaina. We would definitely stay here again. We're looking forward to returning to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireLaura54
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this wonderful place. My husband and I spent our honeymoon there 15 years before this and it was paradise. Beautiful grounds, very pleasant people. Our second trip we renewed our vows on the beach and could not think of a better place to have been. I am already thinking about our 3rd trip there. Laura Akins, Thornton, NH

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: familylikes2travel
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for all ages. We love the ocean, so staying right on the beach was perfect. The beach here is decent, fairly narrow, but enough room for the beach chairs provided. Definitely bring reef shoes, because there is sharp coral in front of this resort and I cut my foot the first day, and I noticed others did as well. You can snorkel right here and see lots of tropical fish, coral and turtles. We stayed in room 732 on the 7th floor booked through VRBO. The owners were very detailed in their explanation of the room and resort, so we knew exactly what we were getting. They provided everything we needed for the week. The room was perfect for us, with a bit of an ocean view. It is not on the sunny side of the building, which was fine because the room stayed cool, a definite plus in this climate. The restaurant had good service, but the food is just o.k. The restaurant at the resort beside (The Beach Club) is way better. The staff is helpful and friendly. Servers will walk around the pool to serve food and drinks. They have small shops where you can buy food, alcohol, bathing suits, clothes, hats, gifts...etc. They also have a salon for hair and nails. You can walk along the beach for miles. We definitely recommend this place, but if you book through the resort, ask for an updated room. The Old Lahaini Luau was excellent. Go early to enjoy the activities, including a lesson on how to dance by one of the beautiful dancers. The road to Hana was fabulous. Take a motion sickness pill if you get car sick. We went all the way around which we recommend. The newly opened road was great. The helicopter tour was pretty good. You see the crater from above and many waterfalls. Our favourite restaurant was the Pacific'O in Lahaina. Right on the water, the food and service was perfect. Bubba Gumps was fun for lunch. There are wonderful beaches everywhere, so get the Maui Revealed book and go exploring. Maui is more on the pricey side, so be prepared to spend more on food than you would normally. Load up at Costco. We had a wonderful vacation. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteKD
Reviews.Content: I would not reccomend this place to anyone. I found it to be very average. There has got to be better places to stay in Maui! Our suite was renovated and was big and nice, but the rest of the hotel was old and rundown. The pools were okay, but were cold and boring. The restuarant was very average! It was small portions of fast food meals (and was way over priced). The towel bins by the pools were often empty. The hotel service was non--existant. There was mention of kid camp, but I didn't see any signs of it. I will say the cleaning service in our room was excellent. The beach was nice. I didn't find the water too rough for our young kids (5 and 7). They were able to body surf a little. I walked by the pink hotel next door and their pool area looked way more exciting (waterfalls and waterslides). Seriously, if you're paying that much for a vacation, go elsewhere! I disagree with people that you don't spend time in your room so it doesn't matter. I expect my rooms to be top-of-the-line every vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay - First time to Maui”
Reviews.Author: California19
Reviews.Content: We have returned from a trip last weekend. We were there the week of Thanksgiving. This was our first trip to Maui. The Hotel stay was excellent for the price we paid. Hotel has easy access to the beach, the staff was friendly and our kids enjoyed in the pools. They have one big and small pool for little kids. They have good restaurant next to the pool and we got $100 credit at checking time. If you are travelling with kids under 12 they have good activities I highly recommend this hotel with kids - they had free scuba diving classes in the pool daily. They have free luau show on wednesday at 5pm next to the pool which was good. Our room was renovated with new cabintes and kitchen counter. In the afternoons we can hear some sound from the renovation work.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: kkaren83
Reviews.Content: A great value for your money. Excellent location! So what if the appliances are a little dated...You don't go to Maui to hang out all day in your room! We paid for a garden view but got an ocean view. Ask for the 9th floor! Pools were great and the ocean was great. The only downside was the copious amount of smokers on the beach- gross. Finally, don't waste your $ on a luau, instead eat local at the Aloha Mixed Plate!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at K Shores. We stayed about two weeks with a three year old and he loved it. The grounds are very large and well kept. The onsite restrurant was ok, kids get free lunch. The beach out front is great for playing, but better swimming and snorkeling is down the beach a little. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Booking through ResortQuest is nice because housekeeping is included. Much appreciated when traveling with kids. The room was a little older. All furnishings were updated but fixtures and kitchen were dated. Very clean and operational, so no big deal. It looked like remodeling is underway through out the property. All the staff were very kind and helpful. Thank you Kaanapali Shores for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it again”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: The Resort Quest Kaanapali Shores was great for the 2nd time! After our first stay in Oct 2006, we stayed elsewhere in 2007, and could not wait to return in 2008! We were not disappointed by the resort. The grounds are beautiful, and the sandy beach is very welcoming. The Beach Club Restaurant on property serves good meals, and the pool side bar has yummy refreshments! We had oceanview unit 928, a 1 bedroom, 1 bath unit. The bathroom was spacious, the kitchen was very nice, and the living room was very comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfortable--something that you don't always get in in a vacation setting. The ocean view of Molokini was beautiful, but that is the only good view we had. Our other view was of the back of the other wing of the property, and the parking lot next door at the Papakea. You have to leave the room and go down to the beach to see the sunset. The entrance to our unit was outdoor, and had some noise outside of the bedroom window as people returned late to their rooms. All in all, I can't wait to return to the Kaanaplai Shores!

Reviews.Title: “not to go back to resort quest kanapali shores, maui”
Reviews.Author: Kmdale
Reviews.Content: First of all, the on line pictures look great of the room. But, believe me, its old , smelly and depressing. Very old! This is a 2.5 star and no more. Now, if for some unfortuneate reason you are already committed and arrive only to see black mold in your bathroom, don't panic just request to be moved. Also, DO NOT use expedia downstairs in the lobby. Oh sure they will offer you a continental breakfast to sway you, but don't bother. They are a HUGE rip off. You can get better deals with Boss frog on the main drag "front street". Of course expedia will tell you that you have to listen to a timeshare, if you use another vender, but not so. Maui is very expensive (trust me, a am not a budget type person), and very much over rated. But, until you go, and figure it out for yourself, you will not understand. I found the locals to be rather rude and really do not like tourist. Sad, because without you and me, there 1 br condos would not be a million dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: njvacationer51
Reviews.Content: Walking into the resort, we had high expectations. Great lobby and grounds. Parking though is $20/day, so beware. We booked a 2 bedroom with oceanview. Room was old with old furnishings and old kitchen (green appliances older than my kids) new TV in living room, but non in the bedrooms. Oceanview was if you stuck your head out of the balcony you saw ocean. Luckily for us, we did a lot of stuff during the day and only slept at the hotel. Very crowded pool. You could not swim in the ocean as there were many rocks. Had to walk down the beach to another hotel to swim. Would not stay there again. many people thought it was great, so they had the lucky room. BTW, we tried to switch rooms, but since we booked on-line, we got the special deal and they could not move us.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapail Shores a great place for families”
Reviews.Author: TravelguruVentura
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few nights at Resort Quest's Kaanapali Shores in a 1 bedroom garden view unit with my son and it was very comfortable. Large spacious unit with a well equipped kitchen, large living area and separate bedroom. For a garden view category our view was nice and we could actually see the ocean through the palm trees. Nice pool area with a good happy hour and kid's eat free there under 12 for lunch only. Charging for a room safe and to park is a little tacky but all in all a grat place to have a s a base camp to explore Maui. Very comortable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “loved Maui”
Reviews.Author: jotrips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two week stay in Maui. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary. This trip turned out to be one of the best vacations we've ever had. I was a bit nervous about having to find our way to the hotel from the airport on the north side of the island at 12:00 at night. We picked up our Mustang convertible at the airport, rolled the top down and a leisurely 45 minutes later, we arrived at the hotel just as they had reassured me we would. Resortquest Kaanapali Shores turned out to be a perfect match for us. The one bedroom oceanview was clean and comfortable with a nice big king size bed. The kitchen had everything you needed, stove, frig, microwave, coffeemaker, kettle, pans, utensils, etc. The washer/dryer combo was handy too. Our maid service everyday was great. Lots of big fluffy towels always supplied. Room was always spotless. Very nice ladies. One little glitch though, you have to make sure that the sliding balcony doors are locked and pushed all the way to the left side to get the air conditioner to work. You'll hear it click on after a minute. The Star Market across the street is so convenient. It was not worth it to drive to Lahaina to go to the Safeway store there. The beach was very nice. Be careful of the rocks in some sections of the water. You can walk in quite easily if you go to the left of the beach and enter where the chain of red buoys are in the water. We toured the whole island and found that we were quite happy with our choice of hotel. Some of the other hotels I had been looking at would not have had as convenient beach access. Of course, there were others that looked fantastic too. We went to the Old Lahaina Luau, the most authentic luau on the island. It was a terrific show with great food and drinks. It is one of the most popular shows and you should reserve your seats a couple of weeks before you arrive. It doesn't apply to the 2 for 1 luau offers but it is well worth the extra money. Next door to the Lahaina Luau is their sister restaurant, The Aloha Mixed Plate which serves typical Hawaiian meals at really low prices. Great for a little snack with a seaside setting. For more upscale dining, we enjoyed Sansei restaurant and the Plantation Clubhouse in the Kapalua golf complex and Kimo's in Lahaina. The Hula Grill at Whaler's Village is great too with a fantastic setting for sunset dinners. There was great snorkelling at Black Rock - had a huge sea turtle come right over my shoulder there. Best spots are close to the rock walls and around the tip of the outcropping. Be careful of the waves though, visibility can be low when it's not calm and there are lots of coral and rocks you can get pushed into. Another great place was Honolua Bay near Kapalua. It's a rock beach though but well worth it. It was very calm and clear when we went there. Lots of tour boats take snorkelling groups there. The best area to see fish and coral is on the right side of the bay, north side. There isn't a sign to indicate where to stop for Honolua bay but you'll notice a lot of cars parked on the road and in a small parking area in a really lush valley near Kapalua. The bay isn't visible from the road, you have to follow a nature trail down to the water. Don't miss Iao State Park, Haleakala crater and the road to Hana which you should leave really early in the morning for. You don't want to drive back in the dark on all those hairpin turns. On the way to Lahaina, not far from the hotel there's a place called CJ's Diner in the Fairway Mall. They will pack a beautiful picnic lunch for you when you go on these long drives. For $5 they will supply you with a styrofoam cooler to use while you are in Maui. You just drop it off when you're done and get your deposit back. It's really convenient since some of the places can be a bit remote with no food or drinks available. We had the best vacation ever. We felt safe at all times. No problem with thefts from our car although we were warned that they happen a lot. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We will want to go back to Maui again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly View”
Reviews.Author: Donnakei
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent our birthdays at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores recently and had a wonderful experience. We had a penthouse suite with a spectacular view of the island of Lanai and the beautiful Pacific Ocean. The unit was very comfortable and clean. We really liked having a kitchen and a washer/dryer in our unit. It was delightful to have breakfast on our balcony while listening to the birds and enjoying the gorgeous view. The hotel was centrally located to everything we wanted to do. In one direction, we were just a short drive to Front Street and all the shops and restaurants. In the other, was another short drive to Napili and Kapalua. Conveniently located directly across the street from the hotel was a full market and a few places to eat. This is the second time we've come here and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Way Beyond Expectation!”
Reviews.Author: BlindGoofy
Reviews.Content: First of all I just want to say thank you so much to the staff at Kaanapali Shores! From the first when we pulled up after a long day of traveling and late flights, we were welcomed with warm smiles & what we've come to understand is the true Aloha spirit. This genuine hospitality continued throughout our entire 10 night stay. When our daughter became ill, and we needed to delay our departure for several days the hotel staff responded with flexibility and compassion. They allowed us to stay on in our room at very short notice even though the hotel was booked to capacity (including our room). They gave us the best possible rate for the room during our extended stay as well. These were real ways that that a big resort owned by a big corporation showed that they cared for us as guests and valued our business. Very impressive! The day to day care from housekeeping, front desk, grounds keeping, restaurant staff, bell desk were all exceptional as well. At no time were we ever made to feel like we were inconveniencing staff, or that we were an interruption to their day. Quite the contrary, we felt like we were the reason they were there; to give us the best vacation time possible. The resort itself was perfect for us, a family of five. The condo rooms were spacious and well appointed without being stuffy or formal. The full kitchen was a real treat to have at hand, and it was stocked with all the hardware needed to prepare and eat meals. There is also a full grocery store across the street, and shops on the hotel's ground floor offering whatever a vacationing family might need at reasonable prices. This is a wonderful place for families with kids from very young to teenagers. There is quite a bit of information right at the hotel about what to do while in Maui. Especially recommended is the orientation breakfast your first morning there. Yeah, it's a bit of a sales pitch, but if you're new to Maui you'll get some important info & discounts. The resort grounds are beautiful, tastefully done and conveniently arranged. The moment we pulled in the driveway we knew we had made the right accommodations choice. Luxurious, easy on the eyes and easy-going would be a good way to put our first impression. The pool/garden/restaurant area between the high-rises was also a delightful place. Walks along the well manicured lawns with little streams, waterfalls and the abundance and variety of trees and shrubs are some of my favorite memories. Add 2 pools, 2 jacuzzi, the amazing beach and a gorgeous sunset and you have a pretty well wrapped package. Another little thing that I liked as a husband and father was that I never felt afraid to let my wife and three teenage daughters roam around the grounds after dark. There were uniformed security on the job all the time as far as I could tell. They were there, but nice and low key. Kaanapali Shores was the best. We will be telling our family and friends about the good times we had there, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Garden Area Noisey”
Reviews.Author: nastybeach
Reviews.Content: When we checked in late at night the front desk had shown me where my room was. It was on the 6th floor above the lobby. I had booked an oceanview room with my travel agent and the desk clerk said yes this was an oceanview room. I could see the oceans way out between the trees in the gardens. You could call this partial ocean view. The next morning we were woken up around 4:30am by the hundreds of birds that seem to flock into the garden area at sunset each evening and flock off at 4:30 in the morning EVERY MORNING! I don't know if the birds are seasonal or do this all the time, but we were not too happy about being woken up every morning. I found that the hotel also nickel and dimed you to death. The gym was 10 dollars a day and a cot was 30 dollars a day. You could use the tennis courts for free, but bring your own raquets as they charge to use theirs. The resort is very nice, be careful where your room is that you booked. Make requests to your travel agent not to be in the courtyard with the birds. Kaanapali area is definitely better than the Kihei area. Across the street is a great coffee shop and grocery centre. The beach was great. Pools were great. Hot tubs were great. Staff was very friendly and accomodating with food allergies. It would be nice if the hotel just put the cost of parking your car into the hotel rate along with all the other incidentals. Maui is a great place and yes I would go back to this hotel, but I would request to not be near the garden area.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: lovelivelaugh14
Reviews.Content: Let me first start off by saying that Maui is absolutely stunning--the prettiest island that I have ever been to. While I enjoyed my stay in Maui, my vacation could have been better had KS honored my request for a renovated room. I have never written a review before--I am pretty easy going--but I feel compelled to warn others. I originally made reservations at Aina Nalu but changed one month before my trip when I realized that KS had lanais and renovated rooms. When I first called to reserve the room I explained that it was a birthday celebration and requested a renovated room. A few weeks later, I called again to make sure that the request was noted and I paid for the room in full. I arrived at KS on Sept. 25 after 13 hrs of traveling--guess what? no notation of my request. The next "available" renovated room was only available on the last 2 days of my trip. I was tired and frustrated so I did not argue. When I got to my unrenovated room on the 5th flr I was disappointed. We were overlooking the back parking lot and the appliances/furniture were outdated. I called the front desk and asked for a room on a higher flr--I was told that it would take a few days to move to a room on a higher floor. We survived in our room and later moved to the renovated room for the last 2 days of our trip (the renovated room was amazing) However, the entire time I regretted canceling my reservations at Aina Nalu. So, while I will be back in Maui next year (it's that amazing) I will not be staying at KS--too much money to gamble with the chance of KS not honoring a request for a renovated room. I will instead stay at Ainu Nalu where all the rooms are beautiful. I wish that KS, resortquest more specifically, would attempt to do more to please their customers. We all know that a trip to Maui is pretty expensive. A room can make or break a vacation. And Btw--I've realized that a stellar review will usually pop up after a not so good review. Hum...I wonder where those come from? See u later Maui--but not in Kaanapali shores

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the resort!!”
Reviews.Author: djz032070
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a week at the resort. Upon arrival, we were happily greeted, given a $100 food credit for the restaurant, and sent to our newly renovated one bedroom suite with a garden view (which we upgraded to a week before our trip). That evening, we were sent a complimentary bottle of champagne (it was our anniversary). Through the week, the staff were friendly and very helpful with any questions we had. Housekeeping was VERY attentive. The grounds were immpeccable. Everything was awesome! They even let us stay late on our last day without charge! Thanks Shores!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: cocoa816
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation and was charged $300, equivalent to two nights stay. Again, before arrival, my banking account was frozen with an additional charge of the remainder of the stay. Since when do hotels charge before the END of your stay? I called the hotel and had the charge removed. Upon arrival at the hotel, I thought the lobby was very nice. We checked in very late, around 2am (due to a late flight). Shopping the next day, my card was declined. I returned to the hotel and checked my account online to see a huge total with well over $200 unaccounted for. I asked the front desk personnel about it. At first, each of them "did not know where the extra charges came from." Then, a supervisor came with an explanation. Apparently, there is a $40 a day charge for "possible" incidentals, totalling $200. Also, the hotel places an authorized hold on the total amount of the stay at check in plus several fees of their liking. Both of these things were to be explained by the gentleman who checked us in, however he neglected to do so. The hotel is nice and service is great, but watch your bill and don't be afraid to ask questions. I felt like more of my time was spent watching my bank account, than enjoying my vacation. The extra fees are not a problem, unless they are hidden. Resorts should disclose all fees up front, so that customers are not left in the dark or with frozen accounts!

Reviews.Title: “7th time around and less impressed than ever.”
Reviews.Author: becksyvee
Reviews.Content: It was our 7th time staying at ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores hotel (formerly Astin Kaanapali Shores). Overall it is a beautiful hotel with great grounds and excellent beach access (crystal clear water with great snorkeling right in front of your hotel!). This time around however we are fairly disappointed to put it lightly. Upon entering our room we noticed a musty smell throughout. Brushed it off as needing to open the windows and doors (which bedroom windows do not open in any of the rooms apparently) to get a little cross ventilation through out the hotel room. We gave it 2 days and in the evening of day 2 after my daughter and mother in law sleeping in the musty room had aquired runny noses, headaches and hacking coughs we said enough and called the front desk. My husband and I both are general managers in the service industry and here are our main points of contention: 1. The guest comfort and safety should be a priority. We were not listened to and were definitely not a priority. 2. Your word should be followed through on. When you say someone will help to move our 6 bags of luggage and 4 bags of groceries to a different room, it should be followed thorugh on. Instead we waited for a new room for 9 hours. Were not called but instead rushed out of the original room only to be told to "call us when you are out". No follow through and again poor customer service. 3. Although we did get another room (seemlingly smaller than our original), we had then spent 9 hours waiting in the same musty/mildew ridden room. The bigger issue is that the manager should have addressed it with us the guest after the 4th time that we contacted the front desk. Instead when we walked down to the front desk, the manager sat in the back office and allowed the same front desk gentleman to tell us we will contact you when it is ready, but it will be somewhere around 3 p.m. No one ever did call our room. We were alerted when housecleaning came up to clean out the original room. An appology and a simple sense of urgency is all that was needed. We spent the beginning of our once a year family vacation waiting for a hotel room that should have been fine from day one. We were made to feel as if they were doing us a favor!!! 4. In addition, the carpets really need to be steam cleaned. We could not walk on the floors unless wearing flip flops due to the soles of our feet becoming covered with dirt from the carpet. It would be our hope that in the future the guest is their first priority and that such issues would be taken more seriously. Guests should be listened to and management should have better follow through and not allow guests to feel as if they are one on a list of 15 to "deal" with that day. Even if they in fact are. That follow through on commitments made should be the rule and not the exception. And finally that upkeep on the rooms in the hotel go beyond everyday cleaning as the air in the first room that we stayed in is not suitable for any person(s).

Reviews.Title: “MEMORABLE EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Zampa-Aiea
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband for his birthday with a Hawaii Superferry ride to Maui and a weekend at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores! It has been about 15 years since my last stay there and it is still the same wonderful full-service condominium resort with a lot more amenities than I last remembered! Although I know that room views are on a request basis only, we were lucky to get an upgrade; the staff welcomed us like they knew us and were always able to answer my questions from where to golf...to what Maui goodies to take home. The location is awesome, the restaurant has killer breakfasts and an incredible Hula Pie (I forgot what it was called, but it was so good that I probably could do the Hula! It's an icecream pie with fudge and strawberry topping). We didn't have the opportunity to use the pools, but did sit out on the beach and take in the incredible views, walk the grounds that was highlighted by the local "mynah birds", and the accommodations were marvelous to say the least! I would recommend this resort for everyone, families, singles, couples travelling together, honeymoon/anniversary or special occasions. Since money is tight now days, if you want to make the best of your Hawaiian vacation...now is a great time to travel, and RQ Kaanapali Shores is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: inetken
Reviews.Content: I read reviews after we had booked this vacation spot and began to have doubts. I can tell you Kaanapali Shores is an ideal place to stay. We had a Garden View Room that had a fantastic view of the beach. The room was clean, the housekeeping excellent and staff friendly. We were pleasantly surprised from the lobby to the first opening of the door to our room. Close to Lahaina and and excellent area to stay in. The pools were fun for the kids and the beach was beautiful, great for watching sunsets. Having a grocery store across the street is convenient, and if you don't like it, there is another a short distance towards Lahaina. If I had one complaint, that is the food in the restaurant is average. The service was, again, excellent as was the rest of our stay. The staff was up front with the parking and safe (we knew about the parking when we booked our vacation). Thanks for making our vacation so enjoyable. This is definitely an underrated destination.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: batesy16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Kaanapali Shores in June. It was a dream vacation. The resort was beautiful. It is north of the busy Kaanapali Beach area. We liked that we were more secluded and in a quiet area. It was a short drive to our Luau at the Hyatt and the Trilogy sunset cruise. The beach was short but very pretty and clean. The pools were nicely kept and there was always a chair available. The rooms were spacious and clean with a comfy bed! We were in a unit that had just been remodeled. The only trouble we had with the room was a closet door came off the hinges. We called the front desk and it was fixed the next morning. It was a great convenience to have a washer/dryer in the unit. We did a lot of hiking and it was nice to wash our clothes immediately. Our room included a $100 credit at the beach club, the on site restaurant. I read some poor reviews about the restaurant before we left. We experienced great meals and service at a reasonable price. We ate breakfast there twice and lunch three times for a little over $100! The macadamia nut pancakes and kalua pork are delicious! I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants to be away from large crowds of tourists but close enough to enjoy the activities on Kaanapali beach. If you are taking a sailing trip I would recommend spending a little extra and go through Trilogy sailing company. They are very personable and they do not over crowd the boats. We did a sunset cruise and it was just breathtaking. They serve delicious hearty appetizers and you can bring your own bottle of wine! If you book a tour before you leave you can save 10% by booking on line. If you want to attend one of the more famous luaus be sure to book a few weeks before you leave. We ended up using a buy one get one luau coupon from our resort. I called the resort to make the reservation for us the week before we left. We went to the Drums of the Pacific luau. It was fabulous. The narrator told the history of the island as the performers danced. The food was good and the mai tais were watery but the pineapple rum drinks were excellent. We had an amazing time on maui! We saved a lot of money by eating in a few nights and using our resort credit. (there is a Star grocery store across the street from the Kaanapali Beach Resort and a Safeway in Lahaina). We stocked up at the Wal-Mart near the airport as soon as we got off the plane! We took picnic lunches with us when we did the West Maui Mountain drive and the Road to Hana. (there aren't many places to stop for lunch)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: tstr
Reviews.Content: This was the second part of our vacation. After 3 nights in Oahu at a Marriott we spent 6 nights at Kaanapali Shores. I had booked a one bedroom Gardenview room but had requested a renovated room on a high floor. The room I received was perfect. It had been renovated and offered what I would term a partial oceanview. It was spacious, clean, quiet and had everything you would need. There were four of us and it was a welcome relief over a hotel room. The staff was very friendly. The grounds as has been mentioned previously were superb and beautiful. Yes, the beach was not as nice as in the main hotel strip but it was much less crowded and more relaxing. Plenty of chairs at pool and beach and towels were available whenever you needed them. We went to Black Rock and snorkeled and I am glad we decided to stay here instead of south of here. We did have a few issues with plumbing but they were taken care of in a timely manner. Restaurant had a decent breakfast and bar had good Mai Tai happy hour from 3:30-5:30 for $4.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to lock up valuables”
Reviews.Author: PeggyNC
Reviews.Content: My family recently spend 10 days at Kaanapali Shores. We had 2 rooms on 8th floor. The hotel was very nice, but we had a bad experience with the maids. Had to leave room while maids cleaned up and left ring beside laptop on bar. When we returned, ( as maids were leaving) the ring was gone !
