We questioned them,offered a reward, and reported it to security. Little did they care. Hotel was nice, but don't leave valuables in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: QuoVadis70
Reviews.Content: The first impression upon walking into the open-air lobby was "wow", and we weren't disappointed. We (3 adults, 2 children) stayed in a two-bedroom suite on the seventh floor, overlooking the nicely landscaped courtyard. The rooms were tastefully furnished and clean; kitchen adequately supplied with pots/flatware,etc; and the washer/drier combo was an unexpected premium. Two pools kept the kids entertained. They also loved the small beach fronting the property. Great sand for building sandcastles and small waves that were ideal for bodysurfing. The restaurant is not fancy, but it has a good selection of moderately priced meals ... from prime rib to hamburgers. We found the Kaanapali Shores a great value and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wongka
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding and were very pleased. The room was clean and we loved the beautiful garden view. The birds were a bit noisy early in the morning since we always kept the patio doors open. Service was impeccable and the staff were very friendly. The restaurant served delicious food. At the time of our stay, one of the pools was undergoing renovations, but we still were able to enjoy the other pool and easy access to the beach. We are planning a return trip to Maui to celebrate an anniversary and would not hesitate staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NortheastRob
Reviews.Content: Dear Kaanapali Shores Staff, Recently, my wife and I stayed at your hotel. (05/16/2008 to 05/31/2008) Our room was#806.We had a single bedroom with a partial ocean view. A full kitchen with washer and dryer. We would both like to say thank you for a job well done. Everyone that we had contact with was very,very nice. The house cleaning staff for our room was excellent. The security guard that we had contact with was very nice. (An older gentleman).The front desk people were also very nice.The staff at the Beach Club were also very nice. This made for a very positive experience. All the people working at this hotel that we had contact with made us feel very welcome. The grounds of this hotel were kept neat and clean. We had a great view from the eighth floor. I saw one person on his hands and knees cleaning the flagstone with a scrub brush. The staff always seemed to be working very hard at this hotel, to keep it clean inside and out. A very nicely managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: BL24
Reviews.Content: After a huge disappointment at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Villas, the Kaanapali Shores exceeded our expectations in all facets. We booked a great rate via Hotwire for a studio condo which was on the 7th floor and had a great view of the ocean and Molokai. Our room appeared to be recently renovated as the kitchen, appliances and furnishings were all in great condition. The only exception was a slightly older TV, but this is Maui and we didn't travel here to watch TV in the room. We enjoyed dining at the on-site restaurant and found the prices to be very fair. The grounds and pools are very nice and the beach was much better than other hotel beaches we've experienced in the area. We always found the resort to be quiet at nighttime-we never heard anyone in rooms next to ours or outside. The entire facility was what I would call comfortable- not too fancy yet far from basic. I highly recommend staying here- the Kaanapali Shores is very deserving of it's TripAdvisor Best Value 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: sunsearcher007
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Islands so I may not be judging fairly, although I have traveled many places around the globe. I feel that this was a terrific value for the $. Following are the goods and bads in my opinion. I felt that the GARDEN AREA was fantastic- traditional-coy pond two standard pools, 2 spas walking trails that travers the area. I'm understanding that they may be removeing some of this for an up-to-date swimming park; I hope not. Next on the list of good things was the at RESORT SHOPPING--They have several small stores on the lower level which include everything from groceries to clothing. All items were very competivly priced. There is shopping across the street but the prices are about the same although drinks were cheeper across the street. The last good value, was the RESORT RESTURANT. The food as compared to other high end resturants was fantastic-everything from fresh fish-n-chips to catch-of-the-day with fresh veggie and 5 star sauces--the price, better than outside resturants. burgers to fancy meals, 11 to 25 $. We eat out several times but we seemed to always go back to the resort resturant. Sorry to say there were some issues with our stay. First, our room was in the (left side as view facing the beach) wing of the resort (7th floor); garden room. It had a nice view of the beach that was a plus, but the AC DID NOT FUNCTION the entire time--no biggy as the room had a small window on the parking lot side and a very large lani sideing door window on the garden/beach side. The problem was the NOISE. The noise on the pool side just echoed between the two wings, and for whatever reason the parking lot noise just seemed to jump into that small window; not sure why. Second not so good item was the beach. It was OK to average, but from the water line out was mixed rocks with sand. You must have water shoes and watch the knees; you will come back with skin up knees. It's fine if you just want to wade to cool off, but forget body suring and be careful if boogie boarding. The last item of issue was our arrangements for a suttle ride back to the airport. Sam (bellman), did great job arranging a taxi van for what they call the "SUTTLE RATE". The problem was that instead of the quoted price of $75.00 for four adults at the end of the 40 minute drive, the driver (who by the way was not the registered licensed person), tried to charge us $94.10. He claimed the he didn't understand english. We even asked him when we got in the van that this was going to be $75--he just knodded. When we got to the airport, it was not until I took his hand-held radio and tried to contact his boss before he excepted the $75. It seemed to us that he was using some elses van and was trying to get the metered rate instead of the quoted rate. Lesson learned verify with your driver before you load up, the actual cost of the shuttle. Other than that I would stay here again but I'd more chosey about the room location.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha! Maui was great!”
Reviews.Author: howmuchlonger
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't make me want to write a review which in translation means it was neither great nor terrible. Typically consumers are only compelled to share their experience when they feel strongly one way or the other. My experience was neutral. The grounds were nice enough. I would describe the resort as clean. The room was outdated. Fixtures were from the 70s. The pools were nice and of good size. If you want a lounge chair at the front pool you need to get there around 9 am. Towels are provided near the pool area if you choose to leave yours at home. The beach is absolutely beautiful, however, it is rather narrow. At certain times of the day there really isn't much beach to lounge/walk on. I preferred the beach just south of Black Rock. The hotel is close to Lahaina (great place for shopping and restaurants) and also a short distance from Whaler's Village. This is a great place for a family looking for a more economical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Brian015
Reviews.Content: The condo is right on the beach. You can walk out of your room and be on the beach in about a minute. The beaches at the neighboring locations (Hyatt, Marriott) were not as nice. Yes, there are some rocks, so get a pair of water shoes. You only have to worry about the rocks if you are going to get in the ocean. Strolling along the beach barefoot was perfect. I was able to snorkle between the Kaanapali Shores and the Kaanapali Beach Club (for free). I enjoyed snorkling near the condo better than the snorkling trip I paid for out at Molokini. The room was above my expectations. New kitchen / bath and very clean. Check in was simple and easy. I was able to check in an hour early with no problem. Staff was always friendly and helpful. The restraunt on site was average. The food was fine. The small pools are nice for older children and adults. There are no shallow areas. Other pools in the area are better (Hyatt and Marriott) with water squirting everywhere, shallow areas, caves, water falls, etc. Overall I really enjoyed the Shores. If they had a great pool area, The Shores would be perfect. Oh, by the way forget loading up at Costco on the way to the Condo. The "Star Market" is right across the street (walking distance). The prices are a little high but you don't have the huge bags of stuff that Costco has.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable quality”
Reviews.Author: miles2go4me
Reviews.Content: The ResortQuest Kaanapali was a good value for our family of 4. Clean, comfortable, pleasant staff, tidy grounds made for a terrific week. The sunsets are beautiful, but the swimming beach is rocky and the sand beach is shallow. Better beach swimming and snorkeling is just to the south Black Rock, only 10 minutes away. There is a great little coffee shop in the strip mall across the street called Java Jazz serving breakfast, and the grocery store (although pricier than the Safeway in Lahaina, 20 mintues away) is convenient. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in West Maui”
Reviews.Author: dhkim
Reviews.Content: We spent almost a week here at the end of May 2008 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The facilities, especially the Lobby and the grounds, are nice and well-maintained. Our studio was well-appointed and in good shape. The staff was very helpful and arranged a snorkeling cruise and a photo shoot for us. The location is very convenient, only 5 minutes from the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali. There is a nice Star Market and some decent restaurants close by. One minus is that the beach in front is thin and rocky, but if you just walk a few minutes south, you get to a nice beach and, if you just drive a few minutes, you can hit several more spectacular ones. All in all, a nice stay. Maui truly deserves all the accolades it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Needs freshen up”
Reviews.Author: fmlaffs
Reviews.Content: I booked a condo for the commodities and was not disappointed. The appartment was spacious and the complex well located. There's a strip mall right across the street.Pools, and gardens satisfactory. The beach not so wonderful but its O.K., we went down the road at Black Rock near the Sheraton. The appartment was clean but needs a little freshening up.They started but its incomplete. The colors on the wall are from the eighties. That, you can live with. But the kitchen cabinet need to be changed. They 're made of wood and smell moldy. Everytime you'd open a door, you would get that smell. All the condo's are not the same as they are probably, individually owned, but nevertheless, they should continue renovating. Great for families.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ryandjenni
Reviews.Content: We just got back and I wanted to write this because I think everyone should know what a great place this was.. I have read some of the negatives and to the obviously impossible to please folks who wrote them next time stay at the Hyatt. Overall this place was everything we hoped for, beautiful spacious room, beautiful views, great service, location is close to everything, beach was sandy and great and some descent snorkeling right there if you swim out a little, (some rocks in the water but nothing serious), pools and grounds very well kept, and the food was good at the restaurant. We did learn one valuable lesson.. Make sure you book a room that has been renovated, and preferably one on a higher floor.. We had booked a standard garden view room and when we got there they put us in one on the 2nd floor that was not renovated. When we expressed our distaste for the room the management quickly offered to move us into a more acceptable room.. And it was beautiful.. Even though it was still garden view it had a great view of the ocean and some beautiful sunsets..To the owners of 737 kudos your condo is great.. Trust me I have had apartments myself much smaller and no where near as comfortable as this room... I could live there no problem..First of all the bedrooms have one king and one queen even though the web site says they only have twins in the spare.. We went as two adult couples so this was very important.. The bathrooms are nice and big and the kitchen was stocked with all your needs.. So in the end keep in mind as far as rooms go they aren't all perfect so make sure you either pay for the better ones up front or as we did you can always risk it and hope for the upgrade if it is available when you get there.. If you book through the hotel you can make sure you specify you want renovated rooms only and we suggest you ask for 737.. Thanks to all the staff at the shores for making our stay so wonderful..WE WILL RETURN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Aloha Suite”
Reviews.Author: RelaxWhenPossible
Reviews.Content: If you are able to book an aloha suite you will find great views and plenty of room. You are right above the beach and have a wraparound deck which looks out to an uninterrupted view. The size of the suite gave the six of us room to be together or get away. We snorkeled off the beach almost every day and could watch the whales on a daily basis from our balcony. We were able to get pictures which rivaled the ones from the whale watch cruise. They were remodeling suites on our floor, but they really did not bother us. Our suite is probably coming up for a remodel, but everything was comfortable and everything worked. The staff was great. This was one of our best trips to Maui and the hotel was a big part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with resort”
Reviews.Author: andeson245
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay an this hotel. Except for a few minor things, we were happy with the hotel and would return. We arrived 1 hour before check in and asked if we could check in early. Since we couldn't and we only had an hour more, we decided to leave our luggage with the bell man and do our grocery shopping. We returned from the grocery store at 3:05 (5 minutes after check in). We were told are room would not be ready for another 45 minutes. We did however make a special request for ground floor, and renovated room, so we were not to upset. The room was recently renovated and very nice and clean. Our neighbors room was not renovated and he was a little disappointed in how run down it was. The grounds are very nice and well kept. We were perfectly happy with our garden view room as we were not in the room much. The pools are on the small side compared to the other resorts but the kids still enjoyed them. The free hula show on Wed. nights is also a special treat. I thought the beach in front of the hotel was just fine. There was a very wide, sandy area, free from rocks for swimming. One of my only complaints is that they nickel and dime you for everything. Parking is $9 a day, use of the safe is $2 a day. Charge for any call outside the hotel, local or not. We tried to make coffee one day but the unit did not have a measuring spoon to measure the coffee. They do supply you with one single use packet but we used that the first day. House keeping will not give you anymore packets so you must buy your own, which is understandable. All the staff seemed helpful and kind. The bell men were especially helpful and friendly. For the price I would definetly come back here especially with kids. This is definetly more of a family resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: JHearn
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a week long stay at this resort. Very nice place if you are traveling with kids. The property has all the amenities you would need. The rooms (we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite) have all the comfort features you would expect. The washer/dryer in room was a huge plus. If the Hyatt is your style then this is not the place for you. What you can expect is a clean and comfortable room at a great price. The fitness center on site is very nice for those interested. It has free weights, machines and cardio machines. Very good for a workout. The Beachfront restaraunt was nice and convenient with food you would expect at say, Applebees or Chile's. The kids were excited about the pools and game room. We liked the grocery and clothing shop on site. The beach is fine if you just want to relax and have a good time. It's not gonna win any awards, but at least it's right there. The property grounds are 5 star. Everything is very beautifully kept. Overall, nice place to stay if you're in an extended group and want to save some money for the fun stuff and dining in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Condo Resort”
Reviews.Author: CapsWife69
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui to attend a friend's wedding. This is a nice condo resort. We checked in and asked for a room on a higher floor and were able to get a room on the 6th floor so we could see the ocean from our balcony. If you are just looking for a condo at a lower price - this is a nice economical option. It's an older resort, but right across the street from a shopping center for groceries, Maui and Sons snorkel rental, etc. Food and service in the restaurant was fine - we had lunch one day and breakfast one day with a $75 restaurant credit with our package. Staff was friendly, wireless Internet was great to have on hand.

Reviews.Title: “Greater Than I Imagined”
Reviews.Author: FlexibleT
Reviews.Content: We arrived and quickly found the ocean side pool. It just so happened that the Polynesian show was going on at the same time. The grounds were absolutely gorgeous! The musicians were playing, the hula dancers were dancing and the "mood" was set for my time in Hawaii. The Mai Tai's were an excellent addition to the fun with the non alcoholic ones being complimentary and the ones with alcohol only $2. The MC was very personable when he announced and asked for honeymoon and anniversary couples to come up to the front. Any one who wanted to could go up and learn how to "hula". We walked along the beautiful beach after the show just to get our feet wet. We received such a warm welcome from the staff! They greeted us with a smoothie and special attention was given, as it was my first time on Maui. I stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was facing the colorful garden area and I was able to see a mountain range off in the distance. The air conditioning had been turned on before I arrived at a very comfortable temperature and I slept soundly in my king size bed. The room was nice and large, very clean and neat and just perfect for my stay. I would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Shores - not worth it”
Reviews.Author: piet10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kaanapali Shores for a week in April. Overall, the condo is well run & clean, and the stay was nice. There are some problems: 1) It is not situated on Kaanapali Beach, but on a small slip of sand north of there. The beach is 10 feet wide and rocky. If you must go to Kaanapali, you need to walk a few hundred yards south. We never swam off the property. 2) There was noisy construction next to us (even on Saturday) and this woke us up every morning. 3) The hot tub is small and always full, and to my thinking unhealthy. 4) They failed to credit me a free 5th night stay, & will not now negotiate. 5) The furniture is at least 15 years old. Stay here if you must, but there are better properties further north or south.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: angg321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores for 6 days and it was wonderful. We rented a garden view, 2 bedroom unit. After reading some reviews, I made sure I requested a renovated unit at check in. The woman nicely searched for about 10 minutes to find us a renovated room. She was unable to find us one for the first 2 nights but told us we could move after the first two nights and she asked me to call right away if our room for the first two nights were unacceptable. I was pleasantly surprised by the not yet renovated room. We had an ocean view (most of the rooms have some sort of ocean view) and the room was totally fine for our needs. There were 6 of us ages 50, 35, 22, 21, 21 and 19. It certainly was not the newest furniture or appliances but it was completely fine. We are not super picky people (which some of the negative reviewers seem to be and find fault with even the littlest things). The maid service was great as well. They made up the beds and cleaned the bathrooms and gave new towels. We are fairly neat people so the amount maid service was perfect for us. We spend a reasonable amount of time in the room and it was totally fine for our needs. We did not switch rooms on the third day because our room was completely acceptable. You have to love the people who pay $300 a night for a condo that sleeps 6, on the beach in Maui and have expectations of staying at the Westin! The grounds are lovely, the pool (we only used the larger pool near the beach) and hot tub were great and the bar/restaurant was good, a little pricey but that is to be expected. The beach is a bit rocky but perfectly fine for swimming and we bought 4 tubes at the ABC store and spent hours in front of the hotel riding the waves and the rocks did not effect us at all. It was a blast and the place was perfect for our needs and our budget. For $300 a night, this place is a palace! Kaanapali Shores exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great area just right for two!”
Reviews.Author: sapphire15
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in a one bedroom condo which we rented through VRBO. Ours was on the 6th floor very near the ocean so we had a perfect view of the beach and the lower pool from our roomy lanai. Our condo was immaculate and perfect for two. We did minimal cooking (mostly breakfast) but really enjoyed having the space that a hotel room just does not have. The grounds here are gorgeous and kept perfectly. There are 2 pools and the beach is fine for sunbathing, though swimming and snorkeling are better at other areas if you are really "into" that. We ate only once at the restaurant because there are so many fabulous restaurants to sample on Maui. What I liked best about this establishment was its size. You did not have to walk miles to get to the beach or anyplace else; everything was so convenient. That would be a real plus if you have small children. If you are looking for nightlife, RQKS is not the place for you. Instead, it was quiet enough to hear the waves at night and that's what we came to Maui for!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience..Topped Off With Whales Right Out Front Of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PortlandBlazer
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Resortquest Kaanapali Shores. I love it there. The new lobby is bright and inviting. My one bedroom oceanview was recently remodeled. Very spacious with a great Hawaiian feel. Met clients for dinner in the beachfront restaurant and the service/food was excellent. To top of a great stay, there were whales right out front of the resort, much to the delight of everyone at the pool and beach!! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive upscale great place to stay and great value”
Reviews.Author: WildBillSEA
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very friendly and helpful. We stayed 6 days and took my wife's 80-yr old dad along too. We made several requests from housekeeping, some unusual like a shower chair for Dad and some pretty common like extra towels and blankets. Housekeeping was right there with just what we needed, and always with a smile. So I give Kaanapali Shores top marks for being helpful. Our unit, a 1-bedroom ocean view, appeared to be recently remodelled. Beautiful granite counter tops, new cabinets, new appliances, new tile. It sure impressed us and seemed really upscale. The kitchen was well appointed and just the right size. And I loved having our own washer/dryer in the room. Top marks for the condition of the room. I loved the location, with the resort sitting right on the beach, the shops on the ground floor, the exercise facility, 2 pools. Everything we could want and more. Top marks for location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: lzlin11
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Kaanapali Shores, we were greeted with smiles and that set the tone for our entire stay. The lobby was open, airy and so nice! There was a computer area with several flatscreens for internet usage at .20 cents a minute, there was a specialty coffee shop and an activity desk. The garden area was beautiful with koi fish and a cute bridge. There is a sundry shop and a gym-though they do charge at the gym. Our room was one of the upgraded ones and it was so nice! (I actually would've minded either way since the newer stove was electric which I personally don't care for-) We were immediately impressed with the appliances and fully stocked utensils. The washer/dryer unit was great. SUGGESTION: STOP AT WALMART OR COSTCO ON YOUR WAY IN FROM THE AIRPORT AS IT IS A 45MINUTE DRIVE BACK TO THIS AREA AND IT WILL SAVE YOU ALOT OF MONEY ON FOOD! The 2 pools & jacuzzi's were awesome. The drinkers tended to stay in the barside jacuzzi but all were welcome. This property is perfect for singles, families, or couples- all !! The beach in the front was swimmable and snorkelable (is that a word) anyway it was the perfect beach and sunset's not to miss! We especially loved the nightly torch lighting and on Wednesday's there is a little hula show by the front pool. There was light housekeeping which was perfect. We requested the phone and safe to be turned off as would not be using them and did not want to be charged extra, that was not a problem. We only paid for parking. The restaurant was excellent and I took the advise of a fellow trip advisor on the Macadamia Nut Pancakes- which were a TRUE HAWAIIAN DREAM COME TRUE with coconut syrup. The kids ate free- but only at certain hours which was a bit of a bummer- but we cooked alot so that was okay. The grounds were immaculate and the staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre - not bad for kids and families, but don't look for service”
Reviews.Author: analyst2
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with another family for 9 days and overall it wasn't bad; but wasn't quite what we were expecting: We stayed in 1 bed condo (1 child) and found it to be ok. The hotel is located close enough to whaler's village for restaurants and shops and most amenities are close by - STAR Market was good (across the street from hotel). Clarify which room you want and I would suggest trying to get 4th floor and above with garden views as most have reasonable ocean views regardless (unless you want the full ocean view). We originally were given a standard room with terrible smells from the canal as well as loud construction noises, and the hotel lobby staff was LESS than sympathetic. So after 1 night we decided on paying for the upgrade; which was on the south side and the trade off was no smells but a lot of outside early am noise with tour busses and garbage trucks in the early A.M. The other family with us had no problems with their room (north side garden view 5th floor), but again the cold response from the front desk upset us. The renovated rooms are nice, but having tried both, my reccommendation would be to work on location rather than renovation. Overall, pools were cold (!) with the lower pool being slightly warmer. The ocean/beach was considerably warmer, and as others have noted, partially sandy with rocks - but the kids had fun. Clean towels in the pool area were hard to come by for the 1st 2 days but they got better. Late checkout was a pipe dream (I stood behind 2 others asking the same thing) which was probably more about departure timing, but they make you wait until 8:30 the night before to get a response. Again, front desk was not at all sympathetic about our plight and I walked away understanding why they couldn't give the room, but more irritated with the cold response I got from the staff - Though they did mention other showers, travelling on a 9PM flight with a 5 year old could have been made easier with an afternoon rest. Overall not a bad spot for first time families with young kids, but not sure about others unless you want to drive everywhere for restaurants, etc. (hotel parking is $9$/Day) Kids club was mediocre and we were with 3 kids 5, 7,9 and none wanted to go back a second day. Gym is just ok, but for $10/day I would have expected something slightly better than old treadmills, 2 elipticles, 2 bikes and no ventilation. Rooms were nice and close so lunch in and rests were nice on the balconcy. The Beach club was decent. I would reccommend the free introductory SCUBA lesson in the lower pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: MargaretShanghai
Reviews.Content: We booked our week stay through Expedia on line. We reserved a Garden View 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite and were very pleased with our accommodations. The location of the hotel is good, near shopping and the higher end resorts. We lucked out and actually had a great ocean view room, plus overlooked the pool so we could watch our children from our balcony. Ask for the renovated rooms - very spacious, kitchen counters in granite, large TV in living area plus another in the master suite. Very spacious and well decorated. Buyer Beware: In booking through Expedia we were told we would receive a $100 food and beverage credit upon check in. We did not, and after making 3 calls that wasted over two hours of our time getting no where we gave up. Tip: Use the Lahaina Ticket Company for your activities reservations. They are very helpful and the prices are much lower than those quoted by Boss Frog, plus you get much better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with very personable and experienced staff”
Reviews.Author: Lanceoak
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay (after Oahu) began with a very personable reception by the bellhops, followed by a smooth check in at reception. All were very friendly and helpful, with the hellhop staying to answer our tourist questions of how to maximize our stay. The room was clean and what would be expected of a condo style room. The restaurant was resonably priced and the staff there ensured our meal was very pleasant. Family oriented as well and relaxed dressing. Our checkout did not correspond with a late flight but we were very graciously accommodated with luggage storage and a room to shower and change (first come-first served). A lovely place to enjoy the beach, central location to visit the highlights of Maui and just chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Spaaaaaaah!!! Best massage ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover1236
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at Kaanapali Shores (we stayed at their sister hotel, the Mahana) but we were fortunate enough to book a massage at their spa on 4/17/08. On a whim one day, my husband decided he wanted a massage so I called and they got us both in that same afternoon. We were met at the front desk by Kelly who was extremely friendly and welcoming but the best part was yet to come. Libby, our Massage Therapist, was outstanding! My husband went first and when he came out he looked the most relaxed I'd ever seen him. He said it was the best massage he had ever experienced and told me he already planned to book another one the following Monday. I typically get several massages a year so my expectations were pretty high. I was not disappointed. Libby used the exact pressure I asked her to and I even opened my eyes once to see her sitting with her knees on the floor in order to get the right angle. I got a 50 minute massage which was around $99. I had the option of having my massage beach side, garden side or inside and I went with inside. I told her that I wanted her to spend more time on my upper back so she worked for 30 minutes on my back and then spent 20 minutes everywhere else. Usually, when I ask a Massage Therapist to do this they have a hard time breaking their routine and I only get about 10 minutes on my back. She really worked on getting the knots out of my back and I felt wonderful when I left. I'm sure the other Therapists are great too, but I would go with Libby if you get the chance. The only challenge is that I think she only works part time in the late afternoon and evening. If you are in Maui for a relaxing vacation, I can't think of a better way to relax than a massage with Libby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: KiheiSands
Reviews.Content: Just spent an extremely relaxing weekend at the Kaanapali Shores. Our one bedroom oceanview room was just what the doctor ordered with all the comforts of home and none of the work. We didn't have to leave the hotel because the poolside, oceanview restaurant offers an array of choices including the decadent "Honokowai Pie" made of Kona coffee ice cream, a chocolate cookie crust topped with gooey fudge. With the ocean steps away and two pools to choose from we never felt as though there were too many people around. I would highly recommend this hotel for a long or short stay ... with or without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: seventogo
Reviews.Content: spent two weeks at the resortquest kaanapali shores for our 20th anniversary/spring break with our kids. we rented a two bedroom oceanview condo thru resortquesst using our entertainment card, and got a wonderful deal and a spectacular room. we were on the top floor of the building with an absolute view of the grounds, pools and the ocean. we watched the whales each morning from our rooms! the front desk was very polite and accomodating. we requested a late check out due to a late flight and they allowed us to stay a few hours extra, and then even allowed us to use a room to shower beyond that check out i f we wanted. as a family of seven, i can say that the condo worked wonderfully well. we could eat meals in if we wanted, we often used the bar be que for family cookouts when we didn't eat out. it is an easy walk up to the room for lunches or snacks. our particular unit was updated and clean and comfortable. i was worried due to some of the reviews, but all worked out great for us. the only minor issue was that the housekeeping often only does minimal stuff since it is a condo. i have stayed in other condo resorts where they did more, but then in others where they did less........... so i guess overall they did ok. i just like them to do the work since i am on vacation..lol! the grounds are so nice and the pools are warm, and the jacuzzi's hot. we were on site for easter, and they had a wonderful easter egg hunt for the kids. my son won a big basket with beach goodies. there is a free hula show on wednesday nights. special drink prices and fun entertainment. pool bar also has a great happy hour every day in the afternoon/early evening. they got to know us each day! great service! we never ate at the restaurant on site, so cannot comment on that. the beach out front does have some rocks, and is perfect for snorkeling right there. it is not a big sandy beach, but most of the beaches have some rocks........ this is maui! there was plenty of sand for my kids to do all the sand activities and i thought the beach was fine, but as others have said, you can move down the beach a few steps to a sandy area. we also took a lot of day trips to other beaches..............NAPILI will always be a fave...........waves for the boogie boards, AND turles if you snorkel! what more could you ask for! we would love to return to kaanaplai shores tomorrow if we could! it is the perfect spot, close enough to everything, yet set apart from the roaring crowds of kaanapali beach.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for us”
Reviews.Author: bt33107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ka'anapali Shores April 1-8. We booked a studio, but were given a one bedroom (yay!). We had a full kitchen and washer and dryer. As others have said, the rooms are on the older side, but the decor seemed recent. Our kitchen appliances were pretty old, but they worked just fine. The room was clean and comfortable. We had an ocean view, only partially obstructed by a building. We were on the top floor (9). We also had a great view of the courtyard area and one of the pools (the quieter one, thankfully!) The pools (2) were nice. The pool nearest the beach was heated and fenced in, and therefore was the most crowded (lots of kids). The farther back pool was much cooler. Both pool areas had jacuzzis. This was definitely a family resort. If you're looking for a very quiet, couples-only hotel this may not be the place for you. As others have reported, the beach right outside the hotel was rocky. We wore water shoes, but you still had to watch your step and go slowly. While we were there, the ocean was kind of rough (at least for us midwesterners!) so we didn't do much ocean swimming there. The beach was a great spot for sunsets and whale watching. One night we saw a whale breach 7 times just about 100 yds out! Across the street was a mini mall with a grocery store and a few restaurants and shops. We ate at Java Jazz a few times (yummy). We did drive to get to most other things. It was about a 5-10 minute drive to Whaler's Village, and about 15 mins to Lahaina. We kind of liked that this hotel wasn't in such a crowded area. There is a restaurant/bar on the property. It was kind of pricey for dinner, food was fine. Since we had a late flight home, we were able to check out of our room and give our bags to the bellman. We were able to use the amenities until 6 pm. We were also given a "courtesy suite" to use for 1 hour to shower and change. This worked out well for us. We would stay here again. It was by no means a luxury resort, but the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the grounds were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: waterpup
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Kaanapali Shores-not impressed! First off-when checking in-we were informed our Aloha Suite booked 9 months earlier was overbooked-and wouldn't be available for three nights-this was the main reason we booked here! This place is old and rather run down. Also this place is not on Kaanapali Beach! It is north of Kaanapali and the beach in front of the hotel is very rocky. It has a good snorkeling spot and a little bit of break for surfing out a little ways but not good for children. I must say the food at The Beach Club was pretty good. Next time we will stay on Kaanapali Beach and snorkel at Black Rock. It was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent”
Reviews.Author: aatayc
Reviews.Content: Dear Scott (hotel manager), I would like to take this opportunity to pass on my family's unreserved thanks for the wonderful stay we recently had at your resort (2/25 to 3/6). We were accommodated in all of our requests without exception and it made the family holiday perfect. My parents had flown from Australia to be with us and the two adjoining ground floor units were perfect to allow Nanni and Grandpa to be with their grandchildren. Your resort is exceptional and we enjoyed the wonderful atmosphere and facilities. All of the other guests and owners we met also added to the experience. I would like to thank your staff, every one of them we interacted with, for making our stay so pleasant. The bar and restaurant staff were very friendly, professional, and a delight to talk to (even when our daughter decided to show us again what she had for lunch all over the floor). Your support staff are also extremely professional, friendly and helpful. I would appreciate it if you could pass my compliments on to your staff, as they really did an excellent job. I would also like to thank you personally for arranging the later checkout from our room, it made the trip back to Houston with the little ones so much less stressful. We are planning a trip to Charleston next month and will be looking at the ResortQuest properties there. Upon our return to Maui, we will not be looking any further than the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores for our family vacation accommodation. You have a wonderful property and an exceptional staff - the sunsets aren't too bad either. Congratulations on a wonderful resort and Thank you,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: scdw3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderfully situated on a fabulous beach. Not too far from Black Rock for snorkeling. The pools were great and warm. The hotel restaurant was as good if not better than any place in town. We had dinner there twice. The hotel was fabulous, even garden rooms had partial views of the ocean. (At least our did.) Stayed in a one bedroom condo. Was great for 2 adults and at least 2 kids of the soda bed. Kitchen was adequately stocked. We will definitely be back! Lobby and gardens are breath taking! Beautiful picture opts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice property, okay condo units.”
Reviews.Author: Saruhhh
Reviews.Content: Note - This property has hotel rooms, studio condo units, and 1 and 2-bedroom condo units. Some are privately owned, some are corporate owned. We booked two 2-bedroom, 2-bath ocean front condo units direct from the owner on a "vacation rental by owner" site. The condo units had a nice layout. The bedrooms were large. The lanai off the living room was big. Having a washer and dryer in the unit was a wonder. The "hotel" is great. Very well-manicured gardens. The lobby and common areas were very nicely decorated and looked "expensive". The pool area was beautiful and had more than enough lounge chairs for all. The beach has plenty of lounge chairs, as well. There are gift shops, a salon, a florist, and a pay-per-use Internet lounge on the property. There's also a restaurant and pool-side bar. There is also a 24-hour grocery store across the street. I recommend staying on the forth floor or higher, if booking an ocean-front, or ocean view room. The palm trees will block that view that you're paying extra for, if you stay under the forth floor. Ocean view rooms are FAR from the parking lot. If you begin your trip at Costco (like we did) or have a lot of luggage, drive directly to the front of the hotel and let the bell hop take everything up for you (money WELL spent). The beach in front of the property is rocky. Bring water shoes. Or, walk to the beach in front of the next-door property (about a 30 second walk). If you plan on visiting other islands, fly out of Kapalua. It's 5 minutes away. Kahalui is about 45 minutes away. We paid $289 + 33.00 tax, per room, per night. MUCH cheaper than booking through the hotel's site. There was also a $89 cleaning fee. Parking was $9 a day. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family stay at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: rexy07
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6-year-old son and I stayed at Kaanapali Shores for 9 nites in February, 2008 and had a great time. Definitely more positives than negatives and we really appreciated the combination of a beachfront, fully-equipped condo with the amenities of a resort. We stayed 4 nites in an 2- bedroom ocean-front condo booked through VRBO and five nites in a 1-bedroom ocean-view condo booked through the resort. The VRBO property was the better deal but was only available for part of our stay - it was actually less expensive even though it was bigger, had a nicer view and had a closet full of boogie boards, snorkeling sets and beach toys. It pays to check around. Condos: Yes, as some of the reviews have pointed out, certain parts of the condos seemed a little dated and worn, however both were clean, spacious and comfortably furnished. Both had nice lanais and beautiful views - we watched humpback whales every morning. Restaurant: Food was good although some items seemed a little pricey for what you got (skimpy appetizers especially). But it was convenient, consistent, fast (which is nb when you travel with a child), and the $100 restaurant credit helped. We liked the fish dishes in particular. We usually ate breakfast in our room so mainly used the restaurant for the odd lunch or dinner. Grounds/Pools: The grounds are lovely as are the two pools and hot tubs. We hung out at both pools. The only downside is that the chairs get taken quickly in the mornings, but we usually found a place to settle. Rented the shaded cabana chairs one day which are nice but the resort should really invest in new chair pads. Beach: The beach was nice to walk along, but had too many rocks in the water to go swimming, so we checked out different beaches around the island and in particular liked Wailea and Kaanapali beach (south of the resort). We also liked 3 beaches north of the resort which have calm bays with kid-friendly waves - Napili Bay, Kapalua and D.T. Fleming. When we return to Maui we will probably stay at Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution!”
Reviews.Author: ScottyB05
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through Priceline.com and requested a 1 bedroom. When we arrived they said we could only get a studio and would have to pay an additional $1400.00 to upgrade to the 1 bedroom. Contacting Priceline.com was useless as their attitude was once we have your money, take what you get. Calls and e-mails went nowhere. Studio rooms have no washer/dryer and we packed light so this meant every 3-4 days staying in to do laundry coin-op style. Not the preferred arrangement while on vacation in Maui. At check-in I informed them we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and would like a quiet romantic room and could they provide something special (flowers, champagne, fruit basket). We got a room over the parking lot. I pointed out this error and was moved to room 221 on the second floor across from housekeeping, the mechanical room, elevator and the propped open fire door to the parking garage. Every morning I heard the housekeepers arrive and push their carts with a knock-knock-knock of the wheels over the tile floor. Sounded like someone knocking at the door to our room. I also listened to car tires squealing constantly and the fumes from the garage made its way into our room through the open fire door. The carpet in our room was so dirty when we walked in white socks they turned black. The water to our room was shut off twice during our stay. I did not get one good night sleep the entire stay because the kitchen appliances were so old they made loud noises that kept me awake. The things other reviewers point out as being nice (the grounds, the restaurant, the pool and the lobby), I expect them to be nice. We were told this was a $350.00 a night room. The in room safe was extra. The fitness room was extra, The internet access was extra. The parking was $9.00 a day extra (mandatory). Receiving a studio when we asked for a 1 bedroom was Priceline.comâ€™s problem. Beware when booking anything through Priceline.com. The resort was charged with providing a relaxing stay and showing us good value for our vacation dollar. Resortquest Kaanapali Shores fell short and did not attempt to rectify it so I could not wait to leave. My wife and I stay in the Napa Valley, Carmel, San Francisco and Lake Tahoe at $350.00 a night accommodations so we know what to expect for $350.00 and what a good value is. I think this property is Okay for families with children who can overlook cleanliness and other issues for convenience/price. OBTW, the something special I asked for, they let us stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockychocolate
Reviews.Content: We went here for a romantic getawy the end of November beginning of December. Great Hotel. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite because the room beside us was being renovated by the owner. Hotel and Pools were kept clean and upgraded. Grounds were immaculate despite terrible storm while we were there. Front desk was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and leisure at the Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: DMeeks
Reviews.Content: My wife gave me this trip for my 60th birthday, and what a trip it was! The Kaanapali Shores was beautiful! Immaculate grounds, very clean spacious rooms, wonderful Garden Pool and Hot Tub, and the Beach Club Restaurant offered a fantastic view and wonderful cuisine. The Mahi Mahi and chips were my very favorite for lunch and the Humpback Whales could be seen "blowing" out in the Ocean. The beach community of Lahaina with its beautiful "front street" was located a very short distance away. The staff were so friendly and helpful, our rooms were cleaned and maintained every day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples, both young and old. Roya and David Meeks [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your dollar...”
Reviews.Author: repenshek
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time here- everyone loves the grounds as they are so well kept and beautiful. Also very accomodating- when we arrived I asked for an upgrade hoping we could get a one bedroom with a view (we had a studio booked) and I was so happy to hear that yes, we would be happy to. Great garden/ocean view!!!! Room 648. I was also concerned that the room would not be updated, but it was. Kitchen was nice. This is not a 5 star resort, but it is a great place to stay if you want a reasonable rate with hotel accomodations. One small thing I noticed is that the bathroom sink and mirrors were not clean. But, we did have daily cleaning service and I was not expecting that! Pleasant surprise! They also helped us with a late checkout , which we really needed. -Nice having Expedia there to book things we had not booked already- saved us time! Advice if it is your first time to Maui- ZIPLINE with ecoadventures and book it a few weeks at least in advance. -OLD LAHAINIA LUAU was wonderful and also must be booked early! -Snorkel trips can be booked there without a problem- DO NOT book with Pacific Whale Foundation- horrible experience. See my review for more info: [-] -One last thing, don't miss the La Perouse Bay lava hike/Snorkel. Bring hiking shoes and get ready for the pure beauty! (The furthest south the road will take you). More in 'Maui Revealed.' Train is vague, follow paint on rock.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but would not return”
Reviews.Author: truthfultravels
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Maui, and I would not stay at this resort again. For the same price, there seems to be many other higher quality resorts around. We went with a group that had two condos - one was a 2 bedroom oceanfront and one was a 2 bedroom garden view. To begin with, even though the rooms were booked about 5 months in advance, by the same person, under the same name, they were on opposite sides of the hotel, not even in the same building. I was lucky enough to be in the ocean front room, with an absolutely beautiful view and plenty of room to spread out. We were on the second floor and quickly learned that renovations were being done on the first floor, which began with drilling and pounding at 7 am. While the first day or two was manageable, as we were still on mainland time, this quickly became old, and very aggravating when you spend a large amount of money to have a nice relaxing vacation. Every time we went downstairs, we had to check to see whether to take the stairs of the elevator because inevitably, one or the other was blocked by equipment, etc. The view from the room was beautiful though. The garden view room had a severe cockroach problem. With at least one being killed in the room daily, and several more spotted in the hallways. This room was also missing several kitchen utensils/appliances. The beach at this resort is sandy and long, but very narrow with a steep slope down to the water. The water was warmer than any other beach we went to, but not very suitable for swimming. In addition, there is a bad current of some sort, marked by two bright orange buoys that we were warned to steer clear of. The service varied at this resort. The restaurant service, and food was outstanding, the housekeeping staff was also friendly. Front desk varied by the person working there, and the staff in the shops were extremely rude. Overall, I would not return to this resort, but it does have a few good points.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price but be careful...”
Reviews.Author: spudwil
Reviews.Content: We had a ground level, one bedroom suite which opened up to the inner courtyard almost right across from the pool side restaurant. This was awesome and super convenient for our kids; they just walked out on the lanai and on to the huge grassy hotel grounds where they could hop on over to the pool or beach, look for geckos and frogs in the bushes or pet the cats that seem to live there. Our suite was very comfortable and plenty big enough for our family of five and I loved having a washer and drier. The restaurant is decent and we were given a $100 credit there when we booked. True, the pools are much smaller and less elaborate than some fancier hotels (check out my photos and review of the Westin) but my kids had a great time in them just the same. Housekeeping service was spotty but we were out so much enjoying ourselves that we didn't care. Very quiet at night except for the rattling air conditioner but it wasn't that big of a deal. Gorgeous grounds and lobby, great little store on the main floor. I highly recommend you attend the free breakfast/information session in the lobby put on by Expedia once a week. We learned a lot about the island from the presentation and got some very good deals on excursions by a very knowledgeable booking agent. A couple of things I didn't like about the hotel: - you are charged $6 a day or thereabouts for the safe in your room even if you don't use it. What's with that? Many hotels provide this for free. - they also charge $9 a day to park your car there which is also crazy. The Westin lets you park for free or will have the valet do it for that price. - the beach at the hotel is not the best. The waves are quite rough, there is a bit of a dangerous shorebreak, and there is lots of sharp coral right under the surface. Too rough to snorkel and too much coral for boogie boarding. We tried to do both several times and finally gave up when my son cut his foot badly on some coral. There are so many great beaches nearby that I recommend you go elsewhere (DT Fleming for boogie boarding/surfing or Honolua bay, Black Rock, Turtle Arches, or Napili Bay for snorkeling for example). Another word of caution: unless you are very interested in buying a time share, do not get sucked into going to the presentation even if they offer $100 off on your excursions. We caved and went to the timeshare thing; BIG mistake. The first thing the guy said was that it wasn't a high pressure sales pitch and that he would accept no as graciously as yes. Well, we sat there for the required 90 minutes and said no, and as soon as that happened the guy got annoyed and called over his boss and she tried to get us to sign on. When we still said no, they both got quite rude and accusatory and it all ended badly with us marching out and them not even saying thank you or good bye. I guess this is what all those time share presentations are like but we hadn't been to one for a long time. We learned our lesson. It is not worth your 90 minutes or the $100 credit, especially when there are so many other things you want to do with your time when you are on the beautifuly island of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Spectacular Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jboydcalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resortquest Kaanapali shores from 12/28/07 thru 1/2/08. We took our entire family which numbered about 20. I had read a lot of reviews for different places to stay on Maui and this place seemed the best. I had read some poor reviews, not very many and most of the reviews were ALL good, but I was still a bit worried. I was VERY VERY happy when we got to the resort. It was all and MORE than we expected. We had 4 condo units with ocean view. Rooms 737 and 752 were remodeled and were very luxurious. I can't remember the other room #'s, but they were very nice as well.The restaurant on site was very resonable and had good food. We saw a few whales while eating breakfast. My husband and I renewed our 32nd wedding anniversary vows on the beach. We went through Madie Galafant. She is the wedding coordinator at the resort. She did a fantastic job, and was very resonably priced. She also helped us get tickets for the Warren and Annabele magic show. That show was amazing and it is at the top of my list for things to do while in Maui. None of us could figure out how he did the things he did and to top it off, he is incredibly funny. This show sells out weeks in advance, so you will need reservations. The pools were very spacious and clean. There were a lot of people there, but we never felt crowded. The bar/restaurant are right beside the big pool and are good about coming to check and see if you want anything. The bar also has a tv and a lot of the guys were watching the football game. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous. When we checked out we left our video camera in the safe in our room. When we got home and unpacked we realized this and called the next day. After several calls, our video camera was found and they are mailing it to us! AMAZING!!!!!! We were totally sad as our entire video from the vow exchange was on it. We plan on returning to Maui and would not even think about staying anywhere else. Everything was a TEN!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: irish6004
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I began planning our honeymoon, we spoke with a travel agent, who recommended the Kaanapali Shores to us. Now I ALWAYS book travel myself online and I NEVER use a travel agent, but surprisingly, the travel agent was able to get me a better price for a flight/car/hotel package than I would have gotten online. That being said, I have a tendency to always try to book the finest hotel out there, but when I began to research prices, I just didn't want to spend $500/night at the Westin or Hyatt for the 5 star experience. Many of my friends have stayed at the aforementioned, however for the same total price, I was able to stay 3 or 4 days longer for the same total price, which I would highly recommend. When I originally booked the hotel, I was a little confused how the place operated since they are supposedly individually owned units. Let me tell you that this place is a HOTEL. The lobby is gorgeous, the landscaping is unreal, the staff is over-the-top, there is housekeeping, a concierge, and you have the ability to charge meals and services to your room... From a guestâ€™s perspective, the place operates no differently than any other resort. We checked into the hotel at night, after a LONG flight from Buffalo, and after a quick and easy check-in, we were shown to our 6th floor studio room. I did offer the check-in clerk $50 for a room upgrade, but he told me the hotel was booked, which was understandable considering it was early July. When I booked, I opted for the studio because it was cheaper, and since there were only two of us, room size was not an issue. We entered the room and were extremely impressed. Hardwood floors, new Tommy Bahama furniture, much nicer than a typical hotel room, and larger also. The kitchenette was well equipped, and although we had good intentions at the outset, we really didn't put it to use. The bed was a Murphy bed (pull down from the wall) and was reasonably comfortable. The screened in balcony was nice, and although it wasn't considered a premium view, it wasn't a bad view. Housekeeping came everyday to sweep up the sand, make the bed, and deliver new towels. We didn't take advantage of too many of the services at the resort although there were plenty (salon, gift shops, massage, gym) we did however spend a fair amount of time at the Beach Club Restaurant. I must say that this is not your typical hotel restaurant. My wife and I went there for breakfast almost everyday. The food was EXCELLENT and INEXPENSIVE. Breakfast for the two of us averaged about $20 for the both of us. There was a cheery waiter by the name of Myeron who often served us, and some of my best Hawaiian memories are of looking out at the ocean, eating French toast with coconut syrup with my wife at the Beach Club. We never ate any other meal there, but I did sip many a Mai Tai (nice happy hour specials) from the Beach Club bar while hanging at the pool or beach, which is just steps away. The beach here is PERFECT. I read a few reviews here that the beach is rocky and such, but I think thatâ€™s nonsense. This stands up to any of the beaches in Florida, and I think some people just need to find a flaw. The beach isn't extremely deep, but it never felt crowded. It is the beach you think of when you think paradise. There are two pools here, one in the courtyard, closer to the hotel, and another pool between the beach and the Beach Club restaurant. I never went to the first pool, only the second, and it was great. I was afraid because of the price there would be a ton of obnoxious kids, but surprisingly there were few. Waiters came around to take drink orders which was nice as well. In terms of location, the hotel was in a nice spot. There are two stretches of Kaanapali Beach; one North of Black Rock and one South of Black Rock. This hotel is North of Black Rock. This is definitely the quieter stretch. The fancier hotels (Hyatt, Westin) are on the South stretch as is Whalers Village. There is also a nice path that stretches along the South stretch in front of all those hotels. I have to admit that it would have been nice to be on that stretch, but not that nice that I would have paid more to be there. It is a two minute drive there from the North Stretch, which we did a few nights. You cannot walk to that stretch along the beach for various reasons. In terms of where to stay on the island, Kaanapali Beach/Lahaina is where you want to be. We spent a lot of time exploring the island and believe me, there is a reason why Kaanapali is the older section; if you had the undeveloped island to yourself, the most desirable place to build a resort would be Kaanapali, hands down. There is a reason that all the newer developments are in Wailea, because that is the part of the island that nobody wanted. Still nice, but nothing compared to Kaanapali. Do yourself a favor and stay away from Kihei and Wailea. NO DOUBT, I will go back to Maui and stay at the Kaanapali Shores, no doubt. Not the finest hotel on Maui for sure, but the cost savings will allow you to extend your stay, and you'll be glad you did. This is as nice as a hotel I have ever stayed in, and I have done a good amount of traveling. I'll finish up with a few DO's and DON'T's for your Maui stay: DO's: Do stay at the Resortquest Kaanapali Shores Do eat breakfast at the Beach Club restaurant Do purchase the book Maui Revealed. The restaurant reviews are spot on Do snorkel at Black Rock. Park at the Sheraton, rent the gear at the shack on the beach for $5 or whatever and snorkel Do the road to Hana, just don't stay there (see my review of the Hana Maui Kai) Do rent a convertible Do eat dinner at Roys, Plantation House, David Paul's Do Bike down the Volcano. I understand that they have suspended that trip, but if they continue it, do it. My wife hasn't rode a bike in years, she was nervous, and it turned out to be the highlight of her, and my, trip DON'T's: Don't stay anywhere else but Kaanapali Don't do the snorkel to Molokini trip (see my review of the Pacific Whale Foundation Four Winds II) save your money and snorkel at Black Rock Don't eat at Cheesburger in Paradise. Super expensive for a McDonalds quality burger Don't spend the night in Hana. Kaanapali is paradise and if you leave you'll wish you didn't

Reviews.Title: “Living the Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: HaligirlMaryland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 9th visit to Maui and my 4th consecutive stay at the Kaanapali Shores. I highly recommend this hotel for many reasons; it is located on one of the top ten beaches in Hawaii, it is a perfect location with easy access to downtown Lahaina, the rooms are clean and beautifully furnished with both garden and ocean views, but most importantly because everyone that works there creates the most welcoming environment by living the Aloha spirit in everything they do. As a Manager in the Service industry on the Mainland, I set very high expectations on great service; which means only superior service will meet my expectations. And the staff has continued to exceed my expectations. From the first stop at the Front Desk, to the concierge desk, the housekeeping staff, fitness center, the hotel stores, the poolside crew and the restaurant, there is consistent dedication to spreading that Aloha spirit and ensuring my stay is the best it can possibly be. I sent my parents there for their anniversary this past May and their experience was just as wonderful! Mahalo nui loa! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations ... beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: cvictoriac
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for us! The condo offered us a great savings in dining. Toaster, microwave, oven. Full fridge. We lived on cereal, mac and cheese, top ramen. Went to safeway ad bought about $80 worth of groceries for 3 of us. They have 2 great pools. We stayed at the front one mostly. Right on the beach. Provided dish soap and washing machine soap for 1 load (I brought a small bag from home from the 99 cent store). Only soap for 1 dishwashing machine load -- should have brought that as well but didnt think about it! You do have to do dishes every day because of the limited dishes. We also received a $100 restaurant credit that was valid at the poolside bar (yahoo!) which was rare. Only problem was the dryer was so loud ... we only ran it if we were leaving the room. But it was great to have so for a week, I only packed for 3 days. I really liked the condo and the location was great as well. We had a one bedroom. Nice size for me and 2 small kids. Would be fine for another person or two. The restaurant was OK ... we were fine with our cheapy food in the room. We werent there for the dining -- but the beach and pool and relaxation!! Take advantage of ResortQuest kids. Kids are free at the restaurant at lunch. There is 1 free kid on the submarines with each adult -- totally fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay with teens”
Reviews.Author: MooshiPalmdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 7 - 14 with our 2 19 yr old teens. We all loved this condo. It was a huge 1 bedroom condo about 1000 sq ft with a large lanai with beautiful ocean view. We were upgraded to penthouse ocean view cuz our plane was late. Our luck. The condo is dated but very adequate and functional. What do people expect for the price which was very reasonable. The kitchen is formica not granite but fully equipped with dishes, pots and pans and glasses. The furniture is Hawaiian bamboo wicker chic but we like that, we are in Hawaii!! We found the staff very friendly and accomdating. I called for a blender to make my pina colodas and housekeeping brought it in 5 minutes. The lobby staff were very helpful and friendly. Our last day they let us check out late at 2 pm and held our luggage and gave us shower priveleges at 5pm after swimming to catch our late flight. We only ate one meal. breakfast at the resort and we loved it. I had the mac nut pancakes and portuguese sausage for 8.95 and my husband had eggs benedict for 11.95, we had excellent drinks by the pool for $6 and on wed nite they had a nice hawaiian show with $2 rum drinks. We were busy every day with sight seeing and did not spend that much time during the day enjoying the condos but did enjoy the pool and jazucci at night to relax. We all talked that next time we would like to enjoy the condo more but we wanted to see all of Maui. We usually cooked our breakfast each morn and packed picinic lunchs and cooked simple bbq 2x in the condo, they have grills by the tennis courts. My husband and son loved the tennis courts. We shopped for groceries across the street at Star Market and at Safeway and Foodland in Lahaina; they were higher than here but I expected even higher prices. Shop what is on sale and what the locals eat and drink. Diary and sodas were high, the hawaiian brand soda and pog juice was cheap but no diet drinks on sale. Beer was $7 a 6 pack, pineapple and mangos cheap. The lobby and grounds were beautiful. The beach was nice with lounge chairs but there were other beaches in Maui we liked better. We walked to both condos on either side and liked this one the best.Walk across the street to Java Jazz for good music at nite. It is a condo not a resort but for our family was a great value and we would love to stay here again. For the price I would definately recommend this condo, we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Hawai'i”
Reviews.Author: Uno_de_los_amigos
Reviews.Content: Booked online through WestJet. Great room, a comfortable one-bedroom condo on the 9th floor. Lots of space and a decent kitchen. View of ocean, beach, and the resort to the north. The noisy side of the resort, it seemed. Most of the units faced into the quiet and pretty courtyard, with its gardens, 2 pools, hot tub, and beach. Weather: a lot of wind, a little rain each day until the last two. Pleasantly warm through our week. Hotel has a single, minimal bar, unlike the Mexican all-inclusives we've done in the past. Everything costs extra, of course. The restaurant was a disappointment on the first night. Our calamari appetizer was cooked in a bread-crumb coating, unlike the batter-fried style that we love at Greek restaurants. It was served, not with seafood sauce, but with a generic pizza-tomato sauce. The ahi tuna appetizer, au contraire, was delicious. The biggest disappointment was the pathetic wine list. As dedicated winos, we found the California wine selection at the Star Market across the street wonderful, and at prices generally less than what we pay in BC. Furthermore, one can do take-out from the hotel restaurant! Try the opakapaka (pink snapper, I believe) - lovely in your own room with a nice Sauvignon Blanc from the market. The "Japanese-named seafood restaurant 2 blocks to the north" (mentioned by a previous reviewer) seems to be gone. Still across the road is the Mexican establishment, where we had a great breakfast on day one. We meant to try dinner there, but ran out of days. Our activities included a bus tour to Hana ($120 each) and a snorkeling trip with the Whale Foundation ($80 ea). Both were worthwhile. Downside is that one feels obligated to accept the $100 rebate which is offered in exchange for a 2-hour time-share sales pitch. The Aquarium is worth a couple of hours. Best meal: Plantation Restaurant, maybe 10 km (6 mi) north of Ka'anapali Shores. 5 stars to the very pleasant and accommodating staff at Ka'anapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Happiest Honeymooners EVER”
Reviews.Author: AshLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful property and we would absolutely stay here again. The grounds are immaculate, staff very friendly, food deeeelicious and location unbeatable! Other reviewers complained about the beach being too small, but we found it sufficient. Snorkeling right in front of the property was amazing. Admittedly a novice snorkeler, we saw lots of brightly colored fish and lovely coral. I'm sure there are better spots, but the convenience was great. Upon arriving, we were greeted by a monk seal sunbathing on the beach in front of the resort - too cute! Frankly, I could go on and on because we had such a wonderful experience, but suffice it to say that you can't go wrong with this spot - particularly for the price. Should you need additional information, feel free to email me as I welcome any opportunity to chat about my Hawaiian honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Try this place with an open mind”
Reviews.Author: kyleigh
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this resort after reading all the reviews and since I am admittedly a bit spoiled when it comes to hotels, my first impression of the place was not that great. It is extremely outdated and the hallways were threadbare in spots. But this place grew on me fast. The room was huge and although it was very outdated looking, it was clean. The kitchen was perfect and we had everything we needed. The beach is nice for sunning or playing on the beach, but not really for swimming. The pools are very old looking. The grounds of the place are immaculately maintained and are beautiful. I cannot recommend the restaurant whatsoever, as the several times we tried it, it was consistantly awful. Even the drinks were bad. I guess this probably does not sound like a great review of the place but I would recommend it if you are travelling with children. It is perfect for families. Also, it would be great for anyone who can get a good price and if you have a car and don't mind going to other places to enjoy other activities. There are two great take out places nearby. As you exit the resort, make a left and go about 2 blocks and in a strip mall, you will see 2 little places, one of which the name is japanese (but the food is grilled fish, pasta, etc) and the other is the Maui Fish Market (I think that was the name.) We got a lot of our meals from there and took them back and ate them on the balcony since we have a toddler and dining out with her is rough. There is also a grocery store across the street from the resort, but be prepared for steep prices. I heard the prices were somewhat better at Safeway in Lahaina. Overall, the place grew on me and I found it to be quiet and relaxing. I would not recommend it if you are the kind of person who wants to just stay at the resort the whole time. I would say it is like having your own apartment in Maui, but you still have to go out to eat, shop, do activities, etc.

Reviews.Title: “FAR EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: silaldana
Reviews.Content: Definitely enjoyed my short stay at this resort. The 1BR oceanview accomodations far exceeded my expectations. The grounds and beachfront location were ideal for enjoying the Hawaiian sun. In-room amenities made my living space very enjoyable. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: joyfilledincolorado
Reviews.Content: The ambience of the gardens at Kaanapali is beautiful as was the ocean. The scenic gardens made a perfect back drop for wedding pictures as we prepared for our beach wedding. The rooms are older but comfortable. I must say the studio rooms are VERY NOISY! As we were on our honeymoon, awakening every morning between 6:45 a.m. and 7 to the sound of the garbage being picked up and to construction below us was very disappointing. In addition, the airconditioning in our unit did not work even though it was looked at by hotel employees more than once. The restaurant at the hotel is very good and reasonably priced. The pools are nice as well. Front desk people were exceptional with the extent of one gal who checked us out on departure day...she was rude at best! One very nice feature which may be standard although we had never encountered it before. We had a 9 p.m. flight out and the hotel held our luggage for us. When we were ready to leave for the airport, they allowed us to use a hospitality suite to shower and change as we'd been lounging at the pool all day. Of course this room was right on the ocean with incredible views. I'd probably not stay here again....the location is great but hard to get any real peace and quiet! Unless, of course, you can upgrade to the two bedroom suites, with ocean view!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: swiggers
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 days at Kaanapali Shores. It was our first stay at this condo resort, but it will not be our last. I was worried before we arrived that it might not be what I expected. No need to worry, it exceeded my expectations. Very nice 2 bedroom/2 bath condo, many conveniences, great layout. The grounds are georgous and very well maintained. Grocery store across the street was very handy. Great resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kimberleyVancouver
Reviews.Content: Hello, We booked at Kaanapali Shores based on the reviews we read. Unfortunately, our room is a disappointment. It is very outdated, smells musty and has a large wet, sticky stain on the carpet (our toddler keeps walking on it). We asked the front desk for a nicer room. We had no problem with paying more but the room we were shown was the same except for the stain. I don't think the room is cleaned thoroughly (for example, the grate above the tub has a large amount of dust on it). I don't know if the people who were happy had renovated rooms. Our family was planning on staying for two weeks but we are trying to find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: linny1977
Reviews.Content: let me begin by saying that I have done a ton of research trying to find the best place for my wife and I while in Maui. I have to say, my research did not fail me on this one. We loved this hotel... I should preface this by saying that I am not the kind of traveler who demands excellent service and accommodations. Never the less, this place was great! We had an excellent view of the ocean and we were surprised to see that we had a kitchen and washer and dryer. The garden was very beautiful and the closeness of the beach was great as well. The cons to this hotel were few, but thought I would mention them. 1. The beach club restaurant on site was ok. Not that good, but not horrible. I would recommend it only if you need a place that is really close. 2. The coral in the ocean is pretty close to shore. I cut up my feet pretty bad. There were plenty of other people there though, so I dont know I just went to a bad spot. 3. The internet was free, but it was sporadic. Sometimes it would work and sometimes it wouldn't. In all, this place was great and we will definitely be staying at here again. Give it a try..

Reviews.Title: “Get's the job done”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Economics
Reviews.Content: Fit right in with what reviews I had read. Great place for young parents and their little ones...but not over-run with the kiddies. My wife and I have no children, but were able to relax and converse with other guests. The location was great for the price. We walked south about ten minutes to a decent snorkeling beach, and the drive to Ka'anapali beach takes about two minutes. Though we stayed in a studio, we had ample room, and enjoyed a partial view of the water. This wasn't a wild nightlife location, aside from four Navy boys who came ashore and somehow decided to crash the hot tub one night. The only inconvenience we found was the difficulty in snagging a lounge chair if you head out on and adventure and return in the afternoon. But a little patience proved effective.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Front Property”
Reviews.Author: mahoneyt
