Reviews.Content: This is a great location for the resort, one minute walk to the beach. The landscape is beautiful. The Beachclub Restaurant has really good food and reasonably priced. Now, the downside of this resort: Pool is average. The rooms are outdated with furniture and the bathrooms need to be renovated to catch up with the other growing condominiums (time-share) resorts. I would not stay here again, after viewing the resort next door, Kaanapali Beach Club is much nicer with the same beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront Condo, a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: PalaninPasadena
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the beautiful island of maui. My first two nights were spent at the Resortquest Ka'anapali Shores. This property is a full-service condominium,located on Ka'anapali Beach, near Lahaina town, and best of all across the street from a local supermarket. I was able to go to the grocery store, buy some incidentals and come back to my room and put them in my refrigerator. I had a full kitchen, living room and a bedroom. There was even a washer and dryer! The staff at the front desk were so pleasant and the mood was very upbeat as everyone was preparing for the Halloween festivities that were being held in Lahaina. The grounds on the facility are so well kept, and the staff were very caring about its appearance. The restaurant on the facility served great macadamia, banana pancakes made just like how the local Hawaiians love to eat them! The only thing I thought was a draw back was the cost of parking at the property. I feel that if you pay to stay at the property, that you should not have to pay for parking. You are a guest, and guest don't pay for parking! Great for families or anyone that loves a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Marion82
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 11th vacation at Kaanapali Shores. It has everything you could ask for: well maintained suites with fully equiped kitchens; comfortable beds in quiet surroundings; a friendly and cheerful staff; immaculate grounds; 2 beautiful pools with hot tubs; and a lovely sandy beach. There is a small "corner store" on the premises and a very good grocery store a block away - you can even bring your shopping cart back to the hotel and they get it back to the store for you. If you don't want to cook, there is a small restaurant on the grounds (which serves excellent roast beef). It is just a beautiful, peaceful place to be. We are 82 years old but looking forward to a month there again next year. It is also a wonderful place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Love the room”
Reviews.Author: hansmeyer
Reviews.Content: Loved the kitchen and living room design. Two TV's made it easier to watch your own show. Plus you can buy food at the local super market which make it easier on the wallet. The staff was very friendly, when you walk past them 90% of the time they said "Aloha". That alone made me feel welcome to the hotel and island.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NikkiJski
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for our honeymoon. We booked a very basic hotel room through hotels.com at a reasonable (for Maui) rate. I thought the location was great - right on a beautiful beach. The pool was very nice as well, and I liked that there was a bar right by it. (The hotel we stayed at in Kauai had a bar but you could not take drinks to the pool area - lame.) Our room was very basic. Nothing to write home about, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for everyone”
Reviews.Author: atrane37
Reviews.Content: I had such a great honeymoon experience that I had to leave a review. The hotel was well kept and the staff extremely helpful. If you are looking to save money it is conveniently located close to Whalers village, Lahiana (Shuttle <$10), and a grocery across the street. The hotel has a wide range of guests from large families to honeymooning couples. However, with two pools the families tend to stay at the pool within the courtyard leaving the ocean front pool to the adults. The rooms were spacious and well kept but not over the top. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores a Huge Disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: 5MauiLovers
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just recently spent 15 nights on Maui. We stayed for 8 nights in South Maui and loved everything. Then we moved to ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores for our last 7 nights. We were hugely disappointed! First of all they charge $9.00 per day to park - RIDICULOUS! The condo was very small and run down. We went shopping and bought a bunch of food and planned to cook some of our meals to save money. The burners on the stove barely got warm and the stove was so hot that it burned everything. There was no way to set the temperature or see what it was. They said they would send someone up to fix it but never did. The dishwasher soap dispenser didn't work. All of the sheet on the 3 beds were too small and all had holes in them along with the duvet covers. The chairs on the lanai were torn and only 2 could even be used. We were woken up every morning by the groundskeepers cruising around on their 4 wheelers and dragging the lounge chairs around the grounds, slamming of the trash bins. We love Maui and the Kaanapali area, but would never again stay at ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores and would definitely NEVER recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: traveler123Ohio
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the resort. Our garden view room was clean and comfortable. The room had a small kitchen with stove, microwave, oven and dishwasher. Bathroom was very large and included a walk-in shower (no tub). Staff was very helpful. The only downside was the pool(s) were being renovated. A third pool was still available for use. I would definitely stay at this location again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: Seasign19
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are Travel Consultants. We traveled to Maui to "refresh" our memories checking out various resorts and Condos. We have booked many clients, friends and family at the Kaanapali Shores and wanted to experience the property for ourselves. Check in was quick and the staff very friendly. We made our way to our two bedroom condo and what a fabulous ocean view room we had overlooking the pool area. Every room has a lanai or veranda with a great view of the ocean or a tropical view with the ocean backdrop view! The rooms have been recently renovated and still working on another section which never got in our way of having a peaceful stay. Each room is equipped with a full refridgerator, dishwasher, hair dryers in both bathrooms, iron and ironing board. There is a dining table and a bar area. King bed in the master bath with a T.V. overlooking the ocean and pool area. The second bedroom had two twin beds with no view. The window was above the beds to allow light in the rooms. The living room area has a T.V. sofa and chairs. The veranda has a chase lounge and table with two chairs. They have weekly entertainment in the pool area with hawaiian music and dancers. Food is very reasonable and good at their restaurant. And if you want to cook your meals there is a supermarket accross the street which was very convenient! Being that we overlooked the pool area, we were never annoyed by screaming kids! The property was constantly being maintained and the beach area was great lined with trees you can seek shade under! I would reccommend this property to families and honeymooners! And I will continue to sell this property with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jules2881
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the negative reviews here, I was a little worried that I might have picked the wrong hotel for my honeymoon - but that wasn't the case! Kaanapali Shores is a beautiful hotel inside and out. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, and the beach is spectacular! We even received a complimentary bottle of champagne for being newlyweds! I was wondering where those negative reviews came from... I don't have any complaints. I would definitely stay here again, if I have a chance to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View”
Reviews.Author: Lori1558
Reviews.Content: This property is absolutey beautiful. Lush green garden, nice pools and hot tubs. When I walked into our PH room, I was totally awestruck. We asked for a Deluxe Oceanview room and it was; it overlooked the entire hotel garden out to the ocean. It was immaculate, and had all the amenities of a furnished apartment. The food in the restaurant was good, not exceptional ,and the beach is very rocky in the water. This pretty much disuaded us from swimming in the ocean. However, the beach is lovely. One of the negatives was that the air conditioner hummed very loudly and the vent faced right over the bed. So, if you're so inclined to catch a cold, you might consider that. Don't know if other units were like that, but air is a must. Watch out for what you are told at the Expedia orientation about tours. Those folks are there to sell. The dinner cruise they so highly espoused was dismal, as well as extremely expensive - - terrible food! Check your Fodor's, Frommers, etc., for best tours.

Reviews.Title: “Was worried about nothing!”
Reviews.Author: ShockedC
Reviews.Content: We were taking our first vacation with our 1 year old son as like any mother, I was fretting about where he was going to sleep/eat/bathe etc. We chose Kaanapali Shores as a package deal mostly because they offered studios with kitchen and we knew with a baby we would need that to feed him, wash bottles etc. We had our fingers crossed and didn't know what to expect. It was awesome!! We arrived a little early, they managed to get our room ready pretty quickly. The room with kitchen was great. Our view was crummy but the other side of the hotel looked like it had great views. The crib was great that the hotel provided. Plus our son loved the pools, the grass, the beach etc. I couldn't have ask more of the staff. Especially housekeeping. A+++++ I was constantly demanding something and they were always so friendly and on top of it. PLUS somehow I got distracted with our son and left a whole drawer full of my clothes behind when I checked out. They mailed everything to me!! I was so very impressed. No fuss, no delay, no stress. So great. I loved the Ka'anapali Shores and would recommend it to anyone (and I'm super picky), especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Kaanapali Shores!”
Reviews.Author: PapaGrammie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a one bedroom condo for a week and just loved it. The condo was nice in a bamboo/tropical decor, the gardens/grounds were BEAUTIFUL and everything was very clean. The kitchen had everything needed to prepare meals but we didn't do any cooking- just stocked the fridge with drinks and fruit and of course had my coffee on the lanai every morning. The location was good and a friendly staff. The Beach Club restaurant was reasonably priced and had pretty good food. We got a great package deal from Costco that included a $100.00 restaurant credit so that was helpful. The pool by the restaurant and beach was always packed but there is another one closer to the main courtyard. They are a bit small but hey itâ€™s Maui so Iâ€™d rather be frolicking in the ocean anyway! The hot tub was very small for the size of the resort and always full so we never bothered to enter it. We enjoyed the beach but there were alot of leaves and twigs that washed up on the shore a couple of days so we explored some other beaches like at Kapalua Bay. Kahekili Beach is very nice too- it's just south of the resort (but north of Kaanapali beach) with an ample FREE parking lot, restroom and showers. It was our first trip to Maui so we tried to see and do alot but also made time to enjoy the beaches. We rented snorkel gear at Boss Frogs up the road and the guy tried to get us to sign up for a time share presentation. What's that about? Next time it's Snorkel Bobs! Be warned most places in Maui hit you with paid parking but many shops/restaurants will validate for 2 hrs. (which isn't very long to do anything!) After attending the morning continental breakfast/Expedia presentation for helpful hints about activities we booked the Royal Lahaina Luau@ $63pp which we really enjoyed. We also booked the Skytrek trip, which is a van-tour that takes 6 people on the road to Hana, included a picnic lunch at Hana and then a helicopter ride over Haleakala crater. This was way overpriced at $279.00 pp. The Expedia expert made it sound like a really fancy luxurious trip for $279pp which we would NEVER normally spend but since it was our 26th wedding anniversary and our first nice vacation in years we went for it. The "luxury" van was just a van with leather seats, the weather wasn't very good so we didn't get to swim which wasn't a big deal but they don't mention the MOSQUITOS everywhere! I had about 15 or so bites which I got to enjoy for the rest of my vacation. They also walked us through what was supposed to be a flower farm but was really just a path around some trees and a few flowers and lots of moquistos with a tiny shop with overpriced lotions and trinkets and the end. The "gourmet" lunch was really terrible cold food and not enough of it (we are NOT picky eaters!). Our driver was kind and full of information about the island and pointed out alot of interesting things. You may not enjoy the Hana experience without a guide to give you some history.The helicopter ride was terrifying for me but my husband loved it and overall we were actually glad we did that part of it. Just be warned this trip isn't what it's cracked up to be AT ALL so save your money and book a cheaper tour or drive it yourself with the help of a guidebook like Maui Revealed- I found that very helpful on our trip. We hit the Maui Ocean Center on our way to the airport- great aquarium though a little spendy at about $50.00 for both of us with tax. Aside from the tour experience we loved our trip to Maui, this resort and the island overall and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for families, but rooms need help”
Reviews.Author: PurpleSurf
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's stay at ResortQuest KS with our two small children. Overall, it was a clean condo with a very lovely view of the ocean from our room on the 7th floor. It was great having a kitchen in the room --that saved us some money from eating out every meal at the expensive restaurants in Maui. However, our room did need quite a bit of updating. The carpet, decor, and appliances were very old and worn. We didn't plan on going to Maui to spend that much time in our room, so it wasn't a bit downer for us, but if having an attractive room is important, you may want to look elsewhere. The food at the restaurant was great and the beachfront view eating there was awesome. We saw the most beautiful sunset after strolling down the shore after dinner one night. We plan to go back to Maui when our kids are older and will consider other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: arriva89
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at RKS. We had booked an oceanview room and got exactly that, except it overlooked the parking lot and an adjoining resort. The staff was kind enough to move us on the following morning. I must say the second room was very nice with a spectacular view of the ocean, Molokai and the gardens at RKS. This room was completely renovated with new cabinets, appliances, carpet and furniture. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but it was nice to come back to in the evening and relax on the lani overlooking the grounds. We found the Beach Club restaurant to be more than adequate and enjoyed one evening meal there along with breakfast throughout the week. Overall our experience at this property was very good and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: hilgrls
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 6 days at the Kaanapli Shores after spending 5 days on Waikiki Beach. Next time we will travel to Maui only. Very relaxing and laid back. The resort is a very accomodating resort for a family. If you have pre-teen to teenage children, request a ground floor that faces the garden, so that you can come and go from your patio. We had the perfect room (#105) on the ground floor across from the pool, restaurant and a few steps from the beach! What a view. We just went in and our from our patio. Our kitchen and bath had not been updated yet, but the rest of the furnishings and decorations were very nice. The grocery store across the street was convenient and pretty reasonable. You just have to accept that nothing is going to cost what you pay at home. For the reasonable rates this was a great choice. We would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beware of what your getting”
Reviews.Author: gammy01
Reviews.Content: when we checked in we had a garden view room on the first floor. the only problem with it was the view was of a dumpster and orange cones and a packing crate. before we unpacked we went back to the lobby and they could change us, but on the next day ,so we could not unpack.we did get a better room on the 2nd day. the hotel is ok but nothing special. we made our site seeing plans thru the conciere at the hotel . we went on the road to hana and there was a small child that SCREAMED the whole time. the family had not informed the company of a small child , but when the driver called his boss he made him take them. when we compained the conciere was going to call us back after he talked to his boss, which he never did. so i would not book anything thru that hotel. it was like they had our money and did not want to hear our complaints. the road to hana is an all day trip and it was very unpleasant trip. we were not the only ones that complained.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the front building!”
Reviews.Author: robinel
Reviews.Content: Loved this condo when I was there in August - had a 2BR oceanview. This time stayed in the "garden view" 1BR room - great room and had a view of the garden, garden pool. The parking lot was noisy in the morning - not a great room if you want to sleep in. Ask for a room in the tower the shops are in, and NOT the building that overlooks the garden unless you dont mind the noise. Great location and great beach - still love this place - would DEFINATELY come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: mamaloza
Reviews.Content: Took the whole family to a two bedroom condo here and LOVED it. Felt like we lived there. They even had Easter activities for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: shuffles1
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice place to stay. No windows that opened in the bedroom making it very claustrophobic in the the bedroom. Kitchen nice to have since could save money on food by cooking meals. Housekeepers did not wash dishes or empty dishwasher. Room smelled very moldy. It was an ok place to stay for the price, did not spend much time in the room. Hotel amenities were fair. Pool was not elaborate or in any way special. Shoreline was nice with quite a drop off into the ocean. Pool side restaurant was very expensive and did not serve anything spectacular or interesting. Had to search for coffee in the morning, and it was not complimentary. Went next door to adjacent resort to buy coffee. Return trip to Maui, would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star --- Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: solyman
Reviews.Content: I won't ever stay here again. They fool you with the nice lobby, but the rooms are old and smelly. There really isn't too much to do at the hotel itself. It has one resturant which has mediocre food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: bryan5150
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 8 adults and 2 children in the nicest condos in the resort - 901 and 902. This is the Penthouse floor on the ocean and they are very modern and very nice. The wrap-around lanai's had breathtaking views of the pacific, the islands of lanai and Molokai. The views from both condos will be in my mind forever. Absolutely beautiful. The condo's had very comfortable furniture and beds. The kitchens were a bit dated, however, we didn't cook much either. The facilities at the resort were great - 2 pools, jacuzzi's, very affordable restaurant (kids eat free), and of course it's located directly on the beach. The drawbacks are it is located about 2.5 - 3 miles north of the actual Kaanapali beach, but it's not nearly as crowded as Kaanapali beach either. Also, don't expect the Westin or Ritz as far as pools and restaurants go - this is a nice, affordable family resort that caters to just that - families. If you can do it, try to upgrade to 901 or 902 as they are the best views and most spacious in the house.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Roaches”
Reviews.Author: redheadneveada
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a wedding held in Hawaii. Very diapointed in the housekeeping and The big Roaches we had to deal with. We have never stayed some where so unclean. We will never stay here again, nor would we recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach location”
Reviews.Author: wllcfan
Reviews.Content: The beach location of this hotel was excelent, we had to walk no more that 100 feet to be on the beach. Still not happy about having to pay for parking, you'd think as a guest of the hotel they would let you park there for free. Also very unhappy with the fact that thier idea of tempature control is that they control it. No thermostat in the room. The bell boy made a big deal of pointing out where is should be and faked shock at the wires sticking out of the wall and even "called" maintanance to report it. We called agian the next day to ask about it and they did not seemed surprised at all that there was no control in the room, but said they would be right up to fix it, never showed up. The room was cool, but at night, it got chilly, would of been nice to have the option of turning it on and off as we pleased. The hotel staff overall was friendly. The room was clean although dated, and the grounds are beautiful. Would stay again if only for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great first experience in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jefcgrn
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Maui, and selected RQKS by watching the reviews here. We took into account both the good and bad reviews. It was our first trip to Hawaii, and our 25th anniversary.We opted to save $ on our hotel(condo) to have more for excursions. We made the right decision. We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the front entrance and the tropical lushness of the grounds. Room 931 had a beautiful ocean view, looked down on the waterfall area and was very nice. King bed, central air. updated kitchen. Large sofa, adequate lanai where we enjoyed the mornings with coffee and the local paper. We liked having a washer/dryer in the room. The WiFi worked a bit slow, but we weren't there to stay in our rooms anyway. There was a note of apology in the bathroom for a small tile repair that had a temporary patch, no big deal. The Expedia presentation was very helpful! The restaurant adequate. We had been informed by a friend to stop at Safeway to get food, so that worked out well, and went to Starmart otherwise. The front desk staff were helpful but not that friendly. We will come here again, as we had such a good experience here! *If you get a chance, take the Trilogy snorkeling cruise to Lanai, they are a first-class crew all the way. All day with snacks, dolphin sitings,lunch, friendly and helpful crew, BBQ dinner, snorkeling, tour of the island, came back at sunset..Great day!

Reviews.Title: “I will never book this place again”
Reviews.Author: IdratherbeinHawaii
Reviews.Content: This place has the worst service ever. We arrived at Kaanapali shores in Maui after having a wonderful time in Kauai and was looking forward to continuing our experience. There were 4 of us in our party and we had asked for a one bedroom with a king bed and a queen sofa bed. When we arrived, they said that our room is facing the parking lot which we were not that happy about. But, without realizing, that's what we had actually booked. We thought we booked a garden room. So that part was our mistake. The front desk guy Ali really needs to work on his people skills. He had none. His attitude basically was that we were lucky enough to be staying there. They have made their entrace area really nice, but the rooms are really old and the doors and the walls make you feel like you are in a prison. Anyway, we asked Ali if there are any other rooms available and his answer was that we had to pay $100 extra to get another room. No apologies, nothing about sorry that we can't accomodate you....we were very turned off right from the start. Then, we got to our room and found that we got a very small place with a full size bed instead of the king that we requested. I called the front desk and they said that it was a queen bed and that although we requested a king bed, it was just a request, not a guarantee. We were pretty sure it was just a full, b/c we compared it to the sofa bed and the sofa bed was bigger. They said we would have to stay there that night and that they could see about moving us the next day if something opened up. The view from this room was really to the parking lot and nothing else. The balcony was so small that two people couldn't sit there comfortably (not that we'd want to look at the cars anyway). At this time, we had it with the place. I called my travel agent (pleasant holidays) and they were so nice to book us a room for the same price at Royal Kahana with an ocean view. At Royal Kahana, we were allowed to go look at our room first and ofcourse, we immediately liked it and took it. We came back to check out from Kaanapali Shores and we got Ali again. I told him that he has to check us out . He handed us the paper and said "there you go". Again, no apologies, no word about us not liking the place. I was so upset about our treatment that I had to write this review to warn others.

Reviews.Title: “Plain and Simple”
Reviews.Author: khamera136
Reviews.Content: I must say the room was acceptable. We mainly just needed a place to sleep as we spent most of our time away from the hotel. Overall the place was nice but the furniture in the room was slightly worn and outdated. Since guests probably spend most of their time at the beach, I wish housekeeping would do a better job of cleaning the room especially when it came to changing the sheets. Also, we felt like we needed to keep our sandals on as the carpet seemed to be damp during our stay. Other than that we had a peaceful time. The hotel was not crowded and we never had trouble finding a place to lounge around and park our car. The staff was very nice and we would recommend this hotel to our friends. Apart from that, Maui was extremely beautiful and we had the time of our lives. Cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Shores is the best on Maui”
Reviews.Author: sawyer281
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the greatest that I have seen on Maui. The service is friendly and very accomodating and the room had spectacular views. I had an ocean view room and was very pleased with the view and the room was more like an apartment than a hotel room. The couch was huge and the kitchen had all I needed if I wished to make my meals there. I did use the restaurant often and the service and the food were top notch! The sunset view from the table was breathtaking! This hotel is worth every penny paid for it, and I will try to make this an annual event.

Reviews.Title: “Had to change rooms--would most likely not stay again”
Reviews.Author: spargs
Reviews.Content: From my perspective, I'm not quite sure Kaanapali Shores earns the title "Resort". Our first condo (a 2 BR/2BA Ocean View) had a very poor heating / cooling system and an old stained carpet. It also had a loft --unfortunately the loft was unusable due to the poor cooling system--it was too hot. The circulation in the condo was terrible--we all had a bad first nights sleep. After 1 night we requested to be moved. The manager was very nice and let us look at several other condos. Two of the three that we looked at were similar to what we had but one condo had new carpeting, an upgraded kitchen and a new heating/ cooling unit. We moved to that condo. Our experience after that was good. The beach is great for snorkeling, the pools are nice, the resort area is safe and and the Expedia desk was great. Would we stay there again? Probably not. The second bedroom has twin beds so with a family of five one kid had to sleep on the pullout. Other condos we have stayed at have queens in the second bedroom--something we would make sure we got next time (according to the front desk they don't have this setup at Kaanapali Shores). Unless you get an upgraded room (of which there are few) prepare to go back to the 1970s.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Family!”
Reviews.Author: travelinteacher73
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Kaanapali Shores on Maui. I have to say that it turned out to be a great place to stay with young children. We had booked a 2 bedroom oceanview condo and when we arrived we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to an oceanfront condo with a wrap around deck (room 901) to be exact for $120 a night on top of the charge that we had already paid through our travel agent. The view was amazing. Each time an employee heard what room we were in they commented that it was the best room in the house. We fell asleep each night to the waves on the beach below and enjoyed sitting out on our balcony looking at the view. The condo was very spacious for 6 people. We were a little taken aback that the 2nd bedroom only had 2 twin beds. As a result, my husband and I slept on the sofa bed. I do agree with other reviews that the appliances in the kitchen need upgrading as does much of the carpet in the common areas. Overall I would say that the resort could use a freshening up, but like my husband said we did not have to worry that the kids were going to damage anything. Housekeeping was very accommodating and came at the time when we asked them to. I thought the beach out in front was great. Many chairs and lots of room. Having 2 pools was great-one was more of a kids pool which was great with little ones. The staff was very helpful with my mother who is disabled. They always got her a taller lounge chair at the pool and even had an extender for the toilet as it sits very low. I do have to say that their "Kids Eat Free" program is a little bit of a hoax. It only applies at lunch time, and is contingent on an adult meal being purchased for each kids meal. There also was a special "Kids Eat Free" menu that limited the choices. I will say that the restaurant is good and we ate there several times. All in all we had a great time and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value and beautiful grounds, but no A/C or internet”
Reviews.Author: richmor1
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and provide a idyllic setting for relaxing by the pools or sunbathing. The resort provides some amenities such as a aging fitness center, small shop, and below-average restaurant. It's a great deal for people that plan on spending most of their time away from the resort. The resort was constructed in the mid-70's and it shows: First, the rooms don't have A/C which made sleeping difficult. Instead the room has a water cooler built in the 70's (similar to a "swamp cooler") that is horribly ineffective, noisy, and fails to produce any degree of cold air. In fact, we didn't feel any cold air coming out of the vents when we put out hands over them! Instead we had to keep the windows open the entire stay which was less than ideal in one bedroom that faced the parking lot. Second, don't expect to be doing much more than email while at the resort. The wireless internet while free, provided frustratingly slow internet. For example as I write this review it took me about 3min to open up the "write a review" page. Also, one of our bedrooms had a light switch with no light attached. I tried all of the sockets to plug a lamp into, and none of them were on the circuit. Instead we just had to walk across the bedroom and turn on the light when we needed it. It's minor, but really odd. It's more evidence that the facilities need some work. The central/common area of the resort is beautiful, with a stream, fish, two pools, and a hot tub. The pool areas are average and seemed to be well enjoyed by the other families. Don't plan on eating at the resort; the restaurant is far below par and not worth the price. Instead, get groceries at the Star Mart across the street and make your own food. There is quick access to the beach. The staff were polite and provided average service. Given our experience, we would not choose to stay at Kaanapali shores in the future, and would be willing to pay slightly more for a resort that had functional A/C, internet, and more modern facilities

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: kellsma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 9 days at Kaanapali Shores condos. Had a great time. We booked directly from an owner and got a great rate. Check around and see if you can find that option. The only difference is that we got our keys from a lockbock on the door and we did not have charging privliges though we did have to give a credit card for parking so I don't know why they could not let us charge but it was no big deal. Just brought cash or credit card down to the pool for food and drinks. Also, did not have daily maid service but could have paid for it if we wanted. Grounds were nice, 2 nice pools and jacuzzis, beach in front is very nice and the resort is close to everything. One tip, for groceries, go into Lahaina to Safeway rather than Star Market. Found a big difference between price and availability of items. Loved walking around that area which is actually not Kaanapali but a small, little town. My husband and daughter rented surf boards and snorkeling equipment from a little place just to the left of the resort(turn left when walking or driving out). He is on the left hand side. Started at Boss Frogs down the road but that was a joke so ended up at this smaller, more personable place and were very happy! Check him out. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: kipshel
Reviews.Content: From the very moment we pulled up to the Kaanapali Shores, we knew we had picked the right resort for our first visit to Maui. We requested a lower level condo and were accommodated with a condo on the second floor. An absolutely perfect location w/lots of privacy and spectacular view of the ocean! The weather was picture perfect the entire 8 days we were there. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful and the ambiance and food at the Beach Club restaurant was impeccable. Our helicopter ride was breathtaking and the snorkling trip was such a fun experience for myself, my husband and 9 yo daughter. My daughter spent one full day at the Kidsquest Camp and loved it. Our luai experience was everything we hoped it would be. We definitely did not want to leave and plan to return and stay at the same Resort. The convenience of this resort, from the market across the street and shopping and restaurants and other beaches just minutes away, makes this resort the best choice for us. We feel like the Kaanapali Shores is now our 'home' away from home. Aloha and Mahalo to everyone in Muai that made our stay the most memorable ever!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected!”
Reviews.Author: 2heberts
Reviews.Content: The minute we drove up the drive, I knew I would love this place. The grounds are meticulously cared for. The lobby decor and flow are so serene and peaceful and lets you know that you are really in Hawaii. The staff members are so helpful and professional. Our room was clean and our garden view was more than what I had expected. You could actually see the shimmer from the ocean as well as enjoy the beautiful grounds below. The birds singing outside our lanai early in the morning added to our enjoyment. The Beach Club restaurant also had very good food and service. We will plan to stay at this resort again should we ever have the opportunity to vacation again in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Easy vacation”
Reviews.Author: nwalker12
Reviews.Content: Booked through Costco Travel. So easy and reasonably priced. My fiance and I flew out of San Diego, direct to Maui, and stayed at Kaanapali Shores Condos. They were nice. Very spacious one bedroom room with a balcony facing the center garden and a little view of the ocean. Bathroom was kind of small, we had to share one sink. The pool was nice, it was almost on the water, but not extravagent. The pool's bar (which was also part of the restaurant) was okay, too busy at happy hour, but the prices were awesome. The only restaurant was okay, we ate there a lot because it was convenient. Overall, good stay for condo living, and good location. Probably would explore other options on the island before staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st visit to Maui”
Reviews.Author: drainwater
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week @ Kaanapali Shores. It was our first visit to Hawaii so I have no other hotel/condo to compare it to. I would just reiterate all the other positive comments from the previous reviews...it's a beautiful place. But I just want to give a warning about the infamous "rocky" beach. On our FIRST DAY, before he had even gotten waist-deep in the water, my son cut his leg badly on the reef/rock getting into the water. The cut required 6 stitches AND he was unable to swim in the ocean or pools for the rest of the week due to the risk of a staph infection. It was a major bummer for him and the whole family...it didn't ruin the trip, but it put a huge damper on it (he had to just sit and watch us swim and snorkel!). I know tons of kids snorkel and swim at that beach without incident, but honestly, the snorkeling was MUCH better anyways 2 lights south at Kahekili Beach (also called Airport Beach)...it was actually recommended to us as a better beach by some of the staff at the hotel...it's a prettier beach, many more fish (and turtles), and easier access into the water without the rocks/reef. We will definitely stay at Kaanapali Shores again in the future. We'll just be using Kahekili Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: esstra
Reviews.Content: Great place for families! We had a one bedroom garden room.It was like a private yard of paradise. Our children ages 9 and 11 loved the beach and two pools. The kitchen was basic but it was great to have. The washer and dryer was so helpful. We packed less so we could just wash as we go! Across the street was Star market which is your awesome grocery store! Also there was a coffee shop, soup place, pizza and Subway(sandwices). The grouds are well kept and the staff very friendly. The hotel is in a good location. You felt secluded but close enough to Front Street.

Reviews.Title: “ResQuest Ka'anapali: Great, just watch the rocks!”
Reviews.Author: RicoD
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the RQ K Shores condo and stayed in room 602. This is the large 2 bedroom 2bath unit. It was superior by any standard. We were ocean front and had a huge lanai.The resort was clean and even w/ some units being modernized, the work was quiet and the workers were friendly. The $9/day to park is standard. We even used the $2.50/day safe just to be safe- no pun intended. Elevators ran quickly, also. But here's the rub: If you really want to enjoy the ocean, you MUST wear some kind of shoe to protect your feet from the rocks. Many resorts in Maui have rocks in the ocean ifo their beach area(ie. Marriott). We travelled about and swam at many other rock free beaches. You can swim there, though. You just have to be careful. The restaurant was good. Diane, the bartender- serves a mean mai-tai and at HH they are $4.00. The resort next door also has a good menu and drink, too- and bigger bar- with outdoor eating. Keep in mind the prices for food on Maui. We ordered two large pizza pies- one w/ sausage from the pizza place across the road and it was $46.00 !! Milk was over $8.00/gallon. We only bot stuff that was on sale at the Star Market. Try the Jazz place across the road also. Nice manager when we were there and great food set in an eclectic setting. As mentioned- we swam at many different beaches- all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: UmassJenn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time at Kanaapali Shores! The hotel and grounds were very nice, and clean... our room was great! Even bigger than we expected, with a full kitchen to cook meals and save a little money (grocery store in the plaza across the street!) It was a great location to visit Lahaina Town, and there's a trolley out front to take you to shop at Whalers Village. We rented scooters down the street and drove all over the area... We did a snorkeling tour with the Pacific Whale Foundation, which was amazing. The Expedia Desk is VERY helpful, with many ideas and great deals! I would definitely stay here again... great price and deal! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not a 4-star condo/hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankieboy22
Reviews.Content: Maui in general is overpriced compared to resorts in Caribbean and Mexico... Public areas of property need to be updated, particularly the pools-and since it is a condo hotel, the quality of the units vary. The first unit we were assigned to was old and in need of major remodeling; we asked for another room and were given the keys to three units, of which we chose a nice remodeled 1-bedroom. Deals are to be had on 2-bedroom units upon arrival (not the outrageous rates they quote on their web site)... On the plus side-the beach is great; the restaurant is decent and reasonably priced for Maui; there is an excellent supermarket across the street (and a great breakfast place and pizza joint also), and most importantly, you are in one of the most beautiful places on the planet. Lots of kids also... For what you pay this is not good value, compared to other destinations....same goes for Maui in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - Very surprised at quality!”
Reviews.Author: YoungSeniorCitizen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kaanapali Shores May 14 thru May 19. A little skeptical at some of the "bad" reviews that I read but the good out-numbered the "bad" so we chose Kaanapali Shores. Could not have been happier with accommodations! Stayed in a 1BR ocean view which was clean and very enjoyable. The bathroom and laundry accommodations were great! Bought groceries at K-mart just after leaving airport (big mistake - K-mart much higher in price than local Safe-way). Ate breakfasts on the lania in the a.m. Dined at a wide-variety of eating establishments in the late afternoon/evening. Staff very eager to help and very friendly. Parking convienent and close. Never felt the obligation to "tip" every time asking a question or for help. Gardens spectacular and beach area great for swimming and snorkeling. Two pools which were clean and accessible if ocean swimming not your thing. Shops and restaurant great addition. On-sight activities desk and welcome breakfast great for info if need it - activities are discounted if interested. Will definitely stay on our next visit which we are planning for 2009. Maui a very beautiful island with very friendly people. Thank you for making our visit such a memorable experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdonnac40601
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel May 5-12, 2007. It is a very nice property and the grounds are beautiful and clean. Our suite was very clean and we had a wonderful view. The staff was friendly, the resturant was good and convenient. I would recommend this hotel as an excellant vacation for families or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roul62
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Shores was the first time that we stayed on Maui.We had a Garden View Condo, but was surprised to find an upgrade on the view when we arrived! from the speedy check in to the ultra fast check out, it was a week we will never forget. All the staff members at Kaanapali Shores went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. The flower shop had delivered,on time, the arrangement I had ordered for my wife, and the Shores management sent a complementary bottle of wine, as it was our twenty fifth wedding anniversary! The Condo was well equiped from kitchen utensiles, to a TV in the Living room and the bedroom.The living room had a pull out bed sofa, and table and chairs for dinning in the dinning area. The Lani was well equiped with lounge chairs and a table for eating also! The bed was a king size and very comfortable. Unlike some other condo's, Kaanapali offers room service everyday.We did need an extra pan, and house keeping brought it right up.The spacious Condo was squeaky clean from top to bottom, as was everything there at the resort, including the grounds, pools, hot tubs, and pristine beach! The Beach club restaurant on the premises had excellent prime, and we had a few casual meals that were equally as good. The bar was located just next to the pool,with a beach activity center located near the beach. The shops located close to the lobby were well stocked and open late everynight.There is internet available, shopping right across the street, the ABC store and Gas station is right around the corner. Try the Star Market, it was open late and within walking distance from the resort. We did all our food shopping there! Lots of close by activities in Lahaina, no more than fifteen minutes drive even with traffic! The snorkeling in front of the resort is fantastic! Hundreds of colorful tropical fish close to the shore line in shallow water! They offer free diving lessons also! Excellent show on the grounds provided free of charge, Kieki Hula, was better than some shows we paid for! We plan on bringing our whole family next year for vacation! This is a great place for a newly wed couple or a large family! It would be possible to have a great time and never set foot off the Kaanapali Resort !

Reviews.Title: “One of our top destinations ever!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTraveler70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Kaanapali Shores in Maui. We experienced a totally relaxing vacation where we were treated well by a very courteous and helpful staff. Our room was an older part of the property, but offered all the amenities that we needed such as a kitchen, king bed, cable tv, and a beautiful view of the ocean. We spent very little time in our room, so it was not important that it was updated. Our resort had two pools, and a beach. The walk along the sandy beach to your left was much smoother than to your right as you face the ocean. The sunsets are something everyone MUST experience. The resort restaurant offered an affordable menu for all three meals. We traveled the Road to Hanna with a tour guide. The only way to see and to hear about this destination. It was way too long, but worth all the energy! We also spent time sightseeing in Lahaina along Front Street where you can stop at the Banyan Tree. It is something you must see. Here we found a variety of restaurants, lots of shops, and an ocean view that was outstanding. Don't hesitate to visit Maui. Just be sure to pack all of your swimsuits, your walking shoes, and sunscreen! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TravelCork
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel with beautiful grounds. We stayed in a studio with a kitchen and it was great. It had a large bedroom / sitting room, a well equipped kitchen, bathroom and dressing room. The staff were helpful and friendly. The grounds had two pools and the beach was good â€“ but there was a lot of stones in the water so watch your feet!! There was a shopping centre across the road from the resort which contained a large food market with a good selection of stuff. For leaving the resort there was a bus from the hotel next door which took you to the local shopping centre and nearby towns. I would also recommend going to the welcome breakfast they have with expedia â€“ we were very wary but we after the talk we booked and couple and they were all brilliant. We did the rainforest walk, snorkeling and whale watching, they were all excellent and would strongly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jesse274
Reviews.Content: Date: June 1 thru June 8 Chicago, Illinois My husband and I took our daughters to Maui the first week of June. This property treated us royally. We arrived somewhat later than all the other guests checking in that day, which caused our particular room category to fill up. We had reserved a two bedroom ocean front condo and we were upgraded to the Alohoa Suite. It was wonderful. Ocean front, but a much larger suite. VIews were beautiful. The property is certainly close enough to enjoy all of the tourist attractions available. Contrary to what I had read in other reviews, I found the beach to be great. Not crowded, during low tide you can walk a considerable distance. If so inclined you could make it all the way to Blackrock at the Sheraton. Watch what time of the day it is, give your self time to walk back before the tide comes in. My only complaint would be that the pool area needs an update, not much to brag about but certainly pleasant enough. It is not quite large enough to handle the amount of guests during the high travel season. I would definitely stay at this property again. One other thing to mention, and this should be addressed to the hotel industry overall. Flights out of Maui seem to be scheduled in the late evening. Due to the fact that check out times are usually noon, it would be nice, even for an additional charge, if there was an option to have a late afternoon/early evening checkout. The Shores has hospitality rooms to shower, but you can only have it for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Maui - wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravNowTexas
Reviews.Content: Maui: Resort Quest Kaanapali Shores at Kaanapali (Lahaina) June 17, 2007. S Bomgardner, Plano, TX Just returned from one week stay with family of four at the above location. We had a 2 bd/2ba garden view room which met our needs. The property is beautiful, could sit on the lanai and stare at the garden with pool, spa, flowers and plants all day. Open Lobby area with garden and waterfall great for relaxing and taking pictures. Staff was friendly,helpful, and efficient. The only maintenance problem was fixed within 30 minutes of reporting it to front desk. The master bedroom had a 10 inch space between foot of bed and TV armoire to get through to the room, closet and bathroom... awkward and inconvenient to keep entering sideways and also lift luggage over bed. Our unit could use some updating( kitchen), but we were gone most of the days.Take advantage of the free hula lesson in the lobby, that was great. The beach is small, but many more close by to add variety. Breakfast at the restaurant on the property was great and price reasonable. Had a great week, hope to return soon to the island.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic home away”
Reviews.Author: JADEN62
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a 1st vacation together and celebration of our 5 years together, with working so much we decided we needed to get away. So after searching on the internet for 3 months we heard such great things about this resort and we are so glad . we booked a room and flight and car and we aarived at the resort. and got our room the standard it didnt have a view but was very nice and the grounds were just beauitful and clean like everything.they even gave us a upgrade in the gardenview room . the food and help of all the staff was amazing you have to stay here and you will see what i mean there are not enough words to say how much we felt at home.we will go back and maybe we will end up staying in maui we loved it so much so go see for yourself teresa wood and wes snawder

Reviews.Title: “middle of the road-bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: stallison
Reviews.Content: i tried to post this once but it would not load. this will be succint. up the road is honolua bay. excellent snorkeling. drive around west maui mountains gorgeous. must see while you are there. take a good driver. 1 lane a lot of the way. beach at paia DT Fleming beach beautfiul and Makena Beach also beautiful. carpet is very worn and old. condo is older. couch uncomfortable so is sleeper part of sofa. bedroom has only 2 lamps, no overhead lighting that can not be more then 60 watts each. one person at front desk helpful and very friendly. the rest seem to think you are a bother. restaruant staff friendly. bellhops friendly. will probably look for another location nearby to stay at next time.

Reviews.Title: “great place for families and couples”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaRelaxing
Reviews.Content: This was my husbands and my first trip to Maui. We have been to Kaui before but Maui is a totally different experience. When we arrived at the hotel, I noticed right away, the beautiful property. There were ponds that had fish in them, which were a perfect picture background. Also there are two pools, which are not very deep and are perfect for kids as well as for adults. If swimming in the pool is not your thing, go to the beach it is just steps away from the pools. Very beautiful beach, quiet, right by the restraunt you can get a to-go order and eat right by the water. However, the water had some rocks in it, and I would suggest to bring some in- water shoes. The rocks, however are perfect for snorkeling because many tropical fish hide out making the water perfect for exploring. The hotel also gives each room upon check in, a 100 dollar credit that can be used in either the restraunt or the store. The rooms are big, and clean and they have a kitchen. One thing out of the whole experience that I did not like was that the gym was not free to use for its guests, but other than that I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! We will be back”
Reviews.Author: LauraSanAntonioTexas
Reviews.Content: WE just returned and the hotel is as nice as the web site looks. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo on the 2nd floor - garden view of the waterfall in the middle of the hotel. It was great, the room was wonderful, and just as nice as the pictures. We ate at the Beach Club resturant at the hotel every night - because it was so good. The beach was steps away from the main pool and great for walking. We will be back, for the price I think it was the nicest hotel in the area. The lobby carpet seemed older - but was right off of the hotel gardens and had a LOT of traffic. The hotel was clean and service was great - even up to my Mother-in laws standards and she is tough. We are planning to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Resort in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: momaLaPalma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation in Maui, Hawaii. We stayed at the Resort Quest Kaanapali Shores, a beautiful, not too large, beach front property. We had a one bedroom condo with an ocean view. The Condo was comfortable and the living room nicely decorated. The King size bed had a firm matress and was nicely decorated as well. It had a washer and dryer which made it even more convenient. The location was excellent because it was a short distance from Lahaina and other places of interest. The Kaanapali Shores has been redone and the grounds look very beautiful especially at night time. The tiki torches give it a Hawaiian and welcoming feel. The restaurant is clean and the food very tasty. The Restaurant Staff was very friendly and the manager gave us "personilized" service. He gave us advice regarding placing of interest to visit, the Hawaiian food and other local eateries. Being a Travel Agent I would highly recommend Kaanapali Shores to my clients and consider this a "good value for your dollar" property. Sincerely Connie

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: DATSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores between 5/18 and 5/25 and had a fantastic time. We travelled with our daughter who is 11 months old and the resort catered for all of her needs. The grounds are beautiful and all the staff especially housekeeping were great. We were on the 9th floor and had a beautiful view of the ocean and the gardens. At night we kept the bedroom window open and the sound of the ocean lulled us to sleep. The apartment had everything we needed, and as my daughter does not eat baby food from a jar I had to cook every meal for her. All the cookng utensils I needed were there. I don't understand what the reviews are referring to when they complain about the property as the grounds are very well maintained and everything is spotless. Yes, the furniture is typically Hawaiian but guess what you're in Hawaii!!! The other great thing about Kaanapali Shores was the other guests who were very friendly and didn't mind having a baby around. We definitely would not hesitate to stay at Kaanapali Shores again. Thanks for a wonderful holiday. Overall great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice landscaping, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CB_in_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my first trip to Maui. I loved the grounds...very green, pretty flowers, and a very pretty koi pond. They have 2 jazuzzis. One is really hot and one is a lot cooler. I ate at The Beach House three times which is on their property and enjoyed it each time. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a computer kiosk in case you need to check your E-mail while away from home. Leave the heavy laptop at home. It's $9 an hour. Oh, and the elevators are the fastest I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but dated condo with excellent grounds and small beach”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days in mid May. Don't expect granite countertops, up to date appliances or more than basic cooking utensils. Having said that, we would stay there again. The staff was terrific. Our check-in was a problem as the room they first assigned us was under repair. It took a return trip to the front desk and a call from the bellman to get a new room. But they put in a great room the second time. Except for this, which could happen anywhere, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortably furnished, with an excellent bed. Sound proofing was very good, with little noise coming to the property, even though there is a large property under construction a couple of blocks away. You have to slam the door to close it. The door does not self close and lock like most hotels due to warping in the door frame. This means that you'll hear doors slamming late at night from close by rooms. A small annoyance if you go to bed early like we do. Overall the property was very well maintained. We had an ocean view condo, set back a little from the beach with a view of the grounds. We loved getting up at dawn and having breakfast on the balcony watching the clouds roll into the bay between the shore and the next island and seeing the sunlight change the view of the water and the hillsides. There is a strip mall across the street from the condo. There is good sized market that can supply what you need. It is much more expensive than the Safeway closer to Lahaina. Go there if you have a car, but be sure you have a Safeway card to save money. Food is very expensive in Hawaii, and at Safeway a lot was on sale if you had the card. The Paradiso Pizza House had very good food in the strip mall. We used it twice for carry out. The hotel has an Expedia Fun activities desk. We used them for a last minute reservation at Ulalena--a great show directed by a former member of Cirque du Soleil. The tickets had a small discount and were front row seats. The beach is small, but it wasn't crowded. There isn't much to walk to. The neighborhood next to the hotel didn't look the greatest. So we went to the Whaler Village and paid to park and walked along Kaanapali Beach. There is a long concrete sidewalk that is is great for walking there. To save money, you can drive to the public park at the end of the beach and walk a short distance across the sand to the beach. The water in front of the hotel has a lot of rocks in it. You'd be well served to buy surf shoes. Many people were snorkeling in a small channel through the reef. The water is clear and was warm. There is a cut rate dive shop nearby that rents snorkel gear for $1.50 per day. There is also a Maui Dive Shop in the strip mall. We used them for a drive trip to Molokini. Neither my wife nor I were certified, but we were able to to have an introductory dive to 40 feet. More than enough for a first dive. If you are there on Wednesday, they a great hula show with a live music group. One of the spouses sells Mai Tai's or fruit punch for $2 a drink, so skip the happy hour and wait for the band.

Reviews.Title: “Run away, try some alternatives close by”
Reviews.Author: aprata
Reviews.Content: This was a big disappointment to us. We even complained to hotwire, and they downrated the hotel from 4 stars to three and a half, and gave us a partial credit to compensate for this unfortunate experience. These condos are individually owned, and they are not taken care of. The kitchen is extremely old, the appliances are the oldest I have seen in my life, there is a smell of wet dog in the kitchen and around the furniture, and the carpets are filthy! There was a thick layer of rust on the fridge, how unsafe! The AC is very loud, and room service very slow. Although the outside landscaping is nice, the inside is extremely unkept. The pools are also tiny. We checked out nearby properties rated at the same star level and similar prices, and the difference was huge. Try Maui Kai, or the Kaanapali Beach Club (former Embassy Suites) next door; or try Hololani a little up north. All beautiful and in the same price range, we went and saw the condos inside in these places, and they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Maui + Shores = Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: AnotherCdntraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my families first time to Maui, and nothing could have made this vacation better! The Kaanapali Shores was the ideal resort, perfectly situated, within a short driving distance of Lahaina shopping (Front Street) and excursions (Molokini), and walking distance of the "essentials" shopping (ie) groceries, restaurants, souvenir shops etc. The "garden view" suite overlooked the garden pool, and we could totally see the ocean, which made the lanai an essential part of the relaxation process. The grounds are extremely well kept. The beach was clean and well accomodating at all times of the day, and the ocean in front of the resort had better snorkeling than the excursion we took (which was excellent in itself). Oh, and the Beach Club restaurant...spectacular ocean views, quick service and top grade dining! I went to Maui a stressed out basket case, and returned after only a week totally relaxed, thanks mainly to the Kaanapali Shores. We will DEFINITELY be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property!”
Reviews.Author: Sherbug1
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 (mom, dad, 4 teenagers) just returned from a week's stay at this resort on Maui. Were a little uncertain, as in our air & hotel package it wasn't that expensive. We stayed in a 2 bedroom "condo" type unit, garden view. While it wasn't totally up-to-date as far as style, it was comfortable and everything worked. Kitchen was a little small, but we weren't in it very much. We loved the grounds - 2 spas, 2 pools, lots of palm trees and flowers. Very pretty and well-kept. A couple things we didn't like: the beach was not very wide, faced uphill, so was hard to walk along. It also didn't have a sidewalk along the beach hotels the way the hotels do right on Kaanapali Beach. (This is at the far north part of Kaanapali Beach.) Anytime we wanted to go anywere except the little strip mall across the street (grocery store, pizza/ice cream place, etc.) we had to drive. But it really was no big deal. One cool thing was a little luau show right on the property in the middle of the week. All in all it was a great place for a family. Oh, husband and I had the king bedroom, the 2 girls had the twin-bed bedroom and 2 boys slept on the pull-out couch. Worked fine! If we wanted to spend more money would go farther south on the beach, but if you want a great deal, so you can spend your money on all the expensive side trips, stay at the Kaanapali Shores. A couple good trips were the snorkeling to Molokini, and the road trip to Hana (that one takes all day, though). We did the north part of the island on our own. Loved hiking down to the shoreline, but hated the hairpin turns. Loved the luau at the Hyatt with the firedancer! Keep in mind the money situation - actually spent over $2000 while we were there. Still had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved ResortQuest!”
Reviews.Author: Rubybabylove
Reviews.Content: We chose ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores to stay at during our Honeymoon and we are so glad we did. The service was outstanding, the accommodations were comfortable and the grounds were gorgeous. The hotel is right on the beach and the lobby opens up to lavish gardens, pools and a sunning lawn before hitting the sand! We kept saying to ourselves, "This is so nice." We are looking forward to coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Porperty!”
Reviews.Author: seinna
Reviews.Content: This trip was a celebration of my 50th birthday with my Mom and 3 best friends. We planned this for a year. I picked this property to stay off the internet because of the location and immenities. We asked for an ocean front condo. The property could not have been any nicer and exceeded our expectations. It was clean and beautiful. We were treated very well while we stayed there. Anything we needed...it was done. The people at the activities desk helped us on all our excursions and they were wonderful. This was my 1st trip to Maui, but all the others had been before and all said this was the nicest place they stayed in Maui. Mahalo to Ka'anapali Shores and ResortQuest for making my 50th birthday a fantastic memory! I would not consider staying anywhere else if I get the chance to return to Maui! Mahalo! Doris Wilkinson

Reviews.Title: “It worked great for us”
Reviews.Author: stephen_lee_moore
Reviews.Content: My wife, one year old son, and I stayed at Kaanapali Shores April 24th thru May 4th. We had a third floor garden view 1br unit. From the lanai we could see the ocean -- I think most hotels in Hawaii would call this a "partial oceanview". I'm sure there are many nicer hotels to be had in Maui, but I think this is a really good bang for the buck. For us, we loved the having the extra bedroom, a free crib for our son, the washer and dryer (which we used every day), and a full kitchen. The two pools were OK, not as great as what you might get at more expensive places. The lobby area was great, the hallways were really looking worn, and the rooms were somewhere in the middle. Probably not up to a "4-star" level that this property is rated, but for us the functionality of the room was more important. The beach in front of the hotel isn't the best, but it's fine for watching a sunset, or playing in the sand (my son loved that) -- too many waves for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: mahalofromCA
Reviews.Content: My husdand and I just returned from from a trip which included our children ages 6, 4 and 9 months and my parents( in their 50's). We loved the hotel, it was perfect for families! We shared a 2 bedroom unit. The room was spacious and we had an ocean view even though we paid for garden view. We booked a package through Pleasant Holiday and got a great deal for our April/May trip! Like others have mentioned the kitchen needs updating but it worked. The rest of the room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. The kitchen floor was really dirty but they sent someone up to clean it. I would reccommend getting a ground floor unit because we had to walk all the way around the building to get to the stairs/elevator when returning from the pool or beach. The beach was not the best on Maui but was fine for our purposes and even had chairs in the shade. It was quite windy a lot of the time. We snorkled right in front of the hotel! The restaurant was fine. My only real complaint was that the "kids eat free" we were offered through Pleasant ended up being valid only from 11:30-4 pm each day. They have nightly dinner specials for $18 including salad which is a deal on Maui. The Star Market across the street was very convienent and the pizza place was great. Check out the Farmer's market down the street on Friday mornings! Our outings included Iao Valley , a nice hike/walk for kids and adults with a small nature center. Snorkeling at Black rock was only a short drive away. You have to go see Warren and Annabel if you have not done so! We ate at Cheesburger in Paradise with the kids and Kimo's and Hula Grill without them. Overall, this is a great place for families and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. However, if my hubby and I can sneak away without the kids I would look for something else..there are lots of kids here!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmaier
Reviews.Content: We wen't to Maui with 48 other people and a wide variety of incomes. The purpose was for us to get married while we were there. Most stayed at KS and were suprisingly pleased with the facility and their hospitality. WE all were upgraded to 2 bedroom condos with ocean views. We were expecting a lower class room and they were GREAT!! Perfect for our group! We hit Costco before we arrived and ate almost every meal in the room. We stocked up on liquor and were able to make drinks/food in the room and take it down to the pool (save a ton of $$$). I don't know of many hotels that allow you to do that. The resturant had great food as well (and what I was told is that kids eat free there). A group of about 20 of us are already planning to go back to that same hotel next year. No complaints. PS..if you are expecting the Hyatt or Marriott you will be a little disappointed, but my parents stayed at the Sheraton for $425 a night (regular hotel room) & said next time they will save the $ and stay at Kaanapali Shores. It is a great VALUE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great overall hotel, but rooms bad”
Reviews.Author: adooley84
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went there for our honeymoon. This was our first time in Hawaii also. The hotel was beautiful and had a very friendly staff. The only thing I didnâ€™t like was there were few problems with the room. We stayed here from 4/18/07-4/23/07. The first day we got there the A/C wasnâ€™t working which they did not tell us at the check in counter. It wasnâ€™t a big deal except from like 10:30-4 during the day it got hot. We opened the sliding balcony door and all windows but no breeze. We had to prop our door open into the hallway for a big breeze. They did keep constant updates about it though. Luckily the A/C wasnâ€™t working just for 48 hours. But when we finally got to use the ac when its on high it makes a very loud humming noise but we were just glad to be cool. The bed was worn down too but not a big problem. There were small nats by the microwave and the fridge doesnâ€™t get that cold at all. Their beach has a big rock wall right when you get in the ocean so really no room to swim, but we walk down to the left a little bit and there was a great place. But everything else was GREAT! Great people, great staff, great food, great stores, great location, great views, great garden, great pools, and very romantic! I would come back again just not in that same room.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is beautiful, but this condo/hotel is just OK”
Reviews.Author: chatikati
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Maui (first time) 4/21 - 4/28/07 and stayed at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores. We booked a one bedroom garden view which was beautifully located. The condo was spacious and clean, however the refrigerator/freezer didn't work from day one. It was filled with ice so we defrosted it but nothing helped. It didn't even keep water cool. Housekeeping was great with plenty of towels. AC was very strong. We even turned it off some nights. Grounds are beautiful. Beach is small but travels along entire coastline. We were a little annoyed that this resort states that it has smoking accommodations. A new non-smoking law went into effect 11/06 preventing smoking in enclosed areas, but some hotels in Maui still have designated smoking areas. This resort has none, yet they state differently on their website. Upon check in they have you sign a waiver stating that you understand that they are a non-smoking resort and will be subject to a $425 fine if broken, yet they also state that not all condos are operated under the same policy as for the non-smoking rule??? ABC store is a block away (great for everything) and Star Market supermarket across the street. Jasmine -- next lot from ABC store has lovely reasonable handmade jewelry. Have dinner at Leilani's on the Beach, located at Whalers Village. All in all Maui is great and there is lots to see and explore around the island. A week is just not enough of time, so we will definitely come back to Maui but will like to try a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Quabba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ( both in our 30's) stayed here from Apr 15-22. We really enjoyed the spacious, clean room. This was our first time with a condo ( 3rd time to Hawaii, first time to Maui) and I really liked it. There is a great market across the street along with a little dive shop to rent boogie boards or whatever. The beach in front of the hotel was beautiful! It was a short drive into Lahaina town and we could always find free parking. The AC issue was fixed while we were there and it was a bit hot the first few nights but they were trying desperately to fix it. They said they had trouble physically accessing where the problem was. The restaurant was pretty good. The food was tasty and plentiful but there are better restaurants in town. The server was a bit clueless as he brought me Long Island Iced tea not regular iced tea at first ( realized after a big gulp), and we sat without utensils for quite some time. He did give us free cheesecake though. The cats are super cute and the striped tabby likes ahi but not shrimp- go figure:) So all in all towels were plentiful ( except when guests would take 10 at a time), the pools were nice, the beach was gorgeous, the staff helpful and friendly, rooms large and clean, they even have a games room. I am not a big gym person so I really didn't care about that part- I'd rather boogie board and scuba and snorkel all day than run on a treadmill. So in short loved Maui and have no complaints at all about the hotel and would stay there again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Kaanapali Shores (Apr. 7 - 22). This was our first time to Maui and also our first time doing a non all-inclusive resort. We had friends who stayed here a few months ago so booked this place on their recommendation. I am an extremely picky person and only stay in 5 star plus resorts. While this is a definite 4 star, we were extremely pleased. We stayed in room 331 which was a one bedroom garden view. All the units have had the bedrooms and living rooms updated and they are soon starting on updating the kitchen/bathroom areas. Our unit was great. The kitchen was nice to have and we made a lot of our own breakfast and lunches. Yes the cupboards are outdated but are clean. It was also great to have our own washer/dryer. I was apprehensive about staying at this place after reading some of the negative reviews on this site. I have to admit I'm shocked by some of the comments. Yes we were there at the same time when the AC went out. We received 3 messages on our phone with updates on the progress to fix it. That week it was very windy due to trade winds that had come in. We found that by opening the window in the bedroom and opening the lanai doors we had a great cross breeze going through. As for the lights, yes they were a bit dim in the bedroom but I had no trouble finding anything and they were great for reading. I also had no problem reading in the living room either. All our lights were great. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. We had one problem with the toilet not working properly, so we called and they were there right away and fixed it. The daily maid service was also great. Our last day there, we had to check out at noon and our flight wasn't until 10:30 p.m. They stored our bags in a locked room and we used the Hospitality room. We had no problems there either. The grounds are magnificient. Well manicured and beautiful flowers everywhere. We did have a couple of lunches and one breakfast at the Beach Club restaurant. The hamburgers there are great. We shopped across the street at the Star Market and they have everything you need. While bread and milk are quite expensive, we found everything else was fairly normal pricing. (Liquor is extremely cheap there). We did quite a few tours also. Note: For the best Luau, Old Lahaina Luau, you have to book this well in advance before you go there. You can book online and it is quite safe. Unfortunately we found this out after we got there. We did The Feast at LeLe which was excellent. We also did the boat tour to Molokia which was fantastic. Great diving and snorkeling. We also did the tour to Hannah which is a must as well as other things such as shows, etc. Another note, unless you are going to go for lots of day trips afar, you don't really need a car. We rented a car for 3 days and that was more then we needed. They have a great bus service right outside the hotel that will take you into Whalers Wharf ($1) and Lahania ($2). They don't operate very late in the evening though, so if you want to stay in town late to party, you would have to take a cab back ($22). To get back to the airport, you can get a shuttle ($56 for 2 people). Another place I discovered was a great market almost next door. As you are walking out of the hotel, turn left at the street and it is about a block from there, just before the ABC store. The best t-shirt prices on the island. Really good quality for $7 - 8 or 3 for $21. Some of the great restaurants we dined at were Roys (excellent scallops), The Fish Company, Bubba Gumps (best key lime pie), Kimos' (best shrimp) and Rusty Harpoon, to name a few. We paid before tip anywhere from $66 to $105 for 2 people which we thought was reasonable for drinks, appetizer, seafood and dessert. My husband is also a very avid diver and he has been everywhere in the Caribbean, but said that this was some of the best diving he has done. Saw lots of sharks, man-a-rays, sting rays, whales, dolphins, sea turtles, etc. This is a great family place.
