We did happen to be there during spring break so there were quite a few children, which isn't our thing, but the place is very spacious and we weren't bothered at all. The only downside of this place (for me), was the bed. It was hard. My husband thought the firmness was great for himself, but I would have preferred it a bit softer. Nothing to ruin a holiday over though. All in all, we were extremely pleased and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasanty Surprised”
Reviews.Author: richardsl
Reviews.Content: As with the previous reviewer, we just got back recently after staying at the Ka'anapali Shores from 4/11 to 4/18 and we too experienced the A/C outage. Outside of that little hiccup, our stay there was very pleasant. The grounds of the hotel were very well kept and beautiful, and the location was awesome. We were not too far from Ka'anapali Beach and Lahaina where we spent most of the time. Although the beach was right by the hotel, water socks were definitely required. There was one part just south of the pool where there was some sandy area, but it was truly more fun to stay at the Ka'anapali Beach south of Black Rock. The restaurant was just okay, but don't order the calamari rings. I didn't find it too appealing. If you're wanting to find some good nearby grub, find your way to Lahaina to Front Street at Alaho Mixed Plate. The kalbi ribs were awesome. Also, if you want some good shave ice, go to Lahaina Cannery Mall and look for Pretzelmaker. Yum. Lastly, I did sign up for the gym for a week and although small with the equipment a little outdated, I've seen worse. I was able to get a decent workout during my vacation. I'd recommend this hotel for others for sure...especially with families.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: jgn-7
Reviews.Content: April 19, 2007 We just returned from a 12 day stay at the resort. Five years ago, my husband, 3 year old son and I had stayed there, and were quite pleased with it as a family resort. This time there were 4 of us (8 and 4 year old boys) plus my husband's parents. We were overall very pleased with our stay. I had phoned the resort directly to book. Although it was more expensive to book through Resortquest, it gave me the ablility to cancel without penalty 72 hours prior, which was important as I have an elderly relative that may cause me to make last minute changes. Plus, the units I did check out were booked for the Easter week anyway. We could have moved part way through but chose not too. I called the resort a few days a head of time to request a renovated unit, and to note that we were return guests and were traveling with seniors. We were very pleased with the unit. It was a ground level 2 bedroom in the separate building which is on the right side of the resort if you are looking at it from the beach. I think any rooms in this part are wonderful. At ground level, our kids could play on the grass and directly access the beach and pool without moving around the parking area. Our unit was beautifully renovated with granite, new bathrooms and furnishings. The owners obviously used the unit themselves and it was well cared for. The restaurant had really good food - pricey, but so is all of Maui. They have sunset specials from 5:30 - 6:30, which give you a break on the prices. There is a really good grocery store walking distance, which had decent prices. I agree that the beach isn't the best. But is was great for the boys to play on and do a bit of body surfing without worrying about huge waves. As long as they had on their sand shoes, they were fine. There was actually decent snorkelling around the buoys that are marked off the beach. My husband even saw 2 turtles at the white buoy on the right side as you look out to the ocean. We did several other beach trips to Napili, Maluaka, Kaanapali, and a couple others in South Maui which were spectacular. But, it was nice to have the Resort's beach there on the days we just wanted to hang out. The gardens are lovely and the property is well maintained. All the staff were pleasant. The other thing I liked about booking directly with Resort quest is that you get daily maid service. We must have tracked in pounds of sand every day, so the daily vaccuuming was really necessary. The only down side was that the air conditioning went out in the entire complex for the last 2 days. Night time was unbearable! I think the people on the higher floors were okay, but at ground level it was not good. We also found that this area had a great deal more wind than other areas. I don't know if that is usual, or what we just happened to get. One last thing we did to make our holiday better, was book in for an extra day. Our flight left at 10:30 pm, so we had the whole day at the resort and didn't leave until about 7:30. Last time we were there, we had to check out at noon, and that was a long day with a kid and no room to use. All in all, we enjoyed our time at Kaanapali Shores Also, I highly recommend the Warren and Annabel show in Lahaina - I have never laughed so hard.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: Kim310
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maui and it was terrific! The room (we had a studio) was great...decent sized kitchen with everything that we needed and the room was clean and well maintained. The grounds were pretty with 2 pools (although semi crowded) and lots of lounge chairs on the beach and around the pool. Good drinks at the hotel restaurant. The gym was indoors and depressing looking, but who needs the gym when you're in Hawaii?! Close to Whaler's village but not safely walkable at night. Staff was friendly and helpful and overall it was an awesome place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family place!”
Reviews.Author: thedeckers04
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this resort! When you first pull up, it is a beautiful gated condo community. You can have a bellman help you with your luggage and bags, but it is easy to do yourself. Within a short walk, you will be captivated by the breathtaking lobby - flowers, waterfalls, beautiful rocks, etc. Everything is open aired - the smell of fresh air is everywhere. This condo is very clean. The staff could not have been any friendlier or helpful. I consider myself very picky and was apprehensive after reading some of these reviews. I would definitely say this is a 4 star resort. The setting and grounds are fantastic. There are two beautiful pools, towels you may use for the pools or the beach, a great restaurant (which is very affordable for breakfast and lunch). The dinner menu is great, but most of the meals are around 15-20 per person. Children eat free here (11 years old and younger)and have their own menu which is pretty good. You can order smoothies, food or drinks while you are at the pool. The smoothies are WONDERFUL, but are $6.00 a piece. Parking is $9.00 a day but every place charges that there. It is definitely a family-friendly resort. Lots of activities for kids here. Kids are everywhere. They have a special activity agenda for kids. There was a Laua there on Wednesday nights. Also, this resort offers a great salon. The stylists braided a lot of the girl's hair here, and that seemed to be a big hit with the younger girls. They also did temporary tattoos. I don't know the price of these things, but my husband got his hair cut at this salon and it was $20. That was pretty reasonable. They also have a nail and pedicure salon there, too. The gym was nice. The two souvenir, clothing stores were nice and the prices weren't too terribly high. They have a convenience store inside which was really nice (food, drinks, souvenirs, books, magazines, etc). The class of people here were mostly middle to upper-middle class.The best decision we made was going to a free continental breakfast "welcome- aloha" session. We were worried it was going to be a time-share type thing, but it wasn't. It was great! We had a free breakfast, drinks while a man who is a specialized tour-specialist talked about what different activites are available for tourists to do. He discussed what past tourists have liked and what they have ranked as being their favorites. My family of four ages (38, 39, 14 and 11) took a chartered trip to Hana (discover hidden hawaii) , snorkeling trip to Molokini and Turtle Bay, helicopter tour of Circle Island and went to a Royal Lahainian Luau. They were all great activities. For the four of us to do all of that is was about $1200. The rooms were nice at this condo, but they were a little outdated. The rooms are spacous and it is great having a kitchen and your very own laundry facilities. It was very clean and the housekeeping service was great. The beds were very comfortable. We had a one bedroom garden-ocean view room. The beds were very comfortable. The only main negative thing that I can say is about the beach. It is very narrow and lots of rocks are in the water and if you don't have water shoes to wear in the water, you won't be able to walk out into the ocean. There are tons of rocks. I was disappointed about this. Some of the other beaches I heard were better. There are a lot of public beaches close-by. We saw a lot of surfers at other beaches. We saw a lot of whales every day! We saw them outside of our condo balcony, while we were driving and while we were on a snorkeling boat. It was awesome! The whales don't come up close to the boats. I felt extremely safe in everything I did except for swimming out in the ocean. The waves were strong and the under-tow was strong, too. It you like to just lay out on the beach, then this beach is fine for you.... and also if you have smaller children that don't want to go out into the ocean, except up to their knees - this beach would be fine for you. The pools are really nice if you do not like the beach. I loved this resort and will definitely stay here again. You get a lot for the money here. I researched a lot before we booked and this was the place for us. It is a little off the beaten path, but it is only about 10 minutes from Whaler's Village. It was a great shopping mall. We had dinner there a couple of nights at Leilanis and Hula Grill. Beautiful atmosphere and great food.... expect to pay $20 a person for a nice dinner though. There is also a grocery store and some souvenir shops across the street from the resort. That was great. I strongly recommend this place! This place is about 45 minutes to an hour from the airport. We had an awesome time! Hope this review helped. We just got back from there for our spring break!!!! Maui is GORGEOUS! Most beautiful place on earth! :)

Reviews.Title: “A "basic" hotel only-but good enough”
Reviews.Author: skijader
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Hawaii and I had a blast although I don't think Kaanapali Shores was a huge part of that. I went with a large, fun family group and its true, it is a good family hotel, lots of kids! The rooms are kept clean everyday but the whole hotel had a rather old feel to it. Everything looks like it hasn't been renovated in years and years but evidently it was renovated very recently-someone just had bad cheap Motel 8 taste. Our room faced the back of some condo's but that was ok since we spent little time in the room. The room also had a kitchenette which was great for making a few meals ourselves to save money(P.S-going to Costco if you're going to be there a week or more for lunch and breakfast stuff is a great idea!-ALSO for alcohol!!). One problem was our fridge froze things on the top shelf-froze them solid, and although we called several times to have it fixed it never was. No biggy though. Overall for a decent place to stay in beautiful Maui, this place isn't too bad. Also, part of our group was on one of the top floors facing the water, it had a large kitchen, living room and two bedrooms and the view was BREATHTAKING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Bartols1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores for my honeymoon. We were very pleased with the hotel. I had done lots of research on all the hotels before choosing this one. There are nicer resorts in the area, but we really liked this one for the price. Our room had a great view of the ocean and Molokai. I thought the place was very clean and the staff was friendly. The grounds and pool area were very nice with palm trees everywhere and tiki torches at night. The beach in front of the hotel was not that great compared to other areas of the island. We went down the coast a little bit to the main beach at Kaanapali and up the coast a little ways to Napili Bay. We also loved Big Beach (Makena Beach) in south Maui. The whole island is so beautiful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again based on our experience. We stayed in June and the weather was sunny and warm everyday for 2 weeks straight.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: MikeSagey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Kaanapali Shores from 1/23 to 1/31/07 and truly enjoyed this hotel. We're in our early 30's and have our first baby on the way in June, so we wanted something nice yet affordable for our trip. While there are several luxury resorts on Maui that are a lot nicer than this hotel, you will likely pay a couple thousand dollars additional to stay there. Kaanapali Shores is everything they appear to be on this site. Our one bedroom condo was very clean and all kitchen appliances were in working order. The appliances and furniture were a little dated, but it added to the overall charm of the place. Our bed was a little hard, but that's about the only negative I have about the room overall. Our balcony faced the ocean ,and we spent each morning eating cereal and spotting whales closely off the shore. The grounds are very nice. Again, you won't get lost in amazement like in some neighboring resorts further south of Black Rock, but everything is very beautiful and well-kept. The two pools were very clean. The beach was a little narrow and a bit slanted, but the view of Molokai in the distance more than made up for it. Keep in mind this is a family friendly resort, so if you hate kids, don't stay here. The Beach Club restaurant was pretty good, although we did only eat lunch there. I highly recommend the steak teriyaki sandwich. Be sure to stop at the Walmart after leaving the airport or the Star Market across from the hotel to load up on cereal, snacks, etc as the kitchen will save you a lot of money. The strip mall across the street also has a good pizza place with cheese steaks and ice cream. The location of the hotel was a little off the beaten path, but yet still very close to all that Kaanapali offers. It's about 3 miles north of the crowded area of Kaanapali but a very short drive to Whaler's Village and the other bigger resorts. Kapalua is about 20 minutes north of the hotel and the airport was about a 45 minute drive (but who cares.....you're driving the coast in Maui!). In summary, if you want to stay in a somewhat inexpensive, yet quality resort, Kaanapali Shores is a solid choice. If you have the money to upgrade to a luxury resort like the Hyatt and are used to a pampered lifestyle, this may not be the place for you. We would definitely stay here again. (PS - Be sure to pick up the guidebook "Maui Revealed" and read it before you arrive. We followed the detailed instructions for hiking and saw some amazing things that normal guidebooks wouldn't lead you to. Well worth the $15!).

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: 1blackdog4us
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here. All three times we had different rooms with different views. All rooms were garden view rooms and all rooms had a view of the ocean along with the nice garden. This is a family oriented condo/resort. It is very quiet and relaxing. We love it because of this. The rooms are not the greatest, but they definitely are nice and this last trip we had the nicest 1 bedroom condo so far. The lanai is nice to have too. We will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in Resort Quest Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: d.mcquarry
Reviews.Content: First the front desk gave us a room which was occupied. Since we arrived late this was very frightening to the family in this unit as well as us. They quickly moved us to another unit. Room was clean although the king size bed promised was two twins pushed together. So if you moved to much you would end up sinking between the beds and hitting the floor. The pool areas and beach were nice. Beautiful views and most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was old and the faucet on the tub broke. When we approached the front desk about the bed they were not very interested in correcting the issue. For the price I would look in to other options rather than this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: irishOhio
Reviews.Content: We went here on our honeymoon and loved it. The service was wonderful and the people were so very helpful and friendly. We booked all our excursions through the hotel and each one exceeded our expectations. The rooms were clean with beautiful views. The grounds are impeccable. The on-site restaurant had very good food. We would go back and stay here in a minute! Especially looking out at all this snow!

Reviews.Title: “loved maui, enjoyed hotel”
Reviews.Author: WyomingGypsy
Reviews.Content: Our stay on Maui was great! There is so much to see and do, we are longing to return. Our room at the Kaanapali Shores was average, in need of upgrading. The main bedroom was so cramped that you literally had to climb over the bed to get to the closets and bathroom. It's a good thing we chose to make use of the wonderful dining around Lahaina, as the kitchen was a little dirty and pretty much not useable. The hotel itself was nice and clean. The property was well maintained and the lawns well manicured.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, Maui!!!”
Reviews.Author: LA_Travel_Queen
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this hotel really is wonderful. I am one of those people that talks to about 4 different travel agents, spends months reading, researching and planning a vacation getaway.I checked tripadvisor constantley reading people's reviews about numerous hotels and finally went with KS. Please disregard any negatives...really! It really is a beautiful resort. Being in Hawaii you want to feel like your in the tropics and this place has it all. The gardens are gorgeous, both pools are great and the beach is even better. Compared to the hotels next door (papakea/emabassy suites/maui kai/mahanna) KS has the best beach. There were plenty of beach chairs to lay out on as well as cabanas you could hide in when the sun got too hot( no extra charge). None on the other hotels really had chairs on the beach. The beach front pool was really nice too. It has an out door resturant and bar. For those of you that are sports fans...you can lay in the sun, grab a beer and watch a game all at once! At night they lights tons of tiki torches which makes the place look incredible. We booked a studio view. Room 840 to be exact. Unexpectedly we had a great ocean view. The room was very spacious and clean. The kitchen did not have the most updated appliances but that really didn't matter. The stove worked just fine and the fridge did a great job keeping the food cold!!! Maid service came daily with fresh towels and made our bed. If your like me and debating on where to stay, i truly believe anyone and everyone would be happy here. I almost booked The Whaler and after going to Whaler's Village and be crowded by too many people it was wonderful making it back to KS. I also looked at The Mahana, not a great looking place. Yes, all rooms are ocean front but the beach is shaded by the building for more than half the day and there is no way you can swim in the ocean in front of the hotel (it's like hard, granite stones in the water). To be honest you never saw anyone laying out in front of the hotel at all. Hope that's enought info for now. I used travelexperts.com to book my trip, again they had the cheapest rates compared to numerous agents. Check them out. Have a great time to all the future travlers!!! Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “"What a Maui-rvelous Place!"”
Reviews.Author: Zen77
Reviews.Content: A true Hawaii atmosphere upon entering property! From checking in at the front desk, all staff very accommodating including Management. Early check-in arrival had us (2 couples) dining at their convenient property Cafe (oceanview)! Just steps away from the Registration Lobby! Pools, yes, The Shores had several! Great for families, also. Our 2Bdrm./2 Bath Suite was fantastic! Oceanfront! The sound of the waves lulled my husband & me to sleep! Views of Lanai & Molokai were breathtaking along with a rainbow EVERY day...what more could one ask for on Maui mornings! Service was superior! Accommodations were beyond expectations & exceptional! My husband uses a wheelchair & we requested a shower chair. Deluxe shower chair delivered! Beyond accommodating...we requested if Maintenance could remove a bathroom door in order to accommodate width of chair! Done! Sometimes its the little things that make a vacation! Kitchen was always handy in the morning, especially if one wishes to leisurely enjoy a cup of coffee (from patio) as the ocean waves roll in at the Shores oceanfront & ponder the days Maui activities! All amenities were great & handy, especially the coffee provided by the Kaanapali Shores! The Star Market is just across street for replenishing food items such as coffee, etc. Oh! By the way, the Shops at the Shores are sooo convenient for buying flip-flops for those wonderful beach walks! The Shores is wonderful for families, couples, everyone! What a place! Our best vacation ever! A true Hawaiian feel/atmosphere at the Shores! We would highly recommend the Shores to anyone! We are ready for another stay! CN from San Diego, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Would go back in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: Pa_Bob-0
Reviews.Content: We had a condo with a beautiful view of Lanai with living/dining room with balcony, kitchen & laundry. Fast and invisible maid service. The room was always perfect, no noise from other guests, excellent restaurant, small but thorough general store on premises, exercise room, informative concierge service, well known to all tourist services on the island. The stunning lobby leads to an amazing central garden with waterfall and fish pond. The whole property is kept in immaculate condition at all times without interfering with family enjoyment. When I get back to Maui this is my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for people of all ages”
Reviews.Author: jogate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Hawaiian islands. Our stay on Maui was wonderful. We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores. We arrived late but were greeted so warmly we felt right at home. The lobby is so lovely we knew we had arrived in Paradise. We were able to have a quick dinner at the restaurant. The food and service were great. Our room a one bedroom ocean view condo was so spacious. The washer and dryer were great - for at this point in our trip laundry we had. We had plenty of room to set up our laptop, relax and enjoy the view. The kitchen came in handy also. The wireless access was perfect. The grounds were lovely. The two pools had plenty of chairs as well as free chairs on the beach and the grounds. They also supplied an unlimited amount of beach towels. We met several honeymoon couples and families with children of all ages. The general tone of the property was full of the "Ohana" (family) feeling. It was so nice we felt so welcome and we were treated royally. The location was great and the beach is great for snorkeling. We hope to return soon with our grandchildren. They have a children's program and a Kids eat free at the restaurant. I highly recommend the Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Experience! Highly recommend for travelers on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: dmduffy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were awesome - just really friendly and very accomodating!! The maid staff were thorough and respectful of we honeymooners :) The hotel is located just 5 miles from Lahaina on beautiful Kaanapali beach. The beach in front of the hotel was great and not as crowded as going to Whalers village. The price is right for this hotel, that's for sure! The hotel is a bit dated, but I noticed some of the rooms had upgrades. And, on the day of checkout, they provided a complimentary change room for an hour before we had to catch our flight. Would definitely visit there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: DazedTA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Kaanapali Shores, and it was fabulous. We arrived at about 6pm, and were treated wonderfully. They even gave us Christmas lights to hang on our bushes around the outside of our room. Our room was a two bedroom unit on the ground floor, and was very nice. The appliances could have used some updating, but they functioned just fine. The pools at Kaanapali Shores were very clean, with a convenient bar at the pool nearest the ocean. The beach at Kaanapali Shores was very nice. There is a reef close to the shore, so you will want to be careful if you go out any further than about ten feet. We have two children who did just fine in the water. The views of Lanai and Molokai were fantastic! We were even treated to whales breaching throughout our stay! You will feel very safe at Kaanapali Shores, as they do have nightly security. Overall, I think that our group would go back to Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCFO
Reviews.Content: Went to Maui over Christmas with all my brothers and sisters and my parents to celebrate their 50th wedding anniversary â€“ total party of 25 in five separate condos. We stayed at Kaanapali Shores, a solid condo resort north of Kaanapali and Lahaina. If you are looking for lots of upscale touches and luxury (eg Four Seasons), this is not the place. However, it serves as a solid choice and a great base to explore Maui from the west side. The 2 BR unit was spacious enough - king bedded in master, two twins in other BR, a pullout couch in living room. Beds were quite comfortable. Living area had a nice kitchenette (sink, microwave, dishwasher and fridge, along with basic utensils), along with a dinette table and living room area and cable TV. It worked great for us and our four kids under 9. The grounds were nicely manicured and there is both an ocean side pool and a smaller pool more set back from the beach. Each room had a nice lanai to hang out on. Definitely a family crowd here - a lot of kids. The location is also not on the main stretch of Kaanapali Beach, but two miles north in Honokawai, and not easy walking distance to Whalers Village, etc. There is a convenient strip mall just across the street with a Star Market (large grocery store) where you can pick up drinks, snacks, etc. We spent mornings at the resort â€“ early swimming in one of the two pools, and would then go out during the day and explore the island and better beaches, and might return for a late afternoon swim. We split our meals, eating about half in the condo and half out. The beach in front of the hotel is so-so - often windy like the rest of the area, sand mixed with lava rocks and not all that great for swimming (although always good for a daily plunge). Lots of activities for families, hula dancing lessons, sunset stuff, etc... Also had a good, informative island briefing on the first day by expediaFUN. They booked some of our stuff and did a decent job with good pricing. A woman named Kai was very helpful. Housekeeping did bed-making and towel service and vacuuming each day. Parking is great in the garage, as we could park on the second level then walk 25 yards to our condo doors on the second level. In summary, solid choice on the west side â€“ especially if you have kids. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm, probably would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: RJM-Texas
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there to complete a week on the back of 5 days at the Westing Ocean Resort Villas. Evidently, all of these rooms are indivicually owned. The first one we were given was owned by someone who did not spend a dime on it in over 15 years! Original appliances, and thread bare carpet. Front desk lady, Rachel, was gracious and got us into another room that was much nicer, but not a good feeling that it is a roll of the dice at to weather you get a nice room. Very nice grounds and pool, restaurant, just basic, adequate. Good location, great coffee across the street, Java Jazz. Good thing as they do not have free coffee beyond the first night the restaurant coffee was dishwater. Charge you extra to park each day, and even $2 to use the safe! It is already there!? Generally, it feels well worn, carpet in the lobby in dire need of replacing and the A/C units are horribly loud. Happy it was only 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: devilspice
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon was from OCt 18-26th. The 1st week we spent in Honolulu (Hilton Hawaiian Village) but this week in Maui is what we were really looking forward to. Come with me now as I recap our wonderful experience on Maui & at the Kaanapali Shores (here on out referred to as RKS). After flying 6000 miles to get from NJ to Oahu I couldn't have been happier to be taking a 35 minute flight. Open seating, you get on, strap in, get some guava juice or a coke & you land, that's it! Of course you still have to get to the airport 9 days before you take of to go through screeing but hey, that's the world we live in now. When we pick up our luggage you exit the terminal I was a little confused, there are car rental buses that are going by but not stopping, so you walk 100 feet to the right & there are the car rental agencies. You get there & a sign says if you have a reservation then go back to the terminal & board a bus to pick up location??? Anyway right behind this sign is a pick up location that everyone gravitated to so we went around & it was very crowded for Enterprise (lowest rates). We kinda made it to the front of the line by approaching from the right hand side but we felt like we cut the line we waited for a bus to fill up & just took the next. Note: people who just came off of 9 hour flights are a bit cranky & will easily demonstrate this on line, especially that little Southern Belle who became the pack leader of the line & insisted we were cutting when we politely waited for an entire bus to fill up, but we just came off a 35 minute flight so we weren't. We get our jeep & it was yellow! Yellow? Yes, only in Maui would I ever be cool with this so Hakuna Mattata, we left for RKS. Being to Maui once before I vaguely remember how to get to Kaanapalli but it came back pretty fast, it's not hard at all. Now for RKS, we arrive & check in & our room isn't ready, not a big deal it is 2pm though, but we get free drink vouchers (yeah) & head to the pool. Bartenders & staff are very nice. The drinks here are CHEAP. I mean price not quality, especially coming from Oahu where you had to take out a 2nd mortgage for happy hour. $3.50 for a beer! $6.50 Mai tai's etc. The Met's are losing to the Cardinals back home & everyone looks really cold (he-he) so we head back to the desk & our room was ready & we got a honeymoon upgrade. Thanks to the dude behind the counter who hooked us up! We get to our room & it's kinda far from the beach but it's huge, it has a kitchen, a huge lanai (balcony), it has a partial ocean view & it's a good deal so we are happy. We also got a $100 food & bevg credit which we wiped out in one meal there but it was a nice little perk. The room: reading other reports I can confim this: it does have a slightly musty smell, nothing major, the bedroom faces the parking lot & there are thin walls there but no where else in the room, the kitchen has some antiquated appliances but they all work, the AC was pretty weak & it was also pretty loud on high. They make up your room around 3pm each day, a little late & they don't do much more than the bedroom & bathroom but no big deal. What I didn't like about the room: TV in living room had volume that would change drastically when you changed the channel, the tub had a drain that had to be pulled out completely to keep from filling up the tub. These were minor things to us though. I would go back there in a heartbeat. The grounds: Could not ask for more, spacious, huge pool with an actual deep end & a bar right there. Beach looked much bigger when we were there then I remember seeing in pictures so that was good, too rocky to swim right there though. Pool has a glass fencing around it b/c it can be windy, nice touch. We used Expedia desk to book a tour without incident & it was competitively priced, sundry shop there was way too expensive! $9.00 for cereal?? Shop across the street at supermarket. Lot's of parking, just go into 5 level garage if you can't find any in front. This place is very nice, very pretty has some mileage on it but the people are friendly, the price is good & it's a great location so feel free to stop having any concerns about here unless you are the type that has a problem with how much evian spritz they give you poolside at the 4 seasons. Activities: We did sunset cruise, not really worth it booze was really cheap quality & pupu's were lame, besides you don't really feel like drinking after you are on board for more than 20 minutes. Helicopter tour-A MUST! We used Alex-air & had a one hour tour, beautiful! Snorkel Tour- the afformentioned Expedia desk-we went to Molomini & Turlte Town-MUST DO! Totally worth it, Pride of Maui crew was very nice. Luau-Make sure you do your homework & pick the right one. The cheaper they are the more you suffer. We did the Feast at LELE. It was PERFECT! Had our own table instead of farm tables, no buffet, we had servers & show was really good. Food was interesting so go with an open mind, drinks top notch. Only thing that bothered me was they take your picture & you can buy them affter but they have 4 sizes of the picture & you have to buy all of them or none. Road to Hana-we got there a week after the earthquake, got up early & were at Hana by 11 am. Great pace, however 4 miles past Hana a little rinky-dink bridge was out so we could not go all the way around. I almost cried (no not really) b/c that meant I had to drive 3 hours back the way I came & now against traffic across all of these 1 lane bridges & hair pin turns while people coming from the other way were'nt really paying attention. It was a tough drive & I was fried when we got done. But no sacred pools, no Tedeschi winery, oh well. Dining-RKS reataurant was pretty good, didn't eat there after we used our credit. Ruth's Chris-great steak, great wine, great scott, the bill! Longhis-Very good Italian food. Moose McGillacuddys-go there for burgers, wings, beer for lunch, dancing at night. A word on pizza-Being from NJ I know good pizza, it is impossible to find good pizza on Maui, so don't expect it ok? Can't remember the others but pick up a book on where to eat & you'll be fine. So in summary RKS-very nice, Maui oh so nice much better than Oahu. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amulyadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights a week before Thanksgiving 2006. Didn't get the ocean view but the room has a kitchen, microwave and refrigerator and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation @ Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: wasper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores mid Oct and had a great experience. Staff was very professional and friendly. Location is perfect...there's plenty going on if you like to be active, and it's quiet enough to just relax. Only a few minutes drive to the tourist areas if you want to take that in. We plan on returning to this area and will stay at Kaanapali Shores again, nothing about this condo that we would change. We had several meals and drinks at the bar/restaurant on site...excellent...and the shops in the facility had everything you would need in a pinch if you didn't want to leave the area. All in all, great vacation, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families!”
Reviews.Author: nicksmom77
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families and seniors who love kids. If you are single....try another condo resort. We stayed here for 6 nights and we were very happy with the condo and the service. The condo was great for the kids (they need room to run around). The condo could have used a new fridge and stove but they did their purpose. The best thing that is right on the beach and there is a market and a coffee place (Java JAzz) right across the street. Java Jazz has the best coffee that I have ever tasted!!! You will love this condo resort!

Reviews.Title: “Queit Comfort”
Reviews.Author: DBJR
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and pleasant going out of their way to ensure a pleasurable stay. The grounds are beautiful, family friendly, and relatively quiet. Near the beach they have a restraurant with good food and service, and priced to make it a value. I would return. If, a view is important to you be sure to select that kind of room. The views are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay at the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: cali2maui
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the RQ Kaanapali Shores this past month (october 2006) and it was great! i wasn't expecting much because of the great deal we got through expedia, but i was very pleasantly surprised. our room was clean, spacious and the hotel was right on the beach. our room was upgraded to a garden view room for free and you could see the ocean from our balcony. our room was on the third floor right above the front desk. we got new towels everyday and our room was cleaned everyday. staff was very friendly. grounds are clean and well kept. pools are good. the beach in front of the hotel is great too. the only thing i'll mention is that our garden view room was quoted to have a king size bed but it was a double. so the front desk let us take a look at another room with a king size bed but we liked the first room better so we stuck with it. other than that, no complaints at all. don't expect ultra-luxurious accomodations because you're not paying for it! But you get a lot more than you pay for at the Kaanapali Shores. the hotel was just an added bonus to our wonderful trip to maui. i would definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing place!”
Reviews.Author: Trixxee
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Kaanapali Shores. I have to say I was really happy with the place. We stayed in a 1-bedroom garden view on the 5th floor but we could still see the ocean. The gardens really are pretty (but how about those birds in the evening?)! Our unit was really comfortable and clean. Having the W/D to do a few loads was great. Both pools were relaxing and not very crowded. Pool bar- happy hour mai tais are quite the deal. On-site restaurant was good (we only ate breakfast there). Staff was very nice. Having a couple of stores on-site was convenient. Lounge chairs on the beach to catch the sunset was sooo nice. Thank you to other reviewers who recommended the Okazuya Deli and Java Jazz. We ordered take-out several times from both places and ate on the lanai. Please don't miss the sauteed mahi-mahi with the lemon/wine/caper sauce at Okazuya. It was $11.95 and you would have thought you were eating a $30 meal, not to mention the portions are very generous. At Java Jazz, order the sausage, vegetable and feta frittata. I think it was $9 and enough for two people to share. Pizza Paradiso in the same center as Java Jazz was very good too. You really can eat well on a budget here. We book our trip through Costco. $1027 for the three of us which included the room, intermediate car, $100 dining credit, fresh leis for all, and a fruit & wine basket that was delivered to us. You can't go wrong with that price. We plan on going back again next fall when Aloha Airlines comes out with their "fall sale" prices.

Reviews.Title: “A great time at ka'anapali shores”
Reviews.Author: RoxyChicka3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Ka'anapali shores the night of Halloween. I chose this hotel because of its central location. The moment we walked in we were greeted and by the time we got to the front desk at least three more people greeted us. Everyone was so pleasant and friendly which really put me in a good mood! The check in process was quick and the room was easy to find. Our room was fabulous. There were four in our party so we booked a two-bedroom, which could have comfortably slept more than four people. The master bedroom was huge with a king size bed, more than enough closet space, and a spacious bathroom, it was perfect for my married friends. My other friend and I stayed in the other bedroom that had two beds and more then enough room for the both of us and all of our things. The second bathroom was great because it was big enough for the both of us to get ready at the same time. The living room was a great place for all of us to hangout in and the view from the two balcony's were fabulous. We had a lot of fun making dinner and late night snacks in the kitchen and it was big enough that everyone was making something at the smae time! The room was great and it was a perfect compliment to the rest of the property. With great landscaping and waterfalls, walking around the property is absolutely beautiful. The pool next to the ocean was a great place to hangout and swim. There is a bar at the restaurant so grabing drinks is really easy!! I had a wonderful experience and I can't wait to stay there again and relax by the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: golfnutone
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a terrific weekend at the Kaanapali Shores hotel. The hotel is very clean and is located near shops (for the wife!). We are from Oahu and are used to being near the beach. However, nothing compares to the beach at Kaanapali. The hotel is right on the beach and it is great to wake up and look out the window to see the beach first thing in the morning. We were given an ocean view room, and it was well worth it. We have stayed at hotels in Waikiki with an ocean view, but the view from our room at the hotel was better than any in Waikiki. We enjoyed the restaurant. The food was fine, but the real treat is the atmosphere at night. I went to the hotel for business. When we decided to do a weekend getaway, this hotel immediately came to mind. It took some convincing to get the wife to go to Lahaina, but when we got to our room, she agreed that it was the right decision to make.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingD
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a beautiful 2BR Oceanfront condo in October 2006. From the moment we checked in my family and I were delighted with the property and our room. The ResortQuest staff was very professional and friendly. All of us wished we could stay a few more days!

Reviews.Title: “Tired room. "Ocean view" was a stretch.”
Reviews.Author: ThomasfromPhoenix
Reviews.Content: (Resort owned, not a privately owned room.) Tired room. Clean, but dang was everything old. The appliances were old and out dated. The refrigerator was terribly loud 24 hours a day and needed replacing. The oven range was essentially antique with a clock that had rotating, motor driven numbers. I haven't seen those old rubber floor moldings unrolled and wrapped around corners since my grandmother's house. "Ocean view" was a stretch. We were in room 651, two buildings from the beach. You could see a sliver of sand and surf between the buildings, but nothing to write home about. Would I stay here again? Hmmm, maybe. I wouldn't pay a premium. Good resort and beach for the kids. Tons of kids on the property. Nice pools and grounds. Friendly and helpful staff. Great $100 free food voucher on check-in. $9 a day for parking was a gouge, but is probably par for most of the area resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: WannaBeIslandGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with our 3 year old son, stayed at the Kaanapali Shores from 09/11 - 09/21. This is the 3rd time we've stayed at KS and we've always found the staff very warm and friendly and the accomodations very satisfactory. Rachel at the front desk was very accomodating. We asked to change room so we can be right across the children's pool. Although we had to wait 3 days for a room, she was able to do it for us. The day we can move, our things were waiting for us in our new room when we got back from the beach. Yes, the kitchen and the bathrooms are a little outdated but it's no big deal. We never had any problems with the parking. You can also take the bus to go to the Whalers Village or to Front Street. Just ask the bell desk for the bus schedule. There is a very entertaining free hula show on Wednesdays. They serve rum and punch for $2 a glass. The Star supermarket across the street is very handy. Most of the nights, we stayed in and got food from their deli. We also stocked up on drinks and snacks. Restaurant recommendations: The Gazebo at Napili Shores (for breakfast; their pancakes are worth waiting in line for), Leilani's and Rusty Harpoon at the Whaler's Village (for lunch or dinner), Cilantro's (Mexican fast food) and Kobe (for teppanyaki dinner; call ahead to make reservations). The best luau is Old Lahaina (no firedancers but very good show and food). Must see: Haleakala and the Road to Hana (highly recommended to take a tour bus instead of driving yourself so you can enjoy the view) If you want a comfortable and friendly place to stay in Maui, this hotel will work for you. If you want a fancy hotel and will be spending most of your time at the hotel, the Sheraton, the Westin or the Marriott would probably be a better choice for you. But for couples and families on a budget, KS is a wonderful place to stay. I recommended this hotel to my cousin and his new wife for their honeymoon. They got back last week and they loved this hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Great ammenities and location for the price”
Reviews.Author: k93023
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a bit dated and showing signs of wear but for the price, you can't beat it. Had two,2 bdrm. suites, ocean front at ground level that were perfect. Maui sunsets from our lanais, twenty steps to the sand, 40 steps to the restaurant/bar. What more does one need?

Reviews.Title: “Aloha at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: SKLK
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Kaanapali Shores in Maui! The hotel staff are always pleasant and very helpful. They even go out of their way to greet you even when your just passing by in the hallways. The property is beautiful and the location is superb. Your right on the beach but if you want to sit at the pool you can still enjoy the incredible view of the ocean. The restaurant has great food and again great views of the ocean. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel for a vacation. SK

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds, Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: falele
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath ocean view condo. My advise is to ask for a condo that faces the SUNSET. Tell them you want a room with a lanai that has a great sunset view. We got a great view on the 9th floor (we asked for a top floor for the great views) but we could not see the sunset because the building was in the way. We went down to the pool to watch the sunset and they are magnificent!! The beds were very comfortable. The beach out front is a little rocky with coral, so we drove to the sheraton beach front and went snorkeling there instead. The staff was great and the $100 included restaurant certificate was great with costco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for the week”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVEL1993
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort at the end of September. When we arrived at check-in we were greeted very nicely, however, during the check -in process the phone rang and the person helping us took the phone call. She began offering information to the guest on the phone while we stood and waited for her to finish checking us in. We feel that the phone call should have been put on hold and our check-in process completed first. Our 1 bedroom oceanview room was on the 9th floor. We had a great view of the garden area as well as the ocean. The condo itself appeared to have been recently updated with paint, carpet and new furnishings. The kitchen appliances were old and could stand to be replaced. The refrigerator either froze your items or kept them luke warm. The bathroom was clean but it could also use some updating by replacing the tile in the shower, new tile on the floor and replace the sink. The restaurant had pretty good food and the prices were fairly reasonable. We ate there for 2 breakfasts and one dinner. We also had trouble with finding a place to park especially if you came back after 9:30pm. The charge of $9 a day to park is quite excessive. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this property and would recommend it to our friends and family. After reading some of the other reviews, we would tell them to make sure that they requested an updated unit when they make their reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: vandiepen
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids (4 and 2), mom, and I just returned a few weeks ago from 7 days in Maui. We loved the Kaanapali Shores. It was family-friendly, had a decent beach and two great pools to hang out at. We stayed in one of the condos and paid for a garden view but from our lanai we could see the ocean and Molokai. It was amazing. The garden was gorgeous and the restaurant was pretty good. Everything we needed was either at the resort or right across the street in a small stripmall with a grocery store. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was nice too because we had an Expedia Fun desk right at the resort to sign up for activities and their prices were much better than booking directly. The resort was just a short drive from Front St in Lahaina so lots of food choices and shopping were close by. We also had a local farmers market about two blocks away that we walked to and bought fresh pineapple and other goodies to munch on. There was a good italian/pizza/sub shop right across the street. There was also a Mexican joint and a sushi bar but we didn't try those but they were handy. The room was great. They did want to charge us $20/day for a rollaway bed. We cheaped out and bought a $15 sleeping bag at K-Mart and had our 4-year-old sleep in that. It was worth it. Who wants to blow another $140 on a bed? I would highly recommend this resort. We had a great time and hope to return someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Average, average, average............................”
Reviews.Author: kevbern
Reviews.Content: If your looking for average rooms, average accomodations and average property for an average price this is your hotel. If your looking for a little more than average than this is not your place to stay. First, The room had a musty, moldy smell that we could not get rid of........The property was very average, nothing extravagant. Pools were small. On the plus side, the hotel employees were very nice and helpful. It's too bad the hotel didn't help their cause. In a nut shell, you could probably find a better place to stay for the same or better price. I would not recommend this to my family or friends...

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous vacation”
Reviews.Author: plimpert
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay from Hawaii.com. We had a great time. The grounds of the Hotel was absolutely gorgeous. All of the people working in the Hotel were very friendly and helpful. We ended up upgrading our room to an ocean front room. It was great to hear the water crashing on the beach while going to sleep every night. The sunsets were amazing. We wished we could have stayed longer than we did. It is an older building, but you can tell they work hard to keep it looking good. The two stores located at the hotel were also very helpful and very reasonably priced. The beach in front of the hotel is very clean. They had plenty of lounge chairs to lay out on the beach. The beach is a little rocky, so bring some water shoes. This was our first trip to Maui. Overall, we had a terrific time. We loved it. We can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: Den/Deb
Reviews.Content: We go to Maui every year and stay at the Kaanapali Shores Condominiums. Our first stay was in 1983 and we have been back 10 times since. twice we stayed at the Embassy Suites next door. We found the Kaanapali shores Condominium to be better in all categories. We have never been treated rudely in any way. In fact, we feel the workers at all levels make you feel welcome and appreciate your visit. We have a booked vacation again in January 2007. Our selection again is Kaanapali Shores, we love it !!!

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: mountainhi
Reviews.Content: the rooms are spacious and well maintained with a balcony the courtyard is a beautiful garden with water falls and exotic plants.the beach was wonderful along with two pools and a jacuzzi.very quiet at night,and family or couples oriented,a great place to relax

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise with the shores”
Reviews.Author: Ntgeek
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week vacation in Maui where we stayed at the Kaanapali Shores. Our stay was 9/8 - 9/13 and our plane landed about 1 hour early. We proceeded to try to check in even though we figured we were too early the staff was extremely kind and found a room for us in the Penthouse Floor. We had a beautiful view of the ocean with a kitchen just as purchased. The room was nicer than expected and having read reviews on this site I was not sure what to expect. To the Management of the shores who posted a correction to the previous review, we were infact charged for a safe even if we chose not to use it. It was clearly written in your paperwork provided to us that we would be charged $2.50/day regardless of use so it was encouraged to use it. With that said we had a lovely stay at the shores and the grounds were beautiful, we ate dinner the 1st night at the bar during happy hour and loaded up on Mai Tai. It was just my wife and I so we never used the pool and spent most of our time on the beach or doing activities. There was plenty of flatware for us to use and a dishwasher in the room with soap provided. Made running the dishwasher easy and convienant. We would definitly stay here again when we return to Maui! As for the $9/day parking, I would not complain to much since we stayed at Ala Moana in Oahu and they popped us $15/day parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not spactacular but jus OK”
Reviews.Author: silverlinning
Reviews.Content: We heard so many good things about the condos and location that we decided to go for it and book our 11 day trip at ResortQuest. When we first walked into the lobby we thought wow this place is really nice and holding up to expectations, then we got to the condo...lets just say I don't see where they rennovated anything. The kitchen was WAY outdated with ok kitchen supplies (no blender) the washer and dryer were really old and I swear the dryer was going to catch on fire (luckily it never did) and it just didn't feel clean. The rooms were okay, tight squeeze with the furniture set up, had to turn sideways to get around the bed and the TV in the master bedroom. The master bathroom was gross. They need to do some resealing around the sink and the bathtub, let me just say YUCK! A lot of build up. The doors to the master lani were really hard to open and when the living room lani and the master lani both open the all the doors would slam shut. At night the doors would shack and seem like they were opening constantly so we had to stick rags underneath jus to get any sleep. The maid service was okay but they would come at the most random times. We tried to be gone when they would come but they kept showing up either at 8a (WAY TOO EARLY) or not until 4:30 in the afternoon when we were tryiing to get ready for dinner. To get them to change the sheets we had to strip our beds ourselves. They don't clean much either (no vacumming unless you request it) they just wipe down and go. They were usually there for maybe 10 min. We never used the pools because they always seemed to crowed and the hot tub was always packed. The beach was nice though. We always found chairs and it was nice and relaxing. Nightime walks down the beach were nice. We found the Embasy Suites next door to be very nice. We loved the grounds, the pool and the resturants there. We did a timeshare presentation over there and was very impressed and come to find out the prices were comprable (oh well, you live you learn) The condos are in a nice location just make sure you go grocery shopping at Costco or Safeway not the Star Market. Overall, we would never stay there again. We will probably never go back to Maui. I guess it is either the Big Island or Kaui. Gotta try all the islands once and then pick your favorite and Maui just isn't it....We still had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Rosa2
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in a 1 bedroom ocean view, 7th floor. We could hear the pleasant sound of the waves at night. Our room faced the attractive garden and pool area. The 2 pools are great for kids (ours are 7 and 11). Water shoes are needed for the beach in front of the property. Ka'anapali beach is much more sandy and ihas great snorkling. It's a short drive with parking at the Whalers Village if you make a $10. purchase (easy enough with a Borders in the shopping complex... a good time to buy your Iz Kamakawiwo'ole CD if you haven't done that yet) Accross the street from the hotel is a Star Market where expensive groceries can be found (this is what the locals pay!) and a great coffee shop, Java Jazz. The unit was large which the children loved. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping service was very good. I thought the kitchen area was poorly designed and the appliances old and worn, the refridgerator was quite noisy. It's too bad they chose the bottom line of appliances, floor tiles and cabinetry when they designed the units.

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than OK”
Reviews.Author: cjk4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui. 8 days at the Kaanapali Shores condos. The service was fine and at times above avergage but the disapointing thing was the condo itself. We we told by the American Express travel that they had all been remodeled in the last year. Well, if that was a remodeled condo I am not sure what to think. We had a beautiful ocean view and the size of the condo was very roomy. The kitchen cabinet doors were almost falling off their hinges, cottage cheese ceilings, old plumbing and very old and sometimes moldy appliances. I did not cook a thing in that kitchen. They did offer us another condo but when I looked at it is was identical. The conceirge service, provided by ExpediaFun!, was excellent. They had terrific suggestions and I think they saved us money on some of the activities we did. The two pools were lovely and our kids enjoyed them although only one was appropriate for younger kids. The on site restaurant "The Beach Club" was pretty good and had some interesting selections. Their prices were decent too. I doubt I would stay their again. We booked at the last minute and not much was avaiable. The location was great to get to Lahaina were all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: IANAL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for our honeymoon in March 2006. We got reccomendations from our friends regarding this resort/condo. We opted for the slightly expensive option of taking the sea side view. It isnt really next to the sea shore (about 50-100 yards away), but there was no obstruction in our view. First day we got up and saw two whales going across :) simply magical, but nothing like that happened in the 5 days after that :). Our views were the lovely ocean in front of us and mountains with clouds rolling down the slopes whenever we left the room. The hotel service was excellent. They offered one day free if you book 4 days and gave us a 100$ coupon in the restaurant/dinner thingy that they have downstairs. Really helped as far as breakfast was concerned. I would highly recommend the jacuzzi (can get crowded occasionally) and a mai tai. The beachfront itself in front of the hotel is pretty small (about 5 yards) at high tide. But this hotel location offers quick access to the tiny beaches northwest (kapalua bay was lovely) and downtown Lahaina. I guess Hana and kihei are a little far off from here, but the last thing you want to do when you go to hawaii is spend time rushing from place to place. Just sit back on the beach, relax, read a book, just absorb the natural beauty around you. I would certainly stay here when we go back to maui/hawaii. Damn, just writing about it brings back so many memories, I want to go right now!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: CannonFodder
Reviews.Content: We (two teen boys, my wife and I) stayed here for the first week in August. I chose this place over the ResortQuest Kaanapali Villas based on reviews here and comments from a travel agent. Overall the resort is nice and met expectations. We had a garden view one bedroom condo. The grounds are very nice; I believe I heard that the property was recently renovated. There are two pools and two hot tubs. The pools are your average hotel style pools; no waterslides or "lazy river" features. The pools were used mostly by younger kids, and the hot tubs seemed to have a mix of later teen to early twenties people when I went. There is a large lawn area where kids/families can play. There are a lot of birds chirping (sounded like hundreds of themâ€¦it was actually kind of loud) in the courtyard in the evening, but it didnâ€™t bother us. The beach is average to nice. There is an actual beach area (unlike some properties), so if laying on the beach is what you want to do then you can do it here. The waters are nicely swim-able but no decent snorkeling or surfing here. For that you'll need to take a drive. Keep in mind that the Kaanapali beach area from Black Rock (the Sheraton) and south just past Whalers Village is where you'll find good snorkeling, surfing lessons, shore scuba diving, and parasailing. If you want to have those activities without driving, then you may consider going the expense of staying at a property in that area. There is an activities desk at the property run by Expedia. I was disappointed with their service. I called ahead to book a luau. The Old Lahaina Luau was booked, so I booked the one at the Hyatt (Drums of the Pacific) through the activities desk instead. Just on a whim I called the Old Lahaina Luau directly and found that I could be put on a waiting list. It turned out that an opening came up during the time we'd be staying and we where able to go to the Old Lahaina event. The activities desk people never offered to be put on a waiting list. Then, when I checked in for our stay, the front desk people gave me a coupon for what appeared to be a pretty good deal at the Hyatt luau, and the activities desk people didn't mention this offer on the phone with me. The condo was clean with ample space. Cookware was minimal but we got by. I wish the room included a blender. The maids come every day to make the bed, restock towels and take out the garbage. The linens are not replaced every day (I think every other day). You have to do your own dishes - there is a dishwasher and some detergent is provided. There is a $9 per day parking charge with unlimited ins and outs. I knew this when booking the trip so I just accepted it. Our stay included a $100 credit for food charges, so that was a nice addition to the trip. I have the feeling everyone gets this but you might check to make sure. The onsite restaurant is very nice. The hotel staff (excluding the Expedia desk) were friendly and helpful. There is a strip mall across the street with a Star Market (grocery store size), Maui Dive Shop, and other smaller restaurants like sushi and pizza. There is free WiFi on the property in certain areas. From our room I was only able to connect twice and the connection speed was too slow to be usable one of those times, so you should plan on going to the lobby area for a better connection. There is also a computer room where people can access the internet on rented computers for around $1 for 15 minutes or so. This was a big hit for our two MySpace junkie kids. I think this property as with the other condos in the area are more suited for families than couples looking to get away or for honeymooners. Would I stay here again? Well, I would shop more by price if I am staying anywhere other than that prized strip of Kaanapali Beach south of Black Rock. I would stay at this property again if the price was close to other properties in the area. A quick overview of the activities we did: - SCUBA diving through Lahaina Divers. I did my advanced open water certification and one kid did his open water certification, plus additional dives for the kids. I highly recommend Lahaina Divers for diving (perhaps not for snorkeling unless you are in to free-diving). - Old Lahaina Luau - The best luau Iâ€™ve been to so far (my third). - Surfing lessons with Island Style Adventures Surf School - the kids were satisfied with them. - Downtown Lahaina - I recommend Top Cats for a burger lunch. Other than that one walk up and down the strip was enough for me. It is fairly touristy compared to the towns we visited last year in Kauai. I think Lahaina is geared more for the cruise ship crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Us”
Reviews.Author: cyndiLouWho
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly a week at Kaanapali Shores 7/16/06 - 7/22/06. The room was booked through ResortQuest via a Hawaiian Airlines package. At first I was not sure about the location since I had pre-selected another condo hotel. My original choice was not available. I traveled with my mother, 65 and daughter 5 and our stay was perfect and we were very pleased with our visit. The property is absolutely beautiful with a lobby that is both comfortable and sophisticated. Our one bedroom unit was recently remodeled and worked out perfectly. The kitchen was much larger than I anticipated and the beds (king in bedroom and queen sleeper) were both quite comfortable. The only real noise came from the flocking birds and an occasional car alarm in the parking lot. (disarmed quickly) The property has beach front which some have said is too thin a strip but it was more than adequate for my 5 year old to boogey board and build sand creations until her hearts content. The pool near the beach seemed a bit more crowded but we have a pool at home and only used the garden pool occasionally. There was always plenty of space at the beach and pool and one really nice feature is there is some shade near the beach which my mother really enjoyed. We also had several meals at the on site restaurant which worked out great for days we wanted to spend most of the day at the beach or if we had been touring all day and wanted something convenient. The mahi tacos and crab salad were terrific and my 5 year old was hooked on the grilled cheese. There is a Star Market right across the street, which I found to be on par price wise with the Safeway, had a hot food bar as well as a good wine selection. Java Jazz in the same plaza makes one of the best mochas I have ever had and has a very nice selection of breakfast pastries. The $9 parking is not an issue at all just know that the cost is added on before you go. The high-speed interenet is 'FREE' and available throughout the property and allows secure VPN connections if you are needing to catch up with work while you are there. We are definately returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped it would be!!”
Reviews.Author: kidlefty
Reviews.Content: Our family of five, two adults, and three teens just returned from an awesome week in Maui. Our stay at Kaanapali Shores was wonderful. Our condo was clean, modern and well maintained. We had an awesome view of the gardens, pool and ocean. It truly felt like we were in paradise. The staff was very polite and helpful throughout our stay. We dined in the hotel restaurant the first night and thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We tried everything from pasta to mahi mahi to hamburgers. Everything was very good. Our family also enjoyed BJ's Pizza, Bubba Gumps, Chinaboat and Cheeseburger in Paradise while we were visiting. I have to say our favorite eatery was Pinatas(Kahului). The restaurant was in a strip mall and was not much on decor but the Mexican food and salsas were exceptional. We also highly recommend a private snorkel adventure with Ann Fielding or Suzzy Robinson. We snorkeled from shore but were snorkeling with a lot of the people boat tours and had our own private guide. She showed us sea turtles, eels, fish etc. and gave our kids and us a wonderful lesson on fish and marine life in the process. You can reach Suzzy through Ed Robinson's Diviing Adventures mentioned in most Maui tour guides. I truly understand why people go on vacation in Maui and end up staying. Our stay was awesome and the Kaanapali Shores Condos were the perfect place to stay in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As is often the case, I have read the good reviews and the bad. A big factor seems to be what unit you stayed in. We booked through VRBO--- and were able to see pictures of the unit we rented in advance. Better yet, we saved $200/night! That goes a long ways towards covering the food bill. Our modern 2BR/2B ocean view condo on the 8th flloor was very spacious and ideal for our family of 5. The view of the property was great, which is notable since the grounds are spectacular. Wonderfull landscaping makes you sure you are in Hawaii (i.e., paradise). We also liked the location away from the crowds on Ka'anapali Beach, but still 5 min. drive to the best dining in West Maui. The Star Market across the street was great for groceries, and the coffee shop and Subway in the same strip were very convenient when we were on the "go". The beach is on the small side, especially at high tide, and yes, there are some rocks (like there are on many Maui beaches - simple solution, wear surf shoes). Our only minor complaint about service was the bartenders at the pool bar. After waiting in line for 15 minutes, their dry attitude didn't add much to the experience. Get some bartenders that like people, and have enough of them to handle the crowd (you'll make more money too!). Otherwise, everyone else on the staff seemed very friendly. Last bit of advice to guests - don't hang around the hotel pools all day, there is way too much else to see and do on Maui for that!!

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: travelphan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 24 to June 30 - two families, a total of 7 people - 4 adults and kids aged 12, 14 and 15. We had asked our travel agent to request nearby rooms but one was a garden view and one was a std one bedroom - the best she could do. When we checked in, Rachel couldn't do enough for us and was able to upgrade us reasonably to a garden view room as well and we were on the same floor. We had 1 BR condos with a pull out sofa in the living room, and a lanai off that with a garden view but also ocean view. Having laundry facilities in the apt was wonderful since we were traveling with kids plus would be away for a total of 2 weeks. Full kitchen was a nice touch too although we only used the refrigerator. Restaurant by pool was very nice and reasonable for lunch - having $100 credit for food and drinks per family was a nice bonus. Were able to eat lunch twice and had drinks one night at the pool before going to dinner in town and just went over slightly. Convenient having the shopping center across the street - ate breakfast in daily and stocked up on snacks, water, soda, etc. at Star Market. Beach was good but needed to wear water shoes if you went in the water due to coral reefs. Chairs were limited but we always managed to get them. Pools were good too. Welcome breakfast with tour info was a waste of over an hour - we were able to book our own activities at less cost and could do it on our own schedule. Front Street in downtown Lahaina is worth the visit - lots of great shops and restaurants and places to shop for souveniers. Snorkeling at the Molokini Crater is great - Maui Dive Shop had a boat ride that left about 10:30 for a half day - fit our schedule and enjoyed by all. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not a fit for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: bdancause
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12 night honeymoon stay in a standard hotel room at the Kaanapali Shores. When we arrived, we were offered an upgrade to a studio for $60 more a night. After viewing the studio, we decided to stay with the hotel room, opting to spend the extra money on activities and dinner. Hotel Room The room itself was small (as expected) but reasonable for 2 people who weren't planning on spending much time in the room. The furnishings were modern (wood with pineapple style decor). The room had a vanity that was separate from the bathroom/toilet, making it convenient to get ready in the morning. The bathroom was sufficient (decent water pressure and a unique platform next to the tub to place toiletries or sit), but was very dark. The room offered a large closet and lots of hangers, but only one small dresser under the tv. My main only minor complaint was that the lighting consisted of old flourescent panel lights that were outdated. Our room was on the 9th floor (referred to as the Penthouse) and offered a perfect view of the gorgeous sunset each evening. We were surprised by how loud the birds in the lower jungle like courtyward were in the early evening and mornings (when it sounded like 100's were squaking). Service The staff here were pretty quiet and tried to stay out of the way. Maid service was virtually invisible throughout our stay and did a good job of keeping our room tidy. They seemed to come later in the day (2PM) but it seemed like that was because we were on the top floor. The front desk staff were friendly when approached and were able to answer our questions when we had any. We attended the island orientation to learn more about acitivities available (highly recommended). We used the prices provided at this presentation to shop around (we got better prices at Boss Frog's down the road). We used the hotel concierge (who actually work for Expedia) to book 2 of our activities. We ended up missing one of the excursions because the concierge told us the wrong meeting point- but they quickly apologized and rebooked us on another day. The concierge also failed to mention that second activity we booked (a Waterfall Hike) required participants to scale a 20 foot banyan tree to see the waterfall. Overall, though, it was convenient to have the activities desk in the hotel. Pools/Beach The 2 pools were average sized- very clean. I prefered the ocean front pool with a great view of the sunset. Pool towels were always available and we were always able to find a pair of chairs. With June being a busy month for family vacations, the pools were packed with lots of kids. It would be nice if there was an adult pool or if they made one of the 2 spas adults only. I was disappointed by the beach in front of the hotel (didn't spend more than an hour there). I found it to be rocky and very tiny. We walked down to the left of the resort and found a better strip of beach which looks like it will soon be developed (there were several cranes nearby). Don't be confused as I was- this is not the same Kaanapali Beach as the one the Marriot, Hyatt and others are on...it is on the other side of Black Rock and not as nice. Restaurant The most pleasant surprise of the trip was the Beach Club restaurant at the resort. After trying the breakfast buffet at the Embassy, we opted for the Beach Club every day thereafter for great breakfasts (try the portuguese french toast with coconut syrup or macadamia nut pancakes). We also ate there for a couple of lunches and 2 dinners. The sunset dining was amazing and the service was exceptional. This restaurant is a hidden jewel for Maui! Amenities I made use of the oceanside massage service. After tracking down the therapist to schedule an appointment (inconvienent appointment scheduling process), I was treated to an amazing ocean side lomi lomi massage. The price for a 50 min massage was $95 but well worth it. The hotel also offered a well stocked sundries shop (very expensive but convenient), gym (pricey at $10 a day), flower shop, salon and souvenir shop. Parking was reasonable ($9/day) and offered plenty of spots and in/out priveleges. The attendants were very friendly and willing to help provide directions. Overall Thoughts The Kaanapali Shores was a great home base for all the activities we had planned. It was convenient to Lahaina and great beaches (Kapalua, Fleming). A word of caution to honeymooners- this place is crawling with kids and families. I would highly recommend it for family reunions, but it is not the place for a quiet, romantic getaway. The facilities were great, but it was tough to find a quiet place on the property to just get away from it all...Some day in the future when we have children and return to Maui, we will definitely return to Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not So Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's my first visit to Hawaii, and and after so many great reviews from Friends, and reading them online, I decided Muai was the place to go. I checked reviews for this hotel online, and found most of them to be favorable. I was very much looking forward to it, but as soon as I checked in, I wasn't sure this would be the best choice. From the moment I approched the Reception desk, I was treated very rudely by the person who was working the night shift. My plane was delayed and we arrived at the hotel at 12:30 AM. I believe his name was Harry. and the first thing I could think of was, Number one, it wasn't his priority to make guests feel welcome, and Two, he seemed really bitter, and just like he hated his job. It was the worst welcoming experience I have ever received. I have received better service at the Motel Six in my younger days. I couldn't believe this Four Star rated hotel had someone like him working the front desk. When I arrived at my room I was suprised to see that the Extra money I had put in for the Ocean View was very little ocean view. There was a big wall next to my Lanai, and I could see merely a fraction of the ocean. However it was a wonderful view of the Gardens. I called the front desk to complain about this, and obviously, he wasn't helpful at all. In fact, when we first checked in, my mom was with me. It was her birthday and this trip was a special treat for her. My mom had mistakingly asked Harry, "and thats an ocean front rrom right?" He quickly snapped back, rather coldly and Rudely "NO ITS Not!!!! Its an Ocean View, and even with that, you'll just see some of the ocean."
