Word of Advice to management: GET RID OF HIM I really wanted to enjoy my stay in Muai. I was going to call the management the next day, but decided to not stress out and make the most of it. The grounds are indeed beautiful and the beach is nice. The restaurant was suprisingly good, and that was where I received the best service. There were many families, and it was rather quiet at night. The room was big, we had the one bedroom suite, and although it did look a little outdated, I just figured that was the laid-back style of beach culture. Parking was not the best, and it was always packed. The beach was jammed pack with Rocks in the water, and made it almost impossible to go inside. I did enjoy my stay here, but the service is questionable. I wouldn't consider this a four star hotel, I agree with other reviewers who have said this is more like a 3 star hotel. and the biggest reason for that is the level of service. Hopefully they can turn that around a make this the great resort that it can be.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: proxl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores for exactly a week. It was perfect for our needs, and we had a WONDERFUL time, but I could see where it might not be for everyone. We had a one-bedroom, garden-view condo. The furnishings were fine -- they were in good shape; the TV units both in the living room and the bedroom looked pretty close to new; the carpets looked newish, the paint was fresh. The kitchens were in good shape, though the appliances were old-looking (an avocado-colored stove!), they worked well. Similarly, the untensils were just fine; the bathroom was just fine; the towels/linens were just fine. Since we were there with our two elementary-school age children, this was exactly what we wanted -- clean, functional, no fuss. But if you're the type that wants fancy appointments, nice scents, fresh-cut flowers, etc., this place might not get the job done. (PS -- as we were there with a family reunion, I had a chance to see a bunch of different rooms (two-bedrooms, ocean-view, studio) and they all were similar. The grounds were terrific -- lovely jungle-y garden in the back, great green lawn in the middle. The pools were like the rooms -- very well kept, clean, convenient, easy to use/get to, plenty of towels, etc. But, again, not fancy - one bean-shaped, one rectangular, no diving boards or slides or fake waterfalls or whatever. Lots of kids in both (great for us, but if I were a honeymooner....) The gym had a pretty good supply of weights and weight machines and cardio, but it was two-storey and kind of cramped. There were a couple exercises I couldn't do because of the way a weight machine was positioned in the room. Also wasn't nuts about having to pay a surcharge to use the gym. The beach, as others described, is pretty sloped and narrow right in front of the hotel. But it's pretty and the view of Molokai and Lanai is spectacular. And, walk 100 yards in either direction and it widens out and levels out. What's more, really unbelievable beaches are a short drive away (I highly recommend Kapalua). Service was fine. The staff was reasonably attentive; the maids were reasonably efficient; they kept the place clean. But you had to go looking for service, as opposed to somebody following you around anticipating your every need. One thing I really liked was all the food choices. The Beach Club restaurant did a nice, basic, affordable breakfast; had good choices for lunch by the pool; stiff $3 mai-tais at happy hour (3 p.m.-5 p.m.) and a surprisingly good dinner. Ate there with 12 adults and we all ordered different things (fresh seafood of various types) and everybody raved. Wine list is weak, but you can't have everything. Directly across the street is a strip mall that has pizza, sushi, Mexican, a very cool soup/coffee joint, and Star Mkt, which is a full-size grocery store for stocking up for the room. And Lahaina has a good number more choices, and is maybe 10 minutes away. Bottom line -- if (I hope WHEN) I go back to Maui, I'll try to stay here again, if I'm bringing my whole family. If I'm coming with just my spouse for a romantic anniversary or something, I might try something fancier. Two tips -- One, don't go to the Sunset Luau at the Sheraton Maui. The food was good (mmmmmm-piiiiig!), but the show was unimpressive. Second, if you have elementary school-age kids, book a room on the ground level. Your patio opens right onto the grounds, so you can sit on your patio with your morning coffee, the kids can run around the garden in your plain sight, and when you come back to the room from the pool or the beach or wherever, you don't have to bring noisy, dirty kids into a lobby or an elevator or down a narrow hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousMe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores from June 10-16, 2006. "We" consisted of two adults, one teenager, one pre-teen, and a four-year old. I booked through Costco.com, who assured me that we had an oceanfront, as opposed to oceanview, room. When we arrived, I was surprised to find that Costco.com had secured us an oceanview room. I had to pay an extra $500+ to upgrade to an oceanfront room during our stay. Our oceanfront wasn't one of the top-of-the-line rooms ending in -01 that you read about in previous posts; it was one of the "standard" oceanfront rooms. We had 1,100 square feet with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, full kitchen and washer/dryer. We were on the ground floor, so could walk out our large sliding glass doors to the patio, a small yard with stepping stones, and on down to the beach. For the most part, the room was very comfortable. The master bed and bath were decent sized and well laid out. This bedroom had a color tv, and two safes in the large closet. The second bedroom was smaller, with two twin beds and a large closet. This room didn't have a view, except if you count the walls of the large pink Embassy next door. The kitchen was good sized, with older appliances. There were plenty of dishes, utensils and glasses, but the selection of cooking utensils was pretty basic. Bring or buy your own plastic wrap/plastic bags, as none were provided. They did provide an initial supply of dishwasher, clothes washer and dish soap, but did not automatically replenish once you ran out. We had to keep picking replacements up at the front desk. Housekeeping came in once a day and performed pretty basic services like making (not changing) the beds, sweeping and vacuuming, and cleaning the bathrooms and kitchen counters. There are two pools on the property--one is right on the ocean, with the restaurant and bar right next door. It's a reasonably sized, but not large, pool. The second pool is in the center of the property and is more geared for kids. Most of this pool is 3' deep with the middle section only 4' deep. There's a large grassy area around this area for sunning or playing. There is a beach, although it's not the white sand beach that I was dreaming about. It's rather small and a lot of it will vanish at high tide, but it's still very nice. It drops off rapidly once you get in the water. There's some good snorkeling farther out. At low tide, take the kids off to the right, where they can find little crabs, lobster, and all kinds of sea life in the little pools on the rocks. Location was nice. It's not in tourist central, but not in the boondocks, either. There's an ABC store if you take a left out of the driveway. Take a right out of the driveway, and there's a shopping center across the street with a Star Market, which will have just about everything you need. You can also shop for groceries at the Safeway in the Lahaina Cannery Mall. The Cannery has a Longs Drug Store, which had some food items for less than you will pay at the supermarkets. Longs also had a good selection of local baked goods and Asian snacks and foodstuffs. And best of all, Longs is open until midnight! All in all, a good property. It's great for families and groups, but not for very picky princesses. We would stay here again, especially in an oceanfront room. Here's some recommendations for activities based on our experiences: --Baby Beach, which is north of downtown Lahaina. It's beautiful, protected and perfect for kids. It has some great snorkeling for those just starting out. We went there on the second day, so the older ones could get some snorkeling practice in before hitting Molokini. They had a great time and spent hours snorkeling. The little one loved the beach, warm water and gentle surf. We returned several times during our stay. --Took a snorkel boat run by the Pacific Whale Foundation to Molokini and Lanai. I'd recommend a big boat like this if you have small ones. But for those of you who don't have little ones and plan on maximum snorkeling, you might want to consider the new covered hard bottom "rafts" that are going out snorkeling. They're more expensive, but faster and can get to places the big boats can't. It took 90 minutes to get from Molokini to Lanai, which drove me nuts. I was envying the faster rafts! --We went to the Old Lahaina Luau. This books fast; if you want to go, make your reservation online before you get here. I made our reservation over a month before we arrived and most nights were already sold out. It was fine, but a little spendy at $89 for people 13 and over, and $59 for children 12 and under (lap babies are free). The after-dinner show was great and the kids loved watching the pig being unearthed from the imu. --We went on the zipline tour run by Skyline Ecoadventures--a must if you have preteens or teens! It has limited spaces and books up very fast. Again, book this online in plenty of time before you leave. --Took surfing lessons with the Royal Hawaiian Surfing Academy in downtown Lahaina. We took surf lessons the week before in Santa Cruz, CA and I thing the pre-water, on-board instruction by Royal Hawaiian was far superior. This resulted in most people getting up on the board on their first try, and everyone was able to get up consistently. A great value and a lot of fun. They have a professional photographer who will take pics and give you a cd for $15--definitely sign up for that beforehand. He got some wonderful shots we could never have taken ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calgary_traveller_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The beds were the most comfortable I've ever stayed in! The rooms were so nice, the kitchenette is very handy and there is a grocery store accross the street! The pools are nice, the one closest to the beach is often busy but tthe other pool in the garden always has chairs and is quiet and sunny. The restaruant was good. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, especially for the money paid; left early.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The stay at this property was a total disappointment. Although its website claims that guest rooms were recently renovated, we stayed in a 1-BR unit that was all original (20+ years old), very dated, stuffy, not even A/C, a 20-year old refrigerator; the whole room was so dark, like a cave. Although the property has indeed done some major renovation (the entrance, lobby, pool, garden area), sections of the buildings were left in their original state. For ex., the exterior hallways were old, stained, and scuffed. After one night, we requested an early check-out. As another comment: this is a VERY family-/children-oriented property. If you have children, you may have a great time there. But if you don't really want to see at least 50 children of different ages all in one place at the same time (e.g., around the pool), then you'd better stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Parpay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks in the 2 bedroom condo with ocean view. The towels, sheets and bed covers were really nice. The condo was very large with plenty of room for us - family of 4. The new furniture was nice and comfortable. However, the kitchen appliances were old and in need of replacement. The grounds were very nice and well-kept. We liked that they had two pools - one for kids and the other for adults/older kids. I do agree with an earlier post about the drinks - but it depended on the bartender - we had a GREAT pina coloda. The beach is pretty small and the tide comes in pretty quick - our 3 year old twins were able to play in the sand though. It's nice that they let you bring chairs to the beach. Housekeeping was execellent - very friendly and efficient. Our place was always clean when we returned. Overall, a fun time and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chiefsrule
Reviews.Content: If you stay here you will not regret it!!!!! Great staff, the rooms were very big and the view was unreal. It was everything we had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maui_Luv_It
Reviews.Content: We had a family vacation in March and stayed at the Kaanapali Shores and we have nothing but good news to tell about our experience. The staff at the hotel helped us set up tours (snorkling, etc,) which we did not feel pressured at all! We were not hurried along and it seems like we were part of the whole experience. I would like to thank Rachel (at the desk) for recommending us with the room we were staying at. We had both an ocean view and the mountain view. The shores feels kind of secluted while being central to the areas we wanted to stay at. Had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Trip in Maui”
Reviews.Author: HUTCH1113
Reviews.Content: My wife and I shared a 2BR/2BA condo at the Kanaapali Shores from May 6 thru May 12th. The unit was definitely large enough to accommodate 4 people comfortably. The condo itself was slightly old, but all of the furniture was new and it was well kept. We were in condo #223 which had a view right above the courtyard, which was beautiful. We were able to sit on the patio and watch the mini waterfall and all the coy fish in the pond. On the second floor, it was difficult to see any of the ocean, but I still enjoyed the garden view. The Beach Club restaurant was very nice. We had a nice meal there one night with the $100 voucher. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meal and we still had money left As everyone has stated, the hotel is across the street from a grocery store and a strip mall with snorkeling gear rentals and a couple other food joints. The hotel was only a few minutes from Whalers Village and about 10 minutes from Front Street in Lahaina. We spent almost every night on Front Street and we loved it. Front Street was not your normal tourist shops and cheesy crap. It had great views, a beautiful Banyan Tree park, unique galleries and lots of great restaurants, which all seemed to have an ocean view. Maui itself is magical. We have traveled to alot of beautiful places, but we agree that Maui is at the top. The climate and geographic landscapes are all so different throughout Maui. One day you are on the most beautiful beach ever, the next day you are driving through a bamboo forest, the next day you are in a rain forest, the next day you may be on a crater, other days you might be driving through sugar cane or pineapple fields. We did a guided tour on the Road to Hana and did a 60 minute helicopter ride. They were both expensive, but well worth the money. It was nice not to worry about driving the Road to Hana. We got to enjoy the scenery with no stress. Perfect trip and the Kanaapali Shores was the cornerstone of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We will come back to the Kaanapali Shores Resort! We stayed for 1 1/2 weeks and it was great. Spacious rooms, great view, great locations. Feels secluded and private, yet 5-10 min driving from Lahaina, Whaler's Village and several beaches. There is a small strip mall across the street with a grocery store which was very convienent. The staff was great and the activities desk was so awesome! It is a beautiful property, very laid back. We highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “loved kaanapali shores”
Reviews.Author: kirsten
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a weeks stay at Kaanapali Shores. we loved it!! their were 13 of us including 3 babies. we had the 2 bedroom condos with ocean views. the grounds were incredible, and very clean, very spacious. If i had to complain their are only 2 things I would complain about and those wouldbe that the "beach" bar drinks were disappointing and the beach was not the greatest allthough the young children enjoyed it and you could go snorkelling. But for the price and everything else we found it to be a great value and just a wonderful place to stay. Maui is just incredible and i cannot wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: skimomkl
Reviews.Content: Very dated rooms. We had a 2 bedroom condo with a loft in the older section of the complex (which is near the ocean) and we felt like we were in a cave. Very dreary, stained carpets, rusty appliance's and no where to plug in hair dryers ect. We moved 2 doors down to the Mahanna and were thrilled. The staff was great!!!!! They upgraded us to the gold rooms (711 and 911) and for only $20 more a night with the entertainment card. Our rooms were very upscale! Beautiful furniture, granite, marble and river rock everywhere. We had panaramic views everywhere, even the spare bedrooms which had beautiful bathrooms also.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wbforever
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly pleased with our stay at Kaanapali Shores. The hotel was even better than we had anticipated. I was a little nervous because I hadn't stayed at a condo before and since we'd stayed at the Westin on our previous trips to Maui, we thought we'd really have to downgrade..but that was not the case. The rooms are decorated with very nice furniture and we had everything we needed. The staff was wonderful at check in (Rachel) gave us a view with a great view, waking up to an ocean view and hearing the ocean waves every morning! The Lanai was wonderful to have as well, we ate out there, relaxed and had coffee in the morning. FYI: the Wi-Fi worked consistently only on the Lanai and the connection works best if your laptop is plugged in (battery makes the connection weak). The pizza and coffee across the street were great and the grocery store was so convenient! We would definitely give this hotel a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Benderly
Reviews.Content: We spend a weekend at the property (Wedding of the Libermans) . Great grounds, very friendly personal, common areas and room very clean. Strong recomendation for those who choose Maui .

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable view and more than I had dreamed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checking in was easy and quick. As we were walking to our condo I was a little worried because we were walking away from the ocean but once the door was opened and we entered the room I couldn't believe my eyes. We reserved a 1 bdrm. with a ocean view and it was that for sure! It was so beautiful. Everything in the room was brand new the floors, the counters everything was top notch. All of the staff was very helpful and very nice to my daughters ages 7 and 9. The large sectional opened into a sleeper and the kids sleep fine there. The pools were nice, but we only used the ocean front one. The beach wasn't bad it was a little rocky but lots of sand to enjoy. There weren't really any crowds anywhere. This was our first trip to the island and I hope I can go again and again and again. I have nothing bad to say about any of our trip except for the airline we flew on. But that had nothing to do with Maui. So in all this hotel gets a 5 star rating from us with 5 being the highest. I hope if you are planning a trip to Maui and you stay here, you will enjoy it as much as we did. Aloha The Sanders, NV

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and since I read all the reviews here, thought I would also leave one too! Yes, the beach is a bit sloped and more narrow than others but many people used the beach to tan and to take a dip in the water. We would drive 10 mins or so and spent time at Kaanapali Beach near the Sheraton, took a longer drive to Makena Beach for the fun waves and to Kanapalua Bay for calmer waters and snorkeling. Variety at every beach! The condo we stayed in was quite spacious for 2 families and the fact you had kitchen and laundry amenities made it feel like home. We had breakfast at the resort rest. for 4 days and then purchased a 3 day "pass" at the Embassy Hotel ( a deal at $8 per day!!) right next door for their awesome buffet (variety again!) We had dinners in (with an infant it's hard to go out at nite) and ordered from the restaurants nearby and one in Lahaina. Star Market across the street came in handy too! Lahaina was fun and we ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise. We also took in whale watching which was fun and went to the Hyatt Luau...recommend it as it ran smoothly, food was great and the entertainment was excellent! We had friends that did the Hana drive and the Crater excursion...they said it was nice but not necessarily a "must-do"; we also went to the Maui Ocean Centre on the last day; interesting but a bit pricey, ah well. I would recommend the Kaanapali Shores to families, there were lots there!Pools were nice, not luxury by any means, but pool water is pool water. The have happy hour for their mai-tais, etc at $3; that was a highlight for the 8 adults in our group! Beautiful landscaping and lobby, more than you would expect at a condo-like place. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: visit_world
Reviews.Content: Overview We visited Kaanapali shores the last week of April, from the 22nd to the 29th. The grounds were very nice and the hotel was kept clean and lives up to the 4 star rating. The staff is extrememly helpful and provide service with a smile. We were there on our honeymoon and on our tight budget, the hotel really pleased us both. We will never forget our pleasant stay there. Full Review Hotel staff ( Excellent) - One of the most nicest hotel staffs we have ever dealt with. The front desk crew was very helpful and always smiled and it seemed like they really cared for our happiness. Even if they were faking it, I enjoyed it. Room (Above average) - We were very surprised by the room. We had a one bedorom on the 7th floor with a partial ocean view and a full view of the garden. The balcony (lanai) was awesome. The living room was really nice and comfy. The bedroom with a king sized bed was very comfortable and spacious. The dissapointing part of the room is the kitchen and the bathroom. Both of these need to be renovated. The bathroom looks so old but luckly it was clean. The kitchen, well sorry folks but I did see one roach there and the tiles and overall kitchen look was so so old. But once again, the housekeeping staff is awesome at cleaning our kitchen and bathroom so that it was atleast clean. So bottom line is that the room was above average to us and the kitchen was super useful. Parking (Neutral) - what can I say, it costs 9 bucks to park here daily. I thought this was reasonable considering the fact that the parking is close to the rooms and seems to be safe. Hotel Location (Above Average) - we felt that the hotel was nicely located and close to a market (across the street) and decent restaurants (subway, pizza, coffee) all just a walk away. The beach in front of the hotel is very nice to enjoy the sunset and for morning walks. I saw a lot of people snorkling in there and they said their experience was just as good as taking a full day snorkling trip on a boat. Pools (Neutral) - If you are looking to spend a lot of time in the pool, I am not sure I would recommend this place. The pools are small. There are two of them and both were clean and fairly empty. But later in the day, they are unkept and the area around the pools fills up with trash people leave behind. We didn't like that part. We went into the spa in the evening and there were drink cups littered all over. Kinda dissapointing. Summary Best Parts of staying at Kaanapali Shores - staff is very helpful, polite and friendly - rooms are clean and kitchen, laundry and balcony are very useful and a must! - parking is close and ample - beach front is amazing specially in evening when sun is setting - garden is soothing and very cleanly kept - hotel restaurant has good mahi mahi as well as pina colada's - cheap eats located across the street, a walk away Only negatives - bathroom and kitchen need renovation - they are clean but really old looking - pool area is clean in morning and afternoon but by night fall, not kept clean - fitness center charges a fee of $10 per day per person - killed 1 roach, did not see any others

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is perfect! The pools are warm and clean and open late at night. The restaurant is good and not too expensive. The beach is beautiful with calm days and small waves and windy days with big waves! Something for everyone. The clothing store is reasonable priced and the little market is handy for a late night snack. We had in-suite laundry and an ocean view. I would ask for a view of the pools and not a view facing north the next time. We have a wonderful feather duvet on the king size bed with nice fluffy pillows, not flat cheap pillows like most have! All in all, it was a great place to stay! Only minuted from Lahaina. Oh and accross the street by the Star Market is a great little pizza place with the best pizza in Maui! good prices there too! For a day trip you must go snorkeling at Molokini and see the spinner dolphins at Lanai..... The diving lesson in the pool was great and afterwards my husband went diving right from the beach infront of the hotel. He went 38feet down and saw sea turtles and even held an octupus in his hands!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Shores was a wonderful place to stay. It is very family friendly with a kids camp, two great pools, and beautiful grounds. The one bedroom condo is a perfect size for a family of four, and having a fully equipped kitchen really helped. There is a market right across the highway from the property, and we highly recommend "Pizza Paradiso" (I think that's the name) for their pasta and gyros, also located in the same shopping center. I think the price at the Kaanapali Shores is very reasonable, and although it is at the northern end of Kaanapali, it is still very close to Lahaina and the other resorts offering shopping and golf. On our next trip to Maui we will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Even storms can't ruin paradise at Kaanapali Shores!!!”
Reviews.Author: needwarmweather
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Resort Quest Kaanapali Shores!! The weather did not cooperate the whole time, but we made the best of it! The accomodations were beautiful. The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfy, and the kitchens were great! The pools were clean and having a few drinks during happy hour was fun, especially in the sun! The young lady in the flower shop (sorry, I didn't get her name!) was EXTREMELY helpful the morning of our parents' vow renewal. We (my sister and I) thought they had premade bouquets, so we stopped by (with only about 10 minutes to spare!) on our way out the door to pick one up. She worked very quickly to make us a beautiful, small bouquet out of just a few stems and some ribbons. It was just the right touch we needed, and we were very grateful for her hard work! All in all, we had an amazing time at Kaanapali Shores, and we can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: sammysawbuck
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Kaanapali Shores on March 9, 2006 and got an oceanfront unit on the 3rd floor of the 4 story building. It was a gorgeous view, but it wasn't the room I saw in the pictures online. After one night, my wife and I approached Malea at the front desk and asked her if we could see a unit in the high rise building. Malea graciously accomodated and gave us a card key for room 604. It was huge and it had a great ocean view, but still not the one I saw in the pictures online. Malea then gave us a key to unit 401 because the previous guests had just checked out. My wife and I went up to look and oh my goodness this was the one. Our hearts were pounding because it was a two bedroom with huge sofa that folded out into a bed. There were lanai doors on every outer wall of the unit that you could totally open and have that openness that you see in the lobby of most Maui resorts. We ran back down to Malea and she told us that unit 701 would be available the next day. She told us to pack our stuff and the bellman would be up to transfer our bags. We left that morning to go to surf lessons and, upon our return, our bags had been moved. We had not told our four children that we got this unit and when we walked into it with our kids for the first time, their faces were like those "priceless" commercials. We didn't even want to leave this condo because the view was so beautiful. And it was whale season which I thought would be no big deal but, let me tell you, seeing a whale for the first time is an instant hook and you will be an avid watcher during your entire trip. Sitting on the lanai was the best view of the whales and they were out of the water all day every day. We saw dozens of them, no lie. We kept the lanai doors open all the time. Two walls in the living room were nothing but sliding glass doors. The dining room wall was a sliding glass door. The master bedroom wall was a sliding glass door. It was so much fun to open all doors and just walk in and out of any one of them for a beautiful view. The lanai had lots of chairs, tables, and loungers for anything you wanted to do out there from eating to relaxing. The view of the ocean from one side of the lanai was supplemented by the view from the other side of the lanai of the pool and the gardens below. I loved positioning my lounge chair at the corner of the lanai so I had the pool/garden/ocean view all at once. The pool was always crowded but never to the point of being uncomfortable. Ordering drinks from the pool bar was easy and quick. Towels were always plentiful. Lounge chairs were always plentiful for either pool, the grass area, or the beach. The beach had sun or shade under the trees. Beach was rocky, but still fun. The poolside restaurant was very nice with good food and great views. The stores at the Shores were filled with fun stuff and there was plenty to keep you busy. The lobby area was beautiful. Parking was never a problem. $9 a day to park, but that was not a problem at all. They add it to your bill at the end of your stay. Our daughters signed up for the lei making and it was fun watching them make beautiful lei's to take home. The entire grounds were gorgeous with the pools, the neatly kept grass and flowers, the waterfall. We will absolutely be back to the Kaanapali Shores. It was easy driving down to Whaler's Village and parking for the day while having fun on South Kaanapali. It was easy driving to Lahaina and parking was not tough at all. All in all, we all gave the Kaanapali Shores and our trip to Maui a 10 out of 10. Do all the touristy things - surf lessons, luau at the Old Lahaina Luau or the Hyatt Luau, helicopter ride, snorkeling, snuba, sailing, and don't forget - December to April is whale season so there's no jet ski's or parasailing during that time. Trust me, whale watching is a gas!! Thanks, Kaanapali Shores and Malea!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views - great rooms - great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Immediately upon arrivial following a 20 hour tirp (flight & layovers) we were greeted by a friendly evening staff. Recoginizing that we were exhausted from the trip, we were provided fantastic accommodations on the Pent House floor. Following one-night's stay we were relocated to our one-week time-share without a hicup. Throughout our stay the staff were terrific, always greeting us with a smile and wanting to help in any way possible. Several folks standout including: Liz - Front Desk, Jon - Bell Desk and Carolyn - Beach Resort Restaurant. KUDOS to Ka'anapali Shores Resort. You made a very rainy week an enjoyable adventure. Hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are going back to Maui in May and we can't wait! This is our third year that we will be staying with AKS...they are very hospitable and the rooms are always clean and comfortable. Very friendly/helpful staff and overall a great value. The only thing I think might be worth mentioning is the resorts beachfront..not exactly what *we* prefer, but that's okay! We love to travel the island and discover new beaches. I highly recommend Aston Kaanapali Shores, you just won't find a better place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenage girls stayed here mid March 2006. I was disappointed a bit by the room for the price. Our room was nothing like the rooms shown on their promotional website. It's basically a very small condo type unit. $ 388 a night for 2 adults and 2 teens (under age 17 so they were supposedly free) - We had a one bedroom partial ocean view room - the king size bed was very comfortable - but the girls had a sofa bed in the living room. It was clean, but the unit was showing wear and tear- especially the bathroom. It's hard for 4 people (especially 3 girls!) to get ready with one very small bathroom -There was no other place where one of us could blowdry our hair or put on make up, etc while another was showering or getting dressed. There are no mirrors anywhere else in the room to do so. We had small ants in our bathroom also. Having the small kitchen was nice/ refrigerator, but again, they provided one complimentary package of coffee the first day, after that you were on your own. At $388 a night, I think they could spring for daily coffee supplies! It was nice to have a washer/dryer unit as we were on a two week vacation and enjoyed being able to wash our clothes conveniently in our unit. Our light above our dining room table didn't work upon arrival. We told the front desk about it, and it was never fixed the 5 days we were there. The grounds are beautiful, and the pool area is nice except I don't like staying at places where I have to rush down to the pool at 8am or earlier just to get a lounge chair because they don't have a reasonable number of them for the number of guests they have. The beach area is VERY small, and VERY rocky which was not enjoyable and made swimming there virtually impossible. My 13 yr old cut her foot on the rocks just trying to cool off from sunning. One of the mornings there were no lounge chairs by the beach area, so me and the 2 girls had to lug chairs from the grassy area to the beach which was no easy feat! At $388 a night, I don't feel I should have to do that. We did eat at the restaurant- once for lunch and once for breakfast. The food was good and reasonably priced, but the male waiter who claimed he worked there for 15 yrs was slow and poor waiter. He forgot to bring out some of the items we ordered, and when my husband stopped him to ask for the condiment that was supposed to come with his sandwich, he didn't bother to ask what my husband needed, he cut him off and said, "I'll be right back" and then didn't return - he came back out and was doing other things and ignored our table until we finally stopped another waiter and asked for the condiment to be brought out! The drinks and drink specials were reasonably priced which was nice and wonderful to have that right by pool and beach. The bar tenders and the activity staff were all very friendly and helpful. Overall, a decent place, but the rooms still need some refurbishing and the pricing should be more reasonable - I would say it was a $200-250 a night type place tops.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Pucmeister
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Staff did everything possible and worked hard in this hotel trying to complete with the ritzier hotels that cost more. Paying $10 for parking was discouraging but my travel agent warned my about that. Very quiet with the room fan/air conditioner on. Nice spot to start your clockwise tour of the West side of Maui. Close to the airport that takes you to an awesome mule ride on Molokai. Liked haveing a kitchen in our studio. Higher up room gave us a great view of the whales.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful vacation in Maui, where we stayed at the Kaanapoli Resort. We booked the trip through Expedia and selected this resort based on all the positive reviews and the virtual property tour. I must say, upon arriving we immediately realized that this place was much nicer than we expected, and we expected a nice place. The staff was courteous and friendly, the property meticulously maintained and the overall "vibe" was unpretentious and welcoming. The restaurant was superb, offering a good selection at very reasonable prices. The service was great and we'd often see a whale breech right in front of the pool, while enjoying lunch. We were upgraded to a one bedroom unit, without requesting it, and it was a clean, classy, well kept place. Most importantly, for my partner, it had a very firm, comfortable bed. We were very pleased with the the Kaanaploi Shores Resort and will return there the next time we go back to Maui. It truly is a classy, comfy, welcoming place in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We truly love staying at this hotel. The grounds are beautiful! The whole area is lovely and you really feel like you're coming back home and not to a hotel. The rooms are spacious and our view on the 9th floor was magnificent! We just sat out on our balcony and whale watched. We saw more whales from our balcony than from the lookout they recommend you go to. The staff is so friendly and helpful. I prefer feather pillows, which they didn't have in our room. Just a phone call and they were there in a jiffy. The restaurant is located at the beach next to the pool. Also a great place to whale watch. Breakfast was good and reasonable. As with all of Maui, there's a bit of sticker shock when looking at menu prices, but they were about $5 less expensive for the same things they offered at other places. The Filet Mignon was so tender and cooked to perfection. The bread pudding was warm and delicious. I enjoyed being in such a tranquil location. It really is paradise, and so romantic. I would highly recommend this location for everyone. Families seemed to really be enjoying themselves as were honeymoon couples and retired types like us. Being repeat customers, we've noticed a lot of positive changes. The new furniture is Tommy Bahama like and lovely. The grounds are beautiful and fun to stroll around. The tennis courts are great and always available. They also have added a little bar b que area, which we liked. Enjoy, we certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the resort and it was just the best! Mom, dad and two teenagers (boy and girl) had nothing but raves for the stay. The two bedroom ocean view suite was clean and comfortable. We had a lanai off the living room and the master bedroom which both had ocean views and direct views of the beautiful garden and pools as well. Clarke at the activities desk by the main pool set up an excellent four day itineray which included two activities a day and plenty of down time in between. The only full day event being the road to Hana. Activities included snorkeling.whale watching (Pacific whale foundation),helicopter rides (Mauiscape), Atlantis subamarine (boring and not worth it, but we aked for it based on a reccomendation from a friend) and a Luau (royal Lahaina). The luau was terrible and not reccomended. We wanted the the Old Lahaina Luau but it was sold out till March 3rd. We also had surfing lessons in Kenai - The best, but I forgot the companies name. Back to the Hotel, excellent staff and service, clean and well kept. We asked for a no smoking room but they cannot control this as the units are privately owned. They did promise to "ionize" the room and this was noted on check in. The room we received was owned by non-smokers and they had a placard at the front entrance asking guests to smoke on the balcony if they must smoke. The room did not smell of smoke at all, so most guests must heed the sign. The Star market across the way is out of control price wise so use the Safeway in Kenai or near the Cannery mall. Our trip was great. The resort was great. We would stay at ResortQuest again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, comfortable and inviting after a busy day enjoying the beauty of Maui. My husband and I went to Maui knowing we were not going to spend our days in our hotel room. But the room was very comfortable and the kitchen was well equipped. We didn't really do any cooking, except for light breakfasts and snacks but it has everything you need. The washer and dryer in unit was also very handy. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: rob1sfc
Reviews.Content: I don't care what anyone says. This place was georgeous! They automatically upgraded us a "garden view" room eventhough I only paid for a "hotel room with a refigerator." The garden view is amazing. It was nothing but trees, birds, and waterfalls right outside our window. When we walked in, it looked like the furniture that they sell at the store BOMBAY. It had a fully equipped kitchen plus a washer and dryer. Sound good? I've stayed at the Hyatt before and although this is not as ritzy, it is very impressive. My girlfriend absolutely loved the room too. It had everything I needed and more. Don't pay attention to the negative reviews!! I was skeptical at first because of them but blown away when I arrived there. The staff was very friendly. This condo was a great value. Everything we needed was right there or within walking distance. I hated to leave, because it felt like home. MAHALO.....

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Shores is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dmusca
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an 8 night stay at Kaanapali Shores last week (1/1/06 - 1/9/06). We booked on Expedia so I don't know exactly what the break down was. We had 3 people in a studio with an ocean view for 8 nights plus airfare from Chicago, a convertible and one night at Grand Wailea for $1580 per person. I highly recommend Kaanapali Shores. Our unit was great and it was really nice to have a full kitchen. As soon as we landed we stopped at Kmart and stocked up on breakfast foods and snacks. We were on the 9th floor in room 936 with a great view of the ocean. Our unit was older and could use some updating but we thought it was great for the price. Since each condo is individually owned each unit will differ. Our unit was very clean and the resort itself is nice. We never actually used the 2 pools but it looked nice. We had breakfast at the restaurant near the pool and that was good. At check in you will get a entertainment book with a $5 coupon for their restaurant as well as a buy one get free coupon for different luaus. (Skip the Sheraton Luau. Its awful!) The beach at Kaanapali shores is nice but small. If you don't get out there early you probably wont get a chair. We would go out there about noon and it was too crowded so we drove a couple miles to the beach which we didn't mind. We moved to Grand Wailea for our last night and its a good thing we waited until the end to go there. It definitely made Kanaapali Shores pale in comparison but that is comparing apples to oranges. If you are looking for a 5 star restort you wont find it at Kaanapli Shores but if you are looking for a clean, friendly place to stay in a good location with nice rooms then this is your place. Overall we really liked Kaanapali Shores and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. We kept ordering 3 extra towels so by the third day our maid automatically left the extra towels for us. They also offered to upgrade us to a one bedroom for an extra $240 which would have had a washer and dryer. In the end we were happy with our studio.

Reviews.Title: “Best time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui. This hotel was recommended by our travel agent. We had a really good time. The staff is very friendly. Everything was taken care of including very good cleanup. The small kitchen was also handy. Being right on the Kaanapali beach and very near Black rock, we had easy access to good snorkeling. The hotel also offers free scuba diving lessons at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “This is at best a 2 1/2 star resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This condo resort is at best a 2 1/2 star facility. The lobby and pool areas are clean and basic, but nice (Two pools, two hot tubs). The beach towels were not well stocked, you have to get them early in the morning if you want them. Be aware that these are individually owned condos and they will not guarantee a specific condo for you. Therefore, some of these people who love this place are probably getting better maintained condos then we got. We stayed in a two bedroom condo #715. This was supposed to be an ocean view condo. It was what I would consider a partial ocean view. The windows did not open properly; there was a lot of cracked tile in the kitchen. Most of the molding in the kitchen was missing. I could not figure out how to get the oven to heat properly, but really didn't care because I didn't go to Hawaii to cook much. The kitchen was very outdated and not well stocked. The room in general was beat up and outdated. Our friends who stayed in Room #716 had a great ocean view, but their room was even more outdated then our room. They had a repaired wall that wasn't even painted. I do not mind out-of-date facilities if they are well maintained. These rooms were not well maintained. The staff at the front desk were rude when we first arrived. We inconvenienced them by requesting a room near our friends. They remained rude for the duration of our stay. The bellmen were excellent, always helpful and friendly. The on-site restaurant had very friendly service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 801 the first week of January 2006. This was a great room with ocean views from all the windows and a large balcony. We were supposed to be in another room, but the room they were planning to put us in didn't have the right number of beds, so the hotel staff upgraded us to room 801 which was a pricey room. The master bedroom had a king size bed and the other bedroom had two full size beds. The couch had a pullout bed as well. The kitchen was small and had an older oven. Oddly I think housekeeping kept on running the clean cycle and the oven door was always locked shut. We only used the kitchen for breakfast so it didn't really matter. The restaurant was alright. It was convenient and had a nice view. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either for the price. The drinks were good though. Happy hour is from 3-5:30 The drink prices were a little high, but not that bad. The pool by the ocean was generally crowded, but there were many chairs and you could find one to use. The beach also had several more chairs. The beach was small, but was fine for a little swimming and relaxing. The room also looked over the pool area, so sometimes you could hear some noise. Overall it was very quiet inside the room. Parking did cost $9/day, but we never had a problem finding a spot in the parking structure. Overall I was very happy with our stay. The suite was bright and airy and I enjoyed the pool and beach area. Suite 801 was about $900/night and I don't know if I would have been willing to pay that price. I would be willing to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores the third week in December through Christmas and had a wonderful time. We're not sure why some earlier reviews were so critical as we were highly satisfied with our experience. We stayed on the highest floor (9th) overlooking the gardens and the ocean. The view was incredible. When we checked in late at night our initial room looked primarily over a parking lot with a smaller ocean view. When we asked for a better view there were enough vacancies for the management to be accomodating. Our one bedroom condo had adequate furnishings...the style wasn't our cup of tea but it was certainly more than comfortable. The grounds were well maintained, the pools nice, the beach was fine although the sand was a bit rocky there were many children playing and it didn't seem to bother them. Lots of families were there for Christmas and although my husband and I are in our 50s and were by ourselves we enjoyed having multiple generations and hearing the laughter of children. We received $100 in restaurant credits and the food there was acceptable. The location is easily accessible to good shopping and to Lahaina. All in all a good stay. Be assertive and make sure you get the view you paid for and you'll have a wonderful time. Finally you'll save money if you don't purchase your activities through the hotel and instead use Tom Barefoot's Cashback Tours in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: tompammc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 10-16. It was our 1st time to Maui and we loved it. We were in Room 721 which was wonderful. The bed was right by the glass sliding doors so we could leave them open all night and enjoy the ocean. Having a kitchen was great. There is a small market in the resort or a larger grocery store across the street. Be prepared to pay $7.50 for a gal of milk. But the fresh fish was quite inexpensive and delicious to cook in our room. The resort also had a flower shop which was wonderful to buy leis. We rented a convertible which I truly recommend. It was so fun to drive everywhere in especially to the road to Hana. If anyone gets the least bit carsick take Dramamine or some precautions before taking the road to Hana. Don't miss swimming in the 7 pools. The town of Paia was fun shopping, kind of a hippy town and we did get offered "Buds" which we declined. The beach at this resort was fun to surf, snorkel & relax. Milemaker 14 was great to snorkel in also. Very calm. However we did get our cute little convertible stuck in the sand and had to be towed out.... We booked thru Funjet who we have always used. The prices were good, however we purchased the travel insurance for $79.00 each and when I got sick and wanted to postpone or cancel found out it wasn't worth the money we paid for it. They wouldn't cover the airfare part of it because they booked us with Delta and not a charter service. Plus our travel agency charged us a change and cancellation fee also. So something to ask about. We wouldn't purchase again. But the Kaanapali Shores was more than we hoped for and we would recommend it, plus return. Everyone was so nice. The restaurant & pools were terrific. At 1st I was wishing we had booked closer to Whalers Village to be closer to shopping and restaurants, but after going there decided we liked having less people and a quieter beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 br/2 ba 7th floor condo from Nov 26 to December 7, and had a great time. Our unit was newly renovated, with beautiful granite countertops, maple cabinets, and stainless appliances. The furniture is lovely too. The grounds are immaculate, and were even prettier after they were decorated for Christmas. We didn't swim at the beach, but did go for a long walk down to Black Rock--a good way to get some exercise and get our feet in the water. The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was the ambience of drinks served at the bar--tropical drinks served in water glasses take away from the mood (the drinks themselves were good, though). Great vacation, great value for the money. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kaanapali Shores for Christmas vacation. 5 adults and one child (10 yr old) We were in condo 154...ground level looking out to the garden and the beach side pool. Our condo was wonderful! Kitchen and bath featured granite counters. Kitchen also featured high end silver appliances. The Castaway Cafe was good, pools were decent size and the grounds where well kept. We didnâ€™t like the fact that you had to pay $9.00 a day for parking even though we were guests at the resort. Beach was fine for lying out and great for watching surfers, kiteboarders and windsurfers. Yes, it was windy at times but we weren't going to let it ruin the trip. The water at our beach wasn't the best for playing in. As stated in many reviews, it is rocky. If you're looking to just relax in the sun(as we were) then it will be just fine. The location was great...easy access to shopping, dining and to all the different activites we wanted to do. Maui is wonderful as is Kaanapali Shores..will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “A+, it was wonderful ready to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. the people there are very nice. Didn't have a problem one. A+ on everything. It is a great spot for honeymooners like us. wished we could have stayed longer want ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sedonaone
Reviews.Content: As with many of the users on this site, I to was apprehensive about staying here. We had a wonderful experience. We stayed in an ocean front 2 bedroom Aloha Suite which could not have been nicer. Huge condo with great views being oceanfront. The bedrooms were comfortable and the lving areas clean and nicely decorated. I would consider these condos well above average. Our unit was on the eighth floor and gave us sweeping views of the ocean as well as Molokii and Lani. We booked our unit through hawaiiconnection.com and could not be more satisfied with the service we received from this online travel service (agent). I really felt we got a lot for the money we spent. I could see that some of the rooms at this hotel, condo project, may be somewhat dissapointing as far as the view. No complaints from us regarding housekeeping or services we received. Everyone we spoke with at this hotel was friendly and willing to help however they could. Very good location, very close drive to whatever you need and to the more tourist areas (shopping etc). Easy drive to Lahaina for all of your tours and watersport events. The grounds as many have said were beautiful and well maintained. The restaurant on site is quite good and we enjoyed a couple of meals there. Of course as with all of Hawaii, the restaurant was not cheap. The only complaint we had was that the $9.00 per day parking fee. We realize that many downtown hotels require you to pay for limited parking available. This is not the case here, pleanty of parking, I just think they have you pay for it because it builds the revenue. I must say we really do feel that for the money spent it should be included. Other than that, all of us on this trip would recommend staying at the Kaanapali Shores.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth...”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTrip
Reviews.Content: Like most of you, after reading some of the negative reviews, I was somewhat apprehensive about staying here. However, my wife and I (with our 17 month old child) had a great time. We stayed in room 822 (one bedroom suite) which had a view of the ocean (albeit far off) and it was about 800 square feet. We had absolutely no complaints about it. Granted, it's not a suite at the Venetian or the Bellagio (Vegas) but you can't expect that for the price. The negatives: - The pools and hot tubs aren't awesome. By that I mean, no slides or waterfalls to swim under. - In reality, it's not on the Ka'anapali beach that everyone knows about. Both this and the Embassy Suites next door are really in Honokawai which I'm sure is the reason the Ka'anapali Shores is less expensive. What this means is that you have to drive to Whalers Village to get to the real Ka'anapali beach where all the other hotels (Westin, Hyatt, The Whaler, etc.) and activities are located. If you stay at one of those hotels you can walk along a longer sidewalk, have a wider/deeper beach and you have more choices to dine and shop (Whaler's Village is essentially an outdoor mall). That being said, if you do choose to stay here, I don't think you'll be disappointed by the rooms. Also, the Ka'anapali Shores has a Wed night Polynesian show in front of the pool just off the beach. It's nice for families. We essentially chose it b/c we wanted a large suite with a kitchen, washer/dryer, didn't need an awesome pool area and didn't want to pay an arm and a leg. Also, there is a supermarket literally across the street where we bought groceries. And be sure to try out Honokowai Okazuya & Deli just down the street and get the Maki Maki with lemon capers. Best mixed plate we had (and we tried many including the more well publicized Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina - which does have a better location (right next to the Old Lahaina Luau and the beach). Overall, I would have rated it excellent had it been located on Ka'anapali beach. As it is, I still recommend it highly. Just know where it is and where it isn't. It's all about expectations...we did our shopping in Lahaina and eating all over the place. If you're the type of person who wants everything to be in one place, don't stay here. Of course, I'll argue that if you are that type of person, you'd be better served to stay at an all inclusive resort in Jamaica.

Reviews.Title: “not a great view, but a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TK815
Reviews.Content: Very few of the ocean view rooms have a decent view compared to other hotels, but they a well maintained grounds and rooms. Our over all opinion was it was a nice and pleasant stay. We would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the ResortQuest Ka'anapali Shores!”
Reviews.Author: math48teach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2001 and definitely wanted to return. Our stay from Oct 17-21, 2005 was very pleasant. We had a pov studio on the 8th floor, but had a great view of the ocean. I liked the arrangement of the studio, having been in a garden view 1 bedroom in our previous visit (when they were renovating). The laundry was on the 7th and 9th floors, so not having a w/d in the room wasn't inconvenient. The cost of the laundry was very, very reasonable. The lobby is beautiful, and grounds are immaculate. The staff couldn't have been any more helpful, pleasant, and eager to make sure your needs were met. We knew to bring surf shoes, as you have to do most anywhere in Hawaii, because of the lava rock. We enjoyed the ocean, and only went in the smaller pool and hot tub. They were much cleaner and less crowded than the pool closer to the ocean. Many people we talked with had stayed there before and loved it as much as we did. Would we stay there again? Most definitely! It's a beautiful place with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great time here”
Reviews.Author: annette2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali shores for 6 nights in the beginning of November. We had no major complaints. The door did fall off of the washer and dryer closet (just a little sliding door) but my husband fixed it in a matter of minutes, no worries. The staff were very helpful..we called and asked housekeeping to give us 5 towels instead of only 3 and they did it everyday with out a problem. The $100 credit to the restaurant was a nice bonus also. We spent it mostly on drinks (try the pina colada with the rasberry swirl!) but we also had breakfast there our last day. I thought mine was very good (sweet bread french toast) but maybe I just got lucky. I would not recommend going to the orientation breakfast in the lobby. You get a bagel and a muffin and you waste around 2 hours of your day. Most everything they told us there I had already found out before we left home. So it wasnt worth it for us. We went on the snorkle to Molokini and Lanai. We enjoyed Molokini a lot more. Lanai was very rough...too rough for me and my family to stay in the water for very long. We also went to the Old Lahaina Luau. I thought it was very good. We got the traditional seating and we had a great view but probably would have enjoyed sitting in a chair more. Also, people in traditional seating gets to get food last which was hard when we had to see everyone else eating and we were starving. The open bar was great though (try the lava flow drink...they also make delicious virgin lava flows). But all in all or trip was WONDERFUL. And it was nice to be able to come back to the condo and have a fridge full of snacks/drinks waiting. We couldn't have asked for much more from this resort...we would recommend it to anyone! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: cbran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed with my parents at the Kaanapali Shores Oct 13-17. We stayed in a 2 bdr/ 2bath condo on the 8th floor and it more than exceeded our expectations. The unit was clean and well appointed. We had a couple of light bulbs that had blown out, but when we called about it the staff fixed it right away. We were impressed with the location, the roominess of the condo, and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff which let us relax and just enjoy our vacation. The tour staff were informative and helpful. I'm sure they tend to steer tourists to certain tours, but I cannot complain because we enjoyed every single tour and trip they recommended. If you like to snorkel - the Molokini trip is awesome! We never went to the Star Market across the street, but did go to Safeway in town, which was easy to find so we were able to get a few things to put in the fridge. We didn't get in the water at the beach at the hotel, but we didn't see a problem with it at all. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful. We didn't use the pools, but they seemed to be maintained very well. The only sticking point was having to pay $9.00/day for parking, but I quickly found that free parking on Maui is a rare and wonderful thing! I highly recommend the Kaanapali Shores. Stay on one of the upper floors in an oceanview condo. We had a great view of the ocean even though we weren't close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “I hit the Jackpot!!!”
Reviews.Author: zeetraveler
Reviews.Content: I had been searching and searching hotels and places to stay for my trip to maui and chose this hotel boy did I ever hit the jackpot I got a great rate.I stayed one week for under a thousand dollars with my discounts and this property is beautiful inside and out I was a little unsure about this hotel because it was rated number 44 on this site but I looked at some of the up to date reviews and chose this property the grounds are beautiful the condo was spacious had everything I needed and more. the service was great and views are wonderful mind was supposed to be only a paking lot view I turned my chair around on the lanai and could still see the ocean this one was of my best experiences ever with 3 star property.I will definitely come back....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from celebrating our 18th Anniversary along with her sister and husband who were celebrating their 5th. We stayed there from 10/15 through 10/21. All the horror stories I read prior to going were not present. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath unit #813 that had a great view of the ocean and one of the pools and was very nicely updated. The Sunrises and Moon sets at the same time were AWESOME! The only problem we had was the closet doors in one room did not work well upon check in. We mentioned this to the staff and since we were checking in at 11pm, they asked if they could fix it the next day. After returning from the beach the next day, it was fixed. The staff was great and our rooms were cleaned before noon everyday. The grounds are well kept and I was surprised as to how nice they are. The pools are nice and were not crowded at the time we were there. In the summer when kids are out of school, that might be a different story. We used the entire $100 credit at the bar sampling each day the "drink of the day". Yes, the beach in front is not the best beach in Maui. However, it was better than some of the reviews I read. You can take a short walk down the beach and fine a wider section of sand to lay out in. The Restaurant food is average as we ate there for breakfast and dinner once. The lunches were far better and they will serve you poolside. Carla at the activities desk was great and she really helped us out in booking activities. We will be coming back next year with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend to anyone visiting Maui to stay at the Kaanapali Shores hotel. My weeks stay was wonderfull. The people working at this resort are polite, informative, and go out of their way to make one feel comfortable - also with providing local directions. My room was kept spotless, and cleaned promply each morning. The rooms are quiet and nicely furnished. the first morning, guests are invited to an island orienatation. All activities are discussed, along with sites to see on Maui. The activity desk personel we very knowledgeable and excellent to make reservations for all activities. Resturaunt on the grounds, sits on the beach, open air, with an excellent cuisine with reasonable prices- and good service. the garden area is beautifull. The gym loated at the resort was an excellent facility Please stay at Kaanapali Shore the next time you visit Maui. I can assure you, I most certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay (w. one exception)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores. Stayed there for 7 nights starting from October 1. Overall - The property is accurately described in some of the other reviews. Room - We stayed in a 1 bedroom ocean view room. If you can spend a little bit more, the ocean view is well worth the difference. Both the living room and bedroom have ocean views. Otherwise, in the garden view room, your bedroom might face the parking lot. The room had everything needed including a washer and dryer. Room was clean and the furniture was fairly new. Pool - Depending on what you are looking for, the two pools are â€“ two pools. They are not spectacular in anyway, but functional. There is an evening hula show at one of the pools thatâ€™s worth checking out. Restaurant - Our package included $100 food credit at the restaurant. Though there isnâ€™t any room service, the restaurant allows takeout. (The view from our 8th floor was much better than the view from the restaurant.) Fairly typically hotel/restaurant menu and food quality. Though the turnaround time for orders was excellent. Location - The property is located on the North side of Kaanapali beach. Out of everything the beach was the most disappointing part of this location. I previously stayed at the Westin (located near Whalerâ€™s Village) and that part of Kaanapali beach is very nice. This part is very steep, a little narrow, the surf is a little rougher and has a slight undertow. The beach itself had a lot of seaweed. It wasnâ€™t my ideal Maui beach. If you donâ€™t mind walking about 10 minutes south along the beach, youâ€™ll find it to be much better. Since we had two young children (2 & 4) in our party, we ended up driving to Lahainaâ€™s baby beach and Kapalua bay a few times. Lahainaâ€™s baby beach is located behind some houses. The surf is very calm, so kids wonâ€™t get knocked down. If you want a good beach for toddlers, ask and get directions. You wonâ€™t be disappointed. Kapalua bay is located between Napali and Kapalua. Itâ€™s a good beach for playing in the sand and snorkeling. It also has public parking and restrooms. Other amenities: A small strip mall is located across the street with a Star market. Star has most everything you will need, but if you plan major cooking, stop at Safeway in Lahaina. The Pizza place is decent for a quick bite. Going north there is an ABC store, past that location is a great little coffee shop and a snorkel shop. Final thoughts â€“ If you are looking for a condo, with good amenities consider the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores. If you require an excellent beach within walking distance from your room, consider other locations.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diznykd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place where we could be married and spend our honeymoon. Our travel agent recommended this hotel and it was AWESOME!!!! We did go in the off season in Nov, so we got a better deal, had a beautiful room and were married in the gazebo on the hotel grounds. The on-site restaurant is hit and miss. The first night we were there, the food was great. A couple of nights later it wasn't all that great. The whole staff was helpful and friendly and the concierge helped us plan the activities we wanted to participate in and gave us the inside scoop on getting better seats, etc. On the whole, we had a great time. We referred friends there who also stayed there and got married at the hotel, and they're still raving about it. We're going back for our anniversary this year and plan on going back again next year. A word of caution, however, if you plan to be in the ocean at all, make sure you get a pair of those rubber divers shoes (not the flippers) as the bottom of the ocean is full of very sharp coral and I sliced my toe open. Other than that, it's the nicest place to stay I've been at in Hawaii and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ka'anapali beach will always be special to us since we were just married on that beach 3 weeks ago. We had a great stay at Kaanapali shores and would recommend the hotel to anyone...especially those on a budget. The lobby is beautiful and the front desk was very helpful. We stayed on the 1st floor and had a beautiful partial ocean/garden view. We could see the beach from our room and had a great big palm tree in front of the bedroom. We loved it. When we return we will request a room on a higher floor. Often in the morning, the garden workers were right outside our bedroom window and I felt we didn't have much privacy. We also had a mouse in the room one night. The front desk was very kind and offered to move us immediately, we declined, but they brought traps in that night. They told us he must of came in through the screen door. Nope, we never caught the mouse! The maids were great, they kept all the sand under control and were quick and efficient. The beach directly in front of the hotel is not the nicest part of Kaanapali but it's great for laying out. A short drive or long (1-2 mi) walk will take you to better parts of the beach. we loved pizza place across the street. Pizza Paradiso. We ate there 3-4 times during our stay. It's spendy for here, but not there. It filled us up cheaper than anywhere else. beach club resturant was expensive and not that good. Star market across the street was very expensive. Maui is the most beautiful place on earth! hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mauitravler06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Shores from 11 sept 2005 thru 23 Sept 2005. The staff was very courtious and helpful. We stayed in a one bedroom which was very clean and well worth its value.We were upgraded from a studio. After reading all the negative reviews from others. I didn't know what to expect. Don't believe all those negative reviews. The place is not the Four Seasons but it is a very nice place to stay. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best Family Beach resort in America”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with six of my Grandkids and their parents to Maui last week (1 Oct 05). We stayed at the ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores. We had a large 2 bedroom suite callled an Aloha suite and an adjacent 2 bedroom suite. the rooms were awesome. The Aloha Suite (2000+ sq. ft.) is full ocean front and the room is only 12 feet from the beach. The adjacent room also had a great ocean view and the room doors were adjacent as were the beach front patios. The staff was marvelous, the service was great - imagine arriving with 12 people (including 3 one year olds, a 3 year old, a four year old, a six year old) and 26 bags, which the staff magically got to the rooms within minutes of arrival. The property is great, 2 wonderful pools and the best family beach in America. The snorkeling for my six year old granddaughter was great right in front of our room, the waves were "safe" for the three year old and lots of kids were boogey boarding on the waves. The rooms had patios so we could eat and watch the kids from the patio when they were on the beach. The full kitchen and large dining area were great and the rooms were immaculately clean. All in all this was a great place to stay. The big problem we had was Delta Airlines- they abandoned in Maui airport for 24 hours. Worst experience a family can have and Delta did nothing- no hotel, no food, no agent in the airport, no help to get needed formula/diappers, did not rebook us- but kept us on the hook until they could get us back on Delta 24 hours later.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resport”
Reviews.Author: eyenurse
Reviews.Content: This was a condo unit with a completely furnished kitchen. The furnishings were very nice and clean. The staff were accomodative. Pools and beach were beautiful. We availed ourselves of the laundry facility which was very reasonably priced and clean. The washer did need some repair as only filled with hot water. I would certainly return to this resort for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and fun vist at ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: foodieFosterCity
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay at Kaanapali Shores (9/22-9/27) with our two children, ages 3 and 6 months, and found the hotel quite decent. The grounds were very nice as other reviewers have said. The two pools were not fancy but perfectly adequate for us. My 3 year old loved the garden pool and spend a lot of time there. Based on previous comments, I was a bit nervous about staying at Kaanapali Shores, but I called ahead and requested a renovated 1-bedroom ocean view suite on a high floor. We were in Room 930 on the top floor, and looked out over the parking lot and a canal along the side of the hotel. However, since we were so high up we basically looked out over the ocean towards Lanai. It was quite beautiful. We might not have enjoyed a room on a lower floor with the same view. I was pleased to see that the room was very clean and we loved the washer/dryer unit! The front desk was quite helpful and efficient. Initally, when I found out that we didn't have a room facing the garden/pool area, the front desk was happy to let me visit a couple of other rooms facing the garden. We ultimately decided to stay in our room so as to avoid another move. Housekeeping cleaned every day and were very nice. We just had drinks in the beach club area and each visit took a very long time.....We decided not to have any meals there based on previous comments, and once there, determined that, in any case, service there would take too long. We did enjoy wonderful meals at the Gazebo in the Napili Shores Resort, CJ's Deli, Leilani's in Whaler's Village, and of course, Cafe O'Lei. I'd say Cafe O'Lei and Gazebo were the best followed by Leilani's. Bad --- Coffee, just north up the street from the hotel, makes great Lattes (better than Soup and Nutz across the street - although their breakfast is very good if a bit slow in service). Pizza Paradizo across the street was overpriced and had mediocre food in my opinion. Avoid the Star Market across the street - its overpriced and hardly has anything- and do your shopping at Safeway and Longs Drugs in Lahaina at the Cannery Mall. There's an ABC just north of the hotel as well. I hurt my knee and needed to see a doctor during our stay. There is a clinic at Whaler's Village that saw me right away and takes pretty much every medical insurance. They faxed in my prescription to Longs and I thought the whole thing was very efficiently handled. I can also recommend the Four Winds II Snorkeling Trip to Molokini. We took it two years ago and again this week. There is also a great beach just two streets south of the hotel - Kakekili Beach Park - it has restrooms, picnic benches, a grassy area and a pretty wide and clean white sand beach that was not very crowded. Its good for snorkeling too. Overall, a great trip and I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place in mid-September, 2005. The room was spacious, clean and well-appointed for the price with a full kitchen, two bathrooms and two bedrooms, and we were given a $100 credit for food and drinks (I don't know if this is standard or it was part of our deal). The gym is good - several treadmills, stepmaster, stationary bikes and nautilus machines, plus freeweights - though a bit small for all the equipment. The two pools are small but uncrowded in the mornings or evenings (I wasn't there during the afternoons). Souvenir and clothing stores are right in the hotel. The hotel also has a free shuttle bus to downtown Lahaina. The beach immediately in front of the hotel has a great view of the three islands off Maui, but might be the worst in Maui - rocky and prone to lots of seaweed and other natural debris. A short walk - about 1/2 mile - down the beach leads to nice, sandy stretches with good snorkeling close to shore. It's not a walk for the frail. In some spots the beach is narrow and the surf gets very close to the tree/bushline. The hotel is a quick drive to the best snorkeling spot on the island - Honolua Bay - as well as some fantastic scenic shore views. Across the street is a small shopping center with a supermarket, restaurants, snorkel shop (a Boss Frog's and a cheap local snorkel shop are just down the street too), and other conveniences. The staff was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation I have ever had!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
