Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 10 day stay at Kaanapali Shores and it was truly the most enjoyable vacation I can remember. We stayed in one of the Aloha Suites which was much more than what I imagined. The balcony was so great that we never wanted to go out. My girls couldn't get enough of the ocean and swimming pool. My 6 year old had a great time at Camp Kaanapali. I hope to return again some day.

Reviews.Title: “"A Pleasure Unlike Any Other"”
Reviews.Author: Tsites
Reviews.Content: "10 Stars" - Can't say enough about the Shores. Six of us (4 grown kids) stayed from Aug 31st through Sept 6th and LOVED every minute. We had a 2 bd/2 bath oceanfront that was spectacular and worth every penny. Rainbows outside our lanai, no noise, beautiful grounds/pool and the restaurant was great. Location is wonderful, close to everything. Let's not forget the Staff . . thanks to Ms. Tanner, Kula and too many others to mention. We ALL felt like Royalty. Will definitely see you again soon. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach Setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was dinner time, so we headed to the beautiful open air dining room which had a spectacular view of the ocean. The meal and drinks were fantasitic, as was the live music and beautiful sunset. The service in all aspects was top notch. We retreated to our room to again be amazed by the view that we had from our lanai. The decor of the room was perfect. We would highly recommend Kanapali Shores for both its service and outstanding setting.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: kulolo_808
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kaanapali Shores from August 5th through August 8th. I was on Maui to participate in the Hawaiian Canoe Racing Championships regatta which was held at Hanako'o Beach in Lahaina. Arrived at the hotel quite late in the evening from the airport. The front desk personnel was very pleasant and accommodating. Got to our room, WOW, very impressed...it was gorgeous. It was a two bedroom, two bath condo unit, with a queen size pull out sofa bed in the living room and also with a loft. There was a full kitchen and also a washer and dryer. This unit could have very well accommodated 8 people very comfortably. From the balcony, we could see the two pools and also a partial view of the ocean. Pool side was very relaxing...no problems getting lounging chairs. Hotel was close to a market right across the street and close to Whaler's Village, where they were having the Maui Onion Festival. Would love to stay at the Kaanapali Shores again. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: cpope760
Reviews.Content: My husband and I we so looking forward to our trip to Hawaii, but when we checked into our room our excitement went out the window. The room was a "studio" with bed and fold out sofa. The bathroom was too small and very outdated. We had stayed at other resorts in Hawaii and were expecting the same luxury we had experienced at those resorts. Not so here. The pools were very small and unexciting, the beach very small and there was a runoff canal right next to the resort that emptied dirty water into the ocean where kids were swimming. We were hungry from the trip and went to the resort restaurant for lunch and I had to send my fish sandwich back. I was so looking forward to fresh fish in Hawaii. My husband and I went next door tho the Embasy Resort and lucky they had a beautiful room for us for the rest of our vacation. Had we not been able to get a diffrent hotel our vacation would not have been as nice. Thank you Embassy Resorts

Reviews.Title: “Maui is the most beautiful place i have ever been!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a bit reluctant to choose aston kaanapali shores because there were mixed reviews. Most said it was great but a few complained. I did not know what to expect, but sure enough it was absolutely wonderful when we got there! It is lovely and well kept with a terrific atmosphere. When you walk in there is a gorgeous water fall and such a excellent decor. It looks just like the pictures! We just got back and i can't stop missing it already. The whole lobby is breezy because they have open areas without doors. Although they give you a free $100 to use for the restaurant i thought the food was not so great so i would recomend using it on drinks while you are by the pool. It is more worth it. Lahina town and Whaler's village are also extremely close by and are fantasic places to shop. I think renting a car is the only way to really get around. By driving yourself the experience is much easier and stress free. My favorite activities were the luau (so cool!) and taking a dinner cruise. I was not fond of the drive to hana but i am not a big fan of rain forests. I prefered hanging out at our cando since we had a awsome garden view from our balcony! I think the room was very nice and the garden view is just as good as ocean view. The sevice was really good too. The room was cleaned daily and we always had clean towels delivered to us. Although we did see a big spider once, but never again after that. So all in all i would love to go back to maui next year and stay at the aston kaanapali shores too! That place is just like home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: going_to_maui
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter age 15 and son age 11 stays at the Shores July 25-Aug 1. It was a nice place to stay. We had an great ocean view 2 beedroom that also had a pool view. The room was spacious, although a little drab. My only big complaint was that we asked for a non-smoking room and they don't have those! They had to run an 'ionizer' to clear the air and that took about 2 days, and we kept the windows open to keep the air flow going after that. Resturant was fine, although we just ate breakfast there 1 day and desert another. The expedia folks helped us get some good tours, and the luau we attended at the Hyatt was exceptional. The beach at the shores was much better than those to either the north or south. We were in the lowrise building so we only had a few yards to walk to be laying on the beach! Yeah! The grounds were very nice and the pool was pretty as well, with plenty of seating and towels. We would go back there (as soon as we can save up enough money!).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights on the 6th floor and had an incredible view of the grounds, pool & partial ocean. We paid for a garden view and had no idea we were upgraded until we saw our room. If you need to book any activities while staying at Kaanapali shores, see Clark down at the activities desk by the pool. There was not a question he couldn't answer for us and he found us some great deals. He rocked! The only negative was that the bar at the pool served less then desireable drinks. They were flavorless and we also noticed other people bringing their's back for a shot of flavor as well. We walked to the more expensive resort next door for our drinks and found that the grounds were not nearly as beautiful Kaanapali Shores and their pool area was totally commercialized in comparison. We loved the Tropical feel of Kaanapali Shores & would book there again for sure. E&P Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aston K.S. from 6/28-7/1/05 on our island hopping trip around Hawaii. We arrived at the Aston and they did not have our studio room ready. They gracioulsy upgraded us to an ocean view 1 b.r. condo, as a result. I was completely surprised by this as we were actually there a bit prior to their designated 3pm check in time. Our room was adequate for our needs. It appeared to have recently had a facelift: newer berber carpet, fresh paint, and new furnishings. The appliances were from the '80's but worked fine. The beach behind the hotel is small and the swimming is not that good. Just off shore is a bit off a drop off and before that it's rather rocky. If you're going to swim, be sure to pack water shoes. We took a quick drive south of the hotel to the Sheraton and I was surprised at the difference between that end of the beach and ours. It appears that where the Sheraton sits, and north of it, is the 'real' Kanaapali. The beach is much wider and the water is better for swimming and snorkeling. This is alos where you'll find parasailing, kayak rentals, and the like. The Beach Club resaurant/bar serves food all day. They also have drinks of the day and happy hours which, for a resort bar, are very reasonably priced. We didn't try the food. This is a value property. I'd say it's best suited for families. Hindsight being what it is, if we head back to Maui, we'd stay a bit farther south at the Sheraton, Whaler, or one of the properites in that vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON IN MAUI at a GREAT HOTEL/CONDO”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, We really can't complain about a think at the Aston Kanapali Shores. Upon checking in to our room, we thought it looked a touch outdated, but the view was GREAT! We called the lobby and they switched us to another, more updated room...all you have to do is ask! I think most rooms have a view of the ocean as long as you're above the 3rd floor or so. Housekeeping did a great job of new sheets, towels and empyting the trash every day. The size of the room is much larger than a regular hotel would be - plus you get a full size rridge, stove and microwave. The courtesy desk does everything for you including booking t-times for golf, and arranging all of your sightseeing tours (we loved the snorkeling trip to Molikini and road to Hana via the $109.00 tour---probably would skip the Atlantis submarine next time though). The desk is open every day (I think) and there is always someone at check in if you have a question. We also had the $100 for credit and got 3 meals out of it for the 2 of us. You can also take the food back to your room, or grab a pizza from across the street at the strip mall and eat it on the beach. The stores and supermarket across the street are a short walk, but nicely hidden from the resort. The resort has a peaceful "away from it all" feel, but its only a short drive to the happening town of Lahina, which is where we spent most of our time. Email me with any questions if this is your first time to Maui (it was ours) and I'll answer any ?'s you may have! We've attached some pics of our room, the view from the room, and the lobby. Have no reservations about booking your honeymoon here. A++

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui 13Jun. We stayed at AKS for 5nights and everyone that worked at the resort was very very pleasant. As I hear all the rooms are up for remodeling and should be completed if not already done. Our room was just absolutely perfect. We were on the PH (penthouse) floor and we had a 1 bedroom o/v suite. Our room had new everything from the appliances in the kitchen to the pictures and sofa in the living area. We took advantage of using the kitchen by buying breakfest items so we could get up and lounge at our leisure and relax on the lanai. We had 2adults and 2 children (ages 9 and 7). The garden pool was perfect for the kids and we never had a problem getting towels or lawn chairs. The beach was fine w/nice waves however a little rocky. The kids wanted to get seashells however very limited. We walked down the beach and we did notice other hotels and even checked out there pool however the AKS maintance and grounds keeping was much more noticeable than the others. So we stayed on our turf. We also had fun doing the lei making class which was great. If you plan on doing any activities while staying at the hotel make sure you reserve your spot as soon as you get there or adleast 24hrs prior to event. One day there was a hula show that was very nice. The AKS offers a program for kids. Stay play and eat for free. Yeah kids stayed for free however the hotel didnot honor the eat for free w/the restuarant that was on property. You had to go else where to take advantage of the promo and there is also a kids club that is on property and there is also a fee along w/that. There were a few attractions that honored the promotion but it was very limited. I don't think the promotion should be advertised eat/play for free if the hotel doesn't let it's guest benefit from the venu at hotel. As you can see that was the only thing that didn't sit well with me. Other than that this hotel was top notch. If you have any doubt in your mind about the accommadation or the Customer service you have nothing to worry about this place was absolutely wonderful. Would I return to this hotel again? Absolutely w/out a doubt. The washer dryer unit was a bonus. We were able to wash out swim suits on a daily basis and we went home with clean laundry in our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just coming back from 4 nights at the Kaanapali Shores. We booked a one bedroom apartment with garden view. After reading the reviews, I was kind of scared, but we were pleased with what we got... Our unit was on the ground level, facing the garden (unit #146) and near the garden pool. Never had problem with noise...This unit had been renovated with a king size bed, a queen sofabed, and a nice bathroom and kitchen (no bugs there). Enough space for us (4 adults and a baby). Ground unit are really convenient especially with a toddler. We stayed one day at the hotel beach, nice beach (although you can find better on the island), easy to swim and large enough... We did enjoy the $100 credit at their restaurant and were glad it was free (we had breakfast there-so so, and did get few cocktails..on the house!) The pools are nice (the one in the garden is perfect for kids, the other one is too deep), never had problem getting chairs or towels... We had requested a crib, and I was ready to argue for the fees (I saw on previous reviews that they made you pay for it...but on different websites like expedia they say it's complementary...did not have to pay- they did not even charge us) No problem with the front desk either: we requested a crib and it came within 5 minutes, same with towels or dish soap... We had a late flight, so we asked to check out later, they allowed us to keep the room until 1pm and gave us access to a hospitalily room to take shower in the evening...That's where I found out we were lucky with our unit...I finally understood why some people were complaining...The hospitality room was really old, I wouldn't want to spend my vacations in there....So I guess your vacations really depend on what unit you will get...So don't forget to ask when you book your room that you want a remodeled unit.... The only complain I have is that they make you pay for parking...$9 though, but I think it should be included in the price of the room. Bottom line: we will definitively stay there again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Aston Kaanapali Shores!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from maui on Friday May 27th..We went to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary, I was a little concerned after reading a few of the reviews but the minute we walked in the door we were extremely impressed! The place is absolutely beautiful..the garden and waterfall outside the lobby was first thing we saw! the walkways all around the hotel were so pretty, the pools were beautiful...the service was fantastic..our room was great..we had a studio on the 5th. floor. My favorite time of the day was when all the tiki torches get lit around the hotel and on the ocean walkways..how romantic!! It was fun at dusk when hotel guests all gathered around to see the sunset..just talking and finding out where everyone was from. The beach club right there at the hotel had great food and we thought great prices..(best scrambled eggs I have ever eaten) we had dinner and breakfast there several times..we were lucky enough to be seated outside just as the sun was going down..we do not have a bad thing to say about the Aston Kaanapali..We would surely go back. This was our first time to Hawaii and could not ask for a better experience. Troy from Expedia was great and booked everything for us that we were interested in..it was nice not having to make any phone calls or reservations, they just do it for you. Thanks to the Aston for a memorable 30th. Anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View - Great Size for large family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Maui and consider it our favorite place to vacation. Now, we have 3 small children and grandma to consider, which made it difficult to stay at a 5-star resort because we would have had to rent at least 2 rooms (not even a suite would accomodate us). We chose the Shores. It is definitely not the Kaanapali Beach we were used to. The beach is small and we really spent zero time there. The pools are lovely, especially the garden pool which is more quiet. The foilage, trees, and grass surrounding the garden pool provide a lovely setting. The ocean front pool is nice, too, but can get a little loud with the restaurant/bar being right there. Not always relaxing. We never had a problem finding a chair, but towels were often hard to come by. We waited on several days for fresh towels. The restaurant was not somewhere we enjoyed eating. We thought the food was sub-par given the prices so we drove to other lovely restaurants around Kaanapali and Lahaina. It was nice to have the market across the street, and Safeway (a bit cheaper) was not too far to drive. What disappointed us the most was the fitness center. The fitness center mentioned on all web sites and advertisements was not included with the room rental, was rarely open even during posted hours, and was a disappointment. The staff seemed nice, but the housecleaning staff was rushed. We decided to rent a large, corner unit with a full ocean view and wrap around lanai. We are not sorry about it. The view made up for any other complaint we had. The sound of the ocean crashing and seeing the other islands was so lovely we could have just lived out on the lanai entirely. Being on the second floor had some drawbacks, especially noise from people out on the beach or the area just below our room. The unit we had, room 202, was not updated. The beds were awful (we're still suffering with sore backs) and the decor was sad. But, we just looked out at the gorgeous ocean and our complaints melted away. We loved the family time and most of the other families we met were very nice with good, well-behaved kids. We are disappointed that we had to listen to sanding, pounding, and other assorted construction noises, which we were not advised of at the time of our booking. Also, it is hard to be next door to people who smoke on their lanai when your family does not smoke. This resort also allows smoking at the pools which is disgusting when you do not smoke and are trying to enjoy the sun. We are not sure if we would stay again, but we would definitely not settle for anything less than a corner unit with 2 bedrooms, especially with 6 people. We enjoyed it! Would not rate this resort above a 3-star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, I'd go back again”
Reviews.Content: I was here the last week of April 2005. I had read some fairly bad reviews and was worried about the place not meeting my expectations. I was pleased to see that it was very very nice. Immaculate grounds keeping and a nice restraunt facing the ocean. My one bedroom condo room had a great ocean view but was on the cusp of needing renevation. I'd be surprised if they booked it again prior to remodeling. The furniture and appliances were tired looking and dated circa 1989 or beyond I would imagine. The drywall near the toilet base was peeling and the toilet would run all the time. I lifted the lid to check on the guts of the thing and a few parts disintegrated in my hand and the handle fell off into the tank. Maintenance came quickly after I called and fixed the problem but it still cycled on and off a bit. Had a nice chat with the repair guy while he fixed it. Nice guy willing to please. All the staff was very accomodating. Other rooms were much nicer as I could see from my balcony. I could see much nicer furniture. But I'm a single guy who was on vacation alone to check out the Hawaiian islands. Therefore I didn't mind these imperfections. It made for some humor when I called home to friends from time to time. But had I had a girlfriend with me, or had I been on my honeymoon, I would not have been so forgiving. I would have insisted on an updated room. One thing Aston should have done differently is relocate the restraunt so that the kitchen fans aren't the prominent sound you hear all day long in the middle of the courtyard. On at about 4:45 am and off by 10:30 pm everyday. Big design error I'd say. Great restraunt location but terrible fan placement. I'd rather hear the waves at night while falling asleep. The Beach is rocky. Wear sandles if you use it for swimming. But nice and private which I liked. Great place for not a ton of money. No bugs or mold in my room. No bad smells. Nice and clean. Just dated early 90's decor. I'd return, not alone (too lonely with so many sexy women strolling around) but with a girlfriend or wife and I'd insist on a renovated room. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “100% Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: sun007set
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aston Kaanapali Shores for eleven days for our honeymoon in mid April. My husband and I were on a budget and went through Apple Vacations to find a good package deal since we didn't want the extra stress of putting a vacation together. I was worried when I read some of the reviews on here. But I honestly thought the hotel was very nice, especially in it's price range. A few years ago I stayed at the Embassy Suites (the pink hotel right next door). I really thought the Shores was a better place for us. We used the kitchen a lot. We went to Safeway to buy most of our groceries and went once across the street to the Star Market (As a side note the nice gentleman in front of us in line asked if it was our honeymoon and then bought us our groceries-I just want to say thanks to the generous people that care!). We made a lot of meals at the hotel instead of eating out every meal. Some nights we even stayed in a rented a movie on the TV at the hotel. Our hotel room number was 209 and it was already rennovated and everything was updated except some of the appliances in the kitchen. But everything worked just fine and we had no problems with anything. The grounds are beautiful there. The gardeners must take their job seriously because everything was trimmed to perfection. We took a lot of beautiful pictures at the hotel and when I brought them back to show people in AZ they were like 'This is beautiuful, where is it?'. The beach isn't that great but we went on so many excursions and mini trips on the island that I really didn't care about the beach at our hotel. If you are looking for a really nice beach you will want to travel a little bit. The pools there weren't very busy and we always made our nightly visit to the hot tub. Other than that the pool area was kept clean. We had a $100 food credit that we used at the restaurant. We took some omlets up to our room a few times and sat down to eat twice. We also used some of it to buy us a few Captain/Cokes and some Lava Flows. (Don't get the coconut shrimp there. A big rip off, 5 little shirmp for ten bucks...Bubba Gumps or Outbacks are much better.) The orientation the first day you are there is helpful. They were honest and we were pleased with all of our activities, they even told us not to book any whale watching trips because the whales were pretty much gone even though they could have easily booked us all trips just to make a few extra bucks. We didn't think we would sign up for everything our first full day there but we did. It made it so much nicer than trying to call everyone and plan out your trip. Just let them do it and I don't think the prices were too bad either. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the room. It was hawaiian but not tacky. It felt like home while we were there. We never had any problem with housekeeping. They always did their cleaning when we were out and about. We did find one roach when we first opened the door but that was the only one and it probably snuck in from the balcony. No big deal though, never saw any other bugs in all eleven days. Tidbits of activites booked through the hotel: *ZIP LINES were so fun and the best thing I tried in Hawaii, I'm scared of heights but I LOVED it! You won't regret it! It's awesome! *Hapa Papa's Road to Hana Tour-worth the $109.00 per person to have the whole trip narriated by a local and everyone gets their own window seat in a deluxe van *Molokini/Lanae snorkle tour on Pacific Whale Foundation-great because profits go back to preserving the islands and wildlife *Bikeride down the volcano wasn't my thing, I got in the van about half way down *Dinner/Cocktail cruises=really cheap alcohol *Atlantis sub eh...so so but neat to see below surface because we don't scuba Overall I really recommend this hotel. I did type a lot of info but reading the comments of previous guests was the best way for me to find the right hotel. I'm glad I chose this one. It really felt like home and for the price I was able to do a few more activies on the island rather than pay double for an expensive hotel. I would go back to this hotel again and I'm recommending it to my parents when they go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! A little Pricey for outdated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is a prime spot on Kaanapali beach. The 2 pools are nice but a little small for the size of the hotel. The hotel rooms are small and are in need of reovation. Hot water was scarce and circuit breaker tripped in our room. Maintenance had to go into neighbors room to acces breaker to turn our power back on. Room had large gap under door which allowed for noise to filter in room easily especially from elevator. Internet access was only available in lobby and signal was not that great. It was odd that a place would charge so much and still make you pay for their fitness center. I guess that's why it was empty when we went in there. Hotel is within a short drive to the main Resort Hotels and restaurants are only 10 mins. away. With rental car it was quick and easy. Beware there is $10 charge for parking. Grocery store right across the street for snacks and drinks. Grounds of property were kept clean and staff was nice. Overall not a bad place but expected more for the price they charge. I would definitely consider this a 3 Star hotel. Will spend a little more next time and stay at one of the nicer resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great 40th b-day and 14th anniversary in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: kscott65
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Aston. Our condo was clean and decor comfortable. The kitchen and washer/dryer were such a nice convenience. No dirty clothes to bring home and it was nice to pick up snacks and soda for the week. The restaurant had a great French Dip sandwich for lunch. We ate at the small bar out by the pool and enjoyed the view of the ocean. As a former Marriott Manager, I can state with some authority that the staff was excellent. The front desk and activities desk were both top rate. Lei-lei (not sure of the spelling) on the activites desk was absolutley awesome! We planned an activity through her for every day of our stay and we were not disappointed! Expect to spend $1000 for one week worth of nightly activities. We were there during spring break so a lot of families with children in the pool, but we never struggled for a chaise to lay out. negatives at Aston were minimal: the halls were a little aged, but clean, the beach very steep, not conducive for walking and the weather was not on our side with a little rain every day, but Vacation is truly what you make it and we had a wonderful time! I'd stay with Aston again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but price and convenience/atmosphere/features were excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ausbj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the ritz but the location & price are right. The rooms are quite adequate - everything i could possibly need during my stay and more. My wife and I just spent 1 weekhere. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were fabulous. It's amazing how much different a spacious room can make, compared to a miniscule hotel room. Plenty of space for you to work in and has a desk with high speed Internet access. There were 3 phones and a great TV with entertainment for the kids like games, movies, internet, wireless, CD's etc. It's great to have all the stations on the TV along with pay movies, pay music. They also had a feature where you can watch old sitcoms, like the Sopranos. I also saw on there that you can get seminars, etc. on selling techniques. A true TV center. Having a microwave and a full kitchen was also a plus. They have free breakfast in the morning with pancakes, eggs any way you like them, a true breakfast instead of the cold items. The daily maid service was great. The poolside restaurant and onsite gift shops made the resort truly a great place to spend some time. The 2 separate pools and grounds were beautiful. The orientation was worthwhile and informative - highly recommended! The staff are all friendly.We stayed in a 1br oceanview room (upgraded from the studio we paid for - dont forget to mention if you're a senior or on a honeymoon and they will probably upgrade you if they have availability!) Visit their website and you'll see where they mention it. Feel free to email me if you have any questions...and need an unbiased opinion. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but get a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Resort was nice and front desk personnel were friendly. Booked on Expedia for a 4 star resort and the room I was given had mold, a broken bed, and broken down furniture. Expedia gave me a $200 gift certificate, which is useless considerring how much I paid for the place. The tour and rental equipment staff were very rude and disrespectful. I recommend getting your tours somewhere else, they do not deserve your money. The restraunt was good and kid friendly. Swimming not so good in front of the hotel, but if you go a couple hundred yards to the south it is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: nschmidt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in April. The hotel itself as well as the grounds were beautiful. Wonderful waterfalls, plants, and openess. Our room was a "partial ocean view" which turned out to be a great view of the courtyard and we could see a little of the ocean off of our lanai. We had a one bedroom condo room which was PERFECT for us. Full living room/dining room/kitchen with bathroom and bedroom, plus full laundry. It's a perfect room for a good price for anyone staying for a week because it gives you a chance to unpack and feel like you have moved in and not living out of a suitcase. We never swam in the pools, but they were never overly busy. The beach was Ok, a little small, but sufficient. A short walk south and the beach gets a little better. Grocery store, Subway, and Pizza Paradiso are across the street. Parking is $9/day. All in all, it was a great hotel. I would definetly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: dpcta
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day stay here. The thing I liked most was the "hotel" feel. It had maid service, a fun poolside restaurant/bar, gift shops, conciere services ect. The pools and grounds were well kept and really pretty. It was never hard to find a chair at the pool. Definitely go to the orientation/continental breakfast when you arrive. It was not a timeshare presentation, rather an information gathering talk. It was very helpful. The staff was helpful and polite. The rooms were ok. We stayed in an updated garden view. Updated basicly means some new paint and furniture. The appliances were old but worked. The condos had very basic cooking supplies. Don't plan on making any gourmet meals or frozen drinks here. Our garden view room overlooked the garden pool. We were happy with the view and were glan that we didn't pay more for an ocean view. Across the street was a shopping plaza with a grocery store(expensive), great coffee shop, an ice cream store ect. It really came in handy! The thing we didn't like was the beach. It was very narrow and sloped. There was a good amount of coral also so bring water shoes. You are not within walking distance to Whalers Village. Plan on using that rental car alot. We did have to change rooms once due to an electrical problem with the room. The staff was nice about it, but it was still a pain. Overall, I would stay here again. If you want to be close to the action, stay right in Kaanapali but you will pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Just So-So”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days at the Aston Kaanapali Shores, and while it was ok, we weren't thrilled. First and foremost, it is important to state that the hotel falls north of Kaanapali beach and of a valley that produces rain daily (a very light drizzle, but quite chilly with the wind). Go a mere 2 miles south and it is always sunny and beautiful - NO RAIN. We wish we had known this going in and I'm surprised that this was not mentioned in any of the other reviews. Given the Lahaina address of the hotel, we were surprised to find out that the hotel is as far north as it is. You really can't walk to Kaanapali beach, so would need to rent a car to get to the action (and the sun for that matter). The hotel itself is nice enough. We rented a 2 bedroom unit with a partial ocean view (room 304). The unit itself was rather run down. The vents were black and "drippy", which was really gross and gave the impression that mold is a problem in the unit. Some updating of the units is in progress, so hopefully this one will get an overhaul soon. The view of the ocean from both lanais was lovely. The staff was very nice, the grounds and pools were well kept. Upon returning to Maui, we will definately stay on Kaanapali beach if only for the convenience of being able to lay out by the pool or on the beach without getting rained on.

Reviews.Title: “Will Come Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: Wjbnapa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Kaanapali Shores many times and while it is not a 5-star resort, it IS great for families and kids! The staff is always very helpful and polite. The activities desk folks are very patient and recommend wonderful places to eat and visit--ask where they like to eat...The newly renovated rooms are beautiful and very Hawaiian. Rooms are spacious and clean and I have only seen a bug there once--granted, it was a big bug, but at least it was dead! They have an active bug extermination program there!! The newly decorated rooms are a big improvement over the old ones and while the kitchens are still "old" they are good and our appliances were new. If we didn't have something we needed, we could call housekeeping and they delivered it to our room immediately. Our view of the ocean was limited, but since we don't spend a lot of time in our room anyway, we enjoy sitting near the garden pool (it's quieter) and you can always find a lounge chair there. Folks who put a towel on their beach chairs at the crack of dawn and then don't show up until much later in the day, aren't being fair to those who use the beach early! It's good to get a clean towel before you really need one--pick one up at dinnertime so you'll have it in the morning first thing... The birds in the morning and nighttime are very entertaining and the frogs "hammering away" are, too! In the wintertime you can see whales from almost any beach! Bring your binoculars for a better view! The shopping mall benind the resort is great! The local food is best and least expensive--don't expect to buy what you have at home for the same price (like grapes for instance...they do not grow on Maui for eating, just wine!). Eat the local produce and you will not be disappointed! The farmer's markets are the best places for fresh fruit as well as island ambiance. The crafts fair at the community center is fantastic and we always find good bargains there! It's on Sundays.... I agree that the parking fees are outrageous--but travelers need to ask questions about EVERYTHING before they stay at any hotel! No place is "perfect"! Remember, you are in Paradise! Maui is no ka oi! (the best!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent/Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i visited Kaanapali Shore from Dec. 11-17 and found it very pleasant and satisfactory. Even though our arrival was quite late at night we were greeted by the front desk with warm "Aloha" and very effieicnt. Even though we stayed there before and enjoyed it then, we found it in much better shape this time. The restaurant was very pleasant and the food was very good. We recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vacation - but would Not stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Maui and decent time at this resort - who couldnt! But we would not stay at this hotel again for one reason and one reason only: The noise in the bedrooms! We stayed in a 1 BR suite/condo. The suite was decent size and they recently updated the furniture and carpet. Kitchen hadnt been redone yet nor had the 1980 microwave oven but no big deal. The one and only problem was that the bedroom location in each 1 br suite is adjacent to the hallways. The BR walls are very thin and because of its location to the hallways you can hear each and every person walk past your bedroom all night long - flipflops hitting the hallway floor, people talking, workers, the elevator bell (5 rooms away), and every car that parks at night. Dont forget the occassional party folks that stroll in at 1 or 2 am and make noise all the way to their room. Thats fine with them, thats their business, but I dont want any part of anyone elses noise when I try to sleep. The only saving grace was that things quited down after 1am and from 1am - 6am you it was quiet enough to sleep. We are not light sleepers either. I recommend the resort fix this or they will lose more and more customers which is unfortunate because the rest of the resort is decent. I would not stay again because I enjoy a good night sleep and I enjoy privacy of my own room. Who wants to be cranky all the next day on their vacation because they were tired and didnt get a good night sleep. Each room also has a 2 inch open gap under their main door and that also lets alot of noise in the room. If you stay here, take a look at the 2 inch gap. I read this on the website before we went and looked. It was true. Kind of strange too as the hotel loses costs on its air conditioning bills. I was surprised bugs didnt make use of the 2 inch opening - we did not see any bugs at all. The overall bldg is a 1960s nostalgia type with some old hallways and unattractiveness to it but they are making efforts to redo all the rooms and grounds to make this a nice place. Dont expect a nice new hotel like you find on the mainland. Couple more things I didnt like but wouldnt affect my decision to stay again. $9.00 parking per day. The Papeka resort next door (also owned by the same owners, ASTON) did not charge their folks parking. Hmmm. The resort will charge you to use the in-room safe. We brought our own crib (pack and play) because we were warned that the resort charges $12.00 per day for cribs. The resort charges to use their treadmills, bicycles, and fitness equipment. This was all unclassy and they should just keep their $100 voucher they give everyone and stop nickel and diming folks. The last thing people want on a vacation they paid decent money for are petty costs and any type of little burdens like this. Now the good stuff. I think you will enjoy your vacation here if you decide to stay. We enjoyed our stay. The pools were small but very nice. Jacuzzis are great. Restaurant and bar make it nice for meals or drink. The lobby is the best part of the hotel and the grounds were well taken care of. The walkways are nice to stroll up and down and connect to Embassy Suites and Papeka resort. We strolled each night and watched the beautiful sunsets and views of Lanai and Molakia. Beach is lacking real estate and coral hinders swimming but we knew this going and drove to the plentiful public beaches on the island each day and didnt mind. Lobby has wireless (wi-fi) internet connection and a real plus and suprisingly at no cost. The shopping center across the street is another definite plus with supermarket, pizza shop, coffee house, and more. If the resort fixes the noise problem to their bedrooms we would return.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING VACATION”
Reviews.Author: smalltown402
Reviews.Content: The resort was outstanding ! I am a travel agent from Iowa and this was our 2 nd trip to Hawaii and I was very pleased with the Kaanapali Shores ! I was with a group of 9 family memebers, we had 2 ocean view 2 bed room condos. Group one received a beautifully newly updated condo, we did not. The friendly staff did offer to move us to and updated condo but after seeing the view of the parking lot , we stayed with what we had. Beautiful view of court yard and garden pool, yes and the ocean. The grounds are wonderful. The pools and hot tubs very nice and curfews are enforced. The beach is pretty but not greatest for swimming, some coral. Great location, easy to get everywhere ! Whale watching was awesome, we used Pacific Whale Foundation for sunset coctail cruise. Helicopter tour is a must, we used Blue Hawaiian, GREAT JOB ! I will book this property when ever anyone wants an affordable vacation ! It was an outstanding vacation !

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: jckent123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and both of our entire families took our first trip to Hawaii/Maui and selected the Kaanapali Shores November 2004. We had some problems with our flight and so we didn't end up getting to Maui until the next day. I called the hotel and let them know that we would be delayed. They said it wouldn't be a problem. When we got there, it was another story. They acted like we never called and said that we would have to pay for another nights stay if we wanted to stay for a week. The front desk staff were rolilng their eyes at us and got fussy when we were the ones who just 3endured a 26 hr trip getting there. After about 2 hrs of arguing with the front desk, they went ahead and said we wouldn't have to pay extra. I think they just got tired of us. 2 nights later, we observed what seemed to cockroaches in our room. We went to complain to the front desk and he told us that the whole island has cockroches and acted like it was no big deal. We asked to see other rooms and they smelled like mildew and one of them had a dead roach right in the doorway. I was horrified. I didn't want to bring back cockroaches in our luggage. The hotel was cold and insensitive to our basic need of not having cockroaches in a hotel room. Reading the other positive reviews, I don't think people payed attention to their room. The two roaches that I saw were very fast and had i not been in the room at that particular time and looking that direction, I probably would not have seen them. 2 days later, Our whole entire floor was given a note that they woudl be exterminating the entire floor as it appeared that when they treat one room, the roaches flee to the next room. I will never go back to this property and i suggest unless you want cockroaches that you do not either. If you do decide to go, look at the huge 2" gap under the door that goes to the outside hallways!

Reviews.Title: “first time maui visitor-good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we arrived to an upgrade which is always lovely...we booked a studio partial ocean view and were upgraded to 1 bed with a great ocean view from the living & bedroom {7th floor was higher than the building in front} the sound of the birds{frogs} and the waves was great. our particular condo was not so modern it was stuck somewhere between 1980-1983..the sofa / the pictures / the fridge all needed replacing but it was well equipt and clean. i have stayed in 4 stars many times and to be honest this is a 2/3 star for the interior of the condo.. the complex was nice the beach amaizing with whales breaching all day long just a few hundred yards from shore ..we beach walked in both directions and was just lovely we loved it ..we went to the orientation on the first morning and it was good {expedia fun} ....very efficient and super nice helicopter trips 100/10 splash out and go for the whole hour dinner cruises 10/10 add 15 dollars and get the better boat whale watching 10/10 kiele V ...awesome catamaran luau 10/10 ..again spend the extra for "feast of the lele" we had 5 courses of the most delicous food all served at our own table for 3 ..no lines!! but fyi tip was not included location perfect - drive up to kapula and check out the ritz and hana was great ..have lunch at the hana maui..$$$$ but oooohhhhh... star market across the street 10/10 . lahaina 15 minutes away 10/10 we had a great time in maui and will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Debkatie
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you like shabby rooms that smell like mildew and mold! Arrived to check in at 2 p.m. and were told the "studio" room we reserved was not ready. No problem, we came back in an hour, but there were still no "studio" rooms available. After disappearing for about 5 minutes the desk clerk returned with the happy news that we were given a complimentary "upgrade" to a one bedroom condo. (Be skeptical of their upgrades!) The room we were taken to had clearly not been renovated in the 25 or 30 years since it was built. For starters the room just smelled bad, as mentioned above. (Had to buy a "plug in" room deoderizer to survive.) The unit's air conditioner was louder than some jet engines. After complaining to the front desk about the noise and asking for another room, what we got instead was a repair person who changed the a/c filter (looked like it had also been there for 30 years) and spent some time trying to quiet the unit down to not much avail. We decided to just turn it off so we could sleep. Unfortunately, the bedroom is arranged so that the head of the bed shares a wall with the cement walkway outside. So your head is literally within inches of people stomping along the walkway. Not only do you hear each footstep, but every spoken word. I won't waste much space with the fact there was a parking lot below the bedroom so we were also serenaded by cars at all hours of the night and day. (Did I mention I requested a "quiet" room when I made the reservation?) Night 2 we opted to try and sleep on the living room sofa bed. It was at least quieter in that room, but the sofa bed was very uncomfortable, as they usually are. The bottom sheet had a small red stain of unknown origin. We learned that the sheets don't get changed at this place, the same stained sheet was on the bed our entire stay. The unit was shabby - there were chunks missing out of the walls that had been sloppily repaired with spackle -- but not smoothed out or, heaven forbid, repainted. There was obvious water damage to the unit, the tile floors were uneven and felt hollow in some places; the cabinets in the bathroom showed signs of water damage inside. In summary, we paid $163 per night (before taxes) to stay in the equivalent of a Motel 6. And that is not to disparage Motel 6, they do serve their purpose, but no one pays that much money to stay in one. I had read some positive reviews about this place on Trip Advisor before I made the reservation and one wonders if we can all be talking about the same place! All I can say is beware of complimentary "upgrades". If you feel you must stay here, at least ask for a room that has been renovated in the last 10 years and avoid room 428 at all costs! As for partial ocean view, as another reviewer put it, you have to be outside the room on the balcony before you can see any blue ocean. We only had 4 nights in Maui and didn't want to waste any time trying to find other accommodations. When we return next year with our entire family (this was sort of a scouting mission) be assured we won't stay here! When we left the snooty clerk who checked us out didn't even ask if we enjoyed our stay! Probably didn't want to hear the answer!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Convenience in Paradise at Aston Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: Escapee
Reviews.Content: My family and I (four adults) spent the week of January 10th at the Aston. I was nervous about the room we would stay in due to the reviews and limited pictures on their website. But rest assured when we walked into our room, we found a very up to date and spacious suite. We stayed in room 148 which is a garden suite so I chose the ground floor; I love waking up in the morning and opening the veranda doors to the lush scenery while having breakfast or lounging around. This room is also tucked away on the grounds so people aren't constantly walking right outside. The birds sang & chattered to greet you each morning, but you can barely hear them with the glass doors shut. You enter the suite from the parking lot side, at the opposite end is a wall of sliding glass so you have a beautiful view of the grounds and meandering creek. Most of these units are owned by other people who rent them out or something like that, so the decor is up to the owner (I think). Either way, I asked for an updated room and we got one. The kitchen came complete with dishes, dish washer, microwave, coffee pot, an island and a washer & dryer. The bedroom had a very comfortable King size bed and the living room had a comfortable pull out. Only one bathroom though. The lobby and the grounds immediately made you feel like you were in Hawaii! I had Afternoon Tea at the Ritz while there and have to say, their lobby and grounds are not nearly as sunny and beautiful (although much larger) and there is no beach either. Upon check-in we also received a $100 credit to the restaurant which has very good breakfast items. We ate breakfast once and lunch once. The pools and hot tubs (two of each) are both completly renovated and the glass wall separating the pool from the ocean helped keep the breezes down which was nice as you emerged from the nicely heated pool (not very warm, but comfortable). The staff at Aston was very friendly and not once did I see any bugs. There were plenty of lawn chairs at the pools, on the expansive lawn and the beach. You do have to rent the shaded ones though. I recommend bringing beach shoes since much of the coastline can be rocky whether it be Maui or Oahu. There is a shopping center within walking distance of the hotel complete with Subway, grocery and an internet cafe. The hotel does offer interent at $10/24 hr. We did not use it. Parking was $9 a day. Aston is 5 - 10 min drive from Lahaina which is very convenient for many restaurants and lots of souvenir shopping. There is a large free lot at the end of the strip, about half a block east of the big banyan tree. Time limit 3hrs, but we always found a space. I bought groceries once at the market in Lahaina and it was so expensive, especially fresh fruit! $13 for 3 lb of grapes! Lunch meat, cheese and bread were decent so we had a few economical lunches and snacks for our long road trips to Hana and the Botanical Gardens. We ate at the following: ROY'S - very noisy, good food, ran out of stuff; KIMO'S -decent food, lovely view; BUBBA GUMP - like any other chain, right on the Beach, MAUI TACOS - must have, tucked away, TEA AT THE RITZ - must do if you enjoy Tea, it was superb, generous and delicous. Held in the Library overlooking the tiered pools and ocean. If you want to eat at Cheese Burger in Paradise, get there early early early. The Old Lahaina Luau is a must, reserve your seating as soon as you know you are coming so you get close to the stage although not seat is really bad the way they have it set up. Food is better than most Luau's but the show and location are the BEST! There are also some nice hospitality surprises when you arrive. And don't wait in line at the bar, your server can get you all of your drinks. My family and I strolled the grounds many times and even spotted the whales swimming around and breaching on several occasions. I still recommend a whale watch tour so you get up close and personal, they can be pretty cheap at $20 (winter months only). Everyone was friendly, onsite outdoor massage & salon, free hula lessons and luau shops on the premises, and across the street were convenient, pools clean, grounds immaculate... I can't think of one thing I can complain about it. Loved it and would gladly return, especially to room 148! Enjoy your trip... ALOHA :)

Reviews.Title: “Studio Unit Overlooks Parking Lot”
Reviews.Author: Rich064
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds, lobby, pools, and room layout is very nice. If ocean view at an affordable price is your priority, however, then I wouldn't stay here again. The Studio Partial Ocean View room actually overlooks the parking lot, and to see the ocean, you have to stand pressed against the far right wall of the lanai to even get a slight glimpse of the ocean. I like to leave my patio door open at night to hear the roar of the ocean waves, but could not in this room due to parking lot noise. We asked the second day to be moved to a different unit, but were told that all rooms at that price level overlook the parking lot. I stayed at the Aston Mahana right down the beach from this hotel last year, at was really spoiled by the spectacular, full ocean view of all the units there. For not much more money, I will return to the Mahana on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! We had a two bedroom condo that was very spacious! It was tastefully decorated and was comfortable for our stay. The staff was very nice and helpfull for any questions you had. It was a tough time getting chairs by the pool or beach but we always managed to snag a couple for our group and i dont mind lounging on a towell on the sand. The only complaint i have is that we were overlooking the hottub and the pool and you culd hear everyones conversations and it went well into the night. In the late hours of the night through early morning all you culd hear were the birds coming back into the tree! i was woken up every morning by this. Overall, it was a nice place to stay with acess to grocery store and food places. we did not eat on the property but i would probably stay here again

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed this family place”
Reviews.Author: granprof
Reviews.Content: We had two different condo seeing that there were 8 of us including two 1 year olds. Both were clean and looked out to the ocean/pool. The maid service was so so. They sometimes cleaned the kitchen and most times did not. Mostly did the bed and towels. My one complaint was the parking and crib charges. Can you believe that we paid for 8 days 200 dollars for the cribs. I could have bought new portacribs for that price!!! Also 9 dollars a day for parking. I saw some people park in the shopping center across the street and then walk over. It is enough that you have to rent a car but to pay for parking is another story. We visited two other island and did not pay for parking at either location. other than that, it was a great location for a family get together.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ason Kanapalli Shores for our Honeymoon in October 2004 . Our room was very nice and we had a great view from our balcony. We loved that all the staff was more than willing to help with any of our Questions. Unlike other reviews we never saw an insect in or around our room. The reasturant on the premise was great and the food excellent. Despite renovations to the Main pool we could not have stayed at a better place. I reccomend this Hotel/ Condo to anyone planning a trip to Maui. Infact we plan to return to Maui this year and stay at the Aston Kanapalli Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aston Kaanapali Shores!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Shores Dec 4th-9th and loved it! Staff was great! We had a 1 bedroom condo (which was really nice with 2 younger children) and were upgraded to an ocean view that was very nice. The unit was very nice with the full kitchen and washer/dryer. The grounds were beautiful, pools were wonderful and it was very nice to have a beach right there. Restraunt at the place was good (our kids didn't like many of the kids menu selections however). We received ASTONishing deals coupon book that we used for various restraunts and activities. The activities desk (which has a free orientation the first morning after you arrive) was very helpful. We went on a snorkeling cruise that was wonderful, a luau to the Royal Lahina Luau and both were very nice. We would definatley recommend staying here and would stay here again. There is a shopping center across the street with a grocery store, but if you want to save money go down the street to Safeway. Lahina is a very nice town to walk around and visit. We really enjoyed Maui and this Condo unit.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, great staff - 10/5/04 to 10/15/04”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Aston condo - Our room was just remodeled - WOW - The lobby was great - great Hawaiian feeling. Great place on a budget saved a lot of money because of the kitchen. Kids loved the sandy beach although a little rocky once in the water. Extra costs included $ 9.00 per day parking but I played $ 14.00 at the Hyatt. They gave us a coupon book on check in that included % off on a meal or two there.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion in paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the week after Thanksgiving at Aston Kaanapali Shores with my borther-in-law, his wife and a friend from NYC. We had a two bedroom unit high above the tropical grounds with a fantastic view of the beach and the island of Lanai with many rainbows and sunsets. Our other friend had a studio with a minimal ocean view but the unit was immaculate. Both condo units were newly rennovated. The new pool was protected from the wind with a glass wall on the beach side. Only one of the two elevators was working in each of the three stacks, due to renovations, which we were told would be completed soon. Everyone had a great time. We go to Maui or Kauai each year. This was our friend's first visit. She extended it for two more days just to relax in the resort. The complete kitchen and washer-dryer in the units make it easier to pack and cheaper to eat. The beauty of the place made it hard to leave. We always feel that we get the most for our money here. We will all be back here soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: CaribeTraveller
Reviews.Content: As many others, we made a quick change from the Caribbean to Maui for our October vacation. We knew before we went that one of the pools was undergoing renovation and that the restaurant was closed during lunch. The bar/grill operation was even better anyway. Our ocean view condo was clean, pretty well furnished with a great location overlooking the pool. The staff from the front desk to the restaurant, cleaning services and parking attendant were all terrific. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, although we might consider staying in South Maui next time because the fish were more abundant in those snorkeling locations. Almost every place in Maui has some kind of coupon or promotion. We had trouble just tracking them, but that was our problem. The 2-for-1 luau at the Hyatt serves a lot of people, but is pretty well organized.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week here for our 30th wedding anniversary. It was our first visit to Maui, and we loved our time there. The staff was very helpful to us on a variety of levels...from the bellman to the concierges as well as the front desk staff. We also appreciated the champaigne that was sent to us for our celebration, it was a pleasant surprise. We recommend this hotel and plan to come back there ourselves sometime in the future. Made our special occassion truely special. Alan and Diana Seuell Kennewick, WA

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit Despite Renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we found out that renovation would be going on during our October 23-31, 2004 visit, we were hesitant to keep our booking. Resort management assured us we would still enjoy ourselves even though the oceanside pool and adjacent area were being retiled and quite a few suites were being remodeled. To back up their assurance, we were put up in one of their Aloha Suites, the finest accommodations the property has to offer. This upgrade was considerably above and beyond what we had reserved, so you can imagine how pleased we were. Everything about the accommodations was topnotch. Bonus bucks for the excellent restaurant on the premises were also part of the booking. We thoroughly enjoyed the smaller garden pool and the beach on the property and almost didn't miss the bigger pool. Management made an assurance that was as accurate as it was rewarding. This is our third visit to Maui and Aston Kaanapali Shores. Since we get to Maui about every two years, we know we will be coming back. When resort management treats its guests this wonderfully, how could we go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was just a little concerned with the somewhat negative reviews I read about this porperty. Our vaction was from Aug. 18, 2004 to Aug. 29, 2004. Once there the concerns were gone. We celebrated our 25th aniversary with another couple and shared the aloha suite on the 3rd floor. The room was huge and had everything we needed for our vacation. The view of the pool and ocean form our lani was fantastic. The grounds were beatutiful as expected. The two pools served the purpose of cooling off from the hot sun, but were nothing outstanding. I would highly recommend this property for the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, beachfront and big!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aston Kaanapali last month and had a WONDERFUL time. We had a Suite, right on the beach and facing the pool on the ground floor. The view was amazing, the location excellent. The pool and beach are RIGHT out our door! The location is very convenient with the store, dive shops and restaurants just across the street. Diving & snorkeling out front is great, there are HUGE sea turtles right out front! We had a wonderful time and will definately return. Our unit had great furniture and a well stocked kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-kept resort”
Reviews.Author: blacktietraveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Minnesota on September 30. 2004. My Wife and I wanted to get away for a few days and found this place on Hotwire.com for what we thought was a resonable price. We arrived at 6:30 at night. The check-in process was very quick and easy. FOUND OUT PARKING EACH DAY WAS $9.00 a day. They did credit us 1/2 days, so for our 4 days/3 nighst stay it was $27.00. They gave us a beach bag, two sun visors, and two water bottles for staying. The room we stayed in was a Studio w/ a Kitchen. It had a queen size bed, couch w/ a fold out bed, full kitchen, tv, patio w/ a partial ocean view. Seperate sink for toilet and shower area. They provided a Hawaii Newspaper everyday, except Sunday. On the premises are two pools, a garden pool and a beach front pool, and a hottub. THE BEACH FRONT POOL IS BEING RENOVATED SO IT WAS CLOSED....THEY SAID IT SHOULD OPEN AROUND NOVEMBER 15, 2004-MID DECEMBER. This part we did not know when booking. The garden pool is more for kids, as it was only about 3-4 ft. deep, but still very refreshing. There is a restaurant on the premises that serves lunch, dinner, breakfast, and a full bar. We only had a quick sandwich from there when we sat by the pool, as it was closed for lunch for pool renovation. The beach front is nice, the swimming out front starts out sandy, then gets rocky. On the beach, you have a view of Lanai and Molokai. There are three tennis courts, that we used twice. They are in really nice condition for a resort. Behind the resort is a strip mall, within walking distance. It had several restaurants, tourists stores(shirts, snorkel, activites center), and a grocery store. The location of the hotel is just north of Kaanappli hotel area, Lahania, and south of Kapalua on the Northwest coast. It took about 40-45 minutes to drive from the Kahuli airport to the hotel. Lahania(mentioned above) is about 10-15 minute drive to the south. There are several shops and eating establishments there. Overall the experience was more than we expected, just wish we were still there.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the Kaanapali Shores was very nice. We were in a one bedroom oceanview condo on the top floor and had great views of Molokai, the channel and the immaculate garden and grounds. The room had updated furnishings (not like the pastel 80's style in the photos). The ocean pool is being renovated, but the garden pool was fine and we didn't miss the other pool. Judging from the work, it will be beautifully tiled and surrounded with palms making it more lovely. For families, it was very convenient. Directly across the street is a small plaza that has restaurants, little shops and a grocery store. There is also a little farmer's market during the week just a short walk from the condo complex. The beach is good for walks, but for swimming it's ok. The location of the complex is between Kaanapali and Kahana/Napili/Kapalua, so you only need to drive a short distance either way to gorgeous beaches. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Aston Kaanapali Shores”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a great week at the Kaanapali Shores. This was our first visit to Maui and we had a wonderful time. Initially, we stayed in a one bedroom on the 9th floor which was very nice but the air conditioning could have been a bit stronger. So we decided to splurge a little and upgrade to a larger suite on the 5th floor. The view from the lanai, the kitchen, furniture, and, most importantly, the air conditioning was fantastic. We ate a few meals at the hotel and I am not exaggerating when I say these meals were among our favorite. It should also be noted that the service was very good throughout the hotel, whether it was the restaurant, front desk, or housekeeping staff (our rooms were cleaned well). I think the Kaanapali Shores offers a good value without compromising on quality or amenities. Many condo style properties on the island have a pool but no adjacent beach and certainly no restaurant. Here you get all of the above, plus a beautiful garden and lobby. Yes, the beach was a bit rocky, but we were able to do some good swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Better than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Aug 19-Aug 25, 2004. We were very pleased with our room. It hadn't been updated yet(but the condition and furniture were still nice), it was on the first floor(ground level) and we had hoped for more of a view(garden view is up to floor 5) but we decided to not move after we got in the room because we liked the set up so much. It had two seperate bedrooms. One bedroom had a king size bed with the bathroom right outside the door. The other bedroom had a double bed with the other bathroom attached. This extra room was nice because we have a teenage daughter(she took the bedroom with the double bed and bath) and our teenage son took the living room with the pull out sofa sleeper. There were 3 TV's. Our room had a kitchen(refrig, dishwasher, dishes, microwave, etc) We also had a washer and dryer. I would suggest getting a bigger box of detergent when you get there(grocery store is right across the street from the hotel) The washer is small and it took more loads than we planned on to get our laundry done. Only had one roach visit during the week - fortunately my husband saw it and took care of it before I did! I only heard bugs were a problem if you left food out. Our room was always nicely cleaned - it usually wasn't done til the afternoon but, this is a big place! We were gone for most of the day anyways(who wants to sit in their hotel room when they are in Maui?) and it was always done by the time we got back. The garden is gorgeous - as so many people say! The beach was bigger than I thought it would be from the comments. The kids couldn't go really far out before the coral/rocks bothered them but they did a fair amount of snorkeling along the shore and some boogie boarding. Wouldn't recommend jet skiing on Maui, but would recommend snorkeling, Road to Hana, parasailing, bike ride down the mountain, luau, Ulalena Show, shopping on Front St and golfing! (activity desk was extremely helpful!) If you get to Oahu - where we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle - and it's a Wed. or Sat. - check out the swap meet at the arena. The prices there can't be beat!!! The Aston Waikiki wasn't as nice as the Aston Kaanapali, the room was smaller(just a regular hotel room with a small bathroom) but we were only there one night and they upgraded us(without us asking) to an ocean view room. (the other party we were with was upgraded to an Ocean Front room) Very friendly, helpful front desk employees!! Waikiki Beach is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of bad reviews on this hotel, however, me & my husband went there Aug 24-30, 2004 and we absolutely loved it. I mean it's not they Hyatt, but it is top of the line for a 3 star hotel. It's very clean and we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom, room # 841, which was great. Service was excellent. There is a 9.00 a day parking fee, but so do all other hotels. I was very hesitent about what the hotel was going to look like, but I was pleased with the results. I was decideing between the Aston and the Kaanapali Beach hotel, we did go to see what the Kaanapali Beach hotel looked like, and we were very glad we chose Aston. :) Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “loved the shores”
Reviews.Author: Tinafri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week in october 2003. We really like the Shores, it had everything we needed. The location was great. We love to snorkel and the shores is located between the two spots we love. Airport beach, which is 2 minutes driving from the shores or Napili beach up north. Our room was clean and the grounds were beautiful. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soaringspirit
Reviews.Content: Great for price. we were upgraded to 1 bedrrom. Not rennovated but very clean. No bugs great view. Loved the grounds. Would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience After the Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui this June, 2004 for 10 days and stayed at the Kaanapali Shores. We originally had a basic hotel room (Expedia). This was a huge mistake, the hotel rooms were TERRIBLE, dirty, bad air conditioning, old bathrooms, showers with no pressure etc. There was no upgrade availalbe our first night. Luckily, our second day the hotel left us a message that because of a cancellation an upgrade was available. Thank Goodness! This saved our vacaton. We upgraded to a 1 room with a full kitchen and a lani and sitting area. This room was excellent, clean, nice bathroom, good appliances, limited but nice side view of the ocean. Know what you are getting at the Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on West Maui”
Reviews.Author: bainblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days at the Aston Kaanapali Shores condos in West Maui in July. When we arrived they had upgraded our room from a studio to a one-bedroom unit! Great! We found the unit to be so large--it was unbelievable. Everything was well kept up and was furnished very nicely. There were tv's in the living area and the bedroom! The bath was so large. The air conditioning unit made a low humming noise, but we got used to it and it was not a problem. It worked fine. Some folks we talked to were staying in other condos in Kaanapali and they did not have air conditioning at all. The hotel restaurant was good although we only ate there once, so I have limited knowledge. It sure was in a great location looking over the pool and the beach. The other pool was surrounded by a grassy shaded area where many people lounged. The grounds were lovely. Much better than I had imagined. The beach was small and very crowded. I would recommend getting up early or finding a public beach to go to. The best beach was over on Lanai'i but you would have to get a ferry over there for the day or join a snorkel/lunch sail over there like we did (Trilogy is the greatest tour group). I had read in a couple of reviews before we went that there were bugs in the rooms. We found no bugs during our stay. The place was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The condos have handy parking in the garage and we were only steps from our room. The condos are pretty centrally located on the west side of Maui--close to Lahaina and Napili. I would highly recommend this place and look forward to staying there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews that I had read regarding the Aston Kaanapali Shores I was more than a little nervous to stay there. However, I just got back and I can honestly say that I had the best time - we stayed from 7/11-7/17. Our room was nice, a little on the small side, but I saw no evidence of wear, bugs or virtually any of the other complaints. The view from our room was gorgeous, the gardens were beautiful, and the beach was nice. This was the first time that I can actually say that the hotel looks exactly like it does in the picture! We had a fantastic time at the Aston Kaanapali and we plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “A little worse than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6/27-6/28/04. This was my first trip to Maui and I am so glad I used trip advisor reviews to help plan my stay. The Aston Kaanapali shores was mostly what I expected based upon all the reviews. I stayed in a two bedroom, two bath condo with somehwat of an ocean view - (more of an internal garden view) at $488/night. Details: 1) The room was large but very worn and outdated (did have a nice washer/dryer), 2) the room was not that clean, 3) the lobby was nice and the grounds were nice, 4) the beach was small and pretty but rocks were just offshore that would cut your feet, 5) the views from the pool with the restaurant were fantastic, 6) entertainment was only a couple of days per week, 7) very friendly staff, 8) lovely tennis courts. I had stayed there primarily to enjoy the restaurant and poolside entertainment with incredible views (and because I took my family of 5 kids) prior to moving to another condo near sugar beach (based upon tripadvisor), but the poolside restaurant was not that nice and had no entertainment the two days I was there. The beach area was prettier than I expected and the room was more worn & dirty. Overall, it was very expensive for what I got and I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was huge, Location was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful here and the room was one of the biggest we had ever stayed in. The location was wonderful. It was close to all sorts of shopping and many restaurants. The room needed some updating but if you're like us and don't spend much time in it, then its fine. We didn't use the beach here because it was a bit small so we traveled to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: maria2004
Reviews.Content: Bah, humbug to all those that submitted negative reviews re: Aston Kannapalli Shores resort in Maui. My family (10 members) spent 6/26-7/6 at the Kannapalli Shores and had a great time. Let's talk about all the negative things first. None to speak of. Positive things: Henry at the front desk made everything great and so did Alexis in the restaurant. Housekeeping was always cheerful and always came early in the day, which was appreciated. The hotel is remodeling but construction is not intrusive. You are a few steps from the beach, and there were kids playing, folks working on their tans, plenty of lounge chairs and the views were beautiful. If you wanted to play volleyball on the beach, or didn't think it was large enough, there were so many beaches nearby that you would need a month to visit all of them. All 5 of the one-bedroom ocean-view units that our family occupied were updated, all equipment worked and 10 folks were happy. Asked a few folks that we met if they had read negative reviews and they stated yes, but they could find no evidence of bugs, poor housekeeping or a noisy facility. This is a great resort for families, close to everything, washer/dryer in unit is great if travelling with kids, all equipment necessary to make life easier was there (pots/pans detergent for dishwasher etc., and everything worked. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone thinking of going to Maui. Reminder: disappointment has two components: what you expect and what you get. I expected a great facility and I had a great time. Oh, this was our second visit and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Whats with the restaurant vent?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very average complex when you start comparing it to other Maui properties, especially around the Kaanapali/Kapalua area. The beach is not condusive to beach activity at all, particularly with children. Everyday we drove to the main beach at Kaanapali to the front of the Whaler. We did this because of the rocky and merky condition of the water to the front of our condo. I thought the price was OK, although we did get a water front (703) 2 bed 2 bath condo for $370. This room was well decorated and I believe recently updated. Our friends oceanfront condo (401) was seriously outdated and not very clean. Also, the elevator doors had vandalism on them, I highly doubt that other top rate properties would allow that to exist more than a day. One thing I am suprised that no one mentioned was the vent from the restaurant which sits in the middle of the complex.
