The vent is not turned off until late at night and even stayed on all night on one evening. The vent sounds like a vacuum cleaner and was louder than the waves, which were not too far from our room. I complained to the front desk twice about the noise, the response was; "yeah, other people have complained also but I think it is on a timer." (???) We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Tower in Honolulu and that property was far superior for the same price. Next time, we will stay on the main beach in the Whaler or Sheraton...

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Aston property in May and when we checked in, we were in a two bedroom one bath condo. Though living and kitchen areas were spacious, I thought the bathroom was VERY small, had no air vent, and became very stuffy while in use. We then upgraded to an oceanfront two bedroom suite (#601) with wrap around lanai. This was A LOT better than the regular condo, however the bathroom was still the small, no air vent, bathroom. The master bedroom's bathroom was just the opposite--large and spacious. We also encountered bug problems, such as small beetles, even though we expected bugs given the age of the building and the close location to the ocean. Great cable tv though! This is a good place to stay if you don't plan on staying in the rooms all day. It's not a bad place to stay, but a little updating to the place would make a difference The location of the hotel was wonderful and the grounds are always kept beautifully. The pools are nice and it really is a great location with the beach being just steps away!

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort”
Reviews.Author: acfougner
Reviews.Content: I just came back from this hotel 6/7/04 and I have to say it is good only if you are on a budget. The room was a large 1-bedroom, garden view which was fine. It is also across the street from a supermarket which helped to stock the fridge with breakfast items & drinks. It also has a washer/dryer which was great. The hotel is very well kept and staff was very friendly. The $100 dining voucher was a nice throw-in, but it won't last very long. So those were the good things, ok time for the bad. Our room had a roach problem, when we were leaving back home our carry on bag was checked because they said something was moving inside and out came 2 roaches. Not good. They charge $9 a day for parking which I think is ridiculous if you are a guest, but all the other hotels charged too so I wasn't too upset. The beach was the biggest disappointment. I am a big beach person when it comes to vacation and I never spent more than 20 minutes at their beach. The smell of seaweed was so strong. The length from the sand to the water was only about 10 feet. Then there were the big signs stating "WARNING - MAN-OF-WAR, JELLYFISH, RIPTIDES." That was enough for me. So every day we would drive to a different beach, I recommend driving down to the beach by the Sheraton which was by far the best beach. There were 2 pools at the hotel, but they were nothing special and very small. We would go next door to the Embassy who had an awesome pool with waterfalls & a slide. If you are on a budget it's a good hotel to stay at, especially if you are going on a family vacation or with a big group because the units are fairly large. But if you are like me and you want fun in the sun with a great beach and pool, stay at one of the hotels near the sheraton & whalers village in Kanaapaali.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definately be back!!! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent our week long honeymoon at this resort. Yes, the rooms are outdated, but we did feel that it was very spacious and fully equipped. When we checked in we got our original room which was "Oceanview", we didn't realize the difference between Oceanview and "Oceanfront", we then asked for an upgrade, we spent a little bit more per night, but I can assure you, it was worth every penny, just to have the breeze blow the curtains and to hear the waves crashing as you go to bed and when you rise...it was just gorgeous. It is room #260, and we will definately stay in this condo again! Troy at the activities desk is VERY helpful and knowledgeable. There wasn't anything he couldn't help us with, definately go to the continental breakfast your first night. It is information packed and make your vacation! We waited until we got to Maui to book our activities and I am certainly glad we did it that way. The only thing we recommend that you would book in advance would be the Old Lahaina Luau, which is typically booked 4 weeks in advance. It is worth every penny and is just a wonderful time. The only complaint I have is the staff at the restaurant is not very friendly, always rushed, and drink service at the pool, is VERY slow...food and drinks were great but the staff at the restaurant was not. We also had an incident in which we called to get a reservation, they said they didn't take reservations, we went down there a half hour later, and they had approx. five tables open...but were told it's a 1/2 hour wait...but the tables that were open were RESERVED!!! What was that? Overall, it was great and we are hoping to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: maxdog723
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic eight nights at the Aston Kaanapali Shores. This place is great - beautiful, well maintained grounds; quiet location, but close enough to the action in Lahaina to be convenient. I planned this trip as a prelude to getting engaged, and it was well woth the time and money spent. We received $100 in restaurant credits upon check-in, which paid for dinner and breakfast for four of us. The food in the restaurant is good, but there are many more choices around the island the prime rib at Kimo's is unbelievably huge - 32 oz!!!. As for the room, we had a two bed, two bath room, with a great view of the gardens and the courtyard, overlooking the inner pool, on the third floor. The beds were quite comfortable, and we had two lanais. Three televisions and a well-stocked kitchen rounded out the room. The beach pool is great, but with the beach only yards away, I spent most of my time with my toes in the sand. Good snorkeling off shore, and the water temp was quite warm. Lots of shopping nearby in Whalers Village and at Lahaina Cannery Mall. If I had any complaint/disappointment, it was that the bathrooms in the condo needed a slight update - vinyl coating on the tile was coming off in spots. And I had requested a late check-out when we first arrived, but the people at the front desk kept putting us off. Finally, on the last day, we inquired again about the late check-out, and were then told the room wasn't available. Seems to me they could have told us that earlier in the week, but at least we were offered use of a hospitality room if we needed it. However, that aside I have to say it was a great trip (after all, she said yes!) and I would definitely stay at the Shores again.

HotelInfo.Name: Aston Kaanapali Shores
HotelInfo.Address: 3445 Lower Honoapiilani Rd, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761 (Formerly ResortQuest Kaanapali Shores)
